I am very pleased with my purchase of the newest version of the Apple TV. It syncs with my iPhone perfectly and displays my information onto my television just as it says! It is very easy to figure out - self explanatory.

I bought 4 more for my girl and her children and we are all thrilled especially with the way it links to Ipads and Iphones making long distance Face Timing more special on the TV screen. Just wish it had more apps!
I bought a 1/2 size bigger due to the wedge but they look great and fit perfectly I would buy again

I bought a "basic" TV without internet connectivity due to quality and price and was able to get the TV connected to the internet using this little box that I got for less than $100 dollars. Hook-up is simple: one HDMI cord to the TV and the power cord to the wall and you're ready to go. It's a little hard to type/search using the on-screen keyboard but I think there is a way around that if you have a computer connected via Home Sharing... but I haven't tried it yet.The AppleTV ability to AirPlay anything from an iPhone or Macbook makes it well worth the money just by itself. The tiny box is also not an eyesore and is barely visible when sitting on a dark-colored entertainment center.
summary: Great way to make any TV and internet TV

reviewText: I bought an Apple TV to replace my Roku device on my family's main TV. I've had a Roku HD for the past year and a half which I've since moved to another TV. The Apple TV has Netflix and Hulu Plus on it which is what my family uses 99% of the time. Roku has more channels, but I rarely watched them. I do like having Spotify on the Roku, but with AirPlay I can easily run Spotify on my iPad and mirror it to my TV/sound system. I think this device is excellent for what it does. My only complaint with the Roku was that it was flaky and I had to reset it frequently. Whether that was the device itself or the software running the channel I don't know. Hopefully it's better with the newer Roku devices. I will still use my Roku on another TV. I also have most of my media in iTunes. If you have a Mac and/or several iOS devices then an Apple TV is worth consideration over Roku. I couldn't be happier with it. My kids enjoy AirPlay because one can play on the iPad while the others watch it on the TV. That solved the problem with my oldest son getting irritated by his younger brothers crowding around him to watch him play on the iPad.In summary, I think both Apple TV and Roku are capable devices. Having other Apple devices in the home was the deciding factor in purchasing an Apple TV for my family. If you don't have other Apple devices then Roku is likely a better choice.
I bought as a gift for Christmas to a friend.  They told me they love it so far and use it everyday.  I wish I could tell you more but I gave it away...

I bought before the hdmi extension in order to project my iphones and ipads on my Tv but they weren't very useful because you always need to be near your TV in order to be able to use it, this one very practical you only need to connect it to your router and it works smoothly  from any place from your house you will be able to stream your videos and play your songs on your TV also you just need a program like Airparrot or others you will be able to mirror your PC also on your TV.This is a very useful item and i recommend it for anyone who has Iphone and Ipad.

I bought he Apple TV after much consideration between it and Roku, I found it best suited what I was seeking. My family and I have a Roku in the game room where the kids can easily access Netflix and watch their shows, while in the media room we have the Apple TV. We are a complete "iFamily," so the Apple TV is perfect. It shares with our computer, iPhones and iPad flawlessly. With the recent addition of ESPN Go and HBO Go to the channels the Apple TV is by far the best choice. And no, you don't have to watch everything or anything on iTunes to get the most out of the Appe TV. If you don't have any other Apple products, the Apple TV stands on its own like a champ. Like all Apple products it hooks up easy and the interface is beyond user friendly. Highly recommend for persons who have other Apple products, as well as for those who want to enjoy a wide array of programs, as Apple continues to add new channels.
I bought it for HBO GO and it looks excellent. The quality makes you forget that you are streaming the video.

I bought it mainly to mirror an iPad and an MacBook Air on TV.Sadly, my MacBook Air (2011) wasn't compatible with it, and the mirrored image of the iPad wasn't very good at all.However, I also assigned my NetFlix account with it, and it works perfectly! The menus don't look that good (which is Apple's fault) but everything I watch looks amazing, almost as good as a blu-ray movie!All in all, I'm quite satisfied with this product, even though the mirroring utilities being as limited as they are.
summary: Not good for mirroring as one might expect, but works perfectly with NetFlix!

reviewText: I bought the Apple TV a little over a year to round out my home entertainment system.  I had previously purchased a Roku and was frustrated beyond belief. Unless my technological savvy partner was available, I was dead in the water with Roku.The Apple TV is clean design, intuitive and has added a new dimension to my viewing. I watch many movies - free if possible, and the Apple TV opens lots of options.
summary: Great addition to any home entertainment system

reviewText: I bought the Apple TV as a gift based on my previous satisfactory experiences with Apple products. I would buy again.
I bought the apple tv for my son for his birthday! I am not sure how this works but I believe you can view your computer on tv? and also watch shows on tv from the internet.

I bought the Apple TV principally to stream my ITunes music to my main audio system, which is a good one. The music is easy enough to access and play, however the fidelity is not first-rate quality. My ITunes library is mostly recorded from CDs in Wave or Apple Lossless  format, which works perfectly when copied to CDs, yet the sound of the same music is decidedly thinner and sibilant when streamed through the Apple TV. It is OK for background or casual listening, but critical listening sessions are unrewarding. Likewise, eventhough the promotion makes the case that the steaming is 1080P, the video shows decided compression effects.The result is a useful product, but do not expect the sound or video to be a mirror of the same content one generation prior.

I bought the Apple TV so I could stream movies from my computer to the TV and it works great.  It does come with some apps but I really don't use them.  Too bad you cannot add apps to the Apple TV.I purchased my second Apple TV for use with a soon to be purchased big screen TV.Apple TV in combination with a Roku antennae works good.  Now I have to hunt down an inexpensive wifi connection.  That might eb the most difficult thing
summary: Perfect for streaming from computer to TV

reviewText: I bought the latest generation of Apple TV because my older second gen took a dump after many years of use (HD crashed). I've become used to using Apple TV for movie rentals, listening to my music collection through my home stereo, etc.  I like the new size and don't mind the lack of local storage and dependence on wireless connection to my home computer for music, photos, videos etc.  Makes for a smaller, cleaner unit.  The wireless-n works fast and flawlessly.  No problems streaming everything.  The ONE thing I am bummed about is Apple's decision NOT to support 1080i output.  This unit supports 720i, 720p and 1080p, but not 1080i. My Sony display is 1080i, so I have to view using 720p instead.  Not a lousy picture, but I'd rather use 1080i like I did with my 2nd Gen Apple TV!!  Common Apple.
summary: Like the new Apple TV but dislike some of Apple's decisions...

reviewText: I bought the unit for the TV in our family room. Since we are heavily invested in Apple products (iPhones, iPads, and MacBooks), it is a perfect fit, and does an amazing job streaming from a remote iPad, iPhone or Mac. I highly recommend this, especially if you own other Apple products!

I bought this about 6 months ago to put in my jewelry studio so I could watch some great shows while I work. I haven't had any issues with it at all. I bought a HDMI cable and put it directly into the TV so I can switch from Apple TV to a DVD player easily. I like having all the shows I've purchased on my iPad or Mac ready to watch on a TV. I'm seriously considering buying another one for a main room TV as well. I like the remote that came with it, no problems with that either. Everything just works. :)

I bought this apple TV as my second unit, My first apple tv was the 720 p modeland it was good but this one if a lot better 1080 p,And also has more internal memory,What more can I say Its Apple,,,,,,A+++++

I bought this apple tv awhile back and I was planning to take it back but the 15 days return policy passed. So I got stuck with it. The good things are that it streams really well and is pretty simple to use. The bad side is that it has way to little of choices for streaming compared to Roku. No appstore, no adding stations, way too controled and limited. The airplay seemed like a good idea but in reality Ive got other things to do with my computer besides streaming movies. My kids like to watch programs from some other sites that apple tv does not support. I like to use my computer for other things. I thought airplay mirroring would be really great but it is not very smooth many times. There are so many glitches while air playing through my macbook. Sound problems and video quality have been issues.I cant really recommend apple tv right now. Apple offers limited channels its super limited. Roku offers i believe around 750 channels.  When you turn on your apple tv youll see movies, tv shows, music, dedicated to guess who, yep Apple to buy or rent movies or tv shows of which you can find many on netflix or Hulu with your membership. The hulu plus on the apple tv does not give you all the content you get on your computer. I don't know why, thats even more limited. Amazon prime is not supported along with others. I wish I would have thought sooner. I suggest going with Roku or another streamer at least until apple gets a better selection. Apple makes great products but this particular one is lacking pretty big in available content and as I said earlier the mirroring features with airplay have not worked very well. Consider very well before you invest in apple tv.
summary: Needs more content and has issues with sound

reviewText: I bought this Apple TV for one reason only, the AirPlay with my MacBook Pro.  It is A M A Z I N G.  One of the best purchased I have ever made.  I am currently streaming my mac through wifi at 1080p resolutions to my tv and am able to watch all the movies.  I was able to stream before with other products/software but with none I was able to stream the subtitles which was something I needed badly.  It has been ideal for me to stream music when I have people gathered in my house.I bought it as soon as it was announced, even months before Mountain Lion was released.  During this time I had enough time to poke around with the Apple TV.  All the channels (netflix, mlb.tv, etc)  available work great.  More channels will be added soon Ive heard.As of today I know of no software to jailbreak it which is a bummer.

I bought this Apple TV primarily for mirroring games and was excited to see how Asphalt 8 car racing would look on my big screen TV... except for one problem... there is a half second lag time from iPhone to Apple TV via Airplay.  Result: when trying to hit the perfect window at 170 mph between knocking your opponent out and hitting the sweet spot in the turn, you end up in his wheel well or in the wall.  I'm sure movies are great (though the "HD" sports streams were like SD quality in a 16:9 frame) but at least for this gamer, it was an epic fail...

I bought this apple tv since my iTune kept getting upgraded and the Sony Playstation did not work correctly with my itune library. I was using PS3 Server.The only thing I dont like about the Apple TV, while watching Netflix the Sony can do 5.1 but the Apple does not !! they are connected to the same Sony Receiver.Also the Netflix client software on Apple TV does not show the movie detail as intuitively as Sony Playstation does, but since I have all my music and movies cataloged on iTune, I using apple Tv primarily.

I bought this Apple TV so that I could watch Chinese tv series from iPad apple apps on the big TV.  Works great.  I even ordered one for my sister and brother-in-law.  The only issue is the picture on the big TV gets a little pixelated when it's enlarged from 9" to 46".

I bought this as a Christmas gift for my brother and his family who all utilize Apple products and the really like like it a lot and one for my son who loves it.  He can purchase all his favorite shows by episode or season.  The only thing that would make it better would be if it had more free programming.

I bought this as a gift and we were very excited to use it. Surprisingly, it's actually very small and the setup was really easy. Once everything was plugged in, we were able to program it within just a few minutes. Once it was all programmed, it was relatively easy to switch through the menu to whatever category of your choice. We primarily used it for Netflix and it works really well.
summary: A nice accessory for those wanting internet tv

reviewText: I bought this as a gift for my daughter and she said she loves it. I got it at a great price too.
I bought this as a gift.  The receiver loves it. I don't really know the details of what it does, but my brother-in-law was excited to receive it. It arrived quickly and was packaged very well.
summary: Cool gadget for any i-addicted person

reviewText: I bought this as a gift. They love it so i gave it 5 stars. It was easy to use.

I bought this as a wedding gift for my girl, because she'd been hinting about wanting one. She's into tech stuff and gadgets and anything with an Apple logo on it, so she loves it. I like it too, but I have issues with it.There's only a couple of things I don't like about this, causing it to get a 3-star rating instead of 5 stars.For one thing, it has an app for Netflix and Hulu, but it has no app for Amazon's Instant Video. Granted, you can stream Amazon content from an iPhone, but it's annoying to have to do that. If my wife didn't automatically assume everything by Apple is the best, I'd have just bought a Roku device because that'll also play Amazon video.The other complaint is the tiny remote. I'm sure Apple-lovers are all swooning over how sleek and stylish it looks, but the remote is just entirely too tiny for my tastes. It gets lost every other day, because it's just so tiny. It's about as thick as a graham cracker, and it's very short and narrow. So it's always being buried and hidden under clutter, or it's always falling into cracks in the couches/recliners. I know it's unheard of for people to ask for bigger electronic devices, but it would actually be appreciated to have a conventionally-sized remote that won't get lost all the time. Frankly, having a bigger remote would allow for programmable shortcut buttons or a small qwerty keyboard which would make the Apple TV even easier to use.
summary: Only have a couple of problems

reviewText: I bought this based on a friends recommendation.  I am more than pleased.  I ordered it on Saturday, Amazon shipped it promptly and I had it set up and working by Wednesday afternoon.  I particularly enjoy watching Lost via Netflix!
summary: A great addition to my home enertainment system!

reviewText: I bought this because I had a TV in a room with no cable. It is a great item for movies and back series. Good picture.

I bought this because my vacation home has no TV service (by choice). I hooked this up and its working great with my DSL internet connection. I bring up sling box on my laptop and watch anything I want on my cheap 32 inch TV through Air Play display mirroring. Best of both worlds. Netflix and ESPN  work great directly from Apple TV.

I bought this because of the appeal of sharing my sizable library with the big screen in our living room. The setup was a pain because of trying to use the remote for the pass-phrase, but the device has never overheated or ceased to work.

I bought this device for its versatility and power when coupled with an apple laptop/desktop or IOS device. Let me just say that I seldom watch live TV, so having different options like netflix, huluplus, etc is nice. Since I have Amazon prime, I wish I could access the videos here but that is a no for now. The device does allow the "air play" from computers with mountain lon and all iOs devices. This works flawlessly. In fact, it worked so well that we bough a second one for the chuch and plugged it to the overhead projector. So whenever  someone delivers a message they can stream content from their iPad/iPhone/iPod to the Apple TV wireless without having to switch the video sources. We ran the audio to the sound board and the results were great.
summary: Excellent device for business, very good for home

reviewText: I bought this for a friend for Christmas and she loves itShe said it was her favorite present . She watches Netflix and loves that she can see her iphone photos on her TV. She hasn't begun to see all the features. I scored big time on this present.
summary: Apple TV stands up to reputation

reviewText: I bought this for business presentations and travel. I highly recommend it for that if you own any apple device or install air parrot.

i bought this for my daughter and boyfriend.  They absolutely love it.  It allows them to watch so many of their favorite shows, movies, you-tubes and the list goes on, on their TV.  And it's only $100, one shot deal.
I bought this for my daughter and she was very happy with it. It was just what she wanted. Good product.
I bought this for my fathers house to use on a tv to play hbogo,etc on.  worked. very happy with the results
I bought this for my friend on their birthday and they loved it. Works perfect loves to use it for music, movies, videos. Great device.
summary: Best B-day present for a my bff

reviewText: I bought this for my office. Not only does it allow me to stream or watch content, but it allows me to seamlessly share my MacBook Pro screen onto my tv. Initialize this with clients and training with employees. Another added feature is having a 4 digit pin setup, so only specific people can connect to it.I wish there was more streaming content and that it had Amazon Prime video.Highly recommend for Apple users and new users.

I bought this for my sister and she love, her apple tv. She wanted to desperately connect with netflix in HD. Apple TV gives her just that and more. She loves it and all the other options available for her.

I bought this for the fact that it can mirror whatever is playing on my iPod or Mac laptop.  I have my old stereo hooked up to my tv so I can mirror Spotify music through the Apple TV onto the stereo.  It's a great option if your not interested in spending a ton of money on a new sound system.  I also mostly use the Apple TV for the YouTube and Netflix apps.  I've found that most of the other apps on it are useless to me.  Most of them require a subscription to use them.  I do enjoy the trailers app however as I don't have any TV reception where I live so it's nice to be able to see what movies are out.  It also will give you info on theater locations and show times which is nice.  As far as connecting it to your tv it's no problem.  Just plug the HDMI cable in to your tv port plus the power cable into an outlet and that's it.  You do have to also connect to your wifi network which shouldn't be a problem. It's a great little device especially if your already invested in other apple products.  If not then I've heard the Roku is better as far as content goes.

I bought this for use in my 4 year old daughters room. This is my 3rd Apple TV. It is an excellent product. With it's built in parental controls and easy of use. My 4 year old can watch all her favorite shows without me worrying about her seeing in appropriate or unauthorized content.
summary: Love it so much this is my 3rd one

reviewText: I bought this in hopes of replacing my Roku 3.  My logic was that there were some channels that had apps for watching video for which there was no channel on Roku and either didn't use or limited their Hulu selections.  First, let me say trying to use Airplay from an iPad for this purpose was pointless.  The Apple TV was plugged directly into my AC router which also happened to be in the same room as our main TV.  With no other network traffic, the picture was terrible and it stuttered, stopped, and restarted for no reason.  So, I wrote off Airplay.Still, I paid for it so I was hoping I can still use it on a different TV rather than buying another Roku.  To put it bluntly, the channel selection is pathetic for a device that costs the same as a Roku.  Not only is there no Amazon Prime, there are not just a lot of other channels either.  I've given up on cable/dish, so having as many channels as possible without having to hookup my laptop to the TV is essential.  Here the Apple TV falls very, very short.The user interface is nice and smooth and I actually prefer it slightly over Roku.  The lack of channels is just too big of a drawback for me to overcome.  So, if you can't decide between Apple TV or the latest Roku offering, I would suggest the Roku.
summary: Far Too Limited Compared to Roku

reviewText: I bought this in order to connect my ipad to projectors/TVs for presentations.  For this purpose the product HAS limitations.  I have relegated it to being used mainly for streaming netflix and hulu+.  If you are simply looking for a device to stream your media to your television...this is fabulous and I would give it 5 stars; however, I was expecting more in the marriage of AppleTV and my iPad.PROS:Great HD quality when using the HDMI connection.Can mirror my iPad to display photos at gatheringsExcellent alternative to cable/satellite (when subscribed to netflix and hulu+)The unit is small and mighty (easy to transport)CONS:-I am a public speaker and use the SlideShark app often to present my powerpoints from an iPad.  For this product to work, you have to have an internet connection.  Not all of my venues do.-I have to work around the limitations of projectors (until I purchase my own) that do not yet have HDMI input.  There are converters from HDMI to VGA yet that only carries video signals the only audio output is optical and most portable speaker systems are not set to receive optical audio signals.IF I were able to mirror my iPad WITHOUT internet (via bluetooth) I would give this 4 or 5 stars, but this was a great disappointment that prohibited me from using it for my primary intentions.

i bought this item to connect between my apple tv (new version 1080P) and my old fat analog tv. the product works like a charm! i was a bit worried from some of the review i read but it came out to be a great product.the package arrives with s-video cable and 3 rca.

I bought this mainly to get access to Netflix and Youtube.  Now we use it all the time to stream iTUNES content/playlists coupled with slide show of pictures from my computed via WiFi...sounds great running through our BOSE home theatre system.
summary: We use this more than I anticipated...

reviewText: I bought this primarily for my theater room which has a projector and surround sound.  The rest of the streaming devices I have are all 780p, so streaming Neflix at 1080p and projecting it on to a wall makes it look like you almost blu-ray quality.  I  also 'airplay' music from my PC where I have 100s of songs stored to this device and then to my Pioneer receiver.Now the complaints...con #1: In terms of content, it is rather limited. I have an account with Amazon Prime and would love to watch the free streaming movies available online, but unfortunately it is something I cannot do with ATV3.con #2:  I have on the unit is that it's remote is flimsy and Apple really needs to review the design of it. Quite often, in a dark room, it is hard to locate the buttons on the Popsicle stick like remote. I wish the buttons were not so sensitive or the remote had some low led light although I agree this would consume battery life out.con #3: This is a common complaint, apple needs to figure out the keyboard.  Searching for a movie using the ATV3 can be quite frustrating at times using the onscreen keyboard. I have a 10 year old no name digital recorder and it has the same keyboard, so it is not something i was expecting from one of world's leader in innovation.
summary: Great unit, but could be better if Amazon prime was on it

reviewText: I bought this primarily to use with AirPlay on my iMac--and stream music from my iTunes, thru the Apple TV to my sound system.  But I also use it to stream photos and slideshows--very easy to use and setup.
summary: Love it - use it all the time!

reviewText: I bought this so I can airplay my iphones screen to the TV.  It's awesome if you need to show off your pictures / videos or even better when you want to browse the internet with onlookers ..I use Netflix and stream movies from my itunes to the TV.Great little device for $99.
summary: Bought this for a few reasons ..

reviewText: I bought this so I could stream my Itunes videos and podcasts to my TV directly from my laptop, the only downfall is that this isn't compatible with Windows Operating Systems.  I spent hours on tech support and forums trying to get it to work but to no avail, I later found that there is a software out there that you can use, it's called Air parrot and  you can purchase it for about $10 and it makes it so you can stream directly from your laptop so you don't have to worry about your data usage.
summary: This is an amazing product but.....

reviewText: i bought this some time back and now with technology you can buy just about anything with netflix and youtube. i love this so i can mirror any streaming video from my i-pad onto my large tv.

I bought this so that I could watch the (VERY FEW) things that I've bought on itunes.  For that, it's great.  You can stream things from the cloud, so you don't even have to download it anywhere.I wish it did Amazon videos, but it doesn't.I also wish that it would play video from my uPnP NAS.  But it doesn't.  Even though it's an itunes server - but only for music.It does have a bunch of apps that I don't really care about - NHL, ESPN, lots of sports things that I'm not interested in.  And it has Watch ABC and HBO Go and some of the streaming broadcast / cable apps that you can use if you have cable (which I don't).  It has PBS, which is cool, you don't need a cable account for that.And it has Netflix.  But so does my TV.  And DVD player.  And Tivo.  But unlike those other devices, it recognizes Netflix's new(ish) profile feature, where for streaming purposes, an account can set up multiple profiles to make queues easier to manage - I have have shows I watch when I go to the gym in one profile, my kids shows in another, my husband's movies in another, and my movies in another.  All separate queues.  This is the only device I have (of many) that recognizes that feature.  All the rest of them just ignore the other profiles as if they don't exist.My only gripes are the amazon thing, my home network media thing, and that while watching content, there doesn't seem to be a way to get an on screen display to show you how much time you have left without pausing it and restarting it.  Maybe there is a way to do that, but I haven't been able to find it.  That and my general lack of understanding on why apple doesn't recognize a difference between "pause" and "stop".  But that's a different conversation.

I bought this specifically for watching movies on tv that I bought on iTunes, but it turned into so much more. My wife started playing with it and was able to access shows in German for my daughter to watch. Great all around. Love it, I use it almost every day.

I bought this to replace my malfunctioning Roku 2XS. What a difference!FasterBetter quality pictureDesign and speed of Vevo, Hulu Plus and Netflix apps are 1000x better than the Roku versions.Easy integration with my iTunes account and airplay through the iPads has made this an extremely versatile addition to my entertainment options. I am very pleased with my Apple TV. It has reinforced the fact that buying a Roku was a a mistake.
summary: This blows the Roku out of the water

reviewText: I bought two of them.  Allows me to have one system operate in two rooms.  Better than running wires through condo.
I BROUGHT THIS AS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY HUSBAND AND HE LOVES THIS AND SO DO I!!! WE PLAN ON GETTING ANOTHER ONE SOON.
I brought this myself but ended up giving it to my son and he loves it. This is a good value and we have had no problems.
I buy these things for every one for gifts. Everyone uses iTunes these days and this lets you easily integrate your home theater and TV. Great features also include access to things like Netflix!
I cancelled my local cable contracts in Singapore and subscribed to Netflix and Hulu via my Apple TV.  I'm addicted and need to get out more now.
summary: I'm watching it almost every night.

reviewText: I cannot say enough good things about this unit. I purchased form Target for $99 plus tax. I cut the cable cord some years ago. I was between purchasing a Royku and this Apple TV. I wrote this review because some of the reviewers stated that smart tv owners would not want this. As a smart and basic HDTV owner, I disagree. Also, I cannot speak to the movie sources, etc. because that is not my interest. What I like most is the Airplay feature on the ATV. I have access to content I want on my iPad via the Internet. Being able to Airplay, and not just mirror is worth the purchase. I have used a a digital media adapter on the ipad before but there is no comparison in resolution or presentation for the adapter vs ATV and the adapter will cost about a third of the price for the ATV and still not airplay. So if you are thinking of going the adapter route - probably not. Some complained about the remote. I rather like the little remote, and like that it has some flex in it. I can see that it might get lost in sofa cushions, etc. but I am pleased with it. The ATV was extremely easy to set up. Another point I should make is that I installed mine on a secondary older HDTV that must be about 8 years old or more. As it relates to the discussion of older TVs, this works perfectly. It is an LG and has one HDMI port - ahead of its time when I purchased it. I was concerned about mounting the ATV on the wall mounted tv. I discovered that the ATV does not have to be visible for the remote to sensor to it, so I was able to hide the ATV in the tv casing. So if you want to watch movies, etc. there are apps for that. I like that there is free international news and other free apps. But I mainly use use Airplay to play iPad content - plenty video podcasts - such as time shifted cable news, and other feature programs, as well as free tv internet/cable/tv channels. Of course, photos, notes, and anything else can be air played as well. It did take a while to learn how to move from one tv input to the other without loosing tv functionality- but that is not a problem now. If you are not apple invested, and if you are mainly interested in movies- you may want to also look at a Royku, but this was a best solution for my purposes. And that should probably be the deciding factor, - what do you need a set to do for you that you cannot already do? Hope this helps and was not too rambling.And about You Tube, just Airplay it.
summary: For owners of smart TVs too!

reviewText: I can now watch all my German TV shows over my I pad on my TV. This is so cool! I love, love, love it! Worth every penny!
i can play all my itunes movies and i use it alot for netflix. also use it for pics and airplay

i can see this eventually replacing my cable boxeasy set upbought a bunch for my kids schoolok, the apple remote is small elegant and can get losti bought a universal remote and had atv learn the remoteit was the easiest remote set up ever just make sure the remote has all the dvr functionsits a high end elegant productfor out school really wows the kids and parents
I can't believe how small this is!!  It's real quick and very nice!!!  I'm going to replace all of our t.v. boxes with this little guy.

I can't believe how small this product is (I almost wish the remote was bigger, even--it's incredibly easy to loose in the sofa cushions). I use an older MacBook that you're not supposed to be able to do the screen mirroring with, but with the addition of the program Airparrot, mirroring works like a dream. All the apps are great, although it is a pity you can't access Amazon streaming through it--music and movies streamed through iTunes are much more expensive. Still, super nice and great for someone who likes watching international television. I can now download things onto my computer and easily watch them on my tv.

I can't believe how well this works between my desktop PC and my Samsung smart tv. It handles music and photos much better than the tv apps. TV apps handles home videos better. It works great interfacing my iPhone 5s and iPad 3 to the TV using IOS7+.

I can't believe I didn't get one of these earlier! It's a great device that I'm getting a lot of usage out of.Not only can I use this to play or display anything from my computer, but I can also stream Netflix and even use the Airplay feature to stream Amazon Prime videos from my iPad, iPhone, iPod or Mac to my TV! It works quite well.It's built quite well and the little remote that it comes with is metal, you can tell some actual thought went into the design of this product.Highly recommend!

reviewText: I cant believe it but they added icloud features to it so I can view all the movies and tv shows from the cloud without using itunes.  I only wish they could add music to it also.  Netflix works great.

I can't believe it took me so long to order this!  I have become an "On Demand" kind of guy, and I have lost my patience concerning TV programming.  It is difficult for me to wait a full week to find out what happened on my favorite show, so I don't anymore.  This Apple TV unit makes it easy!  I can choose a show that I like and watch an entire season's worth in one evening if I wish.  I can use Netflix or other apps to find movies, documentaries, or other programs.  I can go to Itunes and rent movies without having to return them or worry about sending them back to whichever service they came from.  My kids' favorite things to watch are on YouTube, and that makes them happy.  It takes up a tiny amount of space under my TV, and it works wonderfully.  If you are like I was and are on the fence, my advice to you is to BUY THIS PRODUCT!
I can't believe i waited this long to finally get this.  I love being able to stream my music and video off my ipad/iphone/mac straight to my tv/stereo.

I can't believe that I'm actually living in the future! AppleTV is a cinch to set up (Siri helps)- we were up and running with all of our music, videos, etc. from iTunes in a matter of minutes. Love that I can choose from Netflix or HuluPlus for streaming movies. Plus my photo stream scrolls through during downtown. I would highly recommend this if you are already loyal to Apple and iTunes.
I can't bring myself to buy the second one, only because I'm trying to be frugal.  I "need" one for my second TV.  I love the features.  Its Apple.  I think you get everything you expect from Apple.
I can watch videos on my iphone on TV, can browse you tube videos too. The HD movies on itunes store is awesome! great product.
I choosed this rating because it is a great way to watch lots of good things.Also I love it:)!!!!!!!!I recommend it because it is a great way you can rent and watch whatever you want.

I chose this so that I could play my movies and music through my sound system easily. My MacBook Pro is too old to mirror, but when I get a new one, I can mirror my screen to it if I want. Netflix works great on here - what I mainly use it for.
I compared apple tv & roku and just by airplay capability, decide to use this product. simple to setup and easy to use.
summary: if you love streaming, you will love this.

reviewText: I compared this to the Roku and believe it was worth the money being that I have other apple devices.  It works great, its fun and it makes my 2 year old tv feel like new again.

I considered going with a Roku or similar device, but chose Apple TV as there's no material price difference and for anyone with a number of Apple devices there are real advantages to this over the others.Setup was very simple, and I have no signal problem from my WiFi access point at the other end of the house. Straight out of the box both Youtube and Netflix apps are very straightforward to use, and picture quality from both has been very good. The ability to use your iPad or iPhone as a remote keyboard makes navigation easier.If you're invested in the Apple eco-system there are of course many more advantages; access to your iTune library, airplay screen sharing from your Mac or iPad - all the usual goodies you expect when you stay in the Apple fold.
summary: Great picture quality, simple to use

reviewText: I currently have three of these and a HD antenna. We only have internet and over the air television which has been amazing. The Apple TV has worked well for me since I have iPads and iPhones which can have stuff streamed to them via Airplay. I tried a Roku but the lack of Airplay and I own many movies that are in iTunes which Roku wouldn't play.
I decided to do away with TW cable and ever raising prices. I am so glad I made the switch. It works great and watching tv shows and movies when I want fits my schedule.

I didn't expect to have so much fun with this item. It was simple to set up. The only thing I needed to know was my wifi password. I bought it specifically to view movies off my hard drive and it works wonderfully. Great device!

I didn't have high expectations for the Apple TV, as I realize there's not a one stop shop for movie streaming.  However, the Airplay feature for iOS and Macbook Pro devices makes this black puck a good investment.

I do  not have satellite or cable tv service.  This is a good answer to more variety in tv programs.  I get good reception with my internet service.The only additional expense I have incurred is a subscription to Netflix.

I do not regret this purchase at all. First it is easy to set up. You do have to buy the HDMI cable though. Really easy to navigate and use. The only drawback is that Amazon Prime does not work with it yet. I am still hopeful as this would be really great.
I do not want to waste time putting up devices. Just one or two clicks and it is done. Design is modern.
I don't have any complaints, easy installation (it's an Apple) product! Once plugged in and did my settings it was ready to go.

I don't have anything else to compare it to, but this product works great if you're mostly to all-in with apple products.  I just bought my second one.  In sadly typical Apple fashion, however, they should wise up, and increase compatibility across platforms.  My xfinity player won't stream to it, which I find stupid.  If I already pay for the subscription, the device shouldn't be able to decide what I can and can't stream.

I don't have a smart TV so this is great for streaming all my favorite TV shows and music.  I love being able to show big screen slide shows for travels and grandkids.  Easy to use and a no-brainer to hook up.
summary: This is a must if you have an IPad and an HDTV

reviewText: I don't know how well it stacks up against Roku and other competitors, but as an iDevice family, it suits us very well.
I don't know if it was refurbished but device looked like brand new. And works flawlessly. I love it a lot
I don't know what you can say about Apple products. They all work as advertised and perform flawlessly. Updates are available and announced when you turn it on. Works well. No complaints.

I don't like the remote.  However, I was able to easily program my main t.v. remote to control this device.It was easy to setup, like most Apple products.  There are no buttons on it, but it has a number of good input/output options on the back.  I'm using HDMI straight to the t.v.Once you're logged into your Apple account, you can see a menu of Netflix, Hulu, and other things.  I like to keep one computer on the home and logged into my iTunes account.  The "home sharing" option has to be on, but then you can stream photos, music, etc... from your computer.There's a lot of features and much more that you can do with this, but I haven't messed around with all the features just yet. So far, I like it.One thing I want to try is traveling with this.  There are some blogs about how to set it up in a hotel, but it seems cumbersome.  I have a hot spot through Verizon and might set it up with that when I'm traveling.  It might work well in a conference to stream things to a projector.
summary: For $99, a great buy. Streams music/tv. Remote control isn't great.

reviewText: I don't often write reviews, but I am so pleased with the Apple TV that I am writing this one. First, it was really easy to set up, which is important to me. You do need an HDMI cable, so make sure you have one--and don't buy an expensive cable. Sure, I wish the Apple TV did more, but if you have Netflix, Hulu Plus and iTunes--this is a great way to watch them on your TV. I mostly use it to stream video from my iPad. It works with many other video podcasts and other videos sources (such as Leo LaPorte's shows) on the iPad, but not all. I'm very happy.
summary: Great product, very easy to use.

reviewText: I download a few shows from iTunes that I enjoy watching and keeping the episodes.  I purchased this product so I could watch those shows on my television instead of my computer or phone and it's awesome.  I know it does other things and I'm not using it to it's full capabilities but for what I need it for, it's perfect.

I download shows and movies from iTunes on my iPad....mostly to watch on long airplane rides which I take frequently....at home I like to watch those on my big screen tv and this Apple TV is a must in order to do so....I have no problem streaming amazon prime from my iPad over to my tv thru this device either ....what hardly ever works is watching a netflix movie or show on the tv! I would recommend highly!

reviewText: I ended up getting this product and I must say I love it. The only con is that the actually remote is rather annoying. The way that it's set up makes it difficult to use otherwise works as instructed is awesome if you have an iphone or ipad to use it with so you can use the mirroring capabilities. By the way you'll will need an hdmi cable to use this with your tv. I pop the one out of my cable now and use it interchangeably between the two.
I enjoy the AirPlay feature and viewing YouTube videos on my big screen TV. Apple MUST improve the options and Apps it provides on Apple TV if it wants to stay in the game.

If apple were to incorporate this device to include a DVD player, it would be the end all, be all solution for home entertainment.  Unfortunately I have to maintain a blu ray player in additoin to the Apple TV unit to have the best of both worlds.

I finally decided to buy an Apple TV even though I have a blu-ray player that supports the usual apps.  Our family has a lot of Apple products (Macbook Pro, iPad, iPhones, ect), so this thing really added to the collection.  To me, the biggest advantage was the AirPlay option.  If you have an iOS device, being able to mirror what you have to your TV is truly amazing.  It's fast, intuitive, and very appealing.  The Apple TV is small, energy-efficient, and has been a great addition to the Apple family.  As other people have said... if you have multiple Apple products in your home, this is a no-brainer to purchase.  If you don't have them, I'd probably recommend going with a Roku or some other streaming tv device.  I think I'll be able to get rid of cable after using this thing with Hulu and Netflix.

reviewText: I finally got with the tech era. Got this to get WWE Network. Price is great as its cheaper that retail.

I agree with several user reviews who find the included apps limited, however if you use Netflix, iTunes, Youtube, etc. then this little box can't be beat.As far as networking and download speed, I use AT&T; DSL Elite which is capped at 6 mbps and I rarely have buffering issues.  Anyone who uses a cable modem should be aware that you are sharing your cable node with many users so during periods of heavy use your performance will suffer.A recent update added HBO Go!!!

I found that the unit is easy to set up and use, but I have an iMac, iPhone and iPad. It is seamless with apple devices. My only complaint is that it does not stream amazon prime video

I found this listed on Amazon for less than other sites.I'm happy with the way it connected to my smart Samsung TV.It is very easy to set up.Only thing I would change it the size of the remote. It's small size is a little hard to use with large hands.Harold
If you are addicted to Apple products as I am, this thingy needs to be in your Apple ecosystem. AirPlay and AirMirroring are amazing features.

If you are already invested in the iTunes, iPhone, iPad world than this is a welcome addition to any HDTV in the house. Out of the box I had a slight hiccup with it, I had to adjust the output to 720p. After that I downloaded the remote app for the iPhone and it auto confirgured everything else ncluding my wireless network password. Overall I'm very pleased, I can now stream my media library of music, tv shows and movies that resides on my PC. It also does a great job with Netflix and YouTube. It has some cool screen savers that you can configure to use a photo library or even album cover art. AirPlay is neat and works with my iPad and iPhone. The only thing I don't like is it takes way too long time to load video taken with the phone or tablet.
summary: Ideal for the Apple Gadget Owner

reviewText: If you are an Apple person, then Apple TV is for you! Great device! You are able to use it with your other Apple devices. I played a movie on my iPhone and through Airplay, sent the movie to the Apple TV and watched it on my plasma. Cool product! Only down side, cannot add addition apps.

If you are an iPad or iPhone owner and do not have one of these, get it now!  This is a great device and so easy to use.  I was also able to program it into my Logitec RF remote and put it in the other room with the other devices.  We love it and now it has Amazon streaming and HBO on demand!

If you are committed to the Apple ecosystem, the Apple TV (latest version) is a must have.  It allows you to stream all of your content from your main computer iTunes account to your TV in a superlative manner.  Additionally, you can stream purchased content directly from the iTunes store -- if you have purchased the content from Apple, you can stream it if you have a sufficiently fast internet service.  The newest software version of this device also allows you to access certain other content providers including Netflix.  Unfortunately but not surprisingly, this device does not allow you to access your Amazon Video-on-Demand account, which is truly a shame.  Nonetheless, this device does a lot and does it extremely well.I have been using Apple TVs since the second version, and it has come a long way.  This latest version unfortunately does away with the on-board hard-disk, which allowed one to place content directly on the Apple TV.  This was helpful for use in boats or RVs, where you might not have WiFi, internet, or the ability to stream from an iTunes computer.  On the other hand, the setup and use of this device is almost completely intuitive, and there is essentially no real setup procedure to speak of.  The device goes into sleep mode after being idle for a time, but simply click the remote and it immediately wakes up.  This works perfectly and effectively, and cures the grip that everyone had with the earlier Apple TVs, which was that they always ran warm, causing users to question the service life of the component.Overall, this is an elegantly engineered and well thought-out accessory that is a pleasure to use.  If iTunes is the major source of your content, this device is nearly perfect.  If not, you can still stream Netflix and certain other content providers, but it is somewhat limited in this regards.  RJB.
summary: Perfect if you are committed to the Apple ecosystem

reviewText: ...if you are invested in Apples ecosystem, this makes sense. Doesnt have the full app offerings of a Roku, but if you have an ipad or iphone, you can airplay a lot of apps, personal videos, pics, etc. If you dont own apple stuff or have an itunes heavy catalog, get a roku or chromecast.

If you buy into apple products then you MUST have apple TV. We bought this last Christmas not knowing much about it but knowing we loved apple and thought it would be cool to have. We had no idea what we stumbled upon. We canceled our cable and get all our shows on huluplus or netflix and anything we download on itunes plays beautifully on apple tv or we can take it to go on the iphone or ipad. If you're an apple nerd like me then you'll love apple TV. All your itunes playlists, movies, tv shows, etc play on here!You can also access youtube videos among other stuff like the Wall Street Journal channel and sports junk (that I obviously don't care about).Pros:Works right out of the box.Constant updates making it better and better!Can play anything you've purchased on itunes and can buy new movies, music, tv shows instantly.Beautiful picture on our large HDTV.Netflix! Need I say more?Huluplus! Again, need I say more?You can download the "remote" app on your iphone or ipad and use it instead of the apple TV remote from another room or even another location (at work).Cons:The remote is lovely and super thin which equals to it being lost 75% of the time in our house. This isn't really an issue with the remote app on all our other devices, mostly just annoying b/c I'm sure I wouldn't like the remote if it were larger. So not a true con.Wish there was pandora but I'm sure apple will never go for that.Would love more "apps" and offerings but I'm sure they're coming!
summary: Enjoyed for over a year, cancel the cable!

reviewText: If you can't afford cable or satellite reception every where in your home this is the item you want! According to the strength of your Internet connection and wireless,you can access so many programs through your iPad. For the price you can't beat it! Easy set up to a television!
If you do not have a smart TV or want to save hundreds when buying a new TV by this.  A non smart version of a TV is ussually a few hundred cheaper.  Then you buy this and viola!

If you don't want to be another one of the mindless drones who sit through whatever cable has to offer (including insanely long commercials) than this may be the device for you. You can still watch the shows you like via Netflix, HBO Go, ESPN, etc. but without the commercials & without having to wait until a certain time to watch the show. With the Apple TV, you are in control.I like this better than the Roku because the interface is simple & clean. Also, there is a YouTube app which the Roku doesn't have (major mistake on Roku's part). Lastly, the Apple TV syncs well with the iPhone & mac computers so you can show whatever your phone screen is showing on your TV via Apple TV. This is great if you want to watch a game on The Big Ten Network for example & Apple TV doesn't offer it - you can just put it on your phone or computer & beam it to the TV wirelessly. Pretty solid & I don't consider it very laggy, unless you have a slow internet connection.The YouTube interface leaves much to be desired. You can't read comments, etc. but it's still nice for watching videos. You can also download the Apple remote on your iPhone for free. This turns your phone into a remote & saves you time when typing in the search bar of the Apple TV menus. Would definitely recommend.

If you have a HDMI TV and you have any of the Apple products, such as an iPad, iPhone, or iPad then this is a must have device.  I constantly stream movies from my Mac Mini to my TV.  I also can send music to my stereo through this device.  It does require me to have my computer running when I send stuff from my computer.  I'm still not convince about the Googlechrome cast.  I like taking stuff from my iphone, ipad and computer and send it to the TV.  I just love that capability.  Not to mention all the other applications, such as MLB and Netflix.  I don't care that TV's come with Applications, when I have an Apple TV.  Great value for $100!
summary: If you have a iPad, Mac, or iPhone this is a must

reviewText: If you have a iphone or ipad this is great. Struggling to find an Android app that works as seamlessly.  The AirParrot app for your laptop is great works well, wished it was available for other smartphones and tablets that are not apple.It would be perfect if Apple included safari browser as well.

reviewText: If you have a mac computer or ipad, and an Itunes library, this device is for you.I turns your computer into a TV station, Plus you can get the same stuff, or almost the same stuff you get with Roku.So It really worked for me.

if you have an apple environment, then the apple tv is what you need.. not only because of the apps, but for the mirroring and airplay functionality.this is simply a must!

reviewText: If you have an iMac, MacBook Pro, iPhone or an iPad this is such a great addition to your home media system.  Never mind the huge number of other features this device has, the AirPlay feature makes sharing photos, videos (and anything on your iPhone or iPad screen) easy.  No need for a bunch of people to huddle around your phone to watch videos or look at pictures.  Just use AirPlay and show them on your TV.  It takes two swipes on your phone to connect.  That's it.

reviewText: If you have an i-pad you got get one of these.  Air play is cool.  I bought it so I could the NHL Game Center.  That works great too!  A lot of bang for the buck and I am no techie either.

If you have an iPhone, iPad, iMac, or a Macbook, you absolutely have to have one of these. You can mirror the screen of your iPhone or iPad directly to your tv screen. It has several channels like netflix and hulu plus to enjoy also.

If you have an iphone, ipad, ipod, or a mac with 10.8 and above, appletv is a great supplement to your products. I use it to share pictures and youtube videos with friends and family. Definitely recommend having one, it's very seamless.

if you have apple products this is a no brainier. If you use Amazon cloud instead of i tunes get the Roku 3 it has the amazon app. I thought I could get away with using the apple air share function to watch my Amazon movies, you can but there is a downgrade in picture quality. And unless you use apple products the Roku blows apple TV away with the shear amount of channel options. Had I done more research I would have gotten the Roku 3 first. But this is still an ecellent product does everything within it's description.

If you have a regular tv, then his just upgrades it for using Netflix, Hulu, or other services provided through the Apple TV. Netflix3. iTunes contentThen you should pick one of these up.Plug and play it just works, and works fast.The interface is far better than my crappy Visio TV which takes an eternity to scroll through each page in Hulu/ Netflix.And far better than the PS3, which makes me install a new version of netflix monthly (and re-enter my user/ pwd everytime!!!!)At $97 doesn't seem like any reason why you wouldn't want to pick one up.
If you have other apple products this will be the best money you'll ever spend. You can stream to your RV from your computer, ipad, or iPhone. It's really an amazing product.

If you have the internet and other Apple products, then this is a no-brainer kind of purchase.  It syncs with your other devices and provides excellent viewing of shows on all the major networks.  I also have a Netflix account, which makes Apple TV even better.  I can view past seasons of favorite shows in just a few moments.  The remote is tiny and subtle, much what you would expect.  Of course, there is an app in case you lose it.  Great product.

If you like to buy movies from the iTunes Store, this is an easy way to watch them on your TV, and you can also use it to listen to your music collection.  Very small, so it fits most anywhere, and hooking it up was simple.
If you live out of the country, you will not be able to access Hulu! Also, this device does NOT get any local NEWS networks!
If you live way out and tired of paying high cable bills this is the item to use.Pay now then decide later what you want to watch.
If you look at the directors website you will notice that it is based on child pornograhpy.  Why Amazon is allowing such trash to be sold is beyond me.WARNING the website is disturbing:[...]
If you love AirPlay you love this one. Finally,  I can watch my EPIX channels right off the iPad to the big screen without even turning on of off the device.

If you love Apple products and you already have a lot of them in your house (iPhone, iPad, Macbook, etc), the Apple TV is a no-brainer for you.  It's easy to set up and the interface is true Apple quality.  I've used blu-ray players for years to access streaming apps and none of them were as easy to use as Apple TV.  Plus, the mirroring and AirPlay options are great.  Great price, good buy!
If you own an apple product, this is really a great product to have and pair with.  This really become handy to share music, videos, streaming anything, photos, etc.  Must recommend to others

reviewText: If you own an iphone or an ipad this is a great add on, with this you can stream the content of pc, iphone, ipad and also see content fron the native apps in the apple tv
summary: A must buy for apple user.

reviewText: If you own an iPhone or iPad this little device will really enhance your pleasure with Apple Products. For example I like to watch HBO GO on my TV but my TV carrier (Comcast, also known as the worse cable company in the entire univerese) will not support the Roku Player, but thank god does support Apple TV. Almost anything you watch on your iPad or iPhone you can stream it using AirPlay with Apple TV. It is a must have device.

If your an Apple fanboy, go ahead and buy it. Decent interface and speed. However I'm not as impressed as I am with the Android TVs out there...It's still nice to have and for the price is a great addition.
If you're like me and don't want to spend $80 a month on a bunch of shows I don't even watch, then this is for you!

If you still don't have an Apple TV yet, and you have wireless internet, you should get this.  Netflix and HuluPlus are about $8 each.  Anyone can sync their Apple device to your tv to show movies, video and pictures.

If you use iTunes & Netflix at all and have a HD TV this will be the best $99 you ever spend.I listen to all my music watch all movies through it. My bluray player is a giant paperweight now.Also bought an app for my iMac, Airfoil, and can now also stream Sirius Internet Radio through my TV using the Apple TV airplay feature.
if you watch movies and is a mac user you must have one - bought two one for the office and one for the house.

I gave Apple TV a bad review when I first got it then pulled the review after I got it working as it should. I haven't watched cable TV for the past three months. I use it to watch You Tube and all the old movies and TV shows for free. The Untouchables, Amos N Andy, Bonanza, Jazz Videos, Old Boxing matches it's great. If it broke today I would order another one within a few seconds and pay extra to have it shipped overnight. I bought The Barbarians from iTune Store only to later find it for free on You Tube. I just love this thing.
I gave this as a gift this Christmas.  The recipient cannot stop thanking me ... she is SO excited about it!  It was very easy to "install", and it performs exactly  as advertised.
summary: A quality product that fulfills expectations, and then some!

reviewText: I gave this to my boyfriend for Xmas. He has a late 2010 MacBook Pro, running the latest OS system available right now. While he was able to connect it to the TV and get it running fairly easily, including streaming his music onto it, as well as his Iphone 5, he wasn't imeediatelly able to stream any of the movies we had downloaded onto his computer.After he did some research online he found something called "Air Parrot" that solved the problem. ps. he said iif his macbook had been a 2011 or newer it would've worked out of the box.Oh and it xcomes with a new remote too that works for his macbook as well. It was a good buy overall!I like my Roku better...but he's a Mac/Apple guy and I would recommend it if you are one too...otherwise go with the Roku.

I got a HDTV as a gift, and given my Apple product collection (computer, ipod, phone), this just made sense compared to the other TV streaming devices. I love being able to airplay from my phone or computer, and share my photography on my TV so easily.

I got an Apple TV instead of  another "streaming" product out there because I work on a mac so it seemed like best option for me.  It works great when watching Netflix, Youtube etc...but when it comes to watching movies it gets a little slow.  I purchased a movie that I liked and it took forever to get it to start playing.  I really like the Airplay function between the ATV and another mac device, I just wish the Apple DVD player on my MacBook Pro would have access to that but alas it does not.  I have also experienced a lot of disconnections between my laptop and the ATV when using Airplay to play music or watch mp4s but then again I am still using Snow Leopard so that might be an issue.  Other than that I am very happy with my Apple TV, hopefully once I upgrade to Mavericks I should be able to mirror my mac and that will be a welcome feature.

I got Apple TV for my husband for a Christmas present.  We have thoroughly enjoyed streaming movies and pictures through Apple TV. Only hiccup we had was that our TV only had 2 hdmi slots and those were already taken by blu ray player and satellite box.  So, we had to buy a splitter to be able to hook up the Apple TV. Wasn't very expensive $10-$12 (I think) at Radio Shack. Overall we are most pleased with yet another Apple product in our household.

I got in on the Apple TV with the 2nd generation TV.  The current generation, the third one, is the best. 1080p content streamed to your television from your Apple cloud (any music, music video, tv show, movie, etc) or from your iTunes on your computer. You can also watch live and on zed,and content from many of the major network players like HBO, Disney etc. there's also sports fare like MLB, NHL etc for the sports fanatic. In addition, you have Netflix, YouTube and more.These days, I'm watching more content on my Apple TV from my BluRay digital copies, things I've rented or purchased from iTunes and Netflix content then watching regular TV. It's literally amazing.As always, the interface is easy and intuitive like any Apple product.It's extremely small, about the size of a hockey puck and unobtrusive. There's nothing dangling from the side of your tv like with Chromecast.If you're in the iTunes ecosystem it's an absolute no brainer. If you're on the fence, take the plunge. You won't know how you went without it before.
summary: You haven't watched TV until you've used an Apple TV

reviewText: I got my apple tv for about a month now and I have no problem on using it, it is amazing. Its easy to use, its not big, its fits in any place and you can take it on your bag.I highly recommended this product if you are a apple lover and you like your devices connected on the tv.
i got the Apple TV and got ride of cable because this is so useful. Saving $80+ a monthonly negative is lack of sports but there are ways around that.

I got this apple tv just so I could see my iphone 4s on my 55" LED and play games but most game are not really playable because you need to look at the iphone's screen but some other games have airplay enabled, I just wish I could easily find a section on the appstore on my phone that showed airplay enabled only apps.Besides the lack of apps the item itself does the job more than perfectly fine with little setup and the thing is very little and has a sophisticated look which I will assume will mean little after the mount for the back of my tv which will hide it.

reviewText: I got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he says it is better than anything else of it's kind.

I got this for my brother, and he and his family love it. They can stream from the Mac to the flatscreen, which is all they wanted to be able to do. But they now also use it for Netflix and other things. I think they're happy with it.

reviewText: I got this for my dad for his birthday. This is his favorite accessory in his home and he uses it every day.

I got this for my family as a Christmas present for our Panasonic 55 inch plasma TV. It has a great, easy to use interface with a lot of neat features. Unfortunately, I couldn't use the music streaming feature while actually enjoying it because I need to get some speakers for the TV. The remote is one of the main reasons that I got the Apple TV. I love holding it and just looking at it; it's one of the best remotes out there. I also have a complaint about it.DEAR APPLE: INCLUDE THE CABLE IN THE PACKAGE!!! I don't mind if they raise the price, I just hate going and buying a separate HDMI cable. When you buy an iPod/iPad/iPhone, does the USB cable come separately? Of course not. Then why force customers to buy separate cables for their Apple TV. Apart from that, I like this small black box a lot.

I got this for my girlfriend for Christmas because she has asked for one for years. Once we were able to get the thing hooked up, it was really nifty and worked with all of our Apple gadgets. However, I did not pay close enough attention to the specs when I purchased the box and did not realize it ONLY hooks up to the TV via HDMI cable. At the time, we did not have a TV that had an HDMI input. Soooo, we had to make another $100 investment to get a small HDTV that could work with the Apple TV. I would definitely recommend the product but make certain you have an HDTV if you purchase.
I got this for my son for Christmas. He loves it!! It was very easy to set up -- very user friendly!!

i got this free from downloading apps and getting amazon points! lol so yea i love my apple tv.! kit is a new apple tv sealed from apple. its an amzing ox. wish a jailbreak would be out for it. but hey i dont care still amazing 1080p.
summary: free for trying apps getting amazon money

reviewText: I got this mainly for YouTube. Has been working great. I occasionally suffer due to my internet bandwidth but that has nothing to do with the product. Recommended buy especially if you have other Apple products.

reviewText: I got this primarily to watch Netflix in my bedroom, but it serves other purposes too like playing music when guests are over, watching PBS shows, etc. I love that I can use my phone as a remote on it.The one major downside is that Apple is stingy with the apps it uses on the Apple TV and I would really love if they put like Amazon Prime on it (I know Amazon and Apple are competitors, but Apple TV has Youtube on it so I don't see why they can't expand out a bit).Otherwise, it's great! It's really small and doesn't take up a ton of space and I'm happy to have gotten it.
summary: Love this; Wish Apple had more features tho

reviewText: I got this unit once it finally streamed in 1080 and I am so glad I did.  It does what most of the other similar devices do but the AirPlay feature is the best!  I have mostly Apple products and it works seamlessly.  I would highly recommend.

I got two of these.  One for my place and one for my girlfriends place.  I have a Netflix account that we use at both places.  WARNING....it will show up at both places what has been watched at both places.  That's not a problem for me because we are together at one or the other places while watching movies.We have had them for two years, and we are very satisfied with them.I recommend this Apple TV

I guess I am big fan of Apple products...because I realize now that all my gadgets made by Apple. So Apple TV was logical choice for streaming TV. But for my surprise I can do some much more than just watch Netflix on it. Now I can watch on TV  everything that is on my iMac which is a big deal for me.As compare to Roku there is not as much channels but I honestly don't watch other channels than Netflix anyways.I am not sure how my review will help others since I don't know how things work. I just now that Apple product WORK. Simple as that.

reviewText: I had an older version of this and it stuttered a lot during Netflix views. This one has been great!
I had a Roku play for about 3 years that suddenly died.  Deciding this was a sign, I ordered the Apple TV and love it!!  The design is great and it is easy to use.

I had been reluctant to purchase this device for a long time because of the $99 price.  When I found it for $85 I was willing to give it a chance.  I am glad I took the chance!  I love that I can watch Netflix, all my shows purchased from Apple, and anything on YouTube.I do hate the little remote control, but was able to program another remote control to work with the device.  If I figure out how to turn it off without having to read any instructions, the device will be perfect.

I had looked forward to seeing Hulu, for instance, but one can only get a subscription.  Most everything requires a subscription!  Since I could already stream from my laptop via a cable, the Apple TV is redundant.  There are other devices like this out there, and I would encourage you to research them better than I did.  Hopefully I can find a hack for this box and unlock the streaming features that I wanted.

I had no problems out of the box but after the first software update, it would not stay connected to my Wifi.After calling Apple, it was decided to do a full software restore by plugging it into a computer running iTunes.  This procedure fully resolved the connectivity issue.

I had no problem using the Apple TV to view movies or listen to music.  Just plugged it in and started using itBut, I struggled connecting my iPad and Apple TV.  I had wanted to view pictures taken on my iPad using the Apple TV. Apple support was great!!

I had problems renting a movie through the Apple TV. Apple replaced it but the new one had the same problem. I don't know if it is the Apple TV or my internet speed. I have increased the internet speed but haven't tried to rent a movie through it yet because it is a bi of a pain to get a refund--all rentals are final. I can rent on the computer and stream it from iTunes so I kept it.

I had resisted getting this for over a year. I finally gave in when I had movies on my iPad that I wanted to watch on my HDTV. It connected easily and works great on my wireless network. I like the small size. People don't even notice it on my TV stand.Turning it off when not in use too a little research, but now that I understand how it works, it is fine.

I had several of the original hard drive equipped Apple TVs.  I still miss some of the features of having local storage but the new version has won me over.  I now have four of the new Apple TVs in my home and with each upgrade I love them more.  I have a dedicated home theater and the picture quality on my 123" screen is near Vudu HDX quality.  If Apple can get the HD audio codecs to stream there will be no reason to buy another Blu-ray.
summary: The best streaming device on the market!

reviewText: I had the last version of this, the 720P version. This new version has a faster processor, and I could tell with streaming from my computer or my iPad. Works much better. Also a great plus having access to all my 1080P videos and TV subscriptions. Well worth the upgrade.
summary: Love this; use it more and more

reviewText: I had these for less then a week and already 4 of them were broken. And the ones that aren't broke, don't work. They are Very cheaply made. I wish I would have just spent the money on better ones. NOT WORTH THE MONEY!
I had this item just yesterday, I liked so much, I can't believe that I stayed without it for all this time!

I had to write a review on this because i have seen people comparing Apple tv and the google chromecast player and some saying they are not much different. NOT TRUE. I purchased both for my apartment to have one in the living room and in the bedroom The apple tv is $100 but well worth it, especially if u have apple devices at home such as ipad or iphone. But u dont have to have it to work this.  Apple tv has so many more options then chromcast. If u have a television provider there are disney channel apps, nfl, HBO and more u can use. If u have an ipad or iphone u can turn on air play and use the mirroring option so everything u are doing on your device is on the big screen. Also it come with a remote but u can also download the apple remote app on ur device and control it from there that way u have a keyboard and makes searching for movies alot faster.  Now chromecast is good but only $35 because it doesnt have alot to offer. It doesn't come with a remote so if u dont have a smart phone u cant opperate this device and also only offers netflix and youtube thats it. Easy to set up but nothing fun to play with.

I had tried Roku about a year ago but it screwed up my tv and dvr so I was very reluctant to try this but everyone I knew who had it insisted that it was the best.  I bought it, plugged in one plug and it was done!  SO EASY TO SET UP! And it works perfectly with my TV and my DVR (Time Warner Cable).  I LOVE IT!  I only wish that I had got this years ago!
summary: WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG TO GET THIS!

reviewText: I hate giving money to Comcast or Verizon for cable as cable sucks.  Apple TV makes no cable possible.  I pay for what I want to watch.  I just wish I could get German or Canadian content.  Some channels need you to have cable as well.  Things like the ABC and one other.  I refuse to support cable ever again!!!!!!  I would rather buy from apple TV than give any money to cable.  My advice, Boycott cable!!!!!
