reviewText: I have 2 of these products.  Easy to install.  For me it makes access to Netflix, etc easy.  I also use it for a screen saver with my photo stream.  It is probably a little expensive for what you get, but it's Apple and it works.

I have 3 at home, I bought the 1st ten and 2nd version that used to be loud, run very HOT. I ended up hacking those models to run other apps as it is a mini linux box and that was fun for awhile.I use it to stream airplay from my iPad, iPhone and MacBooks both video and also music.I have both 720 and 1080p versions while my TV can do 1080p most videos I watch I don't notice too much difference.

I have 3 of these but this one (newer model) takes forever to send a move over my local network and all the others work faster!!! I did every fix and reset imagine able even to Genius Bar 45 minutes away.  No luck.  Suck a duck Apple TV 3.

I have about five Apple TVs, and really love the new version that allows you to not only get iTunes media but also Netflix, Hulu Plus, HBO, ESPN and a bunch of other networks. Would love to see them add CNN or a news channel (other than BBC) to the lineup.  I can't give an opinion on how this compares to any of the other streaming devices, but I really love it.  Simple. Easy.  Actually follows the theoretical Apple philosophy of "just works" for once.

I have a bunch of apple products and use Netflix, Hulu, etc, but it is not as streamlined or user friendly as I would have hoped. First annoying thing is that when I use the remote it affects my laptop (i.e. it must be on the same frequency--so when I scroll on the tv, it messes with my laptop. I may be a little daft, but I can't always get it to play from my computer or ipad. Anyway, I think my boyfriend (who is very tech savvy) has figured it out (after quite a bit of effort). Have not been using as much as I would otherwise. I do like the ease of browsing itunes and Netflix.
I have a few apple devices and I bought this to go along with them. The set up was easy and fast. Seamless transition from device to Apple TV . Nice 1080p picture and really cool air play features.

I have a huge library of songs residing on iTunes, and once I purchased my Apple TV, I subscribed to iTunes Match and I had instant access to my complete library through my Samsung Smart HDTV with it's optional sound bar. It sounds incredible, and if I'm in the mood, I can actually shake the walls! iTunes Genius works great too, and I use it to create custom playlists. Some of my songs were added a number of years ago, and Match upgrades these to the highest bitrate automatically, which is another great feature. Anytime I purchase music on iTunes, it automatically shows up on my TV. The same goes for my pictures. I take one, and there it is, instantly, on my big HDTV. I wish Apple would provide me with access to Amazon Prime, but since it's available through the Samsung Smart TV, it's not a big deal, but for convenience sake, it would be nice. Apple just added their new Radio feature, which I happen to like too. Overall, I've been very pleased with it for the last year and a half.
summary: iTunes Match Is What Won Me Over!

reviewText: I have all of these gizmos including a roku 3 and chromecast. I don't have a favorite, but this gets plenty of use. If you're an apple fan then you need this today. The music steaming and phone/iPade remote functions rock. I love the apple trailer channel!!!  This is a must have for $100 or less.
I have already been using one of these for a Year or so. I love it so I ordered another one for a gift.It is awesome.

I have a Mac and an iPhone, so I thought I'd give this a try.  I'm surprised at how much I use this.  I watch movies and shows on my Apple TV so much that I'm considering cutting the cable with my cable provider.

I have a MacBook Pro and Iphone, so i bought this product inorder to make them sync easily and efficiently ...1) don't expect a lot of choices interms of content.  2) it's a kinda slow when i play online videos on my laptop and use airplay to display it on TV ..it's not the internet cause it plays well on my laptop but it hangs over now and then on the TV & sometimes loses connection ... except that it's good to have.
I have an apple tv 2 that only does 720p. This is a huge difference on picture quality. If you are an Apple person, this is a must have.

I have an iMac and iphone.  I really enjoy the ease of AirPlay.  My AppleTV is connected into my entertainment system, and it is so easy to stream music or video from either my iMac or iPhone to the stereo or TV.

I have an iPad 4th gen and bought this to stream my HD movies I have downloaded from iTunes.........using the HDMI connection to the TV and the toslink optical cable to my Onkyo receiver I get a fantastic home theater experience....was super easy to hook up and connect to my wireless network.......I can stream from my iPhone4s and my iPod touch 3rd gen as well.......If I use my HP laptop and open iTunes I can stream from my homeshare and play my music too.

I have an original Apple TV.  While I enjoyed it, it always seemed like a half-finished concept.  Only by hacking it and extending the functionality was I able to make a truly useful device out of it. Even then, it would choke on even 720p video if it wasn't encoded just right.The new Apple TV is not only much cheaper, it's better all around.  It's got a lot more features, Netflix streaming, 1080p video (welcome to the new millenium, Apple!), and much more.  The airplay is especially worth it to me.  Being able to stream audio from just about anywhere and sometimes even video was easily worth the price of admission.My only complaint is that they got rid of the USB port on the back and no one's come up with a hack for it yet.  I got a little too used to using my "extended" Apple TV and I want some of that functionality back.
I have another one of these and being abe to use my computers iTunes as well as my big screen is really cool and worth every penny.
I have Apple TV for all four TVs that I have. Great for watching Netflix, renting and watching movies from iTunes etc. The remote app on the iPhone is easy to use and is a must.
I have a Roku and a Logitech device so I guess I'm not surprised that when I got a Mac, I also needed Apple TV.
summary: If you want to stream iTUNES ON YOUR TV

reviewText: I have a Roku and I think this Apple TV has a better user interface for Netflix. It's 52 inches of "eye candy" on my Big HD TV. But what I really like is now I can rip my BluRays with Hand Brake to the Apple TV 3 format, drop them into itunes and now I can watch all my movies through this "hocky puck" sized device. My home theater pc uses around 120 watts of power, while this only sips 1.9 wats. Whats not to like.
summary: Great addition to my home theater.

reviewText: I have a smart tv, a smart blue-ray, even a smart receiver- yet I use the Apple TV to run all my streaming content or for Airplay.Is there an app that it doesn't have? Because I haven't found it.
I have a smart TV but I like the apps with Apple TV much better. I especially like to mirror the IPAD on the TV to share things with others in the room or to show pictures, etc.

I have been a long time Mac user so all of my digital content is in iTunes, and iPhoto the AppleTV fits perfectly into my environment and allows me to access all of that digital content on my TV or through my stereo. I am also a Netflix user and I love the interface Apple created for browsing Netflix. I have even started renting movies from Apple and the quality is awesome. No problems with connection speed over my 15MB Cable broadband connection. Great device for anyone but really great if you are all ready a Mac user.
summary: As a Mac user this fits perfectly into my ecosystem

reviewText: I have been an "Apple Man" since 1986 and I have nothing but. This is a very nice addition to my collection!

I have been an apple tv user for a while and have gone through several updates. I have the standard version and the HD version. HD is the way to go! I look forward to when more and more channels become available.

I have been looking for a simple easy way to tell the cable company to F off and this wasn't it. I thoroughly enjoy the product and its ease of use but am baffled by the lack of other uses. I would have liked it to be compatible with HULU+ or Amazon streaming. After the jailbreak comes out for this device it might be closer to what I was actually looking for.

I have been looking to get apple TV since a long time ago and I finally did it! What I like the most is the mirror option, I can share what it's going on in my Iphone and Ipad in my 55" HD TV and works quite well!
I have been using this for nearly over a year and works great. I have been able to stream all my fav shows and watch videos and movies like I wanted to.

I have both the Apple TV and the Roku 3. The Roku 3 has much better functionality and seems to have more apps than the Apple TV. The AT is great for someone with other apple products mainly for connectivity, but the roku is faster, includes a private listening headphone jack in the remote, has more apps, includes games and looks better. The AT is very simple and streamlined like most apple products. Even the remote is very slender and easy to misplace. This will definitely meet all of your streaming needs, but I prefer my roku.

I have both the apple tv and the roku side by side in our den. The apple tv has the best picture but is limited in it's channel offerings. The roku has less than perfect picture but has more channels.I am planning to purchase another apple tv for the kitchen though.

I have both the Ruko and Apple TV boxes. They are pretty much the same product, but the Ruko gets more stations. I only bought the Apple because I have a Ipad and Ipod touch that I can use to view my content on the large screen tv or even mirror the Ipad on the tv if I so desire. Homesharing works perfectly between devices and if I put photos in the photostream file folder they appear on all the devices including my PC using Icloud. I recommend the Apple TV to anyone who uses Apple products.
I have bought a couple of AppleTV's now and they are really nice. I especially like the Airplay capability. I just with they would figure out how to jailbreak the AppleTV 3!!!! :)
summary: AppleTV does a lot of cool stuff.

reviewText: I have cancelled my Dish Network service and am completely reliant on internet streaming services. My Apple TV is an amazing product, and integrates perfectly with our other Apple products - iPhone, iPad Mini, etc. I recommend it to everyone who asks me about it, or about streaming services.
summary: Apple TV is our New Television Service Provider!

reviewText: I have found that I use this more with AirPlay to view steaming videos and listen to podcast from my iPad and iPhone, rather than trying to navigate the screens with the very basic remote.  The home sharing with your iTunes music and pictures is probably the 2nd best feature, as I can use playlist and let photo albums run on the TV.  This finally solved the anxiety of all the pictures that I wished were framed our in photo albums.
summary: AirPlay and home sharing really make this useful

reviewText: I have found the Apple TV to be the best means for streaming content from your iTunes library to your TV set by far. No other media box has a easier to use interface and all that I have used seem to lag and generally be sluggish compared to the Apple TV. One thing to consider though with the Apple TV: It is designed to be used with iTunes. To get the most bang for your buck with this device, you need to manage your audio/video media with iTunes. I would like to see apps on this device in the future, but for now it does what I want flawlessly!
summary: Best option for streaming content to your TV assuming you use the iTunes Ecosystem

reviewText: I have give about 15 or 20 of these away to friends for holiday presents.  It's a great little product

I have had absolutely no problems since I purchased the Apple TV. I wanted a way of viewing my iTunes content on my HDTV, and it does that and more. I still have to test out some of the other apps, but I am glad I can watch movies and TV shows I have downloaded on a much bigger screen. Amazon and DataVision did well in getting my Apple TV to me right on time. Great job!

I have had an Apple TV 720p for some time.  The newer 1080p version is just as excellent a device as the previous version, but with higher resolution.  It is also a bit faster.  The increased resolution is evident in the photos I show form my Flicker account.  As with most things Apple it is an excellent product.
I have had it over a year. The last 6 months have had some awesome upgrades done in it. They only add stuff to it that is relavent. HBO Go, Hulu, Netflix, and if you have an iOS device it is awesome.
summary: It is really coming into its own.

reviewText: I have had my apple TV for just a few days now and I have loved it every minute!  I have been able to watch all the movies that I have on my iTunes account with just a click through airplay.  Im gonna order another one for the bedroom TV!  The remote that comes with the apple tv is kinda lame, but the iphone/ipad has a "remote" app that is perfect and makes finding the movies i want to watch a breeze!
I have had several AppleTVs and they are a seriously excellent way to get content.  If you have a lot of iTunes content already, they are even better.  Only drawback is no access to Vudu or Amazon.

I have had the Apple TV a few weeks now.  It was easy to install and has beautiful picture quality.  The problem is I rarely use it because of how long it takes to download a show or movie.  People with faster internet may enjoy more, but with even High Speed DSL internet, I have to plan a few hours in advance for any movie I want to watch.  Just to watch a trailer for a movie takes a few minutes to download.  I haven't tried a Hulu Plus subscription yet, but plan to.  If show can be accessed quicker I will probably enjoy it more.  Perhaps upgrading my internet speed some day will make me enjoy this more.
summary: Download times are the only draw back

reviewText: I have had this item for about 10 days now. I am not a techie type person, and this was easy for me to set up. I use this with wifi connection and it is flawless. We have rented movies and have Netflix, they stream with no buffering or drops. The big thing is MLBtv for me and this device is great for watching the ballgames. Overall I am a very satisfied customer!

I have had this product for some time and am very satisfied with it. However, I don't recall seeing a lot of detailed operational instructions with it. Admittedly, I am one who installs first and reads the instructions later. It is a very easy installation and the quality of the programming such as movies is outstanding. The user interface is easy to navigate and I like the feature where I can see trailers for movies and if I don't have time to watch it now, I just place it in my wish list or queue. They also provide customer and critic's reviews. I am running both Apple TV and Roku 2 XS side by side. I did it because I wanted to see which one was the best overall with the intent to returning one of them. Instead I kept them both. I'll save the Roku evaluation for a little later but they are both very good streaming devices with different user interfaces and slightly different offerings. The quality of streaming HD movies on Apple TV is outstanding. I was pleasantly surprised. There is absolutely no freezing, choppiness (truncation) or any other distractions. I ran out of HDMI ports on the TV (which you must have to ensure the highest picture and sound resolution), so I purchased a HDMI switch to hook both Apple TV and Ruku 2 XS. So depending on which product I use, I just switch back and forth. I would also recommend that you not spend a lot of money on expensive HDMI cables. That is simply a lot of hype. You can buy very good HDMI cables for around $15.00 give or take. Just so you know you must have adequate bandwidth. I run at about 24 Mbps and am using a Linksys Gb router. I feel comfortable saying that you can have half the bandwidth that I have and still have a very satisfying experience.
summary: Take a bite of Apple TV

reviewText: I have issues when connecting to entertainment site such as Hulu and Netflix. Does not seem to connect smartly, minutes upon minutes of doing the Hula. and never connecting. This is the case with both my Apple TV devices in two different location and ISP provider.No issues with AirPlay. performance, Works super well.

I have long had and used the old white model, with built in hard drive. It worked well, but i had issues. Mostly sync speed and app support. This model seems to have handled those issues. Speed is fantastic and the array of Netflix and similar apps available on it makes it an all line one media device. Highly recommended.

I have my whole house wired with Apple TV's with a airport extreme tied to a HD for digital movies and such. I have a great time with this! My friends love that they can select any of the 500 movies I have with a click of a button. I look forward to using these items for many years to come! Digital Streaming is the way of the future!

I have no idea how I lived without it. It's far superior to Roku, XBox, and all those other vehicles to run apps like Netflix and Hulu to the TV.  I have used both the XD Roku and XBox Live and Apple TV is far faster, runs smoother, and is easier to use; that alone would be enough to get it. On top of that though, you can play music or videos on the TV wirelessly from you Mac, IPhone, or IPad... But if you don't have any Apple products, it's still superior to the other devices.
I haven't watched actual television for the past 3 weeks! I gave it 4 stars because it seems to loose connection kinda often, while my other gadgets never do.

I have one at home and at work.  We use at home for movies, tv, music, and pictures.  At work we airplay our pictures, emails and anything else we have on our ipads and iphones.  works flawlessly and will eventually replace your cable subscription.
I have one for every room in the house - everything we watch comes over the internet to my TV via the Apple TV. My life wouldn't be the same without it!

I have one of the first ROKU's and of course has a little problems. Since all my "toys' are from Apple, I decided to try the Apple TV. The setup instruction is not clear, but going on the internet to the Apple site, there you can get all the missing details.The unit works absolutely fine and since we are fluent in several languages, we can watch not only movies but most of the foreign TV stations. We don't have to see the tinted US news of course.I'm sure if Apple comes with a new unit in the future, even so I don't know what they can do better, I'm sure I will buy it.
summary: Excellent unit and easy to handle.

reviewText: I have one of these for every tv in the house and office.  to me for the price is a fantastic product.

I have one of these on each TV and utilize my iTunes library continually and throughout the house.  I also utilize them for NBA league pass and other online streaming.  For a hobby, Apple has really developed a good device.
summary: Apple's hobby that works for me

reviewText: I have owned several Apple TVs of all three generations, I have loved the concept from the very beginning. This device is the reason that I don't pay cable TV, just a very fast internet connection plus Netflix, iTunes etc. This third generation goes all the way to full 1080p HD resolution and costs less than half what the first edition cost - and it is so much more capable. My only wish for improvement is for Apple to find a way to offer channel based TV subscriptions, it would be fantastic to put together your own lineup and pay accordingly. It's simply amazing what a small box for less than a hundred bucks can do. I have yet to come across someone who doesn't enjoy using an Apple TV. There's one on every single TV in my household.

I have owned three media player and have over two hundred videos on my system, so this is not my first time to the party.  If you are wanting a media system that is reliable, responsive, easy to use and offers solid pack of features the apple TV 3 is the unit to buy.  I have two in my home.  I will give you the pros and an outline of how you have to set up a system with this unit.1. The wireless feature is high quality I have never had an issue with data transfer or streaming video. (my router is in the basement and my apple tvs are upstairs)2. The family share feature allows you to access all your music, photo's and video files on your home network.3. The screensaver options are extensive and easy to personalize. I have 300 photos that cascade across the screen with music playing from my library. Great feature for parties.4. The slideshow feature has a large selection of shows that all play music , play in fixed order or shuffle and are great for parties also.5. The video and photo libraries work the same as the itunes music library so cover art and genres are easy to set-up. (FYI  the video and photos are run through the itunes program)Out line system configuration:If you are wanting all your videos in a network storage system and your DVDs in a box this is the best way to do it from what I have expereinced.You will need all of the items below:1. Dual band Wireless router with 802.11 N speed equiped with video streaming  ( I use a  Belkin N750 Dual Band Wireless N Gigabyte Router2. Network storage device  (media server, DNLP, NOS  I use a WD MY Book Live  6TB)3.  Dedicated work station  ( I use an old window xp tower this computer will sit in the corner and run 24/7  mine is in the basement)4. Apple TV 35. iTunes installed on the workstationThe set up is easy, just follow the instructions for the network storage the My Book Live is super simple.  Install the itunes on the workstation (basic computer for nontechies) connect the workstation to the router and load your media on the storage system then copy links to itunes (drag and drop to itunes).  Install apple TV 3 on tv and follow on screen set up. Activate home sharing on itunes and apple TV now you have access to all your personal media.  (side note: if you don't know how to copy your DVDs to your network you will need ripping software.  Their are several free programs on the net I recommend a software package called DVDFAB it cost $200 for the suite but, is the best I have used no more legal notices, movie previews and can convert standard dvd  and bluerays to appleTv langauage (Mpeg4)

I have purchased 3 of these to have one on each TV.  I really like the way it interacts with all of my devices and provides both air play and access to my iTunes library for music, photos and movies.  I really haven't found anything to complain about other than you do have to check for software & firmware updates, there is no notification.

I have put off buying this forever, finally took the plunge last week, wish I had spent the $99 years ago.  If you have an IPad, of Mac in the house, then this is a wonderful device to have.As with all Apple devices, it works seamlessly with all of them, easiest set up I have ever had, connect HDMI cable, power cable, and login to your accounts.The minimalistic remote is a joy, three button, wow, only potential problem is it's so small.Works on 802.11 g/n, guessing they will add 802.11ac soon, amazing performance on such a small unit.HIGHLY recommend

I have really enjoyed this Apple product and do not wish I had gone with the more expensive.  My husband and I watch you-tube and netflix on it but also enjoy VIMEO and VUDU and several other apps--not to mention showing off our computer pictures on the television while we entertain.

I have regressed back to PC's for the last several years (because work makes me and I'm not made out of money, yo) but I try to buy Apple products when I can - and boy, do I love the Apple TV. This thing is great - super easy interface and it has HBO Go! Huzzah!
I have several, and use them quite a bit. I hope Apple continues to update and expand on the features of this product, but it is pretty good as-is.

I have the 2nd generation unit, which I've been pleased with.  However, I recently upgraded a 2nd TV to a 50" Plasma.  My son wanted to watch "Frosty" and "Mr. Grinch" on the new TV, but since both were part of my iTunes Library, I could not easily stream them to the new Plasma.  Now that I have this unit hooked up to the Plasma, streaming is perfect.  Of course, it all depends on your Internet Connection, but it's nice to stream 1080p content directly from the Apple Servers to this device with no lags or loss in picture quality.Setup is a breeze.  All I had to do was select my preferred language, enter my Apple ID and Password and all my iTunes content was available.  It really cannot get any easier!
summary: A must have for anyone who buys movies/shows on iTunes and has a HDTV

reviewText: I have the fastest inet I can get which is about 50Mb down. Compared to a Samsung Smart TV with apps the AppleTV dominates. Compared to DirecTV with OnDemand the AppleTV dominates. Compared to the Netflix app on AppleTV iTunes movie streaming dominates. Compared to a Playstation 3 interface the AppleTV dominates. Samsung Smart TV lags terribly in the interface. Netflix app on AppleTV takes forever to buffer, stutters, and has limited content. AppleTV movies play within seconds, never stutter, and have all the new releases you'd expect. AppleTV even has content that hasn't hit theaters yet. If you buy an AppleTV it would benefit you to buy into the Apple ecosystem i.e. iTunes Match, Photo Streams, a Mac computer, and even an Apple WiFi Access Point. When you put all those things together everything just works. It may be a little more expensive upfront but it's worth it when it just works. The most I've had to do is reboot the AppleTV or open and close iTunes but after the last couple of software updates everything has been working brilliantly

I have the last generation, which I love, but the improvements are amazing.How can you live without Airplay?????????????Just click on a photo or song, and play it thru your audio in your house.So easy to use

I have this device for almost a year now.  At first I thought this little gadget was over priced but now believe it is worth every penny I paid for. The video and sound quality from YouTube streaming on this Apple TV device  is unbelievable and better than what you get from the Hi-Def channels on dish network.  Netflix video/audio streaming quality is excellent.  Now you know why Apple products are priced higher than competitor's and why their stock price is > $550/share.You can also remotely connect your iPad thru Air Play to Apple TV and view your iPad screen/pictures, etc on the TV screen with no loss of sound or picture quality. Way to go Apple.  Steve Jobs was a genius who clearly differentiated Apple products from the rest of the competetion.The smart TV interface for Youtube and other internet browsing is garbage and hard to navigate.The remote is sleek and very user friendly and has a robust builtin WiFi.No cons except a bit expensive but definitely worth the price.  I will recommend this to anyone who wants to watch quality YouTube, Netflix  streaming and iPad mirroring on the TV.

I have three of these throughout our house and we love them. We use them mostly to watch Netflix shows and movies as well as the more recent movies from the Apple store. The interface is super slick and easy to navigate. I just wish we could create shortcuts or favorites to minimize the number of clicks it takes to get to things we use frequently.

I have to admit I got a Roku some months ago and then got the Apple TV a month ago...not my initial plan to get both, but I'm glad I did. I use both of them and like them equally. I use different apps on each, so I and my housemate can keep our places in different apps. Since I might only watch for 10 minutes at a time, I don’t want to spend time opening an app and finding my place in a show.I did set up Plex for Roku, but I way prefer streaming from my iPad or iPhone to Apple TV. Its so much easier to search on the iPhone or iPad, for streaming YouTube, movie trailers, music or videos. Also any friend or housemate in the house with an iPhone can stream to the Apple TV. Besides, there is a fun element of seeing your little devise stream to a big TV.I just checked and I could stream a movie from my iPad Amazon Prime app to Apple TV. It DID go full screen just as YouTube videos do. I couldn't tell on resolution. It looked the same to me when I went back to the Amazon app on the Roku and looked at the same movie clip. I can't swear to it though. If you intend to get the Apple TV and stream Amazon Prime, than I would check reviews on resolution or call Apple. I also don't know what would happen with various iPhones. I believe the resolution went up to at least TV resolution on the recent devises. I would say you DO want HD though if you have a big TV. From Amazon's end of things, I believe Amazon streams to the iPad or iPhone in HD. Last I read some months ago Amazon does not stream movies in HD to computers even if you paid for HD. As long as that is the case, in my mind that might knock Apple TV out of the running for streaming Amazon from a mac to Apple TV.The other issue would be bandwidth.  I am told by Apple tech help that when you stream from a computer or devise to your Apple TV, you are using double the bandwidth.  I have fiber to the home so I haven't noticed any slowing down.As for usability of the devises, I enjoy both Apple TV and Roku. They both handle well, and are quick enough, and both are user friendly.With Apple TV just make sure you pair your remote with the Apple TV.  I didn't know that mine wasn't paired, because the remote was working. But some flaky things were happening in one app which I was blaming on the app. When I called into Apple tech support they showed me how to pair the remote to the TV... phew... that fixed my problems.
I have to say, sadly, the Apple TV changed my life. Definitely opened up worlds of new viewing possibilities (Netflix, Smithsonian, etc).
I have tried a lot of methods of streaming movies from my computer to my tv, NOTHING works better than this. I just use my iPad, iPhone or macbook and its SO simple.

I have tried at different times to play movies from my PC or NAS on my TV through my home theatre.  Each time ending frustrated and disgusted.  I was told about the Apple TV and said to myself "so it plays iTunes, it's probably a bitch to set up"  But, I went and put down the $99 for the unit.  After a day of being able to watch movies (with the surround sound pushed through so the entire experience is maintained)  and listen to music on my PC without having to go through all kinds of hassle I went out and got another for the bedroom.  Now I can easily watch or listen to what I want where I want.  The only requirement is that iTunes has to be running on the PC where you want to play content.  The screen can be locked and if you happen to be using the machine while someone is playing a movie or listening to music you don't have to watch or listen to their selections.  Setup is quite simple and access is controlled via and iTunes store account.  Any purchases made through iTunes are available to you on the Apple TV for streaming purposes.  3rd party Apps are VERY limited.  But that said it does a excellent job of what it does, even though it is limited.  There has been an update so that any IOS devices can "mirror" what is on their screen onto the apple TV.  Also the latest generation of Mac's can mirror what is shown on their screen onto the apple TV.  So any net movies can now be viewed on the TV.  A good enhancement.  Overall I'm happy with the Apple TV, just wishing it had more 3rd party app support.  Connectivity on the back includes HDMI as well as fibre optic cable for the audio.  The box is small and unobtrusive.
summary: Connectivity to Movies on your computer with Ease

reviewText: I have trouble to display my mac image on the tv, but I think it could be my wifi.  I didn't have any problem installing it.
summary: Hmmm...  Not that much of content

reviewText: I have two apple TVs now - one in my bedroom, one in the family room.What I like about the apple tv is that it's easy to use, like apple products in general. The user interface is easy - anyone can use it. Actually my 75+ year old father in law recently got one, and it's a breeze for him to use. Along with the remote control included with it, navigation of menus is really easy and apple-like. There's also an iphone/ipad app that you can use to control the apple TV, helpful if you lose the apple tv remote (the remote is rather small). The remote has 3 buttons - play/pause, menu, and a button for right/left/up/down/select. It's well made.I use it for netflix. We have netflix built into our TVs. But the user interface for netflix on the apple tv is slicker and easier to use than that on our TVs.The Apple TV has limited channels - not like the hundreds of channels offered on the Roku. I've never tried the Roku, but channel selection would be a good selling point for the roku. But the apple TV integrates very nicely with other apple products. You can use the apple TV to use airplay with your iphone, ipad, mac computer, apple airport express base station. You could use it to listen to music coming from one apple TV but piped into a tv hooked up with another apple TV. I use it to wireless transmit streaming movies and TV from my ipad to my screen via the apple tv. The only problem is that when doing this, the screen size doesn't take up the entire size of the screen.
i have two in my home. it's a great product of apple.i love it. this new HD version is perfect.
I have two of these because I liked the first one I got another one for my wives TV. I like it more now since I can play Amzon videos.

I have two of these now. One for the kids TV and one for my TV. I have another Blu-Ray player that utilizes WiFi for streaming Netflix or HULU Plus that is just plain inferior to the AppleTV. Not just the navigation, but the actual speed of streaming and drop-outs are awful on the DVD player. If you use any Apple devices, like an iPhone, Mac or iPad, the AppleTV is the way to go! Airplay works seamlessly and you can control it with the Remote App for iPhone/iPad and iPodTouch.
summary: Excellent companion to other apple devices!

reviewText: I have two units - I bought the new version to get the enhanced video output.  It's great to interface to Netflix as well as all of the computers.  Easy to use and setup.
I have used for months and love. Watch Netflix and ESPN3-sporting events over WiFi. Move from room to room if needed. Would highly recommend.

I have warts very similar to the previous poster. Let me start by saying it is incredibly difficult to get rid of warts on the fingers, especially having to deal with the tape falling off every time you get your hands wet. I've actually had to use this product on the SAME warts several times. It turns warts white and I will think they have fallen off, but soon, I can see them start growing back in again. I've been through this cycle 3 times already. Obviously the acid hasn't been able to penetrate deep enough to kill the wart at its root, but after a month of treatment (which is the recommended maximum) this last time, I'm pretty disappointed that it still hasn't been able to do its job.
I hear that this product is limited in comparison to a Roku, but I don't have a Roku to make the comparison.  This product is really easy to use.  I am a happy customer.

I hesitated to buy this at first because of Roku 3 but after receiving the Apple TV and playing with it for awhile I am absolutely impressed by it. Everything worked seamlessly right out of the box. If you already have other Apple products at home this is a must have. Once you get one you'll kick yourself for not getting it earlier.
summary: I should have bought this earlier

reviewText: I initially go this to watch videos and try to eliminate cable.  It's not enough.  While I'm a family with three iPhones and two iPads, it's not compelling enough to have just the Apple TV.  Apples holds the reigns too tightly to be the sole device.  They are slow to add channels and functionallity.I also have a Roku and it provides much more functionallity and a lot more channels.  WIth the use of PlayOn software on my PC and the Roku I have all of the TV I want (recorded, not live) along with Netflix and all of the other video services.

reviewText: I initially purchased the 2nd generation Apple TV and my family used it so much that I bought the 3rd generation for our other TV. Both versions look the same, but the 3rd gen. supports 1080p.We have a Netflix streaming subscription, and use the Apple TV for that, but there are many devices that offer access to Netflix, Hulu, You Tube, etc. so that isn't the reason to buy this, in fact the Roku box offers more in the web-based steaming channel category at the moment. The real reason to buy the Apple TV is the ability to stream media from your ITunes account.I've streamed my media to devices in the past, including an Xbox and a PS3, but this was the easiest by far. This is the only device ive ever had that my wife will actually take the time to use for streaming purposes. she always complained that the other setups i used were too tedious and unintuitive. With the Apple TV, iif you are on a network, and have a PC with iTunes running and Home Sharing enabled, you can access everything you have loaded into iTunes.Then there is airplay, which allows you to actually use your iOS device to communicate with the Apple TV. Anything you have in your iPhone or iPad can quickly and easily be shown on the Apple TV. Streaming music, videos and even viewing apps has never been this easy. The box does a lot more than what I've mentioned, but these are the main features my family uses.
summary: A Must Have if you use media and have an IOS device

reviewText: I just bought this for the chord as I needed to replace mine. Works great and was the cheapest way to get a chord. Took a little while to get here fr China but I'm pleased.

reviewText: I just got an Apple TV and for the most part I love it. I would give it 5 stars if it had more apps like Pandora and Last fm. Setup was simple and I love being able to connect my Mac.

I just got a new MacBook Pro, and was excited to give Apple TV a try.The good - images (still images and slideshows) are wonderful, and it has that Apple one-click and it works kind of setup. YouTube plays well as long as you use Safari, but for some reason sound won't play using Chrome browser.The bad - I first tried it while staying at a friend's house, and found the video choppy -- downloaded videos play smooth as silk on the laptop, but suffers from stutter on the TV. I thought it must be their network or something, and went ahead and ordered one for myself. But I have the same problem here at home, and I have a state of the art setup with high speed everything.And the real reason for such a low rating - Apple support has been a mixed bag -- the first woman I spoke with was snarky and rude and suggested I reset everything in my house and I found her completely unhelpful; the next person I spoke with was more helpful, and suggested I download the latest updates, which I did. They may have improved things slightly, but there is still this hesitation that gets in the way of a wonderful experience.  At least he gave me a case number, so I can call back and see if they have more suggestions. But I think this is a bug on their end, and one they should acknowledge.
summary: Marvelous concept, but has a ways to go yet

reviewText: I like the idea of this device, and if I could get it to do everything they say it will, I would love it.Problem is, I can't get it to work consistently.  I have it hooked up to my home network - wired not wireless -  with a cable modem connection.I've tried to use it for Netflix movies as well as streaming video from other apple computers over the network.As far as Netflix goes, most of the time it works great. However sometimes it just doesn't want to download my netflix movie or it just drops the movie in the middle.Another annoying thing, Apple updates the software and one time when they did it, some of the netflix features were missing, including access to my instant queue.  The next week or so that came back.  I suspect Apple wants you to use it's Itunes store rather than Netflix, so they make it a little inconvenient.I tried to get some movies to stream from my apple desktop machine, but I haven't been able to make that happen either very well. I got it to work once, but haven't gotten it to work again.One interesting feature is being able to show content from an Iphone or an Ipad.  We had several folks at once showing videos one after another one day - that worked great.Customer service: After about six months, the remote control quit working.  This thing is useless without the remote - it's a brick.  You can't turn it on, you can't do anything with it.I had to make an appointment at the Apple store, then wait in line for my appointment, only to find that nobody in the store seemed to know much about Apple TV.  They took the batteries out of the remote on one of their display units, and since the remote seemed to make the lights on the Apple TV blink, they said I needed to buy a new remote battery (they didn't give me one)...  So I took it home, put new battery in the remote and of course it still did nothing.  Back to the Apple store - where after another hour of waiting they finally found a new remote control for me.  It was an excruciating wait for a $99 device to get fixed.  It would have been cheaper just to buy a new one.  It did work fine after the new remote.I hope they get the glitches fixed.  As I said, I like the device, I just wish I could get it work more consistently.
summary: Kind of glitchy - but I like it when it works.

It's annoying because everything is like this. It's unlike every other streaming device, like xBoxes, Ps3's, iPads, iPhones, Smart TV's, BluRay Players, etc. So with this, you don't get some features other devices get since it's not the Netflix/Hulu experience that you get on EVERY OTHER DEVICE. For example, the special profile's for each user(Netflix), not there. The "Max" service on Netflix, again, not there.I hope in a near future update they make the 3rd Party apps the way EVERY OTHER device uses it.Besides that huge con, the device is amazing. It also learns any remote so you can use one remote for everything! Pretty awesome device, just one huge flaw in my point of view.(By the way I'm not hating on Apple. I love my AppleTV. It provides an amazing service that makes it much easier to part ways with your monthly cable TV bill. For just under a hundred bucks, you get access to Apple's entire media ecosystem, including the hottest TV shows and movie rentals in HD. You also get access to apps like Netflix, Hulu, and YouTube to round out your entertainment choices. And since all of this content is on demand, you don't even need a DVR.Setup and operation couldn't be easier. Just enter your Apple ID, your WiFi credentials, and you're good to go. Once you're online, it's easy to find what you're looking for. The menus are easy to navigate, and while typing in search terms with the included remote can be a chore, you can search for content.The two main drawbacks are 1) you won't find a lot of live content on AppleTV and 2) you can't sit back and channel surf (though in some ways, that's arguably a good thing). A simple HD antenna can do the trick for the major networks, but for events like basketball, you might be out of luck. And while you can purchase NBA, MLB, and NHL packages for use with AppleTV, licensing agreements black out a lot of the games you'll want to see anyway.That said, the amount you save by using and AppleTV over your cable TV service can't be overstated. Even if you purchase four or five seasons of your favorite TV shows and rent a couple of movies, depending on what cable TV package you have, you could easily save anywhere from $500-$900 a year. That's a lot of money. And even if you do decide to stick with your cable TV subscription, movie rentals and access to Netflix and Hulu on your TV still make AppleTV a compelling purchase.

I love my Apple TV! It's super easy to set up and use. Just make sure you have a Netflix or Hulu Plus account, otherwise you'll be getting things with your iTunes account.This also works great with your iPod or iPhone (and in my case my iMac) great for playing music from my iPhone through the home theatre system - if I get a call, it pauses the music and then starts playing again when the call is ended.
summary: A great way to cut the cable cord!
