reviewText: I love our apple TV.  It allows us to steam netflix, hulu and more right on the TV so we are not forced to sit around a laptop. Recently Apple has been adding content, and while much of it is still dependent on having cable we still get a lot of use out of it. So true cord cutters might not be happy with it yet.If you are dedicated to the apple ecosystem this is a must buy. It connects to your iTunes account and allows me to stream my music, iCloud pictures (great for when family comes over and wants to see pictures of the kids) and movies. We purchase a lot of disney blu rays with digital copies and they stream directly to the TV no looking for discs. I love this box, we are considering buying a second for other rooms in our house.

I love that i can mirror my ipad to my television. I also have to give kudos for the screen saver. Even if you don't have an an iOS device, Apple TV is an awesome upgrade to any TV that doesn't have wifi.

I love that I was able to call my cable company and cancel my tv subscription saving me hundreds of dollars a month.  This product is easy to install, easy to use, and since I installed it on my tv, I have purchased and installed it in my son's home, my daughters home, and my mom's home, saving everyone money!

I love that the Apple Tv connects with all my other apple products (airport, iPhone, macbook, etc) and I really like the airplay function for games and music. I've had other smart players with the same apps, but the Apple TV works so much smoother and loads faster than Roku or my smart Blu-Ray, which is great! I'm also really glad I can stream all the movies and tv shows that I've bought in the past, that I don't keep on my hard drive, which saves a lot of precious space on my laptop (which I almost never use for watching TV). Most of all, the definition of the streaming quality is very good. I have it hooked into my bedroom TV right now, which is old so I can't say it's super HD yet, I still need to put it to the 1080p test...but I'm confident that it'll pass. This is a great addition to a high quality Tv's, because the new smart tv's are often a bit slow, and can't connect to other devices the way Apple Tv can. All in all, it makes life a bit easier and my TV watching experience a bit better!CON: The remote is pretty small and sleek, but I often find myself needing to type something in, and it's a total b**ch! I downloaded the remote app to type stuff in, but I don't really like it, sometimes my phone is unreachable! Mostly, I'm usually too lazy to find my phone and open the app. You can connect a bluetooth keyboard, but  I don't want a whole keyboard to sit around, I just wish they had a small remote with a qwerty keyboard on the back to make things easier.

I love the airplay. My wife and I use that a lot and netflix is the other one we use. Renting movies off there seems like a waste of time. We rented Cloudy With A Chance of Meatballs 2 and it was $4.99 for 24 hours. Kind of pricy compared to services like redbox and it took about 6 hours to be ready to play in HD using my slower internet connection. We rented Thor from redbox for about a dollar and of course it plays straight away being a DVD. Other than that we love our Apple TV.

I love the apple TV, i actually bought two of those one for the living room one for the bedroom. they work great and i mostly watch tv shows and movies on it. i'll sometimes stream from my mac as well. overall great product.
I love the AppleTV I love using it for watching Netflix and Hulu on my big screen TV Also mirroring my  iPad and iPhone Display With airplay
summary: Great if you like watching Hulu and Netflix on your TV

reviewText: I love the Apple TV. I originally bought it to watch iTunes Movies on our TV but now we watch a lot more than iTunes Movies on it. We used it a lot when our cable line was getting moved to watch ESPN, because it supports WatchESPN. We also use it a lot for Netflix, now that it supports the new profile feature. And I really like AirPlay, because I can stream anything from my iPod or iPad to the TV, and there is virtually no lag at all. Overall, I really like the Apple TV and think it is definitely worth it, especially if you live in the Apple ecosystem.--David
I love the apple TV!  It is very handy for showing your screen on the tv, plus it has an awesome Netflix app!!  I bought one for my grandparents and they loved it as well!
I love the Apple TV! It just continues to get better as Apple adds more features with each software update.
I love the Apple TV it works great and is really cool. It's super fast and delivers great hd it's also great for air play. Now that I have the Apple TV I would not be able to live without it!

I love the Apple TV! We use it for work purposes with an iPad and absolutely love it! I have not tried watching movies or anything with it since it is for work but hopefully one day I will get a chance to.
I love the convenience of being able to use my Ipad to play music and show pictures, slides, and videos on a larger screen wirelessly to the kids I teach!
I love the device.  It met my expectations... I'm be enjoying it for long time.. Thank you for the reminder.
I love the little remote that comes with this.  An apt for iPad installs a keyboard for the remote, making it easier to use.

I love the the Apple TV. Although it isn't mature enough for myself, it still feels like there is room to grow, it is growing and becoming a better product and is already a great device for most people. I bought it once Hulu was announced because I ditched TV and wanted a low power media streamer that had Netflix and Hulu. With this last update to iOS 5.1 for the Apple TV, it added the ability to move icons which I think is pretext to Apps, which would make this a killer device. I am already exited for the possibilities this brings to it. I would recommend buying if you already have any of the Apple Ecosystem like the iPad, iPhone, iPod or Macbook.Pros:Low Power UsageHas Netflix and HuluCan stream my media from iTunesCan use my iOS devices as a remoteCan stream pictures and video from my iPhone to Apple TV with easeCan stream my Macbook screen to Apple TV with easeNEW: Can stream from Apple TV to Airplay speakers!Cons:Making it sleep is kind of a pain, you need to force it in settings or wait 15 mins. I wish there was a button combo...No Apps... yet...Apple UI paradigm is forced on Netflix and Hulu, which isn't optimal for themWish i could remove/delete/hide sports apps
summary: Almost Perfect... most definitely worth the price

reviewText: I love this apple product as it seamlessly integrates all of my apple devices. Streaming is flawless and quick. Set up was a no-brainer. The simplicity of the remote is elegant and intuitive. Great buy!
I love this device because i can watch great movies using wireless and my family enjoy them its fun to watch with family and friends
I love this device.  Now I can watch All My Children and One Life to Live on Hulu Plus on the bigger TV screen rather than on my IPad or computer.
I love this easy to assemble technology.  I use it for Netflix currently and it is fabulous!!! Looking forward to learning more of its functions.....

I love this for watching NHL and MLB. I did not want to pay the higher price for the hockey package with the cable provider, and satellite companies that I have been over the last 10+ years so I figured I would give the streaming a try. I was a little hesitant due to issues you sometimes see on your computer with delays, I am happily surprised. This works great, I have only had minimal delays on streaming to load up the show, but after it is going I have had no issues to this point. If this works this well over the next year I think I will look into cutting the cord on cable and test the waters streaming all my shows. The issues I see are: not a ton of options at this point with apple TV, but I just ordered a ROKU that seems to have a ton of watching options so I dropped my star rating to a 4 due to no availability to expand my viewing options on this unit.
I love this little box, I have almost replaced my cable with it.  My entertainment budget has gone down, and that includes the cost of this unit.
I love this little overpriced gadget. We use it to display on a larger monitor the ForeFlight display from a Redbird FMX through a Bad Elf Cygnus connection.
I love this!  Makes using my tv so much easier.  Looks just like my iPAD.  My son suggested this to me.
I love this product, and the only problem I have is sometime when I am watching HBO through this item it keeps freezing, and coming back -- so, I don't know if it is my carrier or the Apple TV???

I love this product. Great sound, great picture, great quality overall. Seamless integration with my computer's itunes library, my ipad and the internet. It works perfectly in Nigeria. Downside, is not enough content on it. Apple should open it up to more content providers and allow users download whichever provider they want just like apps on the app store. Also would be nice to have a browser, so you can stream video from any website you want. That's why i give it a 4.

I love this product. I was surprised at all that it does like AirPlay for music and video, Netflix and many other commercial streaming services, and Internet radio.  Plus, photo stream slide show!  I loved that I could take a picture during a party and it would show up on the tv!

I love this product! The selection of apps that come with the iOS is great, there is something for everybody. The set up is sooooo easy and connecting to my wifi is even easier. Very intuitive and easy to use
I love this product. Very easy to set up and very easy to use. The price was competitive and the delivery was as advertised. I am very satisfied.
I love this thing if you use itunes netflix or hulu this device is great also it allows u to use apples internet radio with 50 million choices lol
I love this thing. I have one in the living room and one in the bed room. Can't fall asleep without it. No problems whatsoever.

I  love this tiny device and use it all the time with minimum difficulty  Once in a while it requires restarting but that has not been a problem.  I like the ease with which it is installed and the fact that it is so small and not cumbersome.

I love this unit!!! You can stream music right from your iPhone or computer which is the main use for me. I do wish it had an app built in for Pandora but no biggie! I can stream Pandora from my iPhone... Very cool unit that does a lot!
I love this!!!! Works awesome in Europe!!!!! Was simple to set up and works amazing! Definitely would recommend to others!
I love to use it to stream from my ipad. Have not tried to see if it works from other devices, but ipad is enough for me...
i love to watch my tv shows in my apple tv, i pluged my apple in a projector and is awesome.
I loveu it, it is apple, it works, it is easy to install, it is samll and it is HD
I love using this Apple TV. I only use it to mirror my MacBook Pro to my TV. Only complaint is I wish they have Amazon Instant Video on it.

i love watching tv shows on Netflix with no commercials. i tried roku first and it knocked my internet off every time i tried to watch a second movie so i had to send it back. since then, we bought a new router, so i don't know if it's because of the router or the apple tv that i can watch as much netflix as i want without the internet popping off.  on it's own merits, i think the apple tv is great, except they're too cheap to include a cable.  but its an easy install and setup. didn't even have to read the instructions.
I love watching Youtube.com on my AppleTv. Great quality as ALL Apple products are! Highly recommend this product. You'll love it!

Images are too small and trying to type out characters for search strings too tedious often getting the wrong character and needing to drive around for the backspace. Look ahead type guessing while I'm typing in a search would be a welcome enhancement!
summary: Interface is in desperate need of a remake

reviewText: I'm a huge apple products guy anyway but surprisingly it has taken me a while to purchase the apple TV.  I finally bought this product less than a month ago but I'd have to say so far, so good.  I'm pretty satisfied.  It has lived up to the billing to this point.

I'm a huge Apple (Steve Jobs) fan and I purchased this after I obtained several iOS devices so that I could AirPlay content. I also wanted to have a device that could connect to Netflix. So far, I do like the Apple TV but I do think there is room for improvement. Search can sometimes be slow since you have to go from letter to letter (Maybe a model with Siri will come out soon but who knows). Also, I'm bummed that my 2010 i7 MacBook Pro cannot AirPlay, that was a real bummer after I upgraded to Mountain Lion. Also, streaming speeds can be a little unpredictable, sometimes AirPlay or streaming content just doesn't work. All in all, it's good, maybe great, but not perfect.

I'm an Apple guy (iPhone, iPad, MBP, Mac mini, and Apple TV).  There are a ton of products out there that will make your TV "smart" but Apple just does it better.  I love how all my products work together seamlessly: I purchase a movie on iTunes and it's available on my TV, MBP, iPad, and iPhone. No burning discs, no cables.
Im an apple junkie so why wouldn't I have this!!! I signed up for nextflix and canceled my cable saving me over $100 per month. Best purchase Ive ever made.

I'm an Apple share holder but I have to admit I didn't expect what happened when I hooked it up. Homeshare worked wirelessly between my Windows 7 PC with iTunes and the Apple TV. But guess what? The internet shuts down for all the PCs, including the one I have iTunes on. And it's not easy to get it going again. After Googling it, it appears that a lot of other people have the same problem. It has something to do with my router which is a Linksys WRT54G and the IP address. You know what, it should be plug-n-play and it isn't in my case, and I'm not an Apple geek who prefers to spend his life trying to fix what shouldn't need fixing. I suspect if you have a Mac or iPad you won't have this problem, but if you have what I have, you probably will be unhappy. On the plus side, playing your iTunes content through the system or ordering content through Netflix, etc., is very cool. It is the future so I'll keep it and wait until I have a day to fix what shouldn't have to be fixed.UPDATE: Aug 2013. I moved and now have a new comcast router/modem combo and the "shuts down the Internet problem is gone. After many month I really like the Apple TV, especially the iTunes music capability and YouTube. It is well worth the money when hooked up to your TV and stereo. The older modem/router was the problem. Now my PCs and iPhone/iPads work fine.
summary: I recommend but older routers/modems can be problematic

reviewText: I'm glad to have the AppleTV as it's fun and ads a new dimension to our entertainment.I had a problem with network/WiFi conectivity drops but believe I made some changes in the WAP that have taken care of it.The thing I'm surprised about, and disappointed in is the lack of comprehensive music and playback control.  To add music to what's playing is useless.  If you don't build playlists or play by category like genre, artists etc., you really can't build a current play list or "now playing" and have mush control over it.There are probably better appliances out there for a little less money, but over all, I'm pretty happy with this.  I do hope they add more control to it though.
summary: It's cool to have, but it could be better...

reviewText: I'm happy with my Apple TV . One thing , I think I got to learn how to used . I rent a movie and it took a long time to download .by the time the movie has expired , only see half  Of the movie.

I'm most happy with the ability to show my Flickr pictures on my large screen TV.  We have had many enjoyable family get-togethers where I can so easily now share and enjoy the pictures that I've taken via Flickr and videos on Youtube.I also enjoy being able to show my iPhone display and Netflix on the TV and play Internet radio channels as well.  I was concerned as to whether the performance over WIFI would work.  Even though I do have a hard wired cat5 cable available from my router upstairs I decided to try the WIFI first.  It works so well I never plugged the cable in.  I highly recommend the Apple TV unit.
summary: Very happy with Apple TV multiple features

reviewText: I'm not sure if I like this more than my Google TV or not, but this one works very well.

I mostly use my Apple TV for the iTunes Stores (renting movies) and Netflix, but I also have an app called Plex Media Server on my computers that I can use to stream video to my Apple TV such as other downloaded media an can control everything from my iDevices. Perfect if you are in the Apple ecosystem and still works with Android through various apps.
summary: Inexpensive way to play media through your TV

reviewText: Important part for me is that the apple TV is super light and can be mounted on the back of a wall mounted LCD with just a little piece of velcro.  If it wasn't for that I probably wouldn't have bought it and instead used a traditional computer with HDMI output for itunes/netflix/amazon.Pros:  Cheap (I paid $80), box itself is small and light, love the look and feel of the remote.  The first standard remote that I don't want to instantly find a way to replace.  Can get to my itunes library on the TV (which I COULD do with a traditional PC but not with chromecast).  Love the way that it turns on and off on its own.  Clean look that even the technologically impaired can navigate.Cons:  More expensive than a Chromecast.  No native amazon app (need to airplay from another device to use amazon prime instant video).Additional Con:  This one is the fault of the American people NOT the fault of Apple or Amazon.  My streaming ability was immediately degraded by my internet provider the second the supreme court overturned the FCC regulation preventing violations of network neutrality.  This product is less useful now than it was in the past because the American people don't care enough about not getting bent over by Comcast/AT&T; etc to elect representatives that will pass laws requiring network neutrality protections.

I'm reviewing v.3... which is the same as v.2... but now with 1080p.If you see my review for v.2 you should disregard it as they've made significant improvements to the user interface.In short... I love my AppleTVs.  One in the living room and one in my bedroom.  You can "mirror" your Apple's Mac to ALL your connected AppelTVs, so if you're running a movie for a bunch of friends through your mac (like I have a few times) you can have some of them in the living room and some of them in the bedroom watching the same thing.Enough about my life... the product itself is very intuitive to use, the interface is simple and sleek, and allows for iCloud information to be passed to your ATV (bought music on iTunes but don't have iMatch? No problem. All your music that you bought through iTunes now shows up on your ATV and you can play your music to your hearts content). Bought a movie or TV show from iTunes? It plays it via streaming.  They used to only stream rented movies, but NOW you can play any movies or tv shows that you've fully purchased via iTunes.What it DOESN'T do is allow you to play any iTunes extras (the added features that some iTunes movies comes with).  You'll need to run them through your Mac and send the "broadcast" over to your AppleTV.I also love the fact that it pairs up nicely with my Logitech Harmony remote. As simple as the included remote for ATV is, I like everything to be controlled through ONE remote... ONE remote to rule them all... and Apple TV plays nicely in that respect.Why ATV vs. Roku? Quite simply.... simplicity.  My roommate has my old Roku box.  And what I didn't like about it is that there were a plethora of "channels" to choose from, however, most of them had the same content that I could find on the Apple TV box and those apps (Netflix movies and shows, HuluPlus movies and shows, rental items from iTunes, sports apps, etc). You have to wade through all their "channels" to see what they were about and how useful they are to you. I found a majority of the channels NOT useful to me... even less useful when I found out that you had to pay a subscription services for a majority of those channels. And so this is why my roommate ended up with my Roku box.  He don't care. He's happy to have something for free.
summary: They got it right with v.3

reviewText: I'm so excited to have this.  It saves me $60 per month in cable fees.  You can even mirror your iphone to it and access the internet.  Great!

I'm sure there are going to be a lot more detailed reviews of this product on Amazon. I wanted the ability to mirror what was on my iPad on my big-screen TV, and the Apple TV does just that. Great for watching YouTube, streaming videos or whatever (wink--wink) is on your iPad on your television screen. I'm not sure about the quality of streaming video, but the sharpness of some video may be affected by watching on a large screen. Does exactly what I bought it for.
summary: Allows me to see the iPad screen on my TV

reviewText: I'm sure there are more technical reviews above or below this one. Apple TV allows you to mirror your iPhone / iPad, watch Netflix, YouTube, etc on your TV. I also use it to listen to music that is on my home computer, since you can sync the two together. Cancel cable, and you've paid for this baby in one month. If you don't like it, hook up cable again, and you have a "free" Apple TV to go along with your million cable shows!

I must say I bought this with a little apprehension, but I am surprised at how great the product really is and the ease of use. I love the air streaming feature, where from any other apple device like iPhone etc I can simply stream pics or videos I have taken on iPhone to my tv. I can stream music as well which means I don't need to buy another accessory to do this. Great product for great price.

I'm very happy with this device. It's very easy to set up and allows me to see the videos and movies in my iTunes library like I've never seen it before. There are only two wires; the power plug, and an HDMI cable. I was up and running in less then two minutes. The Apple TV walks you though set up; and that goes very fast. I get a lot of movies from iTunes, but Netflix and several other sources are available.The really good news is that the next version of the Mac operating system (OS 10.8) is going to have as part of the system software the ability to access your the browser on your Mac using you Apple TV on your flat screen. I'm happy with iTunes, You Tube, Netflix, etc.; been able to use the browser will be gravy.
I'm wandering why don't  Apple makes simple one like this and better, fully loaded model for the high end systems.
summary: It's okay, if you are just using for one TV or  with simple audio system.

reviewText: In all fairness, it's only been maybe 1/2 hour. But everything I've tried so far has been seamless. I haven't tried Netflix or other apps, but i have two other devices that can stream Netflix (TV and Blu-ray), so I'm not worried about that if it doesn't work well. Of course it would be nice if it streamed Amazon, but my two other aforementioned devices do that, too, so this was not a dealbreaker. One hint though, if you have a Mac, the remote will try to operate your computer, too. That was annoying until I figured out how to turn it off (System Preferences > Security & Privacy > General > Advanced > click Disable remote control infrared receiver). I don't use a remote with a Mac, but I can imagine that if you do, it may annoy you to have to turn this off completely rather than pairing with a specific remote. There may be a workaround for this, not sure.One thing I really like is that I have two options, I can access what's on my computer or iCloud directly from AppleTV (and use the apps), or I can mirror my computer if I want to stream something that's not an AppleTV app, such as Spotify, through AirPlay (this works with Amazon video, too, but you may need to turn off the AppleTV screensaver), though that does require a few extra steps. I originally bought a Roku 3 but found its lack of flexibility annoying and ended up selling it after one week on eBay (besides that, the Netflix interface on Roku was awful compared with my Panasonic Blu-ray). The AppleTV is about 95% what I was looking for. Now, if someone could just replace my Hopper, receiver and Blu-ray with something this petite! BTW,  I have a MacBook Pro running Mavericks. I don't know if AirPlay works with a PC.And P.S., if anyone is wondering why you might want to send something like Spotify to your TV, my TV audio plays through my stereo system, not through the TV speakers. I used to have to plug my computer (or iPod or iPhone) into the stereo receiver through a <gasp> cable.

In a time with hundreds of channels and nothing to watch, the Apple TV saves the day. More TV choices for the whole family on your own schedule and lots of free! I gave it to my husband for his birthday and he spent all of the snow days vegging out. I was delighted because he is normally a work-a-holic and it was good to see him relax.  This product is affordable and lots of fun.
In combination of HD TV and High speed internet Apple TV is excellent stuff for entertainment, I will get another one  for other TV
Incredible service. I received this item the day after I ordered it on-line. This is a gift for my son. Hope it's what he wants.
I needed this extra cable as I have purchased so many Apple products.  It was nice to see that I did not have to go to Apple to purchase.
summary: 6Ft USB Sync Data Charging Charger Cable Cord for Apple iPhone 4 4S 4G...

reviewText: I needed to update the device a couple of times in order to use it on my iPad & IPhone and able to use it on my older MacBook to access the music & photos. However I could not use Airplay or display what was shown on my MacBook. This was actually the main reason I purchased the unit as a substitute monitor. Well at least I could view the content on most of my Apple devices.
i never thought that a small little box could make a difference but the apple tv did.  the box is easy to set up and all our computers and iphones can connect to it
Inexpensive, and delivers so many options to the TV. apple has scored big with this item. Highly recommend to anyone wanting additional TV experiences

Initially I had issues related to airplay working consistently at my home but with the good customer care that was resolved. It was not apple tv issue, it was related to interference due to other devices near the router.My youtube watching has increased significantly after buying apple tv. If you have other apple devices at home like iPhone/iPad etc then searching for something in youtube is very easy otherwise it's little painful to type using the remote which comes with it.Overall very satisfied customer with this product.
summary: Good if you have other apple products

reviewText: Initially I thought to buy Roku but due to the easy interface of what apple had I preferred this ...I'm just loving itYou will enjoy if you have MacBook/Ipad

in my "MAN CAVE," I have a Apple TV that I store all my movies in the ICloud.  After converting all my VHS tapes and DVD disc, i bought my first Apple TV and stored everything on the ICloud.  This was the best plan ever done.There is no more bulky tapes and DVD.  Please this plays clearer than most DVD/VHS players.

In my opinion the best looking, easiest to navigate interface out of the other streaming boxes.  I have two AppleTV boxes in my home and purchased one for my mother as well.  They are high quality, fast WiFi and great for syncing your iTunes.  If you tend to avoid apple products try the Roku 3, very similar results.
summary: You can't find a better interface

reviewText: I now have 2 of these in my house. One in the living room and 1 in the bedroom, it makes life a lot easier.
I now have 3 apple TV's.  One for each TV in the house.  It stream Netflix better than the smart TVs.

Installed on a 24 inch ViewSonic monitor.  It works precisely as advertised.  But had to purchase an additional cord/adapter item to get the sound as the monitor does not have a tuner.This was bought so grandkids would be able to watch programming off an Ipad II and from internet.  Good product.The only downside is the remote is very small and darn easy to lose.  Fortunately, the local Apple store has plenty of remotes for about 20 bucks.Very pleased with this solution for tv for grandkids.
Installed quickly and set up easily.  Worked first time!  Works every time as described it would.  I like it.  I recommend it.
Instant setup.  Works perfectly.  You can play YouTube and content on my iPhone video, audio and pictures...  I love it !

Integrates well with iTunes on the main computer which means any kind of streaming (photos/videoa/music) with in the house is greatNice gateway to streaming  from Internet: acess to apple movies/Netflix/YouTube
Integrates well with the rest of the system.  Plays all of the computer-based content, iCloud, and all of the other things like Netflix, Hulu, etc...
summary: A real nice addition to my home theatre

reviewText: In the past, I always used my Wii to stream Netflix and that was really a pain.  The remote for the Wii was hard to use to click what I wanted to.  However, the Apple TV remote is simple and very easy to use.  I also downloaded an app on my iPhone that lets me use my iPhone as a remote for the Apple TV.  I can also use the Apple TV to put whatever is on my iPhone or MacBook Pro onto the TV (mirroring).  I love that I can play my music that's on my phone or computer through my TV by streaming it to my Apple TV.  I also love how many apps it has.  I can watch Netflix, HBO Go, Hulu, and even some of my movies that I have in iTunes on my computer.This product really works best if you have other Apple products to use it with.  I love the Apple TV, but I probably would have purchased the Roku if I didn't have a Mac laptop and an iPhone simply because it's cheaper than the Apple TV is.
summary: I want to have one for every TV I own!

reviewText: I only did a couple of solves and it accidentally fell and the stem of one of the center pieces broke off completely. Too bad! I bought it because I wanted a stickerless 4x4x4 cube and I also wanted a speed cube. I was going to buy a 5x5x5 of the same brand but now I am not going to. DO NOT BUY
summary: DO NOT BUY - BROKE IN LESS THAN 24 HOURS!

reviewText: I ordered the product from this seller because of the very competitive price.I was able to track the package and was informed of the shipping progress.When it arrived it was with-in the expected time frame promised.The unit was complete and powered up just fine.There were no problems. I would order again from this seller.

I ordered this and, when I figured out how to use it, it's been a really great addition to my Home entertainment setup. If you download the "Remote" app from the app store you can use your iPod, iPad, or iPhone to use as a remote and means of playing movies and videos.  Very simple instructions; just a few modifications to you iTunes account and you will be amazed and the world of technology (at least I was, I'm a bit behind of tech-stuff).I highly recommend this if you have any Apple items with wifi or 3/4G service.Kudos to Steve Jobs!!!

I ordered this device because I'm visually impaired and can't always read text on the TV screen.  When I got this, I turned on Voiceover and it works great.  I talks enough to give me some basic information about a show or item on the menu but doesn't talk over what I'm watching.Setup was easy and I was up and running in no time.
summary: I think this device is great!!!

reviewText: I ordered this from amazon on a Sunday and it arrived on Tuesday.  Perfect price ($5 cheaper than apple).  I was torn between a Roku 3 and an Apple TV.  Since I used iTunes for years and purchase music, movies and TV shows, this is exactly what I needed.  It connected to my account and I can play anything wirelessly through my TV.  In addition I can play/stream anything from my iPhone, iPad and iMac directly to my TV.Don't worry about music/video files you can't play through iTunes.  Simply convert to mp4 or mp3, add them to your iTunes and you're set.  I definitely would recommend this to apple users.  It works for me.

I ordered two of these this time. I liked the one I previously ordered so much that I got one for my two kids for Christmas. So, I bought three in total. Great product, especially because it give me more TV options than I already have. I live in the country and only have DSL and Dish so my TV options are spotty at best.

I ordered two.  One worked as expected, the other had some issues with the buttons.  They were touching the case and getting stuck.I reorted the problem the same day and was told a return label would be sent and once the faulty product was returned a replacement would be sent.  I am still waiting for the return label.The working one does project very well.  Green and red patterns show up well at night.  These are advertised for indoor use only, but it a dry location can be found, it can work very well outside.I will rate it higher if and when I get a working replacement for the other one.

I own a lot of Apple products and like being in the Apple ecosystem (itunes, iTunes Match, iBooks and so on).  I think the Apple TV is a near perfect streamer but I'm giving it 4 stars for only one reason: I cannot play music from it and to an airport express at the same time.  More on this later...-Why I got this?I wanted the Apple TV to be able to play music, and watch TV shows (i'm a cord cutter so I pay for a show or two here and there).  I also have speakers in multiple rooms in the house and wanted the ability to play music to multiple rooms simultaneously.  I had two airport expresses prior to the Apple TV.-How does it work?The user interface is smooth, well-implemented and works well.  Beyond iTunes, you also have access to Netflix, HBOGo, PBS, YouTube and a myriad of other services.  It's also nice to be able to show videos and photos shot on my iPhone on the AppleTV.  The Netflix app is one of the best I've seen.The Apple TV can also work with a bluetooth keyboard making it easy to search for content on Netflix, YouTube etc.It would be nice to be able to plug-in an external drive to play content, but Apple does not allow you to do so.  That's ok though as most people don't spend a ton of time ripping their CDs and DVDs anymore.  If you do have a large music collection and want access to it, just get iTunes match for $25/yr.  You'll have all your music up in the cloud and will have access to it on all your devices.  It would be to be nice to be able to store music on a connected external drive as I have kids and one of their hobbies is dragging DVDs on the floor to create deep grooves.  It would be nice, but it's not a deal breaker.-Areas of Improvement1) It would be nice if the next episode will be automatically queued up when watching netflix.  The family got a bit spoiled with this feature on our Sony Blu Ray player.  Again, not a deal breaker2) While the Apple TV has airplay, you can only use the AppleTV to play audio to one output at a time.  This is maddening.  I have to have a computer open with iTunes running to play music to two rooms in the house.  This is one area where I find the apple tv lacking.  It wants to be my media hub and I want it to be, but my computer still needs to be in the mix for me to use it as such.  While this also is not a deal breaker, it is a problem I hope Apple will remedy.-The Bottom Line:The Apple TV is a great streaming device.  It's everything you expect from an Apple product: It's elegant, reliable and easy to use.  It has some areas of improvement, but none of them are deal breakers.

I own a lot of apple products (iPhone 4, Macbook Pro and an iPad 2) so this was the perfect fit for me. It works perfectly with all my stuff and the only thing at all is that the remote for the TV works on my macbook! But I usually just use my phone as the remote anyways! :)

I own a Roku and a PS3 so I have had all the different internet TV available, but I always wanted to watch You Tube on my 55" screen. This Apple TV blows away the Roku as far a picture quality. The Apple TV is far superior to the Roku! also being able to take my iPhone and my Imac and connect through Airplay my iTunes and Video and pictures from either to my TV is great. This may not have all the channels the Roku has but I am using the Apple TV far more then the Roku.
summary: If you own any Apple products Buy This!

reviewText: I owned a first-generation Apple TV and liked it. However, when I treated up to this current generation I like it much more. I'm very impressed with the user interface, and like the fact that it handles my Netflix and Hulu Plus subscriptions  as well as a variety of other networks and specialty programming providers. It's a shame that Amazon isn't represented, but, I suppose they are too much the competitors to allow such an arrangement. Likewise, with the up-and-coming Google TV. Fortunately, I have a Samsung intelligent television that works with some of these competing services.  I didn't want another box out in front of my television, so I bought an inexpensive hanger which mounts the very small and light Apple TV unit from one of the upper vent slots on my TV. The Apple remote is more than capable of handling this arrangement. I've also come to use the Apple remote app on my iPad, but as software goes I think it is as much a public beta as a real product.

I own this Apple TV v3, and I own a Roku LT.  Both are great devices, with similar function.The Roku works great for Netflix and Pandora.  I love both of those services, and Roku delivers.  Roku is also expandable - there are hundreds of other "channels".  But in general all those other Roku channels stink.  Sorry "other channel" guys (including you, huge online retail store named after a south american river).The Apple TV is a little more closed, but what it provides is excellent.  I can still use Netflix with the Apple TV, and plus I can stream all my music, movies, and  TV shows to the device with nearly zero setup.  "It just works" is very true.  I also love the wireless remote display capability - it is easy to "stream" my Mac's display, or my iPhone display, or my iPad display to my TV.  Again, it just works.  Roku?  I do technical work all day for my job.  I don't also want to do it all night at my house.In all, I love both Apple TV and Roku.  Roku is now on the back burner due to the great features of the Apple TV.
I own two of these and have gifted two more. You can use it for so much more than advertised. Love my Apple TV.

I personally own the second generation of Apple TV, and I absolutely love it.  The way it so easily integrates with other apple devices makes it that much better.  In addition to the vast apple store for tv shows, movies, rentals etc... if you own any apple products, Apple TV makes a great addition!  Couldn't recommend more highly!  My family member is already in love with it and has only had it for a few days!
summary: Loved the 2nd gen, ordered 3rd gen as a present for family member

reviewText: I purchased 5 yards of this fabric & another fabric from the same seller! I've searched numerous sewing/material stores & left empty handed & disappointed! What I received from this seller was beautiful QUALITY fabric at an excellent price! I would HIGHLY recommend this fabric & seller!!!

I purchased AppleTV because I have come to appreciate almost all things apple.We have two iPhone4's and iPads, so it was only logical to cross into AppleTV country.I am totally pleased with my apple world and all my apple products.....BUT right now,I am astounded at the beauty and simplicity AppleTV brings into the house with all my media streaming tommy big flat screen TV, WHEN I want it to do so.Pairing it with an HDMI Projector makes Home Cinema instant fun.

I purchased Apple TV so I could stream live video from my computer to my TV. It is easy to set up and it works as advertised. I can now see player numbers on the big screen so I can see who is doing what.
I purchased as a Christmas gift and my son-in-law seems to really like it.  Easy set up and easy interface.
I purchased it for my son and he loves it.  He uses it on a TV that is not connected to cable.

I purchased my AppleTV after my Google Chromecast got so hot that it bent and died on me in less than a month. What a difference! Netflix? Got it! HBO Go? You bet! Hulu Plus? Of course! Plus, you can access your iTunes library and even rent movies. You can play music, iTunes Radio and a slew of other things. It has loads of apps to use. And if you have other Apple devices such as an iPad, iPhone, iPod, you can broadcast You Tube and other websites and videos as well. You can also mirror your device and have your screen broadcast to show Facebook, pictures, you name it. Set up was a piece of cake. It took only a few minutes to set up and we were settled in watching The Walking Dead. It was completely worth it! I LOVE my AppleTV!
summary: The folks at Apple have done it again!

reviewText: I purchased my Apple TV from Apple.  They didn't have a link for reviews so here I am. I specifically bought Apple TV as I read it can stream from iOS devices.  Ok, just what I wanted.  My 3 year old streaming DVD player has a limited Amazon menu.  No wishlist.  Small con but all my purchased vids are from Amazon.  My ipad retains Amazon wishlist entries. When I want to view one of my Prime vids on my HDTV, I have to note the movie title, then use search to find and select that movie on my DVD player's interface.So, after plugging in my brand new Apple TV squarish hockey puck, registering all the passwords for my wireless network WEP, Apple and Netflix accounts, I noticed Amazon was absent from the channel lineup.  Great access to iTunes purchased or rentals vids but the competition was not there.  No surprise I guess.So, on to Amazon vids.  Vids playing in other apps will only display vids through Apple TV if it's Airplay compatible.  Wish I knew that before sending $100 to Apple.  Vids playing on my ipad in Amazon's video app can send audio to the TV but not video.  However, vids in the Apple "Videos" app will play through Apple TV.  After all, "Videos" is an Apple app. I did notice Apple TV Netflix interface is several times faster than my older DVD streaming player interface.  The remote is what I would expect from Apple, simple and elegant.  30mm wide, 120mm long and 5mm thick tapering down to 2mm at the edges from a single piece of aluminum.  Uses a 2032 button battery. Slender but kinda easy to lose in sofa cushions.I looked into Roku but one reviewer found out that to activate his Roku account, a credit card was mandatory, just in case he made a purchase in the future.  Uh oh.  Another opportunity for a hacked commercial database to spread stolen credit card info, so I will live with Apple TV and continue checking my ipad for my Amazon wishlist movies to search for them in my DVD player Amazon interface.  Such is life, until I buy a newer streaming DVD player.
summary: Great for Itunes & Netfiix Vids But not Amazon Vids

reviewText: I purchased the "Apple TV MD199LL/A" for convenience of quickly connecting an iPhone to a television and watching some other Internet-based programs.  It works well for that. The previous version was more "open" and could actually be easily modified to play more content, but Apple blocked that in the latest version so the price is dramatically higher for the previous model in case you are wondering the reason why. In summary, this is working for the purpose I purchased it and I use a different box for the other things.
summary: Work well, just wish that Apple was a little less prorprietary

reviewText: I purchased the 3rd Generation Apple TV at Best Buy as a means to Airplay music around the apartment with my home stereo. I also wanted to use it for services like Netflix, Hulu and Amazon to replace my Playstation 3 for media (I had every intention to sell my Playstation). I'm glad the eBay sale fell through because my intention of using Apple TV as my primary media device fell short.Problems:1. The Apple TV insists I rent HD movies, purchase HD TV shows because that's what I indicated during the setup. The problem with this is that I don't *always* want to watch something in HD. I don't *always* feel like paying the extra $1. Big budget films, season finales are where I splurge for the HD quality stuff. The lack of easy toggling between HD and SD without having to trudge through the settings or purchasing the SD version from iTunes on Mac/iPad first is a real pain and not convenient compared to Sony's Playstation Store which allows options.2. Where is Amazon? Amazon cuts deals with Sony, TV makers, Roku and other devices but can't manage their way into the Apple TV? I don't care who's fault it is, Amazon Prime Instant Video needs to be part of the Apple TV ecosystem. I already pay for prime and don't want to spend money for Netflix which would be completely redundant just so I could watch older seasons of TV. You can work your way around this using airplay mirroring on a Mac, but not an iPad which will block the image with airplay.3. Where is the media server capabilities? Sony has Playstation Media Server, which will push out content from your PC to the Playstation in HD without an issue. Apple TV will remedy this by Airplay Mirroring but it's completely picky about the formats. MKV is a no go, you'll have to spend a few minutes converting the file to an MP4 using MP4Tools (shareware program, works fine) for stuff to function. When it finally airplay mirrors to the apple TV i'll occasionally see stutters in the stream, though it's tolerable.4. Where is the ambition / extensibility? Where is the application store, the iOS game store? There is potential here for Apple TV to be the next big ecosystem for Apple. Like the iPad they could have opened it up for Apple TV specific apps to be built by developers to push their videos and content. But instead they've taken away the jailbreak method, and have very slowly opened up services over time. Apple TV right now just feels like a little box to bide the time while they work on the real successor to their TV ambitions.-----Those are all criticisms, but I'm not fully down on the little box. It's definitely attractively designed. The processor chip inside the Apple TV is smooth and opens services quickly compared to the aging Playstation 3. The interfaces for Hulu, Netflix and the iTunes services are attractively designed and easy to use. The Airplay functionality is mostly very impressive and music sounds great with the fiber optic sound output to the speaker system. The video might be struggling with the wireless N technology, but when things are at their best, the HD Airplay from the Mac looks great. It's pretty inexpensive and that's something you don't hear a lot about an Apple product. Roku is cheaper with more services, but iPhone, iPad or Mac owners should find serious value in Apple TV with Airplay and ecosystem benefits.-----I can't recommend an Apple TV to the non-Apple crowd. There are much better media options. As a streamer, Roku has more services and a cheaper price. For a premium experience the Playstation 3 has a nice Blu-Ray player, Amazon Prime Streaming, Netflix, Vudu, Media Server and video games which really makes it the most well rounded machine for every day use.Where the Apple TV becomes a worthwhile purchase is when you've attached yourself to the iTunes ecosystem for TV/Movies or you want a nice way to mirror videos/pictures/movies from your Mac/iOS devices. There's nothing quite as rad as watching a video game trailer on your iPhone and hitting the Apple TV icon to immediately see it in HD on your TV with your sound system. It's just too bad Apple never went for a home run with this little box.
summary: Worth it if you use Airplay, better alternatives otherwise..

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV after the HD version came out, V3 I suppose.  What I like is Netflix.  I won't watch Hulu, because you get less for the version you pay for than the free one, plus all the same commercials over and over drive me up the wall.  So, basically it's a Netflix box with a little bit of AirPlay or Air Parrot.  I rarely use this because I am too lazy to start it on my computer and move to the living room.  It's easier to watch Amazon Prime on my computer or my iPad.  I don't watch baseball (gasp!), NBA, or NHL, so those are worthless to me.  Also the just added ESPN and HBO are also totally worthless, as I have DirecTV.  What's with that?  So, I am being generous with the 3 stars only because for what it does for me, it does well.  I only wish Apple would quit treating ATV like a hobby and get serious about offering content.  There are reports of a deal with Time-Warner coming, but once again, worthless to me as I can't get TW. Apple, talk to DirecTV!! Please!!Bottom line, if all you are going to do is Netflix and AirPlay on your home network, it does this VERY WELL!  If you want more, maybe the new Roku 3 is the way to go.  I am thinking about adding one just for Amazon Prime Video and the slick headphone remote!
I purchased the Apple TV as a gift and was amazed at how easy it was to hook up and get it working. This is a very useful product for so many reasons. It's the ultimate big screen for your iPad.
summary: I've been wanting one of these for years

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV because my tv was not a smart tv and I needed access to Netflix and did not want to purchase a gaming console.  I have been very satisfied ever since.

I purchased the Apple TV because the JB was due out in December 2012.  It never came.  Still waiting for the JB to arrive so I can install XBMC onto it.  As a streaming device, it does a decent job running my netflix, but I dislike the multiple screens I have to go to in order to play the next episode of a TV show.  Watch one show, then once it's over, give me the option to watch the next show!  I know this is a limitation of Netflix and not the Apple TV, but comparing it to my xbox360 which also streams netflix, it has some things to improve.I'd also like to note, I don't have an iphone, an ipod touch, nor do I have a lot of shows I've purchased in my itunes, so really until the JB and XBMC are installed, my ATV3 is just a netflix streaming device.

I purchased the Apple TV primarily because I wasn't able to get HBO Go on my Roku with DirecTV. Thus far I've enjoyed it and it has a pretty easy to use interface and seems to be compatible with most of the apps that I use on a regular basis. That being said, if Roku, DirecTV and HBO all got along, I would probably use my Roku more often than the Apple TV. The one thing that Apple has going for it is that it works with all other Apple produces. Seeing as I don't have many other Apple electronics, the Apple TV is really just a gateway to HBO at the moment.
summary: Easy Interface But Better with Apple Produces

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV so that I could use the mirroring function on my ipad to my tv. It works very well, I am very pleased with it.Setup was quick and simple, I had to provide my own HDMI cable to hook it up.With the combination of my new Apple TV and Netflix I no longer have a cable tv bill!!!One feature that I use a lot, is showing YouTube clips on my tv from my iPhone.Overall this is another great product from Apple that just works!!!
summary: Another great Apple product that works!

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV to be the solution for using my iPad to present to an audience. I haven't had the chance to use it for that purpose yet, but in the meantime I'm thoroughly enjoying streaming Netflix and others. I prefer the Netflix Interface on the Apple TV to the one on my Blu-ray player. The same is true for several other services available on both devices.  It also seems that the Apple TV stream slightly faster than the Blu-ray player.I'm quite pleased with my purchase even though I have not used it in the way I intended… yet.
summary: Good interface an slightly faster streaming

reviewText: I purchased this about a month ago.For some reason the wireless connection would not connect, so I just ran an ethernet cable to it.I hope that when I actually have the time and connect the wireless it will work and I am not stuck with a product that does not function properly..Otherwise Apple TV is the way to go!

I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my daughter and she loves it.  It works perfectly with her ipad.  She is able to use it for movies and on-line games.  It was easy to hook up and is everything we expected. It's great to watch video and view photos on the big screen.
I purchased this as a Christmas gift for my grandson.  He tried it out when he was here and it worked as expected.
I purchased this as a gift for a friend.  They love it and has been a great addition to their computer usage.

I purchased this as a gift for our family.  I am not technical in any way but was told by my kids that this was what I should buy to do what I wanted it to do.  I was looking for something to add to our tv to be able to access YouTube, Netflix, iTunes, etc., wirelessly.  So far it's done what I was hoping it would.  Even I can use it (after tutoring from my son, who also set it up) and have enjoyed watching YouTube videos, photos and listening to music.  It's only been in use for a couple of days, but so far, so good.It was reasonably priced and came in a very little box!  It came with a very small and thin remote, but can also be controlled with your iPad or computer (a windows laptop in my case).  I also liked that I could download my own music CD's  (through my iTunes account, I think) and listen to them through the Apple TV.  Overall I'm excited about it and hope to enjoy it for many years.

I purchased this at the Apple Store specifically to connect to different client HD TVs to display my Keynote presentation. Setup is very easy. Once your laptop and the AppleTV are on the same network, in typical Apple fashion, everything just "sees" each other. After a very easy set-up, it's just one click and your laptop display is mirrored on the television set.Most people purchase Apple TV as part of their entertainment system and it definitely did not disappoint in that area. The Netflix and YouTube apps operate flawlessly. Very clean, sleek design for both. Unfortunately (and the reason I cannot gove it five stars), AppleTV does not include a browser like Safari and there are limited apps available, and no means of downloading others.But, if you have an iPhone, iPod or iPad you can display videos using their browsers onto the television you have AppleTV connected. So, no need to catch up on old Episodes of your favorite show on your tiny laptop screen or hunched over your desktop. Display it onto your television screen through AppleTV. I love this feature because I can watch online foreign news channels without increasing my cable bill.Definitely worth the $100!
summary: You need to add AppleTV to your Apple eco System.

reviewText: I purchased this device for my sister for Christmas because she has an iPod Touch, and I appreciate the app that she was able to download and use to push whatever she watches on her iPod Touch onto her TV through the Apple TV, but the lack of apps on Apple TV makes it hard for me to enjoy it more than I enjoy my Roku 2 XS. Still, the video quality is great, and my sister loves it, so it was worth purchasing!
summary: Still not better than Roku 2 XS!

reviewText: I purchased this for a guest room-no need to pay for a cable box for a room only used occasionally

I purchased this for my dad after he fell in love with mine. He uses it to view the pictures he has on his iPhone. He also uses it for music (so many genres to choose from). When he has guests over he will have the beautiful slideshow of pictures running with his selected music playing in the background. He also uses it to rent + view movies instantly. The quality is superb and it is so easy to use. I highly recommend it!

I purchased this for my in laws. They are so happy they have such a small device that does so much. Streaming all my media works amazing on this. I have this hooked up via wifi and have no issues with lag on netflix, youtube, or itunes downloads. I also love that I can use this to throw my iphone screen on the TV.

I purchased this in October 2013 and was so happy until it no longer recognized my WIFI with the router sitting right next to it.  All of my other Apple products, of which I have many, don't have an issue with the WIFI.  I had to dig out my router instructions and reset it last month.  Now it happened again.  I don't have the time or the inclination to continue doing this.  I see from the Apple site that I am not the only one experiencing this problem.  I am a fan of Apple products but am seriously annoyed.  It was purchased on Amazon and it was passed the 30 day window to return it.  The Roku in the other room, further away from the router, works like a charm and has more channels available.  I regret my purchase and will try to return it at the Apple store.
summary: Save yourself aggravation and get a Roku

reviewText: I purchased this not really sure if I was going to keep it. Becausethere are several options now with Mac products (iPad or Mac Pro)to stream videos on HDTV using a cable.  But once I set it up and sawthe ease of using it, the quality of the display, and the options Apple TV canoffer beside video streaming from iTunes or Netflex is amazing. I highly recommendthis product.

I purchased this on recommendation from a family member.Price was better than Best Buy.I have not used it yet.  The moment I got it my brother borrowed it for a ski trip to Colorado, and it worked perfectly for all their downloaded movies while they were at the hotel.  The kids were able to easily navigate the window.  It IS easy to hook up.I love the portableness of this item.Got it in great time!  Price was great!
summary: I think I may like it!  :-)

reviewText: I purchased this second Apple TV after the mountain lion upgrade allowed the mirroring of my macbook. Product has an extremely small footprint and setup is a breeze.
summary: Apple TV is a must if you have Apple products

reviewText: I purchased this so I can watch the movie files on my laptop on my tv.I opened the package and connected everything. Started to upgrade the software on Apple TV and boom!It froze. I thought it would be easy fix. Just reset it and do the upgrade through iTunes.I was wrong. It was not that simple if you don't have the right cable which they do not include in the box.It requires Micro USB cable to connect to your computer which I had to order it separately. You might already have Micro USB in handy but not everyone has it. If it needs restart/reset/upgrade through computer and requires additional cable, Apple should've included that in the box.Other than that, it just works. I love it so far.

I purchased this to add to our Roku 3 and be able to beam Mac content to our smart TV. Found this right here with a local seller on Amazon brand new. Apple updated this 2012 one's software as soon as it was plugged in and online, I love it but Apple seriously needs to add more content. I was a bit disappointed in that respect.
summary: Love it, needs more channel options

reviewText: I purchased this to compliment my IPad!!  It is SUPER easy to set up and use.  I do suggest downloading the "remote" app from ITunes.  It is completely free!! This device allows you to see everything from your moble device on the TV.  Pictures, Videos, Music, Movies, or Games!!

I purchased this to watch Netflix on my HDTV as well as to mirror streaming websites and other things from my MacBook to my TV. Works well. Easy to set up. I like that it is so portable so that I can switch tvs with it. It does require an HDMI cable sold separately. I bought an extra cable so that when I use it on my other tv I don't have to reach behind my wall mounted tv to unplug the HDMI cable.
summary: Does what I need it to do

reviewText: I purchased this wrist band for tennis. It is a very high quality product and gives excellent support.I had several wrist bands that used material that stretches. This band is much better because youcan easily adjust for amount of support you need. Highly recommend.

I purchase the Apple TV, on a whim and have really fallen in love with it.  I have given up cable television completely and now purchase my TV per episode or season on this device.It was incredibly easy to set up and I've found that the picture quality is great, even on standard definition.  The HD is also quite good for something that is streaming.  The sound is also quite good.  I have the sound set up via optical audio into a surround sound system, and the sound is VERY clear.I use it for purchasing TV from iTunes as well as streaming Netflix.  What is really nice about purchasing TV shows and movies via iTunes, is that it preloads what you are watching as it streams, so if your internet connection slows you're quality stays the same.  (I should note however that this does not apply to Netflix, as the quality adjusts per your connection as with most other streaming devices).I highly recommend this product!
I put the Apple TV in the motorhome to connect all of my devices to the TV making road trips just like home.
summary: A fantastic upgrade to the motorhome

reviewText: I really am very pleased with this product. It has the quality feel that apple is known for. Great for watching netflix but.............. The really cool thing is the air play feature. Air play allows you to display the screen of your iphone or ipad on your big screen tv wirelessly. It is great for convvenient big screen face time or skype. I love it.
I really didnt need this product, but i love all "apple" product XD $100 is not bad a all. it has a HDMI hook up and the picture looks great!!

I really do like my Apple TV, however, I had so many connection issues with my HDTV and computer that it was hardly worth it in the end.  It turns out, you have to buy a specific type of HDMI cord to connect it.  I bought cheap ones so some connection couldn't be made.  Just make sure that you buy the right cords, and if you aren't sure, buy them somewhere where you can return just in case.  It seems like this was a pretty common problem all around the internet while searching for solutions.

I really enjoy this!  I only was using the widget from my Blu-Ray player before, (mostly for Netflix) but it buffered slow and quality was not great.  This product took me all of 10 minutes to unpack, install, and begin enjoying! The remote is SUPER intuitive and kind of fun to use.I will be mainly using this for Netflix and Hulu, I have it connected to my TV with HDMI and the picture quality is awesome!  Really excited to keep using this for more fun stuff (iPhone mirroring, playing my iTunes thru TV setup, etc)
summary: Such a good addition to my gadget arsenal!

reviewText: I really haven't had a chance to use it much yet.  But the one time i did, i thought it was pretty good. i didn't see amazon prime or netflix on there though but as i said, i've only used it once..

I really just bought this to link my iPad and our iPhones to my old Bose system to play music.  AirPlay function works excellent for that purpose.  For $100 I think this is worth it for that purpose alone.  Can link to computer to play music from iTunes, and also can upload purchased music into Apple TV to play directly.  You can mirror iPad or iPhone 4S+ to view on TV, decent feature except that iPad doesn't have 16:9 aspect ratio so part of your tv screen doesn't get utilized. Content of Apple TV was unimpressive for me, but I already had most of those features on my Bluray player anyway.
summary: AirPlay works great, but content unimpressive for me

reviewText: I really like being able to pull up a yoga video on youtube throw it to the tv and have my own yoga classes in my living room. Also we watch HBO GO and netflix almost every night.
I really like it,  it is a second one that I bought because my son liked it so much that  i bought one for him.
I really like my apple tv.  Really a great accessory if you have multiple apple devices and a library of music and movies in itunes.  Netflix works great on this too.  Cool little device!
I really like my Apple TV! The only problem is it sometimes takes awhile to load a movie or TV show. Other than that it is awesome and streaming works wonderfully! I don't regret buying it!

I really like the apple tv, but the only thing it really needs is Amazon so I can watch  my Amazon prime stuff for free, and I have more options to rent. I don't like how itunes is the ONLY source for me to rent movies from. I also wish Apple would have software for older modles of Macbook pro to watch movies through airplay. I mean, comeon! My laptop is only about 2 years old.

I really like the Apple TV. It's pretty cool to be able to watch iTunes movies or Netflix on my TV. Here, basically, are the downsides:- the remote uses IR instead of Bluetooth, so it's not 100% reliable. The Remote app on iOS does a good job, however.- Home Sharing (watching a movie or listening to music from a shared iTunes library elsewhere in the house) is unreliable and slow as heck. It's a really disappointing experience- renting/downloading a movie from the iTunes store can sometimes take 24 hours to download, which is ridiculous, given my internet connection.- Overall it feels slow and unresponsiveSo, it's not perfect, and I can see lots of areas for improvement, but it's a nice product. I'm glad I have it.

I really like this product, but Apple needs to be able to add more apps, the lack of available free tv on this product make it hard to LOVE it :) content that is free on the internet, cost on Apple TV, that's not hot!!!!

I received an Apple TV as a gift.  Installed it on a new flat screen in the bedroom.  Easy menu's to perform a record quick installation!  Works great - and easily connects to my Mac & PC Via iTunes.  I now can make full use of my video library through my Apple TV through AIrplay!  Fun, easy, not technical!  Recommend for everyone!I have even bought one for he living room TV now,as well!THANK YOU APPLE!!!
summary: Apple Design, Apple Quality, remarkable device!

reviewText: I received my AppleTV two days ago and I really enjoy using the airplay mirroring feature, but when it comes to home sharing I noticed that when my MacBook Pro was put into sleep mode the Home sharing feature stopped working and I could not continue to watch my movie. It is super nice for showing people pictures and running some ideas across though. I will definitely be keeping it for that feature alone.
summary: I like it, but I don't quite love it yet

reviewText: I received the product in perfect condition as it indicated the seller, I recommend it 100%, it has worked very well! owns iOS which allows me to enjoy many applications, including use much to my studies because it is very useful in every way!

I recently "cut the cord" and discontinued cable TV at my cabin in the woods.  Now I only have this little gadget and whatever I can stream from Netflix, HBO or anywhere on the web.  I have no experience with Roku or other streaming devices; since I have an Apple "ecosystem" I opted for this.  I am very pleased.  Set up was super easy and it works like a champ.  So much so, I bought a second unit for my city apartment.  One small complaint -- the remote is very tiny and I'm always misplacing it or losing it in the sofa cushion.  Recommended.

I recently bought an Ipad and Iphone and now I'm addicted to everything "Apple". Apple TV is amazing in the fact that you can spend hours and hours watching youtube videos and can see your own stored movies and videos from iPad, iPhone, or regular computer. It still lacks Pandora or the potential to add new channels like Roku does (I only bought this one to watch youtube videos, otherwise Roku is way better than this).

I recently cancelled my cable to try Apple TV. It is amazing. There are more things on there to watch than I can even imagine. I was just browsing through the network app the other day, and couldn't believe the choices! Definitely recommend.

I recently purchased the Apple TV device and love it.  It was easy to install (almost did it by itself).  It worked the first time and whereas my previous wireless connection was "spotty" the Apple TV is solid.The caveat however was in order for me to be able to use my headphones (in the middle of the night when my spouse is sleeping) I had to purchase an Digital => Analog converter ($80.00) plus an optical cable and an analog cable ($30 each) in order to hook the Apple TV to my receiver.The Apple TV only puts out a Digital signal.  Oh I also had to purchase an HDMI cable (Apple TV to Yamaha Receiver - $100.00) to connect the digital signal to my receiver.

I recently purchased the latest generation of Apple TV (gen 3). My decision was based on the review of both products that CNET.COM did back on August 16, 2012. Check out this video review. The setup and interface between the Apple TV and my router/modem was simplistic Like most Apple products, the quality of the hardware and the ease of use helped make my choice.The only reason I did not rate the Apple TV 5 stars is that the product is lacking applications. Both the Apple TV and Roku both have Netflix, However, the Apple TV does not have Amazon Prime Video which Roku does. I hope Apple will add this application to their menu in the near future.If you are looking for a streaming video box that is easy to use, quick in its response time, and small in its hardware design, then I would recommend this product.
summary: Apple TV vs Roku - Which streaming box should you buy

reviewText: I recommend this Apple TV.  Good price, good quality and as Apple Brand...Excellent.  Just the remote is a difficult to handle.

reviewText: It does exactly what it is designed to do. It updated to the latest firmware and new menus. It has had zero problems since I purchased it. I use it mainly to show movies that I have on my MacBook laptop and for some presentations at our local Macintosh User Group.
It does the job with a minimum of fuss - providing access to on-line content and displaying a beautiful picture on the TV.  Recommended

It does work as expected... however i cannot seem to get the air play to work (stream wirelessly from my iphone/pad to the TV)Other than that it's great to have shows available at anytime!

Items was received in quick order. It took a bit more to hook-up and connect than I thought. The directions that come with it are not the best to follow. Once it was hooked up and running I was super happy. The wife loves doing her thing with "her" music and the family photos rolling across the screen.
It has become the core of late night entertainment as it flawlessly handles Netflix and its vast library of TV and movies.  The remote control is the paradigm of simplicity and function in one.

It has to be one of the best products I've bought in a while. I use it almost every day.
I think it is a good produce to have when you want to watch more on your computer and TV.

I think the Apple TV is a fabulous product.  I have one on every TV in my house.  So easy for watching HBO Go, or streaming content you've purchased.  But another great feature is the mirror option.  If you have an iPhone, iPad or Apple laptop computer, at the touch of one icon you can stream the content from the device to your Apple TV.  Want to show some pictures to your friends, just press an icon and mirror your phone to your Apple TV and see them on the big screen.There are so many things you can do with your Apple TV, and Apple seem hell bent on adding more and more features.  Just this week they are streaming a concert live from Austin, free for Apple TV owners.  In the fall they get 30 artists to film an exclusive concert, and show these concerts for free.Various TV channels are getting involved too, so you can stream a surprising amount of free content without having to subscribe to a ton of stuff.As with all Apple products, it isn't the cheapest choice, but it is one of the best.

It is a good product and cheap for what you get...nevertheless I think that is a little closed for example to have a browser in the TV without using a iPhone or iPad...But you have a product easy to configure, to use.For my childs it is great for example with netflix, youtube, etc....

it is amazing and works great =) ,, my wife loved it =]i like the idea .. and it is small

...it needs Hulu Plus and Amazon Video On Demand.I'd heard rumors Hulu was coming - but Apple was essentially holding it up / blocking it.The 1080p quality is awesome - I figured it wouldn't be that great - but as a test, rented Immortals (300-esque visuals) - and was amazed at how good it looked.  I only noticed artifacts once or twice - which is no worse than average blu-ray playback.Airplay of our music library is great, and the Movie trailers are a crowd pleaser.  Haven't really used many of the other features.Overall, there's still discontinuity between the various sections UI - primarily in searching.

I took this with me to Dominican Republic and was able to use it with my ipad and get all USA , like Netflix and other things I use to steam, not like my song player, would not pick up USA only the country's program. It's very easy to use and steam onto to your TV .
I tried all the rest, and in the end, the AppleTV, especially considering the constant updates and feature additions, is the best of the breed by a mile right now.

I tried to not get this for 2 years by using the following options.Pogoplug for Media storageBoxeeMac Mini Power PC 1GB RAM as HTPC running XBMCIn the end nothing was seamless and was ridden with high geek factor for ease of use and biggest downside the lack of playlist organization in enabling non-tech folks to use it easily.Once the new Apple TV was released even the lack of 1080p was not longer issue [Online content does not matter much for lacking 1080p] but lot of my home Media content from my camcorder is 1080p and did not want to lose it's resolution [Yes I can see the difference on my TV, though web claims 720p and 1080p are not distinguishable... not for me since I do not sit 25 feet from my TV...].Advantages:a) Use my iphone to figure out what I want to see [from either itunes, pogoplug, NAS with app, Online content] and just choose airplay..... This is no learning needed for folks using these and so problem solved.b) Natively on Apple TV you can access any content shared from a itunes client on any machine. Again I have a MAcbook that is always on serving the itunes for iphones and ipads sync and so this is not new requirement for me. So works great with it.c) The UI for netflix and youtube are much simpler and refined than other devices including Roku which I tried in another place.One thing to do however is in settings menu for playlists by defualt it would only show music play-lists. With this I felt stumped when none of my video play-lists in itunes was seen forcing me to browse the long list of videos.... But turning this option to show all play lists fixed this and now it works like a charm.If you already have itunes as your work-flow this is a great option. Otherwise options can be there like DLNA players which can connect to your NAS, but UI is not that good and not for non-geeks usually.Why 4 stars.... Some things like Flickr and other options are very rudimentary to useless and slow. I hope there is a fix for flickr since that is one another place I have tons of photos already uplaoded and want to use that.
summary: Great Option of all Apple Homes

reviewText: It's an Apple product so what's not to love? So far I haven't had any problems with this. I've been able to watch movies downloaded onto my computer via iTunes seamlessly. I think it works great! I have not used it yet to stream movies from Netflix or anything like that yet.

It's an Apple TV -- like most Apple stuff, it works great. Very fast menus, loads content fast, easy to use, etc. BUT -- there is no analog audio. Only optical digital. I don't know why they didn't put a combo jack on this like on the Airport Express. So stupid. Not everyone has surround sound digital audio systems these days. I had to buy an external DAC -- costing another $35 when Apple could have just added an analog jack to the Apple TV for $2. There's no good reason to leave this out, it's just annoying.
summary: Great, but where's the analog audio jack?

reviewText: It's an AppleTV. What more can I say that hasn't already been said? Haiku!Sleek little black box:Netflix, Airplay, Youtube, More!Mmm...All my content.

reviewText: It's an Apple, what else can I say.  You don't need an IPhone, IPad, or Mac Book to use this device.  You do have to have high speed internet and an HDMI high def television or monitor though ...  Egad!  This is 2014 ... who doesn't have one of those yet?
It's Apple TV a $99 investment into almost limitless entertainment. This is the fourth Apple TV I bought, if you have a TV you need Apple TV.

It's Apple TV, it works, it is easy to setup (especially if you have an IOS7 iPhone).I put this on the TV in our bedroom so now I have NetFlix, WatchABC and access to my iTunes on my PC (yes you have to launch iTunes on your PC to have it show up).Setup was super easy, if you have an iPhone or iPad running IOS7 you can just turn the Apple TV on, turn on the BlueTooth on your iPhone, lay your iPhone down on the Apple TV box and your phone automates the install process! Type in your Apple ID password and confirm that you want to setup the TV and BAM! The Apple TV is setup with your wifi password and iTunes account info.Simple as can be!The only thing missing from the Apple TV options (for me) was Amazon (not surprising since they compete) but it's easy enough to run the Amazon Instant Video app on my iPhone and use Airplay to shoot it over to the Apple TV. The recent addition of WatchABC is awesome and now gives me ABC On Demand in our bedroom (we have a bare minimum cable box in there).I would also suggest installing the Apple TV Remote app on your iPhone/iPad/iPod Touch.
summary: What's not to love about this thing!

reviewText: It's Apple...which means it's easy, works as you would expect and then some!  So good, I got two!  One for living area and another for my bedroom.  Love how easy it is to connect and to mirror computer screen to TV.

It's nice when a powerful product just works right all the time. It took about 90 seconds to set it up and it has been working flawlessly ever since. The only disadvantage to it is the limited number of programs available compared to ROKU, including the Amazon Instant that I use occasionally (using my Samsung TV Smart Hub). reviewText: It's not a TV.  It's a very small internet computer that streams great content to your existing TV (if it has an HDMI input).Wow, how cool is this thing for less than $100? It rocks!
