reviewText: It works flawlessly.  No issues here.  Radio stations on it are my main priority, most of them sound crystal clear (with the exception of few.)  500 channels of whatever genre I want at my fingertips is just awesome!  Add a slideshow of all of the pictures that I've ever taken with my iOS devices is just so cool.  The remote app for it works perfectly, and the remote that comes with it is one of the few high quality remotes that I've ever seen.  It also has some of the best reception, working about 50 feet away.  1080p looks brilliant!  YouTube very rarely need to buffer.  AirPlay is delayed by a few milliseconds, but you really only notice it when gaming, and I got used to it quickly.  I love being able to push a button on my phone or iPad, and instantly see a mirror of my screen on my TV.  The build quality on this good.  It's plastic, but it still feels pretty dang good for something that'll be out of the way most of the time. (not as good as the 1st generation build quality though). Overall, a very solid addition to your setup, perhaps this will be the one device to bind it all together, as its done for me.  Highly recommended.

reviewText: I upgraded from the 2nd-generation version. That version is still very popular because it can easily be jailbroken, so I was actually able to make money on the deal while getting the latest version. The only issue I had with the device was that initially I was not able to stream audio from iTunes. It would play one song, then quit. As it turned out, the problem was with my Symantec AntiVirus software. I had to tweak the software to allow iTunes to communicate out. I primarily use the Apple TV to stream music and to watch Netflix. The video quality with the Apple TV is superior to the quality of Netflix streamed through the Sony PS3 or a stand-alone Blu-Ray player with Netflix capability.

I used this case for months, until I got an iPhone 5! The case is very protective, which surprised me but it really does do a good job with protection. I dropped my phone ALL the time and there was never any damage with this case on. RECOMMEND!

I used TiVo until I added "Boost" to my wireless and couldn't get TiVo box to work anymore. I switched to this and LOVE IT.I don't have that monthly fee for Tivo. I can watch almost everything I now get on Cable on either Hulu Plus or Netflix. It was super-easy to just plug it in (don't forget to buy the cable that connects from the Apple box to your TV cause it doesn't come with the Apple TV box). A child could set this up, its that easy.Crystal clear TV also, oddly sharper than when I watch cable on my HD TV's. I don't know why that is.I'm going to use this for a week and figure out which cable stations I no longer want, then save some $$ on my cable bill.Buy it, you won't regret it.
I used to get on Netflix and Hulu etc. through my blu-ray or Wii and this is much easier. A great buy for the low price. It is sleek, works great, great picture and I love AirPlay.

I used to use my blu ray player for watching Netflix and Hulu and listening to music.  But I always hated how slow it was in loading those apps.  I invested in one of these around Christmas and haven't used my Blu Ray player since.  I've even gotten to buying digital movies because it's so much easier than having to fiddle through your blu ray disc collection. The only downside to this is that it doesn't automatically play the next episode if you're watching a series on hulu or Netflix.  You have to click back, scroll down to the next episode, and hit play.  It's not like the app on the ps3 that does all of that for you.  But I can live that so, I'm good.
summary: YOU HAVEN'T LIVED UNTIL YOU'VE OWNED ONE OF THESE!

reviewText: I use it a lot for work and pleasure.  I am a minister and it is a great tool for visuals.

I use it for access to iTunes music and movie purchases, streaming radio and podcast and most of all to airplay and stream my blu-rays and dvds from my Mac to the Apple TV and occasionally i would stream some Korean Dramas from the Mac to the Apple TV as well. Great value, and a must have for Mac and iOS users if you want to airplay mirror streaming.
I use it for netflix and for airplay.  it is almost a year and it is working fine.  if I didn't use it for airplay, I would buy a cheaper brand.
I use it for netflix mostly great for buying or renting movies too. If I wasn't married I'd cancel my satellite tv for this!
I use it mainly for streaming Netflix but love it! No access charges to use it! Am looking forward to streaming the digital movies I have on my computer!
I use it mostly for airplay and iTunes radio. The streaming services work well also, but everything and their momma streams the same thing these days.

I use it pretty much every day ranging from using it for music to netflix or watching a long youtube video. if you have a mag you can send music, video to the apple tv instead of watching it on the computer, you can also control it from any ipod,iphone,ipad as long as they are on the same network  my dad liked it so much i got him one for fathers day and he really enjoys it as well..must get
I use it to get music in an area that doesn't get good reception, but over the internet it works really well.

I use iTunes match and watch a fair amount of Netflix streaming. The ability to use the apple remote on the iPhone and iPad is awesome, it makes search and YouTube much easier to use. However, it took 48 hours to stabilize and work correctly, I did not change any settings, just waited and there it was. I think Apple maybe watching me!Much better wireless network range than the previous version.
summary: Took some time to get working on the iPhone and iPad

reviewText: I use it with my iPhone all the time and it is great! If you like to see things on your tv and go bigger, you will love apple tv. I got it for my husband as a Christmas present and I am the one using it like crazy.

I use my Apple TV all the time.  I had to buy one for my brother.  I use it almost as much as anything else that is connected to my TV.  It is great for streaming anything from my MBA (allows dual screen appearance now which is nice), as well as just playing music through it from my phone or iPad while I am working around the house.I still have a Gen 2, which is at least a couple of years old now and still going strong.  I highly recommend these to everyone!

I use my Apple TV daily and I love renting movies on my Apple TV. I never rent movies any other way.If you have other Apple products, you will greatly appreciate the Apple ecosystem and how easy it is to get these devices to work together.

I use my Apply TV every day and really enjoy it. I have HBO Go, Hulu, and Netflix and use all three of these apps on the Apple TV frequently. Intermittently, a show will not load, but that it mainly due to my wifi connection cutting out. The box is very small and can be mounted to the back of your TV with hardware that I have seen on Amazon.The cons of this product are few, but may be important to you.1. The remote is TINY! I know that you can download the Remote app on your iPhone and use that, but I like having a separate remote to use since I do not always have my phone by my side while watching TV. This remote can get lost easily if it get left on the couch or on the bed.2. No Amazon Prime Instant Video!3. This may not be true for all, but if I am playing a DVD through my MacBook Pro and mirror it to my Apple TV it is unbearable slow. The video skips or completely stops. I was so excited to use the mirroring feature for this purpose since I  do not have a DVD player attached to my TV with the Apple TV, but I never use the feature because of its poor performance.These cons may not be issues for you, but they can be a bit of a nuisance. Overall, I do love my Apple TV and use it frequently.
summary: Works well, but could have better options

reviewText: I use only with an Iphone now but can't wait until I get the Ipad.  Already had a SmartTV for Hulu and Netflix that replaced the now obsolete Roku so I didn't need that feature.  Very simple to use with music, videos, pictures, YouTube, and probably more that I haven't seen.  It is great!

I use the Apple TV as my main television source. Between Netflix, iTunes, and the available networks/channels my needs are well met. A convenient thing is the podcasts on iTunes are easily viewed, making viewing of a diverse array of programming simple. Plus, I can stream my own iTunes collection through my TV on iCloud, the most seamless personal entertainment system ever!But, it is tweaky. My box crashes at least once a day and has to be rebooted. This seems to relate more to how well my computer, router, and the apple TV box play together than the box itself. But, the box is a factor in this problem. The selection of channels/networks is a bit limited compared to Roku. But, this is overall a better system.

I use the Apple TV in a room where there is TV which is not connected to any cable or DISH/DIRECTTV line. It is used to let my grandchildren watch shows from HULU PLUS and NetfLex and I can easily rent movies through iTunes if need be.  It was easy to set up and works great.

I use the Apple TV to play video from my computer, via iTunes (just convert your videos to MP4) as well as for my HULU and Netflix accounts. It used to work with Amazon instant video, but Amazon recently removed that functionality in order to boost sales of their own similar device.

I use the AppleTV with all of the Apple products in my house and it works seamlessly. I have an Apple AirPort Extreme Base Station that has an external HDD plugged into the back and together with the AppleTV I am able to easily access all of the digital media on the HDD without having to get off the couch. I have only had it about 3 weeks but it's one of those things I'd hate to go withou after owning one.My only complaint as of now is the Netflix app needs a lot of improving. I am used to Streaming Netflix through my Xbox 360 and the Netflix app on it is much better. The AppleTV Netflix retires far too many button pushes to get things goin and doesn't have continuous play like the Xbox. I am able to get around this though by just steaming it from my computer to the AppleTV.Overall this gets a 10 out of 10 from me.
I use this all the time and it's turned my TV into something that I use way more now. If you have a Macbook that is capable of Airplay, the possibilities are endless.

I use this Apple TV almost daily and I'm not sure how I lived without it. I own a lot of digital content and have ripped my movie collection so I can take it on the go. Streaming this content to my TV is very easy with this device. The content is maintained through iTunes and it's a simple matter of turning on Home Sharing on your computer, and signing in on the Apple TV. Obviously a wired connection is preferable but I've found a wireless connection works fairly well also. I've only had a buffering issue a few times but blame that on my old wireless router.The UI is similar to that of an iPhone or iPad; there are multiple apps available for the user to choose from (most of them existing services you need to sign up for) and it's as easy as signing in to use the apps. We use this for Netflix, Hulu, and MLB TV, all of which work great on the device.The device is small (the remote even smaller) so you won't have to take up a lot of valuable space on your entertainment center to enjoy it. I own two of these now and have loved having them. If you use iTunes a lot to manage your content, give this a try.
summary: Awesome Product for a Low Price

reviewText: I use this as well as a Roku. If you have a iphone or iPad the Apple TV really works well with them

I use this daily, sending a Pandora stream from my iPad to my TV and home theater speakers. It also lets me stream artwork apps from the iPad, or Flickr, which make for a very pretty TV screen through the day. Love it!

I use this device to stream movies and shows on the web to my HDTV with great results. Picture quality on HD content may not be as good as that from my Oppo bluray player but it is good enough for me. Will recommended.

I use this every day! All of my movies are in I tunes now. I can play a movie from it on the TV for my kids while I still use my computer. I can do music on it too. I dont have speakers anymore because my TV speakers are awesome and thats all I need. I have 2 of these for 2 different TVs. Great purchase

I use this for online movie streaming and playing music from an iPhone, and it works great for both.  The user interface is simple and syncing with an iPhone for music streaming could not have been easier.My one gripe is that I have not been able to get my Logitech One remote to work very well with the Apple TV. The Logitech turns it on and off fine, but I have not figured out the navigation using the Logitech.  It may be just that I have just not put in enough effort to get the Logitech One programmed property, or it could also be another case of Apple not playing nicely with products outside the Apple family.  The Apple remote is intuitive and easy to use.
I use this for wireless demos and presentations regularly and it's the only way to go. Several at our company have adopted the Apple TV.

I use this handy device to stream movies, music and TV programs, podcasts, etc. I got rid of Satellite as was costing me about the cost of this little device a month! I built an antenna from clothes hangers for local channels and installed it in the attic. This gives me two to three channels for each of the big four networks! You can get Hulu and Netflix and more. Programs I can't get from all these sources I can usually buy from the iTunes store. I bought full seasons for three programs cheaper than what one month of satellite was costing me!Setting it up is a bit of a hassle as you have to use the remote to enter IDs and passwords. Its four-way toggle makes it easy to hit the wrong thing.  But, once set up, you're through!  I have no streaming issues.I also have Ruku which offers access to Amazon, Netflix and other channels, plus a hard disk via USB. Between these two I have access to all the media I can stand.Update:  June 15, 2013Still very pleased with this purchase.  The user interface is much easier to use than the Roku.  Between it and Roku, if I could buy only one, the Apple TV would be my choice.  I've dropped satellite and use cable only for internet. Definitely recommended.
I use this on a daily basis. it's everything i need to stream videos, and music to my tv! Love it

I use this teaching. I load a Keynote document onto my iPad and then display it through the Apple TV. The ability to walk around the room and not only advance slides by touch the iPad to display a "laser pointer" type image that is *much* easier to follow than any real laser pointer.
I use this to watch HBO GO, Netflix, & Crackle.  No complaints, menu's are easy to navigate and no issues streaming.  I have an Apple Time Capsule and 40mb internet.
I use You Tube and NetFlix mostly. Like most other reviewers, Apple needs more subscription movie/TV services offered beyond NetFlix.
summary: Easy to use -- good movie streaming with 3MB download DSL

reviewText: I've already had one and use it mainly with netflix and my macbook pro. I bought this one for my sister. As expected it works fine.

I've been using Apple TV for a couple of years. This is my 3-rd device: 2 at home and 1 at work. At work (iOS dev shop) it is a great solution to sharing your iPad, iPhone or OSX screen with a team. We could not run a meeting without it. We loved the ease of switching between different devices: no wires or adaptors to worry about. At home I use it for streaming Hulu and Netflix, showing my photographs and occasionally renting a movie from iTunes.  I like it for what it's built for, however, I feel that Apple TV is aging fast. Competition from smart TVs, game consoles and other streaming devices is catching up quickly. Apple needs to innovate to make me buy another Apple TV in the future. I want 3-rd party apps on Apple TV and better integration with the rest of the home theater.
I've been very pleased.  Since we own Apple products the ease of setup and use is just like any other Apple product.

I've been wanting a Apple TV since I got my iPad so that I could watch movies from my iPad on my TV.  Unfortunately, Apple TV is a HDMI output only device, which sucked cause my TV although full HD is a older model that doesn't have HDMI inputs.  So I really thought I was screwed and wasn't going to be able to use the Apple TV as I really wanted to unless I bought a new TV.  Well that was out of the question so I started looking for HDMI to composite converters and thanks to Amazon again found ViewHD Two Input HDMI to RGB Component YPbPr / VGA 2x1 Switch Converter Support 5.1CH Surround Sound, did take about a hour to get everything right and set up but thankfully it converted the signal from the HDMI on Apple TV to the YPbPr connection.  Setting up aside, the Apple TV is amazing, its basically like getting iTunes to run on the TV screen.  So i'm glad that after all that had happened that I got it, was well worth it.By the way some have been saying that ViewHD Two Input HDMI to RGB Component YPbPr / VGA 2x1 Switch Converter Support 5.1CH Surround Sound doesn't work with Apple TV Gen 3, and it may not depending on your set up but for me it works fine and my TV is a RCA 55' Full HD 120Hz from probably 2004 or 2005 can't totally remember think I bought it Christmas 2004.
I've been watching so much Beyoncé on my Apple TV it just doesn't make sense this product is so great thank you so very much for the fast shipment

I've bought these for myself and for relatives and friends.  It greatly expands available TV content at no extra cost.  Everyone loves the photo slides feature.  People are amazed when I take their picture and it pops up in the ongoing slideshow a few minutes later.
summary: People are amazed when I take their picture and it pops up ...

reviewText: I've convert everything to apple now. Being able to network my iTunes music and movies and have them go right to my TV and surround sound. Using my iPad as a remote is awesome as well..

I've had an AppleTV for several years, but just got this one for my in-laws as a gift. They love it so far - it is so simple to setup and use that they were up and running in no time and enjoying Netflix and other services right on their TV. Can't go wrong with an AppleTV!
I've had mine for about a month or two now and it's great! It works way better than the in tv system.
I've had my Apple TV for half a year and love it. It's user friendly and the interface looks nice. Definitely recommend it.

I've had my first Apple for about 18 months now.  It works great and I haven't had any problems with it at all.  I bought a second Apple 2 months ago and got rid of cable TV all together.  I now have free antenna TV along with Apple to stream Netflix.  I no longer get ripped off paying $72.00 a  month for lousy cable TV.  Now I watch what I want, when I want, for a $4.00 monthly fee to Netflix. This is a pretty good way to save money in this bad economy.
summary: I own two and love them

reviewText: I've had nothing but buffering and waiting with this unit. Netflix especially but NHL Game Center and Hulu weren't much better. Roku works fine and TWC says its not our internet connection. After a week or so of spending more time waiting to watch something, I sold it for a loss and moved on. Hope this was just my bad experience.

I've had the Apple TV for about a year and a half now and I love it.  It isn't something that you would call a must have item, but it is very good at what it does do.Here is what you get:*  User friendly interface*  Integration with other Apple products*  Access to the iCloud*  iTunes integration*  Apps that include MLB TV, NHL TV, NBA TV, Netflix, and moreAgain, it isn't something you absolutely have to have, but it is fun and adds an element to your media consumption.
summary: I love this, but I don't know if it is a must have

reviewText: I've had this device for about a month now and thought I'd give some impressions which might aid those considering a purchase.First, on the device itself. It's small in size and works well. I recently cancelled my pay-TV package because it was just too expensive for the amount of time I used it. I had 500 channels and watched about 1 of them. My main viewing interest was in watching NHL hockey games, and I watched nothing else, so why pay for what I wasn't using? NHL games were available through Apple TV for $100 dollars a year—about what I was paying each month for pay-TV. A good deal. I find that I actually get a better picture through the Apple TV than I got through my pay-TV provider, so I'm satisfied with how the device works.Now, what I'm not so satisfied with. First, in the NHL TV package, the games come on when the games begin and end immediately when the games are over. What's the big deal about that? Well, I like to get at least a little pre-game and post-game coverage. I'm not expecting complete pre- or post-game shows, but at least a little something. I don't need the game to switch off the second the final buzzer sounds. This isn't Apple's fault. I'm sure it's in the NHL TV contract. I won't reduce my rating because of this, but it's something to consider for sports fans because I'm sure it's the same deal with the NBA and MLB packages.There is not enough content available from Apple TV. Looking at the list available through Roku, they seem to offer a lot more, and a greater variety. For instance, I'm a subscriber to Amazon Prime. It's not directly availably through Apple TV. I've read here in reviews that you can view Amazon prime videos through Apple TV by mirroring your iPad, but I haven't been able to make this work. Oddly, I've been able to get the sound, but not the picture. I hear the program, but get a blank screen. Maybe I'm dumb, but Apple prides itself on making easy to use & intuitive devices so dumb guys like me don't have to bat our brains out getting the devices to work. Besides YouTube and the NHL games, there is really nothing available on Apple TV that I want. So I take a star off for that.I'm a long time and loyal Apple user, going back to the days of the Powerbook 160, and I like Apple products, but it's a love-hate relationship. Some things about Apple products bug the hell out of me, and a prime example of this is the Apple TV remote.Apple seems to have a design protocol that states that all their products will have a sleek, minimalistic, zen-like design with no bumps, protruding surfaces, seams, buttons or breaks to distract the eye. They want their products to have a certain "look" or, as they might call it "sensory experience". This may all look very well in a salesroom display, but we customers have to work and deal with these things, and what looks good doesn't always work good.The new model of the iMac is a perfect example of this. They designed a light, sleek (a real Apple word there) razor thin display unit that almost disappears when you look at it from the side. A wonderful technological accomplishment, but Apple doesn't seem to realize that just because you CAN do something doesn't mean you SHOULD do something. In my work with computers, a DVD-R/optical drive is a necessity. The new iMac, with its sleek chassis, has no room for a DVD-R drive, so if I want to use a DVD-R drive, I have to buy it separately, hook it up to the computer, using up a valuable USB plug, and have it sitting by the computer with cables running all over the desk. Hence we get the sleek, elegant zen design of the iMac with an un-sleek, inelegant dvd-r drive sitting next to it on the desk, with spaghetti like cables running from the drive to the computer. Sort of ruins the sleek, elegant, minimalistic effect, nicht wahr? Dammit, this thing is a DESKTOP computer, not a laptop. It's not something I'm going to carry around in a briefcase. Do I need it to be sleek, razor thin, light, when it's going to be sitting on a desk? The design is eye-catching and you may say, "wow!" the first time you see it. The ten thousand times after that, it's just another thing sitting on the desk. Recently when I needed a new desktop computer and discovered all this, it was the closest I've ever come to switching from Apple. I didn't, but I did go out and buy a used, reconditioned 4 year old iMac, which I'm satisfied with.Sorry for wandering off the subject, but I felt a need for an Apple rant. Back to the Apple TV remote. It's another one of those sleek, almost invisible, disappearing designs Apple so loves. But do the Apple designers ever watch TV? Do they ever use a remote control? Do they realize how easy it is to misplace a remote control? Don't they know the frustration of having a remote slip down in the sofa cushions when the user doesn't know it's slipped? Do these people live in the real world, or in a hermetically sealed container constructed completely of sleek, aluminized, elegant zen surfaces colored only in shades of white, black and gray? The Apple TV remote is ridiculously small, ridiculously thin, and just perfect to get lost with the least bit of inattention. It is a thing designed to win design awards, not to be used. So I reduced the rating another star for this.It's a shame, because the Apple TV device is really a nice item. It works well and, as I said, gives a very good picture. But there is a severe lack of interesting viewing content. If that is improved, I will revise this review and bump it up a star. I don't suspect they will ever change the remote device—it goes against their senseless design ethic. Since the remote is such an essential part of this device (it's useless without a remote), and the remote is such an annoying (if elegant) design, this thing will never be a five star item for me.
I've have a Roku and a WDTV.., but Apple TV is the best by far. Apple mirroring is the ticket that opens up a world of goodies. Stream from your ipad or iphone directly to your TV. How sweet it is.

I've never been in the cult of Apple.  Mac Books and iPhones are nice but never worth the money to me.  This thing is TOTALLY worth it.  The interface is indescribably better than the one on our Bluray player, we can do absolutely everything with it, and our picture quality improved way beyond what I had previously thought our internet connection was capable of.  Highly recommend.
summary: The best streaming device we've had

reviewText: I've owned a roku since they came out several years ago.  I love my roku, that now lives in our bedroom.  We moved to the AppleTV mainly because I wanted to ditch cable and save some money.  Being in an Apple household (2 macs, 2 ipads) it just made sense for us to move to the Apple TV, but the main reason for us was the iTunes integration.  iTunes had everything we wanted to watch, so we knew moving to the AppleTV was going to give us the widest range of options for watching what we wanted.In addition to Netflix, Hulu & iTunes rentals and purchases, you can access anything that's in an iTunes library on your network.  So we've converted all of our DVD's to .mp4's and stored them in iTunes so we can quickly get to the videos we or the kids want to watch.  It's easy enough to operate that my 3 year old can use it, and has parental controls to block access to specific channels that I don't want my daughter getting to (like You tube). I do wish it would allow you to block content by rating, however I've yet to see that on any set top box to date.The one thing that really bothers me on this unit is that backing out of an app is a bit of a pain.... It's essentially hitting the back arrow on your browswer... back for every movie you've viewed till you get back to the home screen.  Not sure how Apple missed the boat on that, but overall I can live with that.

I've owned a V1 Apple TV for several years and loved it. I hung onto it because I thought it was better to be able to download songs / movies to the Hard Drive. I decided to upgrade to the latest edition, and pleased I did. The new Apple TV connects to iPhone / iPad remote control effortlessly. I think you get maximum value if you are also using iTunes match so all your music / videos are available even when your PC is turned off.Great product.
summary: Great Upgrade From Previous Apple TV

reviewText: I've really loved my Apple TV. The quality of video it streams is great and I can access all the things I want. I have Netflix, my favorite shows, movies, video podcasts and more. Also the airplay integration with my Mac has been great to watch Conan, Late Night and other shows that are online.

I've streamed a few movies from my iPAD to here, but I see the bigger value in this if you actually subscribe to Netflix streaming, Hulu, or other streaming media.  We don't---since we have HBO and Netflix DVD.  To make best use of it, better to have streaming subscriptions.
summary: Great concept, but only if you have Netflix, Hulu, etc

reviewText: I've tried and owned several different brands of media streaming devices and the apple TV still remains at the top of the list. The response time when navigating through the menu is amazing and the way the pre-installed apps are displayed is very user friendly.Out of the box I was able to setup the WiFi and start watching Netflix within 5 minutes. There were some software updates available and depending on the size of the update they can vary with how long they take.My only complaint with the Apple TV is the lack of USB support allowing me to stream my own personal content through my TV. That is the only reason I am docking a star from this review.
summary: One of the best media streaming devices

reviewText: I've tried Roku, WDTV, PS3, Xbox, and now this.  Of all of those, this is the best combination of price and functionality.  I needed a quick device to watch iTunes and Netflix.  I would like to see Amazon Prime as well, but that wasn't a deal breaker.  One of the best features though is the AirPlay feature.  It is so easy to share your pictures and videos from an iDevice to the AppleTV.  I even use my Android phone and Windows laptop with software to be able to use the AirPlay mirror feature.  The user interface is just plain easy to navigate and nice to look at, unlike a lot of the other devices which can be confusing and ugly.  You don't have to be an Apple fan to get a lot of use out of this little box!
summary: I should have gotten it sooner!

reviewText: I wanted to be able to sit in my easy chair with my iPad and select movies and play them on the TV without having to get up. Well after reading reviews that this baby could NOT stream amazon prime free movies I was ready to box it up for return.  I kept digging  and after a few hours discovered that there was a new app that would allow this very feature through airplay.  It got terrible reviews but I installed it anyway.  The app has worked perfectly for me. Also, after seeing this in action my daughter got an Apple TV also and the app works perfectly for her.  She loves the music too.Go to App Store and search for "amazon instant video".
I wanted to give it 5 stars, but the use of a key board on the remote would help a lot.My netgear streamer has one.Over all easy to use and install, movies stream fast really fast.

I want to keep this brief and to the point, because there have been hundreds if not thousands of reviewers before me.I personally have used this product hundreds of times since I purchased! I use this to watch YouTube videos streamed from my iPhone, and I also love watching Netflix TV Series like lost from my Apple TV. The product is fantastic and I have no complaints!I would purchase this again with no doubt.
I was a bit skeptical about purchasing a Apple TV, but I'm glad I did. It's worth paying 100 bucks.

I was a little skeptical when I first bought the Apple TV but it exceeded my expectations.The mirroring function allows you to broadcast whatever you have on your iPad onto your TV. This is great for streaming sports, movies, etc... that would normally be too small to watch on your iDevice.You can also set up your Netflix, Hulu Plus, HBO Go accounts on the Apple TV and stream them to your TV.The only con is that the movies, TV shows, etc... available for purchase on the Apple TV are very expensive.
summary: Great for projecting your iPad (iPhone) onto your TV

reviewText: I was a little skeptical when I ordered a used apple TV, I wasn't sure if It was going to work well. When I received the apple TV immediately I was amazed! The apple TV works as if it was new. If you can save money where you can you might as well! I'm glad I ordered the Apple TV used and not new, I ended up saving money and It works as if it's new!

I was a little unsure at first. It was highly recommended to me to buy it. I love the thing. I like having the ability to play my music directly from my computer, use netflix, hulu plus, YouTube, etc. Awesome buy.

I was astounded by the capabilities of this little device and it's ability to deliver crisp clear HD clarity over wi-fi. I won't get into the details as all the other reviews cover most of the plus points. I'll just offer some lessons from my learning curve.For those with a high-end A/V system and planning on using a Logitech 900 remote, I'll just say this was fairly easy to set up under "activities". Tip: you won't find a "logical" category for it in the remote set-up guide, so instead look for it under "computers/Media PC" and type in Apple TV as the device. I have this little guy tucked away in a closet in the bedroom and controlled by the RF blaster. It's hooked up to my Harmon Kardon A/V system using the optical cable for sound with video through HDMI. Wi-fi is over a newer dual-band Cisco router. No problems at all streaming HD movies at 1080i!One other tip for those planning to stream video through iTunes. When converting/ripping HD movies (720 or 1080) using handbrake or some other program make sure to set your fps rate to 30. Anything less, and you'll get very "choppy" almost slow-motion output to the TV. I tested every scenario to try to fix this problem until realizing it was the fps setting! Also keep in mind that ATV does NOT play all types of files and MPEG4 (MP4) is the preferred type. Some formats such as MKV, AVI and others will not load into iTunes and subsequently ATV. You'll need to "jailbreak" it to be able to use other formats (Someone please let me know when you figure it out..haha!!).
summary: Everything I wished for and more

reviewText: I was having major streaming problems with Netflix and thought they were the problem. After a lot of research I realized my Sony Bluray Player might be the problem. Read up on Apple TV and decided to give it a shot. Score! This is so much better video quality and streaming issue is gone. Best $100 I've spent. It was so easy to set up. I highly recommend,

I was looking at purchase a nice dock like the B&W Zeppelin Air, but then I realized I could buy another Apple TV for 1/6 the price and use it with any speakers I want.  This solution works very well for me as I can take my small powered speakers and the apple TV anywhere in my wifi network and I have air play speakers.

I was looking to purchase a 2nd Apple TV for another HDTV in my home.  This used device works just like the original MD199LL/A I already had, and gives me the ability to wirelessly stream TV shows I've recorded via my Mac/EyeTV/Pinnacle HDTV Tuner for the Mac.  This setup, coupled with an Over-the-Air Antenna, has enabled me to ditch the DVR Recorder and cable service from Comcast.  Three months' worth of saved rentals/cable costs and I've paid for my equipment.  I wasn't watching anything besides the local channels anyway.

I was not really sure what internet TV box to get.  I almost bought a Roku.  Apple has done a nice job in making this product simple, intuitive and functional.  Streams H.D. video with very little buffering at the beginning.  I also ordered a new N network router to make sure the wireless speed in the house would support the box.  I Highly recommend this upgrade, although I tried the Apple TV with the old G router and it worked well with it too.
summary: Easy to set up and learn

reviewText: I was not worried about the quality of the product but the setup was so quick and easy and networking was done in less than 10 min.  Great product.
summary: So easy to set up and works great

reviewText: I wasn't exactly sure what to expect.  I was just hoping that it would be easy to view my photos & videos on my regular TV.  Not only does my Apple TV do that, but it also allows me to watch my Netflix, as well as so many other options.  Why I waited so long?  I have no idea.  Great product, great delivery!

I was really worried when the item arrived any the box looked as if it had been through fight. But when I opened it it was in good condition, minus the dust.  The only reason I didn't give this item a higher rating is due to the remote battery was dead and I had to purchase a new battery immediately to complete the setup.
I was skeptical if my mom would like this because she is not tech savvy at all. But the apple tv is so easy for her to use and navigate so she can watch her shows and movies on netflix she loves it.
I was so impressed with the first Apple TV device that I  decided I was going to buy a second one for my room. It works with all my other Apple products.
summary: This is my second AppleTV Device

reviewText: I was told after I made the purchase that there is an upgrade to the one I bought. giggle  I didn't know anybetter. Either way, doesn't really matter, this item is awesome. Takes up very little space and allows me to use Netflix, and many other applications like ESPN - through the use of my AT&T Uverse internet. Awesome buy! Love it. Several of my friends have bought it after seeing it at my apt.

I was trying to stream movies via my ipad but wanted to see them on my TV and heard about apple tv.  I had no idea what to expect but absolutely love it now!  it was so simple to set up and I love how i can access my itunes and videos from it too.  If you are a iphone or ipad person I highly recommend apple tv!
I was unsure if Apple TV would solve my issues, but as soon as I connected it, I immediately disconnected cable TV and haven't looked back.
I was worry than it didn't work outside the US but it works well and i have no complains. i will recomend this product if you have other devices apple so you enjoy better.
I watch Netflix, MLB and rent movies.  A must have for iPhone and iPad users for the AirPlay option (watch anything on your phone/tablet on you TV through wifi)

I went from spending $170. /month to 65./month by getting rid of my cable and just having Internet with Hulu + and Netflix. I get all the same shows and more features than I had with cable only. It took a little adjustment to get used to operating. But if you're good with an apple product such as an iPhone or iPad you'll adjust quickly.

I went with the ATV over Roku simply for Airplay and the way it fit into my current media setup.  I wish it had more channels like the Roku, but Airplay makes up for that for everything I personally watch.  It will be great if and when Apple decides to allow more apps on the ATV.  It has huge potential.  The biggest drawback for me is the lack of support for external storage.  I already have an HTPC setup so it was not difficult to keep iTunes open to watch all of my videos.  But if I could just attach an external HDD with all of my music and videos, that would be ideal.  Roku does this to a limited extent.  There are other devices that allow external storage I know, but they have drawbacks in support and function that just aren't worth it.  So I will stream ITunes for now and wait to see what Apple comes up with next.  I have an Xbox and previously used it for all of my streaming.  So far I am happy with both, but we'll see how they compare over time, especially with Netflix and Hulu Plus apps.
summary: Hard to choose between ATV and Roku

reviewText: I will be happy when they expand the content available.  I especially find the mirroring useful.  I would recommend it.
I wish more apps were available. I so want to get away from paying for obsolete/uninteresting television, I love HBOgo. Will be buying more for the rest of the house!
I wish they supply magnifing glass to read the guide. however was able to set it up without reading. One extra page in guide with larger font will be great help.

I works as advertised but doesn't seem to really do all that much, let's you spend money on various services etc.It does let you see your I pad screen on your HD TV but after looking at photos on an 3 megapixel 9.7 inch I pad air, they don't look so good on a 2 mega pixel 47 inch HD TVDONT KNOW IF I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN OR NOT .?????
i would buy another one of these. I don't have to buy a adapter for my iphone to play movies on the tv. this new age of "streaming" movies is wonderful.
i would definitely recommend getting an Apple TV especially if you own other apple products because you can stream them thru the TV

I would give this product five stars, except it doesn't include Amazon streaming video as one of its channels.  But in every other way, it is far superior to the roku player I had before - easy, intuitive interface and displays closed captions for Netflix (roku didn't).  Also, Apple service is much nicer and more knowledgeable to deal with than the service I received from roku.  I have to watch Amazon streaming on my tv, though, or I can mirror tv screen thru the Apple TV, but resolution is not as good.  Hope Amazon/Apple get together soon, so I can give this device five stars.

I would have given this product 5 stars if Apple allowed Apps to be installed. Very easy to set up. This is a sleek box that allows me to play movies, slide shows from my MacBook air, iphone, ipad or access my PC iTunes library on my Plasma TV.  I am glad I returned the overpriced Apple HDMI adapter for the Apple TV. Some reviewers complain that Amazon Prime is missing but I can use mirroring on My MacBook Air to watch Amazon Prime. In the bedroom I find myself listening to music on my TV just as much since it is just a click away.

I would love to give this device 5 stars, but it's lack of Amazon Streaming Video is, to me, it's only downfall. The box connects quickly and easily to your network - setup is painless. I was plesantly surprised to see I could connect a bluetooth keyboard to the unit, which made setup even faster. So far, this device has worked flawlessly. I have several devices around my home which have access to Netflix, this is by far, the cleanest, most user friendly interface.

I would love to say its 5 stars especially because it apple but I can't. It has a beautiful UI that is easy but it does have WIFI PROBLEMS!! Sometimes it says theirs a errror when i try to watch netflex. So i have to unplug it and plug it back in. But it if very nice and small, but until apple fixes the wifi problem I can't really recommend it, even if you can mirror anything from your ipad or iPhone on to it.
I would recommend this to everyone! Great product. My kids love watching Netflix through this device. Great for the entire family!

I wrote a few reviews about the other streamers and I always said just buy apple tv instead!The best design, Check!The best software, Check!The best ease of use, Check!The best option to watch anything you like, almost Check! (no amazon prime at the moment, 7/7/13)The best resolution, Check!The best screen saver, Check!The best of the best, Check!!!

J&R sent me the old version which doesn't have an AUX or a 3.5 mm cable so if the battery is dead it doesn't work. I asked to return it so they told me either to ship it or to come to the store in NYC. I went to the store and took a refund so before buying it check if it is the new version as the old version doesn't have AUX
Just added the latest Apple TV to my home theatre. Love the airplay which allows you to send any video or picture to your flat screen TV.
Just an awesome product.  It is a must have for any apple lover.  Remote is really small so just be careful not to lose it.
Just an issue if you have to type word by word on screen and navigate thru ABC onscreen keyboard, if you have an ipad o mac runs great, just select apple tv and goes to your main screen.
Just as advertised for easy access to Netflix and music. Love it!No down side at all.Apple makes great product!

Just awesome, especially due to the fact that you can mirror your devices to your TV. We play our music from our iphones through our TV speakers and it's seamless. All of our movies that we've purchased are viewed from "the cloud". No storage problems for our laptops.

Just based on the video quality alone, I would give this product 5 stars, but if you also add how it integrates so well with other iDevices, this is an exceptional piece of technology. It will not replace your cable box/subscription because a lot of the channels require some sort of account to log in. However, if you already have a Netflix or Hulu account, it will nicely fit in to your entertainment ecosystem. We used to use our PS3 to view Netflix but now Apple TV is our device of choice.
Just does not carry amazon prime video. Use it for YouTube and Netflix. Good all around device that will do the job it says.

Just got it two days ago so still figuring out all the things it can do. Teenage son is quicker at learning the specifics to using the Apple TV. I was surprised about having to pay for certain features:( Home match. Took some time to connect to my home computers.

Just got mine yesterday, can't get myself away from it. This is a great product if you are an Apple aficionado. The easy setup and ease of the interface is suburb. Airplay is an awesome feature specially when you have too many apple products laying around.I would recommend in a heartbeat minute to anyone interested in this kind of gadgets. Way to go Apple.

Just how I expected and it came in mint condition! Couldn't even tell it was used!! The only other thing is that it didn't come with the HDMI cable which I didn't know I had to get so it would have been nice if I knew that but maybe I just missed it in the description.. Anyways fast shipping and an awesome product!

Just like all of the other Apple stuff... simple, useful, and reliable.  It's great to be able to project the iPad screen up on the TV so the family can share a laugh at a YouTube video, to browse photos or watch a movie.
Just like it should be … plug & play! Now I need a faster internet connection to fully appreciate some of the features.
summary: Works Just Like I Expected It To

reviewText: Just what it's supposed to do.  Minimal packaging, perfect length.  Not much else you can say about it.  As they say, it just works.

Just when I thought I had a good flat screen, withApple TV MD199LL/A [NEWEST VERSION] Apple TV, it became a great TV. To start with, music from my computer never sounded so good using Apple TV. I play the music through my old Pioneer sound system (using the AUX input red white and a cable going from the red white out on the TV to the AUX  input on my Pioneer) and it's like I have my own mini theater.There are pod cast programs I can access which makes my TV an educational tool in ways I had never imagined. The real joy is being able to show movies I have created on my iMac and showing pictures of family and friends as a slide show with music added instantly. I use my iPod in ways that give me more for the money than I had ever thought possible. If you are looking for first run movies, you'll find them on Apple TV as well. With the price of movies going up all th time, it's so nice to invite friends over to watch a current movie playing in theaters in the comfort of your own home. You can stop the movie any time and go back to it or go back to a sceen you want to watch again if you like. Rentals are good for 24 hours so you can keep on sharing if you like. HD movies never looked so good. Being able to access Netflex using Apple TV is a real bonus for me as well. I can look at TV series that I may have missed or movies that I have forgotten all about and would like to see again. On Netflex I can find movies for the children in our family so I can let the kids watch what ever they like on a TV in a separate room. This is one of the best purchases I have made. Apple TV comes with WiFi built in so you don't have to buy a USB adaptor for your TV to access WiFi; Apple TV automatically does that using a HDMI cable (not supplied) connected from Apple TV to your TV. If you have wireless access to the internet, all you need is Apple TV and am HDMI cable; it's that easy. I thought it would be compicated; boy was I wrong.
Less that 1 year after purchasing this product we are regularly having issues with intermittent connections when using Airplay, Hulu, Netflix, etc

Let me start by saying I am a Roku guy.  I have 2 of them and they are awesome.  So why did I buy an apple tv?1.  The simple answer is the mirror feature.  With apple tv I can stream the CBS app on my iphone and have it play through my TV.  Why do you need this?  Well we dumped our cable and CBS shows are only available online or apps.  This is a super easy way to keep current on all our shows.  You can do this with anything else on your iphone or ipad.  I use the iphone because the stream window is almost full TV size where the ipad is minimized.2.  I was blown away by the HD quality.  It puts roku to shame.  My wife, who can't tell the difference between standard def and HD on  Uverse even noticed the difference between the roku and the apple tv.Why didn't you give this a 5 star rating?  2 reasons:1.  You can't watch your amazon prime, though as I write this I haven't tried mirroring from my phone.  C'mon apple, add the app.2.  You can't add any channels. You get what apple gives you.  This is where Roku shines.  My recommendation get both.
summary: Great buy for those looking to cut cable or supplement.  Apple TV Vs Roku

reviewText: Like all Apple products, the Apple TV is a fantastic product that is easy to use and durable. I just hooked it up to my tv and follow the onscreen instructions. It's that easy!
Like all Apple Products...the best.  The only con I have is I wish it had more content for video shows.  Very easy to set up and use with great sound.

Like all the apple products we've tried, it's simple to use and does what we want it to do.  I do wish the remote maybe had a keypad, as it is a bit laborious to pick out letters to type in a youtube search onscreen, and is very easy to misplace for months at a time due to its small size!
summary: Way better than the Logitech Revue we used to have

reviewText: liked the first apple tv my son gave me so much that I bought this for my other tv, they're both great units.
Like every Apple product. Excelent if you have ipad but you have to pay for everything to watch movies etc.
Like everything Apple, it does what it does without any BS and does it well. This device delivers content perfectly, and that content is user specific and on-demand. Incredible.
Like it

Like most Apple products, this is well made with a great interface. I took a star away for 2 reasons: 1st, no Pandora.  Apple needs to include that.  2nd, I had to call tech support to make YouTube work.  While this may be YouTube's fault, it was still annoying.  Tech support finally got it working by having me manually change an IP address (not my local WiFi IP, but an external IP).

Like my iPad and iPhone, this device works great as advertised.  It setup easily the first time into my AV system.  I waited for this version to get the 1080p interface.  It looks and works great.  I have actually bought 2 additional units as gifts.  One is connected to a projector in our karate dojo to allow video recording students with instant replay.  It works great.I also have a Boxee Box in my system.  Boxee has many more apps, but I really don't use any of them, so I'll probably use the AppleTV as my default Internet media viewer.As a big bonus, it connected perfectly to my Harmony 900 remote so I still have 1 remote for everything.
Like my iPhone and iPad, this works very, very well.  Intuitive navigation, was easy to connect and synchs with all my mobile devices and the library on my pc.

like other apple product.  it works very well.  The only downside is price, just like any other apple product.  i needed this for airplay capability and don't need it much for streaming.  If you factor heavy on streaming, roku is probably better.jailbreak for gen3 is currently not out 12/7/12 as of this review but it is said someone is working on it.

Like so many of Apple's products, this seems to come with many maddening singularities.  It required weeks of tinkering to get sound from Netflix, for example.  I still haven't figure out if or how I can watch videos on my computer without first loading them into iTunes, and, of course, my Kindle videos seem to be out of bounds as well.  I am not a "tekkie," so maybe these betray my own incompetence, but...you know what...I don't like buying hassles, which on balance this is.  I see some but not much net gain.
Like the idea of being able to show people pictures  and video from my phone on my tv when we have a party !!!!
Like this little guy.. Apple made this product well and it meets every things I need it to do.. super easy to setup, configure, and operate.
Like what this has to offer, didn't really realize many things like movies and all have to be purchased.  Not quite like a smart tv, but close.
Little problem with selection language, but once that was fixed it works great every time.i recommend to every one who doesn't want to spend $2000 on a smart TV.

looking for something with an easy set-up and can instantly forward videos and music from my iphone.  This does exactly what I wanted.  I have on in the living room as well as bedroom when I want to watch movies that are on the computer.For the living room you can use this one trick.....I hooked the apple TV up to the stereo reciver via the optical audio cord.  Now, I only have to turn on the receiver and forward music from my phone to get the sound.  I can leave the tv off (like when going through hdmi) because the apple TV will  start playing what I do on my phone instantly.  HDMI can also be hooked up to make it a dual output device.
summary: Love it (apple fan) Does what I expected

reviewText: Looks like finally I have what I needed. I am using airplay to stream from my macbook, using vlc player to stream dvd. Works like a charm. Great product at this price.

Lots of free stuff to watch on Apple TV. Works with your Netflix account too. Easy set up if yo order the suggested HDMI cord! Very tiny and takes up very little room. Make sure you turn on automatic updates so it will do it during the night and not when yo wan to watch a movie!!

Lots of pre-loaded apps.  Purchased as a gift, but most apps were already available on his blu-ray player.  Only uses it to push music and video from his iPod Touch and iTunes from his computer.  There are a few free apps for viewing movies, but we don't have a paid hulu, netlix or other subscription. Maybe down the road.  We were also hoping to hook it up at his mother's house to do a slideshow from his iPod, but the unit requires wi-fi/internet access as well??  She doesn't have that.  It's an okay product for people with Wi-Fi/Ethernet internet access and non-smart TVs.
summary: Great product, mini remote, wish I would've read up on the apps and requirements.

reviewText: Love 1080P output. Airplay from iPad and iPhone work well. Now able to sync with Bluetooth keyboards which helps with entering titles on Hulu and Netflix. The only negative is airplay mirroring from a MacBook can be laggy so it's better to connect a TV directly to the MacBook if you want to mirror your display.
Love all Apple products. Apple TV lived up to the brands reputation. With this product i am going to try to eliminate cable TV from my life.

Love all my Apple electronics, this just adds to my collection and love how my MacBook Pro, iPhone and iPad all can mirror and sync up with ease. Netflix, Hulu, Crackle, iTunes store, Watch ESPN, there great. I know it will never happen but it needs amazon prime also.

Love apple TV.  Does take a bit to think when using Netflix sometimes, but we had the same problem with the wii, so I think its a netflix problem.  Its fun using all our devices to control the tv.  I wish there would be a way to move things around in the menu.
Love Apple TV- lots of choices and there are a lot of free programs available.  Some of the movies that are a lot older have ridiculous charges but there are still a fair amount of shows.
Love Apple TV!
Love Apple TV. So glad I bought it. It lets me watch everything I want to on one easy device. I am also considering buying another one

Love being able to push media from any of the apple devices in my home. Renting movies on iTunes is very convenient. It's easy to set up just plain works - you can even access your iTunes library on your Mac from this device and stream whatever is there.

Loved it, great addition to my other Apple products. Setup was a breeze, even though using the included remote to scroll through letter and after letter when setting up can be a pain. I would encourage anyone to get a Bluetooth keyboard.

Loved the Interface, loved the remote functionality with iPhone 5, iPad, iPod touch its just amazingly easy to use Remote App.Setup is easy, in 5 minutes I am ready to go...Airplay feature is too good and convenient.Apple TV box is so small that it fits in your hand, pocket and great finish, its really looks smart.Highly recommended product.

Love how easy it is to set up and get going with Netflix and the iTunes store. The product design is great. Small form-factor box and remote, not a lot of buttons to fumble around with. Netflix operation is nearly flawless compared with other media PC options I have used in the past (Windows Media Center, for example).What is missing from this product (and the rest of the Apple iTunes setup) is a server device so I can effectively play my movies that I have in mp4 format using the Apple TV. Currently you have to have another computer running iTunes with Home Sharing enabled to be able to play your movies that are not downloaded from the iTunes store. On top of that, the Home Sharing setup is not the most reliable. I have had to restart iTunes on my computer and restart the Apple TV to get the Home Sharing library to show up on the Apple TV. It just seems to stop working occasionally.Apple, get your act together. Put in some way to stream movies from either a NAS device or a home server to the Apple TV!
Love how easy it is to set up use. Great content, and you can use the Apple rote on your phone or iPad. Delivered fast!
Love it all the way!  This is great for those of us that have large digital collections of movies, music and tv programs!  Works fantastic.
LOVE IT.  Can use it for anything in your Itunes library and many more features!!!  Lots of possibilities for your big screen tv!
Love it! Fast shipping, we use it all the time to watch Netflix. I would order again for another room. You should get this product.
Love it for watching Netflix and for movies and music from my iMac or iPad. AirPlay is its best feature. Wish it supported Amazon Instant Video and MLS Live.
Love it. Giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because it is NOT compatible with Amazon Prime. Other than that I am enjoying the heck out of the viewing freedom it provides.
love it.  good product, works well.  would buy another.  would recommend to friends.  product delivers what was advetized.  that it.
Love it, great product. I can sync it with my iphone, iMac and iPad for games, tv, movies, music and so much more. Nuff said!
Love it!!  Great product I would suggest this to anyone interested especially in mirroring their ipad to your tv .........great idea!!!

Love it great purchase have recommended to friends really great if you have other apple products in ones home compatible remote . I can even use the remote for my laptop.  who would have guessed!! cool!!
summary: my hubby loves it. Press a button on the laptop/other apple devices and it will project on the big screen tv that i have. cool!

reviewText: Love it!  Now have 2 in the house and will soon add a 3rd.  If you have other apple devices then you need an apple tv

Love it so fat.  I only wish the movies were cheaper and there was an easier way to search YouTube videos.  AirPlay is a great addition.

reviewText: Love love love the Apple TV it does so much more then I even thought, worth the money, very happy with my purchase

Love my apple tv and use it quite a bit.  I love that I can play my music and have a slide show of my favorite photos from my Imac when I am in the mood for music.  It gives me access to my itunes movies etc.

Love my apple tv. If you want to show your friends or family pictures from your latest vacation, do it. If you want to have a bigger screen than your phone when playing a game from the app store, or you want to see what your edited video project will look like on a tv, just airplay. AIRPLAY AIRPLAY AIRPLAY.Only thing I really dislike is that the remote from the apple tv will also work with your mac computers. There is a way to turn it off though.
Love my Apple TV! I am a Mac user so its awesome that I can use Airplay with my iPad and tv to watch whatever I want. Is a little pricey but well made and hopefully will last a long time, its Apple!

Love my apple tv its a good product to watch movies or if your an apple lover like me makes watching or listening to your itunes media very easy i use it when the family wants to watch movies but the my laptop or ipad is just to small also love the speed on my xbox its always buffering but since i started using my apple tv for netflix and hulu etc i no longer deal with the buffering

reviewText: Love the Apple TV.  We use it daily as we don't really watch much traditional TV.  Super easy to install and get started.
Love the apple tv. Works great with my iphone! I am a huge apple lover and love how simple it is.

Love the device-This is far better than other competing devices, I think. reviewText: Love this Apple TV. I can Watch movies on Netflix and on my computer. Love this product better than I had expected. Now I am thinking about getting rid of my cable.
Love this device. Works especially great with other Apple devices. All the apps apple has been adding have been great and streaming media from my computer to the Apple TV is fantastic.
Love this. I stream hulu and most of the main channels from Apple TV.  The the fact I can stream music, videos, etc from iCloud/iTunes.
Love this little gadget. Let's us watch netflix or stream sports events from our iPads. Everyone in the house uses it with their iPads and iPhones.
Love this product EXCEPT I do not love that Amazon cannot be received through it!  The best feature is the cloud feature from the home computer, and also the You Tube feature is fun.  Great value!

Love this product. Got it mainly for Hulu Plus, Netflix and MLB. Have MLB and Netflix already on my LG blu-ray but the picture can't compare to this. Setup was simple and haven't really tried too much of the Air Play but it is quite easy too.
Love this product. Much better than blu ray. Easy to use. I love it for netflix and renting movies:) great product overall

Love this product.  You can get Netflix and many more online (paid) services.  The main reason I bought this was to be able to watch sporting events on my iPad that are not available anywhere else and project the image from my iPad wirelessly to my TV via the Apple TV connection.  It works much better than viewing things via the laptop and connecting the laptop via HDMI to your TV.

love this so much! so easy to use, and makes watching TV fun again! we loved it so much we bought a 2nd for the bed room, so we can start a movie or show in the living room and finish it in the bed room, this is great!  just wish i could watch Prime on it, but i know that'll never happen, so that why i have a Roku too. But i think this is a far better product than the Roku, as far as ease of use, setup, and quality of picture. Its sleek, small, and SO easy to use! I did buy a Logistic multi-remote because i got tired of losing the tiny apple remote and having to use 3 remotes (TV, Sounds, Apple) to do things, so i'd suggest investing in a multi remote to make life easier.
summary: why dont you already own at least one!

reviewText: Love this thing and it just keeps getting better. Great picture quality, very easy to use, and they keep adding apps. I can't wait to see what Apple adds next!
Love this thing. Was pretty hesitant when I bought it but I'm so glad I did. Now I can watch netflix is something bigger than my iPad.

Love this!  Use it every day!  We watch a lot of movies and older British TV series on Netflix, and the girls absolutely adore the videos on YouTube that are for children!  This device allows us to watch anything we can see on our iPhones or iPads right on our TV screen, including our photos and videos as screen savers!  If you have an iPhone or an IPad, you should have Apple TV!
Love to watch movies and listen to music on my tv with Apple TV. So easy to setup and use.

Love watching netflix when nothing good is on tv and my husband watches baseball through MLB.  We also can watch videos from the tv on it too...but I don't know how to do that yet, my sons and husband do though!
Made a perfect Christmas gift for my son.  He and his wife really like it -- fits with their Apple universe.
Made by Apple.  Need I say more?But seriously.  Super simple to use.  Reliable.  Excellent content.  Seems to provide a better quality image for Netflix than my Xbox does.
Makes all my apple products sync up to my tv flawlessly. No more running vga cables from your laptop to share your screen

Makes it nice to watch movies and videos from the ipad. A little quirky though and sometimes videos don't work depending on the app. Other than that it works well. I believe it is overpriced for what yo get though. I don't use all the crap that came loaded on it either. It seems to me that all that crap is just another way they try to make money off of you.
Makes me wonder why I wasted so much money on satellite TV!  I highly recommend this as either a replacement or a supplement!

Makes your TV a smart TV with all the bells and whistles you would expect from Apple. Interfaces with other Apple devices so you can do things like play your itunes library through your AV system wirelessly. Already set up for other providers like Netflix, Hulu, etc.

Many of the reviews did not mention many of the things that I was concerned about.  I was interested in a faster method of viewing Netflix.  I did my research and decided on the Apple tv.  The setup was very easy, even for someone like me with only a limited technical background.  I used a hard wire connection with cat 6 cables and a HDMI auto switch so I could hook up both the ATV and a blu ray to one one HDMI port on my TV  The increase in speed from turning on the equipment to watching a movie on Netflix was simply unbelievable.  No waiting for 20-30 seconds or more for the blu ray to load.  It was almost instantaneous and the improved navigation was wonderful.  Coupled with the simple design and Apples reputation for quality make me very glad that I chose the Apple tv.  I wanted a system that would last and not give out in a year or two.  The final reason I chose ATV was for its ability to view my pictures off of my other apple products.
Meets all expectations , easy to set up and easy to use. The price was right and was delivered quickly. Couldn't be happier with this purchase.
Meets all my expectations! I could not believe that I was able to purchase the new Apple TV for cheaper price than what many are selling the old one!
Menu button no longer works...makes the whole thing useless.I think I would try another product next time. Not recommended.
summary: Box is great, remote is not

reviewText: Mirror and have fun! Haven't tried it enough but having fun so far! I think what stands out for me is convenience and quality of the product.
Mirroring is so easy with Apple tv.  One touch of a button and I am sharing my photos/videos/presentations.  The only downside is that the audio does not transfer as well, just the video.
More polished interface than the roku.  The integrated power supply makes it heavy enough to keep it in place.  The roku is so light that the cables move the whole unit.
Mostly Iise it for Netflix and playing music. It is much nicer than the experience I have with doing this with our Blu Ray player.
Most often I use my Apple TV to AirPlay and mirror stuff from my iPhone and iPad. I wish there were more choices to load apps onto the Apple TV. No Amazon Prime streaming yet.

Much better than viewing from a PC screen.  Works great with and all my TVs (60", 48", 32", etc)  Only downer is it control, especially initial set ups and initial logins to services, is best completed using a PC/Mac/iPad device.  The remote control works but keying in characters is difficult.  I liken it to texting using Morris code.
summary: Good device.  We play music, movies from Netflix and other, MLB network, surf the net and a number of other things

reviewText: Much smaller than the 1st Generation, and the OS interface is totally different.  Easy to install/hook up - just two cables.  And the new AppleTV gets my iTunes library content from my Home Sharing rather than downloading it my library.  Much faster.  Still getting used to the new interface though - MUCH different than the 1st Generation AppleTV.

My biggest gripes with the AppleTV is the lack of video apps and its inability to autoplay.  If you buy a series on iTunes, you need to click to start each episode.  If you are watching Hulu Plus, same thing.  The Roku will at least offer Autoplay in many apps, including Hulu Plus, where you can marathon a series without being interrupted to needing to find the remote after each episode and then click around to get to the next episode.My other gripe is Airplay with a mid-2012 Macbook Pro (upgraded with 16B ram and 512GB SSD) along with 80 MBps (yes, eighty MBps) wired internet.  There is a lag of about 1-2 seconds when you use the Airplay feature to play what you have on the laptop on the TV.  Voices do not line up with the audio, which is very annoying.I just find the AppleTV very limited at best.  Yes, I can watch video from my iPhone 4S, iPad 3, or 2012 MBP on my TV, but that's really about the extent of this device.I own a Roku 2 HD, PS3, Wii and Wii U, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, mid-2012 MBP.  I use the PS3 the most for streaming, followed by the Roku 2 HD.  I lent my AppleTV to a family member, who I think after one or two days gave up on it, and it is siting in their drawer.If Apple opened the AppleTV up to app makers for more streaming video choices, as well as the ability to Autoplay, then I would highly recommend it.  Problem is the are far too few choices for streaming, and there is no autoplay feature.  It's just too limited when you compare this device to competitors.
summary: Not as good as a Roku or PS3 for streaming... too limited and no autoplay

reviewText: My boyfriend and I recently decided to get rid of Cable and I bought this for him as a birthday gift.  He LOVED it and has repeatedly said that this is the best gift I have ever gotten him.PROS: Netflix and Hulu Plus can both be streamed from the device (the Hulu still has items that can only be streamed from your actual computer/laptop if you have a Mac, you can do some mirror imaging and get away with watching on the tv after all).  Streaming photos and access to your music playlists is great.CONS: The only con so far is the "random" photo streaming... the random setting doesn't seem to cycle through the pictures very well.. I will see the same pic out of 300 a couple times just in the first 15 minutes the photo's are streaming.  that being said, not a real good reason to take any marks off the review.With the Apple TV and subscriptions to Netflix and Hulu, We aren't missing cable at all!!
My boyfriend is able to watch his shows on Netflix in the loving room, and I can watch my netflix shows in the bedroom with Apple TV!

My Brother compared system to system and said this is it after days of intense research.  I am great full to him and to this Apple tvsystem.Amazon was right on in sending it to me, a snow storm made it one day late and the shipping dept. research that for me and called me back as to exactly where the package was and the hold up.  I AM HOOKED AND WILL CONTINUE TO SHOP AT AMAZON.THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR KINDNESS IN EVERY DEPT. I DEALT WITH.
summary: So glad my Brother did the research!!

reviewText: My brother insisted that I purchase Apple TV and I'm so glad that I did. It's beautiful!! I also have a Netflix account that can be watched through Apple TV it's awesome and Perfection will be attained when AMAZON adds there movies. ( Hint-Hint)
summary: It Truly is as Easy as 123 to Connect!!

reviewText: My Chromecast is officially junk; Apple TV is spectacular! There are a lot of app options that I am unable to use due to a lack of owning cable with the corresponding channels (so stupid, this is totally the networks' fault), but my Hulu account is wonderful on this interface. Plus all of my iPad and iPhone apps magically have an AppleTV icon now, as it recognizes the device on the network. Meaning I can play anything I watch on my devices immediately on TV. If I can find a way to work around the cable subscription conundrum, I will never buy cable/satellite again with this. Just my Hulu and Amazon Prime subscription and I'm set. Amazon has so many movies I can stream for free, and so many shows, that between that and Hulu, I think I get everything I could want except for some of the TLC and Bravo shows I like. Pretty great for the price. I wish I'd bought it sooner...
summary: Should have bought this before my Chromecast...amazing and works with Prime videos

reviewText: My Daughter loved it she now is able to watch TV shows in her room she could not watch before!
My entertainment organization has jumped light years thanks to purchasing the Apple TV. My kids love it too since it has so many options for videos, movies, music.
My family and I have given up TV and this Apple TV gives us a way to watch some shows and movies without having cable service we love it!

My family and I use it everyday. Easy Netflix streaming, and Hulu plus for TV..therefore you will strongly consider cutting ties with your cable company. Should you have an iphone, the integration is seamless, and we often watch videos off YouTube,/internetMy 4 year old can pick up my phone, go the downloaded (remote) app, select Netflix, and watch her favorite shows. Very easy to use. And did I mention I dropped my cable company??  savings over well over $100 a month (kept the high-speed internet though.)

My family loves Apple TV. It gives us everything we already had on the phone and ipad right on the tv. This includes all of the movies and shows my kids watch and it's easy enough for them to function it on their own

My favorite aspect of this apple TV is the ability to watch youTube videos on my 42" plasma.  While I could have accomplished this in other ways, the streamlined operation of the Apple TV makes it seamless.  Additionally, I appreciate my ability to link my iPad to my apple TV and listen to Pandora (through the backwards way of using TuneIn radio to connect the iPad to the apple TV, then going to the Pandora app and that overriding the TuneIn Radio music) during parties and social gatherings.Another great apple product.
My household has two iPads and two iPhones and I was more than happy with my order. I have dropped the cable company and run everything through my Apple TV.

My husband bought Chromecast after seeing a commercial for it, but we already have access to Netflix through the Wii U, and Amazon instant video since we have Prime.  Chromecast didn't do anything new that we didn't already gave.  We got Apple TV and LOVE IT!!! We can play Netflix, and ABC, HBO, Disney, PBS (for Downton Abbey) plus all of our other iTunes movies!!! So pleased with our purchase!!!
My husband got an Apple laptop and with this device, we can connect his computer to our regular TV. This allows us to watch a movie on the TV, view photos, etc.
My husband had bought one of these units at the local Apple store.  He like it so much, he wanted another.  This was about $10 less expensive for the same product
My husband just loves his Apple TV, however that means that I won't be able to watch TV anymore.  But I knew that would happen when i got it for him.  LOL
My internet service didn't like it, my DSL speed is too slow.  So I gave it to my son in Philadelphia, and he loves it.
My kids loved this product!  Said it was the best gift they received.  They were able to plug it in and use it immediately.Of course, it helped that they had a hdmi cord available for immediate use.
My kids use this more than I do...... It is fun impressing them by using my iPad to throw pics and videos up on the big tv. My netflix and Hulu accounts interfaced seamlessly as well.

My main purpose for buying this was so I could stream video from my iPad to our TV.  This has given us that and much more!!!  My husband and son immediately were hooked on Netflix.  For us, this is so worth the price!!!

My main reason for purchasing the Apple TV over ROKU, was so I could access my very large iTunes library in the living room. It does this beautifully, but what I didn't expect was superior performance when streaming from Hulu Plus, Netflix and YouTube. There are a lot of the apps that are also resident on my Vizio TV set, but many that are not, and vice versa, so this also added an expansion of my streaming ability. Set up in a few minutes without a hiccup! Note too, that i am using a PC, not a Mac, and I am not particularly Apple-centric, but I find iTunes to be the best app for compiling and centralizing a music and video library. I can also access my library via my Samsung tablet using Samsung Link and have iTunes open for the Apple TV and other Apple devices without any conflict.Now for those considering getting one of these in order to stream from your personal iTunes library, you can do so without any concern.There are some limitations on video format, but if your primary player is iTunes, and the video plays there, it will play via Apple TV.My audio files in iTunes are loaded as uncompressed .wav files as opposed to using one of Apple's codices. I am an audiophile and many of my files, particularly home recordings from LP, are high resolution at 96kHz 24 bit, as well as the typical 44.1kHz 16 bit CD files. Absolutely no lag or bottleneck to the flow. I am currently piping the audio into a stereo system from the TV set's line out jacks, and the quality is nearly as good as playing the files directly from the computer into the main system it is hardwired into.At first I couldn't locate the proper playlist option, and assumed that the playlists weren't working. Turns out it was a simple matter of selecting the sort option to sort by name and then scroll up and BAM!, there it was.
