Almost all Zone 2 outputs on home theater receivers require analog instead of digital, so I find myself unable to play iTunes or Pandora through the AppleTV to my outdoor speakers. Other than that, I love this device. It sets up quickly and just plain works great.
summary: Still one of the coolest devices ever

reviewText: This was purchased as a Christmas gift for my geeky dad - the type who knows the specs of what he wants, so it's hard to get him anything tech related. He's loving it! He has it synced up with his iPad and iPhone, and loves that he can change the music we're listening to during dinner from the table. It's not a must have device, but if you know a gadget person who is already into the Apple tech, it's a great gift.

This was so easy to set up and use. Now we can watch a lot via the Apple TV from our computer. Considering getting rid of cable due to excessive fees that include many things we are not interested in. We recently lost TV service for 2 days and hardly noticed ti.
This was so easy to set up, instructions were clear and easy enough a child could have done it.  Very happy with Apple TVJeanne Diehl Stiffler

This was super easy to install and use. The HDMI connection to my TV processes the audio signal through to my Receiver. I wanted to be able to listen to music without my TV being on. The Digital Optical output on this unit was available, but the input on my Receiver had already been used. I bought a C2G / Cables to Go 40019 Optical to Coaxial Digital Audio Converter that allows me to use the Apple TV for music without my TV being on. I also love the ability to use Airplay from my iPhone or iPad to view photos, videos or even Network TV programs on my TV.
summary: Easy to use, lots of options for fun viewing

reviewText: This was the easiest piece of equipment to set up... I plugged it in.. made a couple of adjustments, loaded my account info and I was on my way... There are a ton of channels, great streaming of Netflix and others.  Whats not to like?  Beats Cable!

This was the perfect gift for the gadget guy who has it all ( my Husband).Great gift!The only down side I see is that if you have multiply televisions in the house you'll have to purchase one for each television. We have ours in the family room, perfect central place in the house.

This works great.  I found the setup a bit confusing, mostly in regards to iTunes passwords and such.  With only two buttons on the remote, text entry (i.e., the pasword) is a major challenge to "type" in.
This works great - the picture quality is amazing and it is very easy to set up - love it.

This works great.  We have an older 720p flatscreen, and we set the Apple TV to 720p and it works great.  We use it for videos from our iMac, rentals, and YouTube.  I would say it has a slightly better-than-average interface to YouTube.  It could take some pointers from the Wii YouTube interface, though.
This works quite well and I now have the original (760p) Apple TV and the new one (1080p).I am very pleased with this instrument.William Linder

This would be a great product.  If it worked consistently. and better. I have been using this product since February of this year when i decided to get rid of cable. I had high hope for it but I'm really disappointed. I love how you can use your iPad or your mac to control the device. But a lot of the time, the sound and the movement of the picture are out of sync. It does what I call "kick back" which means it kicks the picture off of the TV and back to the PC or iPad MANY times throughout watching a program. So that I have to "send" the picture or program back to the Apple TV. Sometimes, the sound does not come through at all, at which point I have to either unplug the device or reboot my computer. I had really hoped this was going to perform much better. At time I just hate it. I do also have a Google Chromecast in another room. I notice that the Chromecast works PERFECTLY with my iPad, but not so much with my Mac PC, however, at 1/3 of the price of the Apple TV, at this point, I will be using Chrome to expand to other TVs in my home. No way will I purchase another Apple TV until/unless these issues are resolved.

To be honest, this is being written on a year-old Macbook Pro. I also own an iPhone, a Time Capsule, an OG Apple TV... and between myself, significant other, and the friend crashing on my couch, the number of fruit-based electronic devices in my household currently numbers at... ten? Eleven? Fact is, I might be slightly biased.But! Another fact is this gadget may finally be the thing that convinces me that we're living in The Future. And why is that, you ask?AirPlay.See, the thing is that Apple has pretty much nailed the concept of dead-easy streaming to the big screen mounted on the wall (just like yuppies!). This has kind of changed my life. I consider myself, if not an audiophile, then at least an audio appreciator, and love and cherish my vintage, freshly re-foamed JBL loudspeakers. I have managed to basically make my entire A/V setup disappear from my living room as a result of this little box. I plugged a chip-amp in behind those speakers, and then just started using AirPlay. For everything. Soon, I'll have the ATV mounted behind the TV and poof! That's it! If I want to listen to a CD (yeah, I have a CD collection) then I'll pop it in the laptop and beam it over. Same with a DVD. Or radio from my phone. I select the ATV and those JBLs start pumping.And it gets even more exciting when someone has photos to show us or a spontaneous YouTube-off. All of it just goes straight to the TV, reliably, no fuss - just the occasional compression artifacts faintly audible.And that's the thing. It's not perfect. It's wireless, so I'm not wringing the ultimate in audio quality out of my ones and zeros. It's mostly a dumb box, requiring I have my laptop open if I want to listen off of my iTunes library, or buy things ala carte off the iTunes store more often than I intended to. I also really really wish I could add services to it. And honestly, if you're not as brand-centric as I somehow became, it's probably won't be so magical (what with AirPlay being proprietary and all). But it does 1080p, and has been the the trigger to completely upend my attitudes and behaviors surrounding media consumption and my home. I watch more videos. I listen to more music. I present things to my friends and learn more as a result. And that's not bad for the little black hockey puck once known as Apple's forgotten side project.TL;DR - I own a lot of Apple product, so this fits perfectly with my life in The Future, full of streaming and robots that fold my laundry. Might make less sense if you own disparate electronics. I'd say to throw one in the cart next time you buy a Mac.
summary: The best techno gadget for my future lifestyle!

reviewText: To be honest we just hooked this up a couple of hours ago but we love it already. We were able to mirror our Macbook Pro screen onto our flatscreen with no problem. Now we don't have to look over each other's shoulder when perusing the net. The one downside that I see is that it looks like in order to play iTunes music we will have to pay about $25 a year for iTunes Match.Have not figured out how to do it otherwise. Also have not figured out if I can play my Amazon Cloud music either, probably not.All in all, we will probably not use the ROKU anymore, at least with this tv.
Too bad you cannot get Amazon films on it.

Took a little while to get it to stream from my iPad, but now it works all the time and the picture is fantastic. HBOgo and watchespn are the main apps I use as some are still blocked like the xfinity player, but hopefully that will change soon. I don't have cable tv so $100 to watch ESPN and HBO is definitely worth it.

To start with, let me note that I am primarily a Netflix and iTunes user. I started out with a very nice Roku 2XS which worked just fine out of the box, detected and connected to my network, and functioned exactly as it was supposed to. Then... I realized my iTunes library was completely inaccessible and realized I'd made a mistake. So I ordered the Apple TV from Amazon. Here are my observations:1) The fit, finish and packaging for this most inexpensive of Apple's products is as good as anything else Apple makes. It does not appear like a stepchild in Apple's product line. It is an extremely tactile, compact, weighty little device with clean lines and is a perfect physical match for my new flat screen.2) The user interface is far and away superior to that for the Roku or any other similar device I've tried. Some thought has gone into their software for this device and it's the most usable in its class.3) The "channel" selection through AppleTV continues to grow, and so far as I can tell, this item offers more options that the Roku.4) The Airplay connectivity with my wireless PC works as expected. It's a very pleasant experience to find your complete iTunes media library accessible directly on your set without being forced to connect yet more cabling. I have a 2Wire router from AT&T; and the performance is easily good enough for high-def movies and TV shows. This is the main reason I went with this device. I am quite satisfied. I can now see new episodes of "Justified" and "Mad Men" when they come out on iTunes the day after the episodes air. You can't get everything in the most timely manner through iTunes (Game of Thrones? Hello? HBO?) but this is a large chunk of a good solution for people like me who refuse to subscribe to cable.I would eventually like to see Apple manufacture another version of this product with a 2-3 TB hard disk. I would absolutely consider buying such a device given that they can be trusted to put thought and design into the software to really make it work.
summary: Extremely solid, reasonably priced home theater tool

reviewText: Tried a Google Chromecast before this. It was very limited. Moved to the Apple TV because I could use AirParrot to share my screen to the Apple TV...what a difference. I could put anything I wanted on the TV then, and use it as a second big monitor while I worked. Even better, it looks like the features I used Air Parrot for are build into Maverick.
tried other streaming devices, they were complicated to set up and didn't work all the time.As with all Apple devices this is simple to set up and operate

Typical Apple product - it just works.  I have an Apple network and all Apple devices (iPads, iPhones, Airport Express, Time Capsule, iMac, Mac Mini, etc.).  Plugged it in, turned it on and in a few minutes I was on my secured network.I am thinking of hooking up a Bluetooth keyboard, because with the slowness of the hunt/peck alphabet input built into the Apple TV, it's a pain typing more than a few letters.I also set this up to control with Remote on several iOS devices.  That feature works nicely.This is hooked into a Samsung 46" LED TV via HDMI (had to but that cable separately, which seems odd).  In the future I'll hook up a sound bar to beef up the sound and drive the sound from the optical out.

Typical Apple product, works with an all things apple to mirror media to your tv. Can see why you'd buy a roku or another media player since it has more applications available to it (Amazon Prime for example), but for people that have an iPad and/or am iPhone this just seems like the right choice.
summary: I love this thing. Instantly syncs with iTunes media puchases on same wifi

reviewText: Typical of an Apple product, beautiful, yet functional design.  I just wish my TV provider would allow you to stream their channels over Apple TV.  It would make it that much more functional.  We have 2 and use them every day.If you have a Mac, you can easily do screen mirroring and watch streaming videos from your laptop to Apple TV in just one click.

Unit was super easy to set up and provides great video & sound.  Its important to know Airplay will only work if both the Apple TV and portable device (iPhone,etc.) are connected to the same local network.

UPDATED 6.3.13 after having this for about a month I realize that this requires alot of bandwith which with my limited internet access due to being in a rural part of my state and county I am finding that streaming movies from Itunes is buffering alot and I have other devices such as blu-ray player, Roku 3 and such that I have had no problem with before. I'm returning and going back to my other devices.I love this APPLE TV due to the fact that I have nothing but trouble with my ROKU players over the years...I'll try to explain...I'm a subscriber of HULU PLUS I watch probaly 75-80% of my TV programs on here than watch LIVE or on my DVR since I hate my cable company so much but my wife doesn't want to do without it and we live so far out in country and local TV stations that we can not pick up with Antenna without getting expensive equipment or other means... I don't watch alot of TV like I use to but I like the HD for sports programming due to the fact that not ALL major sports are on TV due to blackout and other regulations..but enough of that HULU has worked flawlessly on this device (unlike it on ROKU) the APPLE TV does not have all the channels on ROKU but to be honest there are too many channels on ROKU that I didn't watch anyways...the main ones for me is HULU, NETFLIX and an outlet to watch movies (ITUNES STORE have Apple ID with my Iphone).Hopefully one day soon they will add Amazon Video on Demand.(an email to customer service informed me that they have no timeline in place but they do have Apps on Iphones , Ipod Touch, and Ipads.
summary: LOVE IT!!! better than ROKU in my opinion

reviewText: Use it but it is not as user friendly as my d-link media server. Like most Apple products totally focussed on the Apple platform. Great to mirror the computer but if used for downloaded movies those have to be actually started on the computer ( unless they are in the i tunes library of course ).
Use it mainly to mirror my macbook or iPhone to my HD TV. The movie store and music streaming are also great features.
user friendly and fun! I canceled my regular cable tv because of this. Works good with Apple phone app. Thanks
Use this thing daily! I deleted my cable after getting this. I use HBO Go and Netflix along with streaming from my home computer's iTunes library!
summary: Best Addition to My Home Entertainment System!

reviewText: Using it at our office to display presentations from our computers directly onto large screen TV.  Also use it for access to Netflix, etc.
Using this all the time now.  Getting rid of our cable DVRs and just using this.  Both kids took to college for easy access to Hulu etc.  Doesn't have Pandora naturally but everything else we use.

Using this device with an iPod/iPhone/iPad makes it better. I love Apple products in general it's good if you have a net flicks account or Hulu plus.  Mirroring is another feature that I use very often.
summary: Amazing I would defiantly recommend buying this Apple product.

reviewText: Usual Apple - everything just works well !!! Easy set up and and easy to use. No problems at all.

Verdict: MUST buy if you own Apple devices!Apple TV is awesome! If you have Apple devices (iPhone/iPad/iPod), this is perfect because it lets you watch videos that you normally would watch on your small mobile device screen, and puts it on your TV via AirPlay. Think of it as hooking up your computer to your TV via a HDMI cord but only it's wireless!I use it all the time because I like controlling my Netflix, Hulu Plus, etc on my iPad because it is so much easier to search and select on your iPad (compared to TV or gaming console apps), but it's much nicer to watch on a big screen TV. That alone is worth the price of the device.On top of AirPlay, it allows you to sync and get content from your iTunes library. Not to mention the every growing apps that come standard on Apple TV (although keep in mind most apps require you to pay for the service). My favorite free app is VEVO. When you have guests over, I generally just pick a genre and it's nice to have background music playing with the music video to match. Let's be real - we all miss watching music videos! Much better than playing music and have a muted TV show on in the background.
Version three works for me.  The installation is Straight-forward; just power and HDMI is all we need.  The remote is not sophisticated, but works well enough.
Very awesome i absoulty love it it is the best thing i ever bought i use it every day love it
Very compact and easy to install. As an Apple product, completely integrated with the others Apple products. The function mirroring for pictures and videos is fantastic.
Very cool product and works seemless with all my other Apple products. Very easy to use and I highly recommend.
Very Easy set up and learning curve.  Really cool playing video from Iphone and IPad by Bluetooth on big screen.

Very easy to hookup and setup.  Can play movies from my iTunes on my macs, iPads and phone.  very easy to share (mirror) my iPad screen - we were looking for something on-line and a bunch of people needed to see the screen very easy to do.  Streams Netflix very well.  Purchasing movies from iTunes is painful, I entered my iTunes id and password which is not a quick thing to do without a keyboard, I kept getting messages to verify this device by connecting to a computer and reentering the password.  I did this 4 times and it still didn't like it.  I ended up just purchasing the movie on iTunes and then this let it stream it.  So far I have not been able to purchasing any content on iTunes from this device.The firmware/software updates for the device seem to come every few weeks and take about 30-45 minutes to get loaded and I have pretty fast internet connection.Overall a good device that has some very user-friendly features and some very unfriendly features.
Very easy to install and use. Amazing speed in accessing my Apple account on my computer. I recommend this product emensly.
Very easy to install, but I have the apple I-pad mini Wi-Fi and had no problems.Apple is a great tech advancement over Google.

+ Very easy to setup+ AirPlay feature is super easy to figure out.  As long as your iOS device is on the same network as your AppleTV, it automatically appears as an option when playing videos, pictures or audio from your iOS device.+ Beautiful interface- I wish there were more "apps" available for this device because there aren't anywhere near as many apps here than for iOS devices.  I wish they had Amazon Prime video app.
Very Easy to set up and connected to wireless effortlessly.Graphics are impressive and the Airplay feature through other apple devices works very well.
summary: Easy to set up amazing graphics

reviewText: Very easy to set-up.  Small and simple to use.  Movies stream smoothly and without breaks.  Much less expensive than a smart TV.
Very easy to useExcellent pictureItune and iclouds work greatScreen resolution excellentMirroring from computerLap iPhone iPad iPodLooks great from any tv
Very few apps. I wish apple allow to install apps from app store. The quality is great for sound and streaming.
Very good content. Easy to operate (apple). Running a video in the ipad or iphone wireless using the mirror function and see it in the TV without delay is simply priceless.
very good has super HD feature i like,plus it was on sale great, thank you, very prompt service,will suggest to others, P>kumar
Very good.
Very good performance. However, I hate the remote. Takes so long to  call up what I'm looking for.A small keyboard like my Visio tv has is much easier to use..
summary: Review of Apple TV MD199LLA (NEWEST VERSION)

reviewText: Very neat, can play music, watch movies, sound and picture quality is amazing.  I have seen Roku and playstations interface, and for the price I think Apple TV is the way to go, especially if you have other Apple products.
very nice and good price love the airplay mode, i connect my ipad 2 via wifi and i can see my videos directly on my tv without using cables thats amazing
Very nice and user friendly, but I also have Roku and it has way more channels than Apple TV and it's cheaper.
very nice
Very pleased minus the remote control and its lack of functionality. Also, Netflix often will not load and you then need to unplug AppleTV, plug it back in and it works fine.
Very pleased with the Apple TV & the quality. No issues, just need higher bandwidth internet to download movies faster. Fast shipping.

Very simple device with a great user interface.  I use the mirror function with my MBP all the time to show friends and family home videos and photo's.  There is some latency with video, but I expected that.  Awesome for YouTube and Netflix streaming.  No complaints as of yet.
Very simple to set up and use. Plug this in to your tv, tell it where the wireless network is, and all your MacBooks, iPads, and iPhones start offering it p to play music and video. It's that simple.
Visually impaired and the Apple TV is essential in viewing and using my Apple iPad.  User-friendly.  Wish instructions were easier to understand.

Vudu, Amazon Instant Video and other services are not yet available in my country, and even when I do access them via Unblock-Us, movies don't have subtitles in Spanish... Or even worse, no subtitles at all. So iTunes is, so far, the best option for digitally renting movies down here in Ecuador, since they started offering us this service about a year ago.My only gripe is that, despite having a 11Mbps Internet connection, iTunes movies load slowly, so when I rent a movie I have to do it from my PC, wait around 5 hours for it to download, and then watch it from the Apple TV. By comparison, I can watch 720p Netflix with no delays at all.Another plus of the Apple TV is that the UI and remote are so easy to use, this is the first time my 76-year-old dad is using Netflix all by himself. I also have a PS3, but he always asked me to turn it on and play the TV show he wanted. He would not dare use Netflix on the PS3 by himself. I once also caught my mother watching a video from her iPad on the TV via Aiplay... I have only needed to teach them a few times, and they already feel confident with their Apple toys.
summary: Best choice for Latin America -But you also need a PC

reviewText: Wanted to be able to stream movies and I'm an Apple product person so the choice was easy for me. It easy to use and makes a great addition to my home theater. Apple you have done it again!!
summary: What can I say - It's an Apple!

reviewText: Wanted to dump cable tv but still have viewing options. Apple TV is great!  So much to pick from and compatible with our iPads.  Using antenna free TV and Apple TV has saved us $100/month.
Was able to get a great price on amazon for the apple Tv.  I have a few units all work great.  Excellent product.

was working great until now when it doesn't detect my wireless signal (and that too from an apple router!). which means i can't do airplay from my ipad. otherwise it works great on the wired connection. let me try taking it to the apple store...
Watch Netflix and videos from our Ipads regularly.  Kids love it.  Easy to set up and to use.  Highly recommended

Watch TV from iPhone, iPad or MacBook if you get past the proprietary Monopoly apple has on all their products it helps to be able to watch on a bigger screen. It works for keynote presentations or web design, or just playing Angry Birds Star Wars
summary: Watch TV from iPhone, iPad or MacBook

reviewText: We absolutely love this Apple Computer for your TV .  We just enjoy it and  wish we had gotten it sooner.

We actually purchased the Apple TV after we had purchased the Google Chromecast before it. We absolutely hated the Chromecast and decided to spend the extra money on the Apple TV. Man do I wish we would've just purchased this the first time. It works perfect and it's very much seamless when it comes to connecting to our other devices. This is the best streaming device we've ever owned.

We added this to our growing Apple TV collection - a device for each of the family room, bedroom and basement. With our house dominated by Macs, iPads, iPods, i-anything, it's key to enjoying our media and Internet entertainment throughout the house. They've always been easy to use. Use the Remote app on your iOS device to control any of them.
summary: A must for your Apple ecosystem

reviewText: We all have Iphones in our home, so this was a must-have for us. We can all share photos, videos, etc instantly. The apps are also very easy to use an navigate which is all we need.
We all love it!  My husband and I and our 17-year-old son!  The selection of movies is a weekly event and we love the TV series available on Netflix! We gave up cable and THIS is our TV now!!!

We already had an account for MLB.COM and we added Netflix for unlimited streaming for $8 a month and the amount of movies and shows available are seemingly endless.  I doubt that one person can watch everything in one lifetime.  I'm catching up on a lot of shows that I've heard about but never really watched before.  You can watch the whole series in order without commercials.  We really like the standup comedy shows too!  We have cable internet service so our connection is very fast but the streaming still lags behind from time to time - granted it's a wireless connection so perhaps it's the microwave or garage door opener interfering with it, but other than that annoyance, we're completely happy with it and we'll likely buy a second unit for our bedroom TV.

We already have an Apple TV device and many others but too stubborn to my an additional device.  Frankly it makes no sense to have to purchase another separate box for all of the TV's in your home.  We found it frustrating to be in one room and not be able watch programs because the device wasn't in that room.  It also took
summary: Slow delivery but all forgotten once you get it!

reviewText: We already own one of these and are purchasing one for our son, it's so nice not dealing with cords when watching movies, or since we have a sound bar we even listen to music simply and easy to do.  Love it!

We also have a samsung blue ray that we use to view Netflix. That thing is so slow. The apple tv is farther from the router but it works flawlessly. I haven't tried to download pandora on it. I'm nit sure that's available. That may be the only drawback for me.
We are an Apple family and this is just icing on the cake.  Apple TV is easy to install, set=up and navigate.Highly recommended.

We are an Apple family:  two iPads, four iPhones, three Mac book pros, one Mac book Air & one time machine. It all works together seamlessly.  We are going to buy one for the Google TV that is great in its on right, but lacks 'AirPlay' which we love.
summary: Great addition to our Apple home

reviewText: We are having so much fun playing with this Apple TV. It has so many cool features, and it was a breeze to set up. I would recommend this product to anyone.
We are huge fans of this devise, especially with the upgraded software which now puts iTunes Radio on your Tv and home theater.  We have bought 4 of these so far and giving them as gifts.

We are in love with our Apple TV.  We have netflix and ESPN, ESPN Sports Etc......Those extra channels are provided inHD through our cable company. We are looking into buying another apple TV soon!!! :) LOVE

We are living overseas and did not have access to American TV and there are very few radio stations. The Apple TV has changed our music and TV/movie viewing life. Very easy to set up, although there are occassional glitches and the device has to be set up. The optical connect to the stereo system is easy, and sound guality is great. We were amazed at the number of internet radio stations, and the ease of streaming directly off our ipad, mac or iphone --- just use airplay. Makes it easy to download a video from itunes and then play it through our home stereo system. One of our most recent surprises with music is we are enjoying the Rhapsody music service, $10 a month, and with airplay we can stream directly to out stereo system. Little quirks are the remote -- make sure you follow the steps to ensure your laptop isn't picking up the apple tv. Also we have slow internet, so downloading movies via apple tv is too slow to stream -- instead we download to the laptop and use airplay to watch on the TV. Just a great device for a great price.
We are now able to watch the games on MLB, movies, TV shows we've missed, and with the update, iTunes Radio and Disney are now available.  Love this!!

We are officially cord cutters, and now watch everything on the Apple TV. Netflix, Hulu, iTunes, etc. over the past year or so the content channels have multiplied like rabbits. The connection with iCloud for all of our music, purchased movies and photos is liberating, and AirPlay works like some vision of the future out of a science fiction movie.

We are super happy with our Apple TV. We use it in the bedroom to watch the occasional Netflix, etc. We were plugging iPad into TV with a 10 ft HDMI cord before and that was a pain in the butt!Apple TV is super easy to use and took less than 5 min to set up. Love that we can also access the iTunes content from my computer upstairs, including movies that I download as torrents and convert using Vuze. We've even used it to watch videos from YouTube or to listen to the iTunes radio stations.
summary: Why did we wait so long to buy this?

reviewText: We are very pleased with our new Apple TV and all of the alternatives it gives us. Can't  recommend it enough.

We bought an apple tv the last time we were in Florida.  We live in the Caribbean, so our cable is horrible, but we can now get Netflix here.  I used to watch movies from our Wii, but now with the apple tv, I can watch anything I can get on my laptop or iPad or phone including music and apps.  I don't know if Roku works here, as some of the options to watch movies and tv are not available here, so this is our best option.  The apple tv was so easy to set up and and it's so easy to use, one of the easiest things I have set up.  My husband and I aren't getting younger, so a lot of the new tech stuff seems so complicated, so this was really a great surprise to set up so easily.

We bought this Apple TV as a gift for my in-laws.  They wanted it to stream videos from Netflix and to stream their iPad.  It works perfect for that.  It was really easy to install with step by step directions.

We bought this so we could watch Netflix and HBOgo without using our Xbox. Does fine, easy install and set up. Only complaint is the Disney junior channel won't let me use it. It didn't list Time Warner for a provider. So even though I pay extra for the channel it isn't available and that was one of the reasons I wanted this.
We can browse tv shows and movies immediately through this Apple TV. Most especially I love watching movies in my Netflix account.

We cancelled Directv and use the Apple TV plus an antenna for our tv watching needs.  We have plenty to watch, especially since I can stream any app that plays video from my iPad.  If you are tired of spending ridiculous amounts of money for the 99% of cable channels you don't watch, consider an Apple TV.
summary: Love It for Cutting the Cord

reviewText: We can flip our tv shows, videos, games and everything else up on the tv! Plug in and start watching.  Easy easy.
We especially enjoy the TV shows minus the advertising and the podcasts and music stations on radio. Very pleased with our choice to purchase the Apple TV.

We got a box for streaming Netflix with our new flatscreen a few years ago, but it never worked properly. The cable guy told me I needed Apple TV. For the price, it is SO WORTH what this does for you. Never since hooking it up (relatively easy with my husband's help) have I had a problem streaming Netflix. It works great. The mirroring is nice too, when I want to send something from my MacBook Pro up to the big TV screen. Works like a charm.
We got Apple TV for Christmas and LOVE it! We cancelled our cable and now just watch shows from the iPad and stream them on the TV. It's saving us a ton of money!
We got this for our son-in-law for Christmas. He set it up at our house and was impressed with it instantly. Very cool product.

We got this one as a gift for my brother. They are enjoying there everyday with the kids being able to watch old shows and they love playing music from their iTunes. We have one as well that we use all the time. We have fun when friend are over and we airplay different video or clips that we have found on youtube. Every household should have one.

We had a MacMini hooked up to our tv to watch Netflix and movies.  I don't know why we waited 3 years to just buy the Apple TV.  I love it.  Watching Netflix or HuluPlus is so easy.  Access to your music & movies is simple and we love that you we can link to pictures on another computer to use in the screensaver.  For the price, it's well worth it.
summary: Why did I wait to buy this

reviewText: We had a WD box for watching Netflix but wre very disappointed in it. It was slow loading videos and froze often. We purchased the Apple TV unit because we have iPads, iPhones and Mac computers and were very happy with them. This device works so well and integrates with our other Apple products that we regretted not getting it first!! Amazon also saved us around $10 over purchasing it at an Apple store. We had it the next business day with free shipping too. We recommend the Apple TV.
we had one already and this was our second for our 2nd living room so We love it. Price was better then instore. I recommend to anyone who doesn't have cable and has netflix or Hulu.
We had one in the bedroom and use it so much that we got another one for the family room.

We had to return our first unit which was defective. Amazon promptly sent new unit. We haven't had any issues. We have this and a roku. The roku is better for the kids and apps. Apple TV is great for airplay.

we have a large and extensive library on iTunes.  Educational stuff as well as the entertainment.  a 2TB drive dedicated to storage off of one computer that shares the content.  We have two Apple RV boxes like this that wirelessly communicate to an Apple Time Capsule, which connects to the LAN by wire.  That Time Capsule is just a wireless station, and so the 2 TV's are connected in to it, which in turn connects via the Time Capsule to the Apple Mac Mini which runs iTunes all the time.  We have 24x7 access to the library of movies, music, tv, off of iTunes.  I don't connect these to the internet because that just brings up trash content.  We control it. The tools to control it are a combination of using OPENDNS service coded into the Apple Time Capsule, and parental controls on the rest.  Takes some doing, maybe I should write a paper on it.
We have an Apple TV, and think it's wonderful! Everyone in our extended family has them too, and it's great!
We have an Apple TV in the den that we mostly use for Netflix and to mirror images from iPad or iPhone. We enjoyed it so much that we decided to purchase one for the bedroom.

We have an "un-smart" TV and so earlier this year bought a Sony SMP-N200, which is effectively the smart TV gubbins in a separate box.  I'm very pleased with the Sony for what it does.  But it's what the Sony doesn't do that caused me to want the Apple TV - I still have to watch ESPN 3, and non-Netflx/Hulu Plus streaming sites on my iMac - which is fine, but isn't in as comfortable a location as my TV is...The combination of the Apple TV and my iMac now means that by using Airplay Mirroring, I can watch anything streaming on my computer directly on the TV - which is just what I wanted.  Oh and we can also display whatever my wife is streaming on her iPhone directly on the TV.Purchasers do need to check the spec of their hardware though.  If you have an apple computer from before 2012, check the compatibility list on Apple's web site, to see if airplay mirroring will work for you.  If airplay mirroring won't work for you, and you don't intend to update your hardware, you may want to look at the Roku (no you-tube option to date) or another streaming device, which has more "in the box" streaming options than the apple TV has.However, for me and any other Apple devotees, this is the streaming device you want to attach to your "un-smart" TV (and possibly your smart TV as well).
summary: Perfect if you have an Apple "environment " at home

reviewText: We have a Sony Smart TV but often times we would have issues with our Netflix connectivity.  I assumed it was our DSL, but our computers and phones weren't having issues on the wifi, so I wondered.  I decided to purchase this AppleTV because I also wanted to listen to the music on my phone through the stereo without tethering my phone via a cable.  I am SO glad I purchased this as our main Christmas gift to our family from "Santa."  It took one use to realize all the issues we had been having with Netflix and YouTube were due to our TV, not our DSL.  Now we can watch Netflix and YouTube all night long on our TV with the AppleTV with no issues at all.Using it for playing music from my phone hasn't worked out as well.  When doing so, it often cuts-out, there's popping or it'll just drop the connection.  It's so frustrating, I've just gone back to listening to the music on my phone via a cable. Oh well...it's not everything I wanted, but it's still pretty darn good.  I also wish you could use Amazon Prime on it, but again, oh well.Our set-up:  we connected to our AppleTV to our Sony Receiver via HDMI cable and of course the TV is connected to the receiver via HDMI.  It works great!
we have come to expect so much more from Apple that we expect more!this product is very good and getting things onto my TV is so easy.Wonderful extension to their product line

We have full cable with on-demand and TiVO - and this was a critical addition. Apple TV lets us access HBOGO and a host of other programs that are phased out, on-demand.  The range of programs is excellent, and fills out the variety of shows we can watch.  It's compact size makes it an easy addition to the "media center" corner of the room.

We have one at my house, love it, so I bought one for my parents for xmas.  Came quickly, def original product, no complaints, and they love staying in to watch movies.  Super easy to install and use!  Does require wi-fi, iTunes account
We have really only used it for Netflix at this point but so far so great! Extremely easy to set up and very straight forward to use. No complaints!

We have slowly walked over to the Mac side of the world over time simply because their products work and work well.  When this is coupled with the airplay any current mac device instantly has the ability to have what ever TV this is attached to as a monitor.  We've streamed movies from the laptop through this with fully acceptable results.
summary: for us, this little unit works VERY well...

reviewText: We have the first and second generation Apple TV devices.  These have proven to be very useful and very user friendly.  Great to be able to pull up movies or tv shows you've purchased and watch it on your big screen.  Also great for listening to your iTunes library through your sound system.  Will probably upgrade to latest version when released.

We have the Roku and now the Apple TV. The Apple has a better looking user interface and movies are easily made able to go fast forward or reverse, something the Roku has trouble doing. If you have streaming Amazon Prime then you need a Roku if not the Apple TV is a better choice. This unit can stream YouTube videos something the Roku doesn't and I choose to start my online "in the cloud" movie collection on iTunes rather than Amazon. For a hundred dollars, hard to beat the entertainment value.

We have the Roku and the Apple TV. At first it took a little figuring out because the products are different but I love the apple tv a lot more. Very easy to use. Haven't had a problem so far. The guy who did a lengthy comparison of the two is spot on and he convinced me to buy this product and I'm not upset that I did. Very pleased.
We have two of the older models and one of the new and love them all.  Setup easy, use easy, and wireless-N.

We host a lot at our house, so this is great for sharing fun YouTube videos or even to project music. It's great for Netflix and very simple. I am not very tech savvy, so I love this. It's simple but has a lot of great features.
We just love these apple TV's. We currently have two..we have no complaints. It has everything you need ready built in. It's a breeze to use.
We keep moving it from room to room because we love it so much.  Obviously we need to get another one!

We left our Roku behind and opted instead for the AppleTV.What we like:- Airplay, airplay, airplay- It downloads content pretty quickly, we have never had any slow network issues or Netflix buffering- The quality of the content playback is superb- Did I mention airplay?What we miss about our Roku:- I could install apps for the Roku, including custom apps that would stream content from a home serverIn summary, it's a great deal and has enabled us to rid our selves of the shackles of cable TV.

We like this more than we expected we would. Can't wait for Apple to add more services. We also have a blueray player that has network services, and the Apple TV is a completely different (faster, easier to use, more elegant) experience.

We like to use the Apple TV for two things - 1.  To view movies and other shows from our Netflix account and 2. To receive content (streaming) from our iPads into our large LCD TV for viewing as a family.  We are never short of good quality material to watch and learn from.
summary: Great product if you have other Apple products

reviewText: We live in an area that is not connected to cable and our only internet provider is a phone line--not the most user friendly to watch streamingTV. We dropped the satellyte. We had an early roku device which did not have caption ability. It served us fairly well but one of us really needs captions and with some of the British series, we both need captions. Now all the netflix has captions and I can down load movie rentals and any tv series that I might want and watch them without interruption. My phone line does take a while to down load so I try to do most of that job over night. The Apple product seems to be more efficient and even when watching streaming there is less buffering than before.While we are buying some of the programs from the Apple Store, we are still saving money over subscribing to a satelyte company that forces you to buy so much programing you don't want and never watch .  My husband and I are very happy with this product .
summary: Apple TV has made television veiwing more enjoyable.

reviewText: Well 1st I love Apple products. My wife & I have iPhones, iPad, & now 2 Apple TVs. It works great & fast shipping. I can't complain about it.

Well, I bought this for my friend not knowing too much about it.  It's a great entertainment tool.  I like how you can stream Hulu and play games on it too.  I'm not too familiar with the product but the smile it brought to my friend was priceless.  I think this is a great buy for anyone who is a fan of Apple.  Me personally, I don't have time to play with these new toys.  I will assume another update for Apple TV will come out which is why I usually hold out on a purchase like this.  Anyway, if you are looking for a great companion toy for your TV watching, this is great.
summary: Friend loves it, I like it too

reviewText: Well.. I own 3.  I have them in bedrooms, living rooms, every-and-any-where!  I plan on getting more too.  I have it connected to my network and surround sound.  I can play movies, music, Netflix, you name it!  Best part, you ask?  I can control it all from my iPhone, iPad, or MacBook Pro (with the Maverick update, that is).  It's just wonderful.

Well it's made by Apple so you know it's gonna have a certain level of quality and functionality, but this device is just awesome. Many different ways to access content from Netflix to HBO Go to Apples own services and many more. Also if you have a Mac computer you can also screen share to it (just check yours is compatible. Very pleased.

Well my girlfriend and I love Apple TV so this is our second purchase. We got one for the living room then got really tired of moving it into the bedroom so... we got a second. If you are tired of paying a ridiculous amount of money for a s*** ton of channels that you never watch this may be for you. Apple TV provides fairly inexpensive access to all the various TV shows and movies that we want. Its about $16 a month for hulu and netflix then whatever we spend on iTunes renting movies. For us it comes out to much less than the easily $100 plus that we were paying xfinity for a bunch of annoying channels we never watched. If you are the type of person who likes to watch every brain melting tv show out there and can't handle having a few moments of quite while you pick out your next show or movie then maybe steer clear... I dunno, just get one anyway
Well not really, but this my second Apple TV. This product is easy to use and it matches my decor.
Well worth the cost if you have a subscription to Netflix or Hulu plus.  Also works with Amazon Prime videos
summary: Works great and mirrors my iPad so I can use nothing on it

reviewText: We love Apple TV. It was very easy to set up and now we can access all kinds of programming that we did not have before. Love it!
We love Apple TV.  We did have to upgrade our wireless, but that was an easy fix.  We love it!
We love Apple TV. You can do slides how with all your photos from your phone, iPad, iPod. We love watching movies also.
We love it as it is the gateway to internet.  Easy to use.  Only thing is that newer version's remote is not compatible with older version.

We love it!But the remote is soooooo small. It gets lost all the time.  My toddler loves to grab it and hide it. Had to buy a replacement remote for $25.  But the product works great (and even the replacement remote works great... just take out of box, point, and it works.)
we love it. use it all the time to stream from iPad. we can also show off our photos and stream music from our computer.
We love our Apple TV and now have one for each tv in house. No more $100+ satellite bills every month. Woo hoo!!

We love our Apple TV!  For a long time, I didn't know what it could do, so I was not very interested.  We love to use it for family gatherings and holidays to enable everyone to see pictures - new and old!  It is simple to operate -- even though we have the same capability in our Samsung TV, we prefer the Apple TV.
We love our Apple tv. My nine-year-old actually set it up and started using it before I even got home.
We love our Apple TV so much that we have given this as a gift twice.  I think its the perfect wedding gift for any couple with IPhones.

We love our Apple TV!  Super easy to set up, as with most Apple items, pretty much plug and play.  I have an external hard drive I copied all of our movies onto and we use our Apple TV rather than shuffling around DVD's.  With a 3 year old that constantly wants one of her disney movies playing this sure does simplify my world!  My DVD boxes are all put away in the closet, DVD player hardly gets used.  I haven't really tried a lot of the other functions (Netflix etc.), but it does exactly what I bought it for.

We love our Apple TV.  We got all caught up on old tv shows using our Netflix account.  There's alot of other things we could get into, but he haven't explored it yet.  I've been wanting to watch Netflix on my big screen TV for so long, and finally found a way to do that with the Apple TV.  I strongly recommend everyone buy one of these little gizmo's.
We love the picture quality and ease of use. We highly recommend this product for iPhone/iPad owners, for they can control it with the REMOTE app.

We love this!  It automatically detects wireless connection, just add iTunes account and voila! all of your purchases from the Apple iTunes store.  We watch Hulu Plus, movies, tv shows and pause/play back at our choosing. Much cheaper than DVR (monthly) and my 3 year old loves it.  It is small enough no one even notices it by my TV, QUICK on/off with no boot time.  Awesome product.

We love this product so much, we purchased a second one for our home. The integration of photos, music and movies (among other things) is so seamless and so easy! This will be a go-to-gift for all going forward.
We love this!! You can view Netflix through this.  We LOVE playing our music from our phones through out TV surround sound.  Plus all the additional stuff.  Definetly worth the money!

We love using our AppleTV and have completely moved from having cable to watching movies and TV through Hulu and Netflix, thank to this bad boy. The only downside (and not sure it's an Apple problem) is that we'd love if Closed Captioning was available.
summary: We use ours all of the time

reviewText: We love you Apple. Keep producing these wonderful gadgets. Life is much more interesting with technology and Apple is the company for it.

We never dreamed we could get anything from the net. that we get on our computers on our TV and often in hi def. We enjoy you-tube, Facebook, our emails, photos and messages on our Ipad and Iphone and much more.
we now own 4 and i am on the only one in the house without one... what gives?  I need one... easy, mainstream... fun

Went ahead and got this and my wife and I are loving not having to pay for cable. We watch Sky news all the time and get international news and weather-a nice feature. Also hooked up to Netflix streaming and downloading from iTunes.Also we had an issue with the icons and we had to call Apple. They gave us great customer service and they fixed our issue and we were able to get back to watching very soon. Apple is a great company all the way around.
Went to local store to purchase Apple TV, only to find the last one walking out the door as I walked in.  Looked at Amazon.com and I had it next day with no trouble. Thank You Amazon.com

We purchased this to replace our Roku player and it was by far the best decision. It is much more user friendly and it also streams quicker with less lag time and buffering. On the Roku it was constantly stopping during play to buffer or load and we rarely have that issue with the Apple TV.The layout is also extremely user friendly and actually makes logical sense compared to the Roku which had a horrible layout.Also the Roku would always freeze up and become unresponsive if you pressed one too many buttons, and would force you to unplug the entire device in order to reset it. We have never had to do this with the Apple TV.Best streaming device!

We really were looking forward to Apple TV but once we got it we found you can use it for much more than mirroring stuff to your tv. The biggest disappointment is the limited apps and the ones you can get you have to pay for everything. Hindsight we would just upgrade our tv service for Dvr and sling box.

We saw this in one of our friends homes and loved the setup.  We live in Eruope, and once you overcome certain IP address issues this thing is wonderful.  Its great to be able to watch some updated American TV shows and not have to fork out a ton of money for satelite fees.
summary: WHAT A GREAT TOY FOR DAD

reviewText: We skip Cable and watch all our content from the internet.  The AppleTV is our portal to a growing list of channels and content providers.  We've team it up with its native support for Netfix as our primary way of watching stuff.  We have one for each TV.

We use 2 of the apple TV's in our home.  We no longer subscribe to cable or satellite and have been enjoying the extra money in our bank account every month and the ease of using the Apple TV.  We do have a subscription to NetFlix and Hulu Plus so we will use those to watch programming.  In addition we find ourselves listening to alot more music through MOG and Pandora through the apps available on the apple devices.  Also has the ability to watch NHL, MLB and NBA games through those apps if you have a membership to any of those.  But even if you don't you can watch the highlights from all the games offered in these apps.
summary: Perfect if you are an apple family and don't have cable

reviewText: We use Apple TV to augment our normal service (AT&T's U-verse) and watch both iTunes and Netflix content. Works great!

We used to have a Roku but it was an older version and I wanted to upgrade. Since we have mostly Apple computers, however, I decided to try the Apple TV instead. It's great. We use it mostly for Netflix streaming and the picture is extremely good. One of my favorite features, however, is Airplay. If your computer supports Airplay (newer Macs do), you can stream anything from your computer wirelessly to the TV - no cables needed. There is little or no degradation of the picture - you can stream movies, photos, music - if it's on your computer screen, you will see it on the TV. And there's no set-up involved - simply set your TV to Apple TV input and click the Airplay icon at the top of your computer screen. Whatever your computer screen is showing will also be on the TV. Additionally, you can set the sound to come from the TV sound system not your computer's. I was skeptical at first because we don't have the fastest internet connection and I thought the picture when streaming a video would be choppy but wasn't at all. We are very happy with this product.
We use iPhone, iPad, and Macbook, and so it make a lot of sense to get this Apple TV. This device is very easy to set up and convenient to use. We are really happy with this purchase!
We use it for Netflix, streaming on our iPads, sharing family photos and music. I need to get a second one for the bedroom.
summary: Can not live without my Apple TV

reviewText: We use our Apple TV as is, no jailbreak, so far, and this has been working fine. Setup with itunes cloud we play our own music collection off of the apple TV a lot, but many times we are having issues with the connection it took days, maybe even weeks before all of our library was available on the AppleTV. I think this is an itunes cloud issue and not a hardware issue. Applications for youtube isn't up to its best performance yet. Sometimes downloading itunes movie rentals or purchases gets stuck if the broadband internet connection isn't performing at top speed. Just for us, we found that Hulu plus isn't that great for providing additional options to Netflix. We use the mirroring for iphone and ipads every now and then but manytimes just using an hdmi cable direct between the iphone, ipad or laptop to the TV screen's hdmi port is many times the better option.the remote control for the AppleTV still has a lot to be desired---is quite small and hard to control even with my smaller female hands, but my husband and teen sons don't like the small size. Even i feel like the remote control is going to fall out of my hands while I use it. The controls are pretty basic, and I must see primitive. A keyboard would be a nice add-on option especially for the simple task of keying in words for searches, rather than toggling from letter to letter with the up-down-left-right RC buttons. Are you listening, Apple? (Wait! as per E.J.'s almost immediate comment, there is a free Remote Control app for the iphone and ipad that you can use with the Apple TV. I just tried it and it is a handy remote control alternative that I am still getting used to, BUT i really like tapping searches in for itunes, movies, netflix and youtube instead of toggling for letters. Highly recommend using it with Apple TV now. Thank you, E.J., for the tip)So lots of 3rd-party factors going on for the AppleTV to perform to its max, but we don't regret cutting our cable TV off and saving 70% off of our ATT Uverse bills!I read up on jailbreaking the AppleTV to get more content on this thing, but I am looking forward to a paradigm shift for smart TV so that more content will be made available through this medium.
We use the Apple TV daily for Netflix, HBO to Go, screen sharing, pod cast or just listening to the thousands of internet radio stations available.
We use the apple tv to stream content from our phones andhome network. This thing is too super cool.
We use this all the time.  Well worth the money and the picture is super clear.
summary: Well worth the money and the picture is super clear.

reviewText: We use this as our family room sole entertainment box. It has all the apps that we need and services that we use so we can watching whatever we want from any source on this little box.

We use this for AirPlaying photos and videos from our iPhones and iPad. I also bought Real Racing HD2 to try it out while using the iPad as a controller - it is a fun game when you play it on a big screen TV. Lastly, the Netflix interface is more user-friendly than what we have with our Sony BDP-S590 DVD player (which is not bad on its).

We use this for Netflix and Hulu Plus.  We signed up for these through the Apple TV and after the free trials are over they will bill to our iTunes account.  We can turn the subscription on and off through iTunes.  Theinterface for Netflix and Hulu Plus is similar.  It looks like services like this work the same with the Apple TV vs. having apps that have completely different interfaces.  Youtube works well and the radio is nice also.  It's excellent.  The interface is really clean.  Setup is dead simple.  It seamlessly integrates other Apple devices.It also integrates with our iPads and iPhones.  Having it work with other Apple devices is surprisingly useful.  We airplay from these devices to the TV all the time.  We use this for Pandora, video clips that we come across from web pages, etc.  It's nice to put those up on the TV to show the family.  You can mirror screens as well.I have to say that it's cool to start watching something on the iPad (e.g. a Netflix documentary) and then resume on the Apple TV later on.  I do this all the time.  I start watching something on the iPad, maybe while the kids are using the TV.  Then when they're done I resume on the TV.  That's more of a Netflix thing than an Apple TV feature but obviously it all works together nicely and I want to mention it for those who are considering this kind of setup.We use the remote app to control the Apple TV and that works really well.  Also, the screen saver for the TV will pull from your photo stream so when we take a picture it immediately shows up on the TV's screen saver and photo stream,  Having access to everything you buy with iTunes is very nice.The remote that Apple provides is not bad.  I've seen reviews that complain about it.  It's small, yes.  But it's very functional and we make sure to put it on the coffee table or an end table when we aren't using it so that it doesn't get lost.  It doesn't allow you to control the sound on the television.  That would be a nice feature to add.Like any Apple device it automatically updates its software periodically when new versions are available.  It's very user friendly.Lastly, we used this setup plus a Winegard FreeVision TV antenna to eliminate cable TV.  We're *very* pleased.  My wife was a skeptic and pleaded to drop the idea.  I kept cable while we tried this and then I let her decide.  Our deal is that she can allocate the savings from cable to something else that we need (for the kids or the house).  She loves the new setup now that she's tried it.  The kids absolutely love it and thanked me for getting them Apple TV.  It's really about the entire system but they like how Apple TV organizes kids shows by character.  They flip through and then find new shows to watch.Buy it.
summary: One of the best purchases I've made this year

reviewText: We use this for so many things, watching Hulu, youtube, itunes, etc.  It is small and usable, but we hate typing into it.  I keep wondering if there is an app for the iPhone/ipad so you don't have to type using the small Apple tv remote.
We use this for watching Netflix and iTunes purchased content on the TV.  The only way it could be better is if it had Amazon Instant Video content.

We've tested all the devices out there in this segment, and the Apple TV remains the best!  The latest version added Hulu Plus which we use a lot and really enjoy.  Hands down this is one of the best units, just wish it had NAS storage playing and wasn't so locked in Apple's little world.  But, still really nice and worth the price!
summary: Still the best interface out there!

reviewText: We wanted to use our older tv as a smart  tv this works just great! Now my I pad can play on our tv and I phone.We love our pictures viewed on the tv from our iPad.
summary: We set it up on the TV and very simple to make work 10 minutes.

reviewText: we went from Netflix through our BlueRay to Apple TV and the picture, the sound, the speed, etc are all noticably better.  This is worth the money!

We were dissatisfied with the interface between our TiVo premiere box and Netflix - wait times for our instant queue to load, fast forward function, etc.  I got Apple TV set up in minutes and we are extremely happy with the way that it streams movies from Netflix. It also has a great interface with my MacBook air using Airplay - a cinch to have it display whatever is on my laptop screen. Highly recommended.
summary: Much better Netflix streaming interface than TiVo

reviewText: What a concept! No more viewing my little iPad screen.  I can use the air play option and send everything to my television screen, Whether it's video or pictures you're sharing with others, it is so nice to launch them across the room without worrying about wires.
summary: Great way to optimize viewing Apple devices

reviewText: What a fantastic addition to any television.I like the YouTube function which allows me to watch anything on the big screen
What an upgrade from version 1!!! Way faster and great picture. So easy to use with Remote App on iPad or iPhone.
What can I say about this product, it's an Apple!!! A great addition to any TV. Enables you to watch great, current movies for $5.

What can I say about this product. No surprises, the product is as good as expected. I have an iMac, iPod touch, iPhone 5 running on Apple Extreme, so installation was not a hassle at all. But see that your devices are running on the same wifi network.
What can I say but this product met 100% of my requirements... the main requirement was to access Netflix.. and the quality is just awesome...
What can I say if you own an Apple product then you must get one of these. Best thing out there for seeing your pictures on TV.

What can I say ... I love Apple TV. It's just so easy to pop pictures, movies, whatever to your TV from your iphone, ipad or your Apple computer. This is a must have item if you are an Apple device user.

What can I say...I've never had a complaint about anything Apple, from iPhones to iMacs. The gift recipient loves this latest generation Apple TV, especially since he can stream Netflix directly through the device and interface apps from iPhone to TV.Apple items don't have sales, but I always found anything Apple to be worth every penny.Amazon shipped this directly to my gift recipient in another city right on time.
summary: Another Apple product does it again

reviewText: What can I say that everyone else hasn't?  As far as a thoughtful review, forget about it.  Subjectively, I love it!  My kids are able to use it all the time for Airplay and we can stream content to it, via wireless N.  Super easy to configure.

what can i say......we use this everyday. i love playing games on the iphone or the ipad, then throwing the signal on the TV via apple tv. great product.......we have everything apple in the house now.
What can you say, it is an Apple product and allows me to effectively integrate all my Apple devices.  Love it!

what can you say. It is apple after all. works like a charm. Doubles the pleasures watching Netflix and You Tube. Watch out for its razor thin remote. It has tendency to disappear between crevices. If you have an I Pad or I Phone you can operate the device with them

What else is there to say?  These things practically sell themselves.  I now have three in the house and I'm very pleased with every feature.  The quality of the device is outstanding, which one would expect from Apple.

What else is there to say?  The UI is excellent and very quick to respond to commands.  It's much less laggy than the TiVo UI.  You get access to a whole bunch of video and music sources.  It's tiny.  It's beautiful.  It's 1080p.
What I like best is ease of use. Theability to watch the programs I missed first time around is really nice.
summary: What can you say, it is an Apple product.

reviewText: What more can he say it's Apple TV, if you have one you know what I'm talking about. If you don't have one in use a iPhone or iPad you should really think about getting one.
summary: A must-have if you use an iPhone or iPad

reviewText: what more can i say about apple product. Apple TV is easy to install, easy to use and compatible with any laptops. I am using it daily either to stream or watch movies.
What to say - It's an APPLE!!! It is absolutely PERFECT and works like a charm.  Definitely BUY 1,2, or 3

When I bought this Apple TV, I wasn't plan to watch that much streaming video/movies.  Since I had this unit, I have been watching movies on the TV instead on the iPad.  It is easy to set up and reliable.  It is also being used to share video amongst family.  I highly recommend this product.

When I first purchased this I found a better price here than apple store or Best Buy. But when Amazon started to charge tax for some items, I purchased all my other 4 apple tv's at Best Buy, yes, that is how much I love aplle tv's, I have one for each television in my house. It is a great product, with awesome features, my favorite being Airplay or mirroring. It is very easy to use, even for my 6 year old. Since I have Amazon prime, I can mirror movies or shows from Amazon instant video that are not available on Netflix, directly to my tv.

When I got this product I was planning on binge watching shows on Netflix, maybe watching a you tube video here and there, but that was about it. Then I found out that HBO Go was available for the Apple TV. That was amazing for me because I love many HBO shows, and all seasons of every HBO show that they have made are available on HBO Go. Unlike the Comcast On Demand service, you can access any episode of any show any time. The interface is easy to use and intuitive. I even used the iTunes app on the home screen to rent a movie. Everything was easy and fun to use. I think in the future, this product will just get better as more apps and services get included with the product.
When I received it the battery in the remote was dead. It had not been cleaned out of who ever signed into it before. Took forever to get here.

When the revision of apple TV came out... I really didn't see the point but now that apple allows hulu and netflix, connects to your iTunes eco system, and allows content streaming from iDevices - the only question is why don't more people have them?

When we first got one, we were trying to find a place for our pictures and music.  It kept it centralized and was a great to see pics more often than not.  Now we no longer have cable (going on 4yrs) and it has become the focal point of our tv.  Since it almost alway on the Apple TV now, we have our photo stream turn on and get to see images all the time.  We can play our music or favorite radio station.  There have been some hiccups but for the most part, it is the best streaming out there.  I have seen streaming on other devices, and it just not bring the quality that the Apple TV does. Highly recommend it!
summary: Had one since version 1 and still love it..

reviewText: When you have it, do you understand the benefits of AirPlay. Compact, nice design and pretty easy to set up
summary: Now I really know the advantages of the AirPlay

reviewText: When you own a Apple tv you have the control to watch any show/movie you want anytime you want. Old tv series, old movies, YouTube videos all @ the touch of your Apple remote. Gave one to my mother and sister and they have enjoyed it as much as we do.
...which is what I think everyone has to say about this product.  It makes it possible to have all the specialty programming I want (NBA TV, iTunes, etc) without the necessity of cable.
summary: LOVE IT, wish the Airplay was more consistent

reviewText: While the Apple TV is a wonderful addition to your media setup if you have other products from the Apple family such as an iPod or an iTunes playlist that will sync up with it.  However, since the default remote that comes with the Apple TV does not have a keypad or many shortcut buttons.  With a better default remote, this would be a 5/5 product.  As such, it's only 4/5.

While the AppleTV is great for streaming your itunes content, netflix, etc. I believe the real power is AirPlay.  I love being able to mirror my IOS device (iphone, ipad) screen up on to the TV to share pictures, videos, web pages, etc.  It's especially great for doing face time between my kids and their grandparents.  It's like a business video conference with the display and audio coming through a  55" or 42" TV.  The iphone or ipad essentially become the video camera.  Last, after living through several generations of media (VHS, LD, DVD, Blu Ray) for movies, I've given up and moved to download them.  The Apple TV works great for streaming them.  Apple continues to add new functionality and sources for media.  There are even third party apps where you can stream your PC's screen to an Apple TV.
summary: If you have IOS devices, you need one or more of these!!

reviewText: While this thing is pretty awesome I wish it had a few more apps on it. I also wish the mirroring feature, that I use to stream videos and music from my IPad straight to my tv, worked with everything I did on the IPad. For instance- I tried to pull up a map on the internet and wanted my parents- who needed a larger image- to be able to see it on the TV but it doesn't let you do that!
Who still buys at Apple Online Store????For 10 bucks less, you get the same, faster!Must have for Apple Macbook users!

Who would have guessed that and entire gamut of movies and shows were available to me through Apple TV? True, I did need a technician to install the device but I'm particularly inept with technology.  Now that I've got it down, I have endless hours of good education and entertainment that was not available before this.
summary: Apple TV Allows Me Many Choices

reviewText: Why buy one of those roku things when you can spend just a bit more and have this!  Awesome quality, great streamline compatibility with all things apple!  Have a couple of these hooked up in my home, love them
Why didn't I buy this sooner.  Easy to hook up - love the music, photo and movie aspects.  Plus being able to watch Netflixs on the large screen TV on the sofa instead of the laptop.

Why they didn't allow apps to load on it or safari, I have no idea? This would be in every home in America if that was the case. I like the fact I can mirror my iPads and iPhones to it, but forget about trying to get a web browser on it. If you own a Mac this is a must have. It works good with my windows computers if you leave iTunes up and running. Great picture quality on my projector which doesn't have smart apps, and would be good for anyone who has a good tv but not a smart tv. If you have a smart tv, I'm afraid this cool device wouldn't be good for particuarly special for anything but watching your iTunes content. You can mirror anything from your iPhone or iPad except safari? If somebody knows a work around for this please let me know. Otherwise this is just another cool apple device that can run, iTunes, netflx youtube and Hulu in highdef

Wish I could get to my HBO account to watch from the Apple TV but there are many options for video including Netflix and Hulu. Streaming audio wirelessly from my iMac is one of my favorite features of this device.
summary: Great for streaming audio and video.

reviewText: With a house full of apple technology, this item is a must. It is a bit of a chore to set up and we have to keep reconnecting it but once you get it connected to your device it works great.

With all of my music, movies, tv shows, pictures, and videos that I have on my Mac based library, the Apple TV is a great addition to the entertainment system that only makes sense. Its also impressively small, which is nice when adding to your entertainment center.
summary: This is great if you are an Apple user with an itunes library...

reviewText: With most of my devices being Mac, this was a great addition. I dumped most of my cable services, and I'm saving a ton of $. I wish it came with a web browser and apps could be added, like CBS.

With so many long, detailed reviews about this awesome product, I figured a short, quick review might be helpful.Apple TV is great, I've gotten rid of cable, I'm saving money, and mirroring from an iPhone is pretty amazing.Netflix, Hulu Plus, YouTube and Vimeo are all available and work seamlessly, plus anything you've purchased on iTunes is ready to play, this includes music, TV shows and movies. You can also rent through iTunes, which though I thought I wouldn't use, I've rented just about a movie a week since purchasing Apple TV.Also, MLB, NBA, and NHL packages are available, however, there are blackout restrictions based on the location of your internet provider, so if you're a fan of local teams, these may not be worth it.In closing, buy Apple TV, it's worth it.

With so much available and viewable on apple tv, it can practically replace your cable subscription.  Its so easy to use/set up, even a monkey could do it.Best way to utilize all of its capabilities is to use it in conjunction with your ipad. You can view almost everything on your ipad through mirroring.
summary: Makes me wonder if i need to pay for cable anymore....

reviewText: With the latest discounts, it's an even better buy.  All you need is a one computer in the house w/iTunes running to get music, movies, photos on your TV.  There's loads of gizmos that'll do Netflix and other pay services, so in that respect it's about the same.  I have three for several years and no issues

With the release of Mountain Lion (OS X 10.8), the Mac has gotten the ability to mirror screen content to the AppleTV. To me, this means the AppleTV has gone from being a useful enough product to one whose flexibility and multitude of uses make it something you should own if you have any toehold into Apple's ecosystem.I will keep it short and simple! Below are some simple pros and cons too:Pros:++ Simple set up++ Very pretty and smooth++ AirPlay (for music and video)Cons:-- Very limited channels/content-- iTunes only for content, even for in network- iTunes match dependent for musicI wouldn't have bought it for myself but my friends got together and got it for me on my birthday on VenTribe.comI like it, and I think you will too!
summary: If you are an apple person - you should own this

reviewText: With this, I canceled my cable service. It cost me less than the monthly cable program fee and still have all the programs I wanted.
summary: I can get just what I wanted and not paying too much

reviewText: Wonderful product that my son wanted for the holidays. This will be a gift that should surprise him and I know he will enjoy.
Worked real goos.  Make a Apple products work on TV.  You can have whatever is on device on tne TV or just the videos.

Working as expected.  Not much suprise as I bought after thorough review over this product.  My internet speed might be a little slow, as every time when I try to use the NBA recap fuction, it will need several tries to have it work smoothly.  Other than that, everything is good.

Working well hooked it up to the tv with an HDMI cable and to the stereo with the optical cable.  Can play on the ipad or listen to music and it works well.  haven't used the tv portion yet, but am ready to do it.
Works 100% integrated with all other Apple stuff in our home. Somebody (not me!) has been thinking as usually when it comes to Apples products. Not the cheapest BUT IT JUST WORKS!
summary: Apple original what more is that to say

reviewText: Works, A must if u own an ipad. cause apple air feature is really awesome! received a working product which makes me a happy customer!
Works as advertised. No complaints. Easy to hook up. Took me a little bit of time how to mirror my ipad.
Works as advertised, seems like a must have item for any apple groupie but its a nice standalone device also if you want to use netflix
Works as described.  This is my second one, and would recommend to anyone and everyone.  Definate must have.Great job APPLE!
summary: It's Apple, how can you go wrong!

reviewText: Works as you'd expect an Apple product to work:  simple to set up and use.  Great for a variety of streaming content options, and if you have a Mac or i-device then it's worth the purchase price just for the convenience of AirPlay.  Highly recommended!
Works awesome with my Iphone.  I can put what ever I want on my TV for everyone to view.  ..
Works fine , and offers a lot of entertainment value for little cost.  I am just learning how to use it the best way

Works fine. Does not get local channels or real time TV. However an indoor antena should get your local stations. Check to see if Netflix, Hulu or your antena gets your "have to have" shows before severing ties with your provider, if that is your intention. Nice feature allows you to stop the show your watching and resume it where you left off later. Most of my tv watching is when I go to bed so works out great. Can see on your tv what is on your Ipad. Bit of a lag doing it that way. If your getting it to sever ties, it is a change to get used to. Switching your tv from one source to the other to watch from the antena or apple tv and the change of the menu. No big deal.

works good, does what it is supposed to do. Does for sure not what the description doesn't say like playing various files as a media player could. I got it for the air play function in order to play videos on the big tv which are streamed to iPhone/ iPad. Can recommend it for this and the advertised purposes.
summary: works good, does what it is supposed to do

reviewText: works great and it's pretty awesome being able to easily display my extended screen through airplay. it's a typical apple product works great but comes with restrictions for example, there is no amazon prime app; the news network is pretty lame; it's a pain to turn it off or rather put it into sleep mode.
summary: typical apple product works great, but comes with restrictions

reviewText: Works great, could tell this was brand new, bought this right before black friday when it went on sale for another $10.00 off, contacted amazon and they refunded me right away. All in all, got this $15.00 cheaper than apple.com
Works great.  Easy connection.  Walks you thru set up quite nicely.  Many options available once you set up so take the time to check it all out.
Works great! Easy to set up, use and worth the money. Would highly recommend for anyone that has Apple products.
