Works great for me as I have a large iTunes library.  A must for easy acces to your library! I definitely recommend it!
Works great! I can watch movies from Netflix and more content from youtobe and others. Moreover, you can watch some of your comcast channels.
Works great, it is the second one I have in two different locations and they both are a great help.
Works great. It was easy to hook up to the wireless network and the mirroring  feature for iPhone and iPad is cool
Works great.
Works great to stream movie to TV but only compatible with Apple products. That's ok for me that's all I have.
works great with all apple device, fast, clear picture and great soundi use on my iphone  and ipad a lot
Works great with all my Apple products.  Apple has continued to update he software, which Apple excels at.  I also own a Roku, and I now prefer the AppleTV.

Works just as advertised.  I got it primarily to stream Netflix and watch youtube clips on my TV.  This device does a fantastic job.The only con I have about the device is the "apple sharing" feature whereby you can link your iphone/ipad to the apple tv to playback videos/pics you have taken.  While the pictures look fantastic and load quickly, the videos on the other hand take forever to load.I heard to mitigate this problemm, once should be connected to the interned over a wired connection as a oppose to wi-fi.  This really is not a option for me, so I guess I will have to live with this issue.

Works perfectly and is even smaller than I expected.  It uses a single HDMI connection for both audio and video.  The WIFI transmission is very fast, I have a 30+ mbps hardwire internet service to my router.  Netflix use is smooth with no pauses in streaming.  Playing a movie wirelessly from m iPad or Macbook is seamless and the audio and video match up perfectly with no synchronization issues.  If you own Mac devices and especially movies purchased through iTunes you should have an Apple TV.

Works perfectly! Connected to my tv with hdmi, used optical-audio cable to connect it to my stereo, used cat7 ethernet cable for network connection, the result: perfect! If you want to connect your ipad/iphone to mirror the image to your display this is the correct item, it comes with lot's of installed apps (youtube, espn, ...). works perfectly with 1080p. with homeshare, watch everything from your itunes library or computer

Works perfectly fine, easy installation, you can play any file (music, video and pictures) in your TV, moreover, you can access youtube and other things like (flicker, Vimeo, Trailers, etc...).Syncing the files to be displayed on TV can be done via the wireless network or wired, I have tested playing HD movies via wireless network without a problem.It is recommended to download the FREE (remote) application available from Apple for your Iphone or Ipad to easily control the device and type faster for YOUTUBE search instead of using the provided remote control.Browsing pictures is super fast, there is no lag what so ever, I was surprised to see that even though my pictures are larger than normal Ipad or Iphone pictures, also there is a cool slide show and screen saver.Notes:- You need to buy an HDMI cable it is not included with this product, many available in AMAZON and can be available for less than $10- The item I have received is supporting (100-240V & 50-60Hz), I think some customers outside US might be interested in that, I have also uploaded a photo with such details.

You can get Netflix but you have to pay for it. I can get netflix through my DVD player or go to red box, so why get Apple tv. It has an HBO app, but you need to be paying for HBO to use it, and I can access the same stuff it offers through ONDEMAND with my cable provider. Again, I dont need AppleTV to get what it offers. It has Youtube, again, I don't need appletv to watch youtube videos. It offers shows, which again you have to pay for and I can get from my cable provider, usually for free. It has ESPN, again I don't need APPLETV to watch ESPN.I am sure for tech people, they can sync their ipad and their macs with Apple TV and do wonderful things, but for me, I don't  see what it offers really. Netflix and youtube videos?I am still totally searching for the point of having AppleTV.

Apple always make the best products, don't they? I love the Apple TV because it is very smooth and fast. I use a device called Boxee to view my own files on my projector, and compared to the Apple TV, it is too slow and laggy. I love the Airplay on the Apple TV. The only thing that separates the Apple TV from perfection is its inability to stream local files. Sure you can stream your iTunes collection, but what about my Avi's and MKV's?

Apple claims to always have an intuitive interface, and while this is a remarkable machine and I am delighted with what it is capable of doing, unless your intuition involves unplugging the machine from time to time to get it to work, I might argue with that basic claim.  Admittedly our set up is probably not typical, (more security and firewalls than most probably have) which made the alleged -no step- set up a nightmare.  Still, it does work and is really wonderful.  The Air Play mirroring leaves a lot to be desired though.  First turn of anything that is bluetooth, and don't use a microwave or baby monitor.  Getting it to play internet radio through the Radio 365 app was infuriating.  And since my musical tastes don't run towards "everything Apple/iTunes" I'm left with an intuitive battle that involves a lot of unplugging the Apple TV and rebooting my iPad.  Let's just say there is room for improvement.
summary: Interesting use of the word intuitive.

reviewText: Apple does not make any bad products in my opinion and I have always been happy with my purchases...I have one at home now, one that I take on the road with me when I travel and one at my in-laws...you cannot beat the price on amazon!

don't have to say much about this, if you have at least one apple product (ipod/iphone./ipad/mac) don't have to look any further.airplay option kills the competition.project any video, you want from you iOS device to your TV, projector (i use a projector).Play songs from your itunes on your home theater through this, all wireless.build in apps, many argue that apple Tv doesn't come loaded with many apps like the roku or some other, but they don't have airplay which is what i love the most in this. Easy installation and love playing games on HDTV with the mirroring feature.Originally, I hesitated in buying Apple TV, but I love the fact that you could play games from my iphone and airplay it on the HDTV.  It is wonderful.  The set up it very easy.If you are undecided, please try it, you will love it.

reviewText: Easy to set up and use. Great alternative to on demand thru cable.  Encourages binge watching tho so be warned!
EL PRODUCTO SI ME GUSTO ES NUEVO Y EXCELENTE NO TENGO NINGUNA QUEJA SOBRE EL PRODUCTO MUCHA GRACIAS POR VENDERME EL PRODUCTO

First off, I absolutely hate Apple's possessiveness when it comes to EVERYTHING.  You buy a movie or a song through iTunes and you don't fully own it and can't do with it what you please.  However, buy the same item off of Amazon and it is yours - no strings attached.  You can share it with a friend or open it in another application.  No problem at all.That said, we immediately didn't like that the Apple TV does not have the ability to add "apps" like the Amazon app one for movies and rentals.  We'd much rather support their business model than be tied to Apple!  I get how this is in direct competition with iTunes / Apple but not having the choice is annoying when you'd rather own things you buy.  It's not a library book with strings attached!  If I bought the same DVD, book or CD at a store I could give it to a friend when I was done with it!  We also were disappointed in the lack of a Pandora app.  Sure, I could use Airplay from my iPad or iPhone but to have to change the setting every time on that device and not be able to create Pandora stations from the TV or thumb up/down songs from there was too many steps.I generally don't like homesharing because my base PC NEVER stays on (and why would it?  It's a waste of power...) and it was impossible to set up multiple accounts on the Apple TV (through two PCs).  I read somewhere that Apple makes it look like it is doable to set up more than one but never fully implemented it.  Then I tried to get BOTH of our iDevices set up to act as remotes.  I got one easily enough but could never get the second one working.  These are things that should be simple and Apple makes you THINK you can do them... but wow...  maybe not without a heck of a lot of research and tweaking!Sure, the photostream is cool and the interface slick and I'll miss those things but are they worth it?  Are we getting our money's worth?  Most importantly, can we easily do the things that we want to without having to spend hours googling to see if what we want to do is even doable?  The answer, for us at least, is NO.  So after two months with this thing, and still too many questions and frustration, we are returning it and getting a Roku 3 instead.

First off, I do like the look and interface to the Apple TV.  I really wanted to like this product.  However, having lived with it for more than a week, I find the Roku to be a much better alternative.  If you are already into the Apple Eco-system, then hands down this is the product for you.  Air Play was cool too.  However, I was looking for free content and new Roku has a similar function as AirPlay.  Not much freebies on Apple TV except Podcast.  The content on Podcast was spotty at best.  If it's more up-to-date, it might have been OK.  Another complain is that the unit would freeze up after a few program searches.  I had to reboot the unit every time I use it.  As a result, loosing all my user profiles and log in info, including re-entering wifi info.  I could not recommend this product based on my experience.  Bottom line:Pro - If you already subscribe to the whole Apple Eco-system, you already have you content there.  AirPlay.Con - Not a lot of free content, unit freezes up.

For a mere $99USD, you can have so many options--streaming on demand top movies(usually for a nominal fee), music, TV, and more, love the floating images as a screen saver. As always, Apple products surpass all others.

reviewText: For iDevice users, this is simply the best options available. Combined with the possibility of jailbreaking, this device offers an unparalleled experience in media. Must-have!

For what it's supposed to do out of the box, it does pretty well.  But it's extremely limited in the kinds of media it can play.  This has been solved for the 1st and 2nd generation Apple TVs through the painless jailbreak process, but a jailbreak is not yet available for this, the 3rd generation unit.  Until that happens, I strongly recommend spending your sawbuck on last year's version (MC572LL/A) instead - although it only supports 768p (the 3rd gen adds 1080p), the older unit can run nitoTV, which turns the AppleTV from a curiosity into a must-have game-changer.

Put it in my daughter's room, since I don't have cable run to her TV (and don't ever want it in her room - horrible for kids!!) and she's able to watch the Disney Chanel without the commercials (which is why cable sucks so bad!) and also youtube, which allowed us to watch several mini-series of MLK, Jr. which she needed to do a report on.  The mini-series helped her get a perspective of his life and what he went through and WHY he went through it.  That was something I couldn't have done any better and the timing of the Apple TV arrival was perfect for that alone.  Great little device.  Love the mirroring feature too. I bought this because I want to display my slingbox feed on a "regular" TV - not just an iPad or a computer.  It appeared to be one of the "connected" devices on the slingbox website that would support that application, and I chose it because I like Apple products for their quality.  It doesn't, however, do what I want, at least not without an iPhone or and iPad 2, which I do not own.  It can apparently stream video from an iPhone or an iPad 2 running the Slingbox ap, but it doesn't have a native ap or a browser that would let me access the slingbox URL directly.  I also bought a $35 Chromecast, and it does the job well enough, from a Chrome browser (on my old macbook, for example).The Apple TV is a nice enough product, but it doesn't do anything I couldn't already do with my Toshiba blu-ray player.  It can stream Netflix apparently (something I can do on my blu-ray player).  I am especially disappointed that it doesn't have an ap for streaming Amazon videos (please someone correct me if I'm wrong).  The lesson here is of course that I should spend more than 45 seconds researching products before I buy them online, but who has time for that?
summary: This is not the Slingbox player I was looking for...

Also, you have to import all movies you want to watch that are a file into itunes and then have itunes on in order for it to show up on apple tv.  The access to netflix and all the other channels it great and easy.  All in all, I love apple tv and am planning on buying another one for our tv downstairs.

I gave this Apple TV to my son for Xmas. He has used ours and really liked how it worked with his other devices.  He said he, "works like a charm. Use it all the time. It will be nice to have for a party to play music through"

I guess I was expecting too much from it. I already have a TV with internet...has all YouTube, Netflix etc. I thought it will be easy to just play apps on TV. But unfortunately, even when I can switch to TV, most apps just offer mirroring, my iPad and iPhone batteries are still being used and they become useless when I am mirroring. Also, some iPad apps , like CBS, do not even work full screen on TV, I feel like just using my iPad to watch those things. Also no slide show options for pictures on my device.... Well as I said, it's ok and maybe I was just expecting too much...

I had an Apple TV but bought another for our summer cabin and it's better than ever with the recent additions to the lineup. I hope they continue to evolve. The Roku and Google competition is keeping Apple on their toes but nothing else integrates with iPhoto and other Mac products as well as Apple itself. Well worth the $100.
summary: Even better with the new HBO Go

reviewText: I have 3 televisions and own 3 boxes including the now discontinued ReView (Google TV), The newest 2012 Apple TV, and The Roku Unit. From a functionality standpoint, the Apple TV is my least favorite.APPLE TVPros: The design, reliability and ease of use and general "fit and finish" is the clear leader of the bunch. Being able to stream some of the content on my Ipad and Iphone is also a cool bonus.CONS:The google TV acts like an Android Phone, you can add apps. Unlike the Google TV, you can not add APPS to the Apple TV and are left with the very limited selection of built-in applications. I can't stream my Amazon Videos, Can't Browse The web, Pandora is not native and the list goes on.  (Unless I am on my Ipad)and the selection is just plain poor.There is no USB port where I can connect an external HD and play media off of it. Both my RoKu and Google TV do this and I use it all the time.I can not connect to my NAS server in the house. Both my RoKu and Google TV instantly see the share and I can stream all the movies and songs that I have on my 3TB master NAS which holds all these things. Although my NAS is an "itunes" server... the only way to stream videos to an Apple TV is to connect to a PC or Mac which is running and logged into Itunes. If I wanted to keep my laptop powered on all the time, this would not be an issue but I don't.In summary, I think the features and functionality of the Apple TV is very limited. It should work like an Iphone or Ipad and support apps just like Google TV does, they should add some USB support and start making NAS products which are compatible with it.
summary: I have a Roku, Google TV and Apple TV and Apple is not on top

reviewText: I have a love/hate relationship with my Apple TV. Mainly love. I've had it for six months now, so I have a thorough understanding of the pros and cons.Pros:The best AirPlay streaming device you will find (I initially purchased a receiver with built in AirPlay, but the inconsistency was unbearable)Small and energy efficientSimple set up and updatesNon-intrusive designQuiteCons:Limited functionality (Jailbreak seems unlikely for this model)AirPlay can be inconsistent with music cutting out or not playing at allThis device suffers more from HDMI handshake than any other (not a fault of the device per se, but I can't figure out why this is happening when I've been able to troubleshoot better with the rest of my devices.Bottom line:This is a great purchase at $100 for the AirPlay alone assuming you have other electronic products to get use from this functionality. It can be infuriating when your ATV's AirPlay doesn't work properly, but I have found that shutting it down (put to sleep) or unplugging as a silly, but effective troubleshooting method. I'm not going to comment on Hulu, Netflix, etc. as I have other devices I use for this. I would like to see apps for Amazon Prime and others. More apps in general would be nice (here's hoping for a jailbreak). Also, if your Mac is mid-2011 or older you can't use AirPlay to mirror your screen.
summary: Typically Very Good at What it Does

reviewText: I have apple everything theirs no comparison ,the only problem I have with apple tv is you should be able to load iTunes gift cards like you can on other devices so you can rent or buy movies instead of having to use your credit card.

I have a Roku (newest), Apple TV (this one), and old models of each.  I am disappointed with the trajectory of latest Apple TV.  It functions poorly in comparison to Roku (IMHO).Problems:* In my experience, Airplay tends to not work with audio or video.  Apple TV abruptly disconnects from MBP with iTunes radio.  It abruptly disconnects from iPad with an internet video.  Getting Airplay to work is an arduous process of (re-)connecting and (re-)typing Airplay code.  Otherwise, Airplay is susceptible to (more) public use.* No amazon prime videos (obviously)Common Problems (Roku and Apple TV):* Must have a cable account to connect to some networks, like Showtime and HBO, which is what I wish to avoid in first place.* Hulu has commercials.  (I hate commercials.)Positives:* Video on demand (100+ Episodes of Scrubs with Netflix!)* Unhook from cable and retain many benefits, even some sports (like highlights).* Connect in new ways to some networks.

I have been an Apple TV fan since version 1 so I upgraded to the new Hi-Res version and am enjoying it.  I will buy the real iTV when it comes out as it will usher in a new generation of smart TVs as a lasting legacy to Steve Jobs' vision.

I have two of these: one in the family room and one in the bedroom. Seamlessly syncs with all other apple products and services. Works great on wired and wireless internet connections. I recently canceld cable TV service and use Apple TV exclusively to access Netflix and Hulu+.

reviewText: I love this device. It lets me AirPlay everything from my laptop, my phone and my tablet. It is very easy to set up with your Wifi. I have it hooked up via HDMI to my plasma tv and have it outputting sound via an optical cable to my surround sound. The reason I have the optical is so I don't have to turn the tv on to airplay music. I just turn on my surround sound and airplay music to it and then I can do chores while jamming out. My surround sound has sleep functionality so I can leave it playing when I go to sleep and it will turn off. It can access YouTube, Podcasts, movie trailers, Hulu Plus and so much more. The only thing missing from it is a browser, like Safari. I highly recommend this device to Apple users.
I love this product.  I have the Roku in my bedroom but the Apple TV is much nicer to navigate.  It's a bonus that its capable with my Iphone:)
I love this thing and I only wished I had bought one sooner.Could use some more services such as amazon, hbo go, etc.I suggest you go get one of these right now!

I needed some way to connect my PC computer, Apple devices (iPhone and iPad), and wifi services (NetFlix etc.) to my TV. This does it all simply and well. I use the HDMI output connected through a 5.1 channel HDMI AV Receiver to the HDMI input on my TV. I get great sound and picture. I can view content from my PC, iPhone, iPad, or the internet. It all works well and is easy to set up.

In our house we have a Roku and an Apple TV (in separate rooms)I liked the Roku but wanted the ability to access all my iTunes purchases and music from my couch and stream on our TV, for that it works great. The screen saver feature is nice as well as it also will display our iPhoto albums when we're just listening to music.My main reason for the 3 star rating is lack of Pandora integration and clunky navigation via the remote shipped with the Apple TV. I use the Remote app via my iPhone but that's only a slight improvement.If you aren't tied to Apple/iTunes then I think the Roku is a better choice

summary: Wish i had purchased this first

reviewText: I own a lot of movies, TV series, etc. from the Apple store, and therefore had to use an Apple TV.  But given the choice, a Roku box, or even my own PC running Plex Media Server, is a better and more versatile system. Apple, when are you going to allow Amazon.com, Windows media servers, and other digital channels?
summary: Useful, but no substitute for Plex

reviewText: I passionately dislike Apple and the way it does its "iLife". However, this was a gift for family that already had an iPad so the mirroring idea is what sold it the most in reality.A HUGE thing to mention here is that the controlling momma Apple does not allow any other apps to be installed onto the device. Whatever Apple chooses to install or remove during an update is what you will get and you will have no say in the matter. Why do I say this? Well...do you have Amazon Prime so you can watch tv and stuff???...not on the Apple TV you don't!!The control leaves much to be desired. It is also NOT a bluetooth control so you must keep a clear shot to the device for the control to work.On the plus side, the looks of the device is sleek and classy. It blends very well and does not take up much space at all. The setup (I am pretty technically inclined) was a breeze. Connecting was equally easy (HDMI).Reliability: Cannot attest to any of it as the device has barely been used still. I hope Apple still takes pride in the products and demands the high level of quality it did when Mr. Jobs was still in charge.Disclaimer:I am extremely bias in support of the Android platform. I use Samsung devices (SmartTV, Smartphones) and they all connect together wonderfully, the TV let's me install extra apps (on top of the pre-installed ones). I have used one of the many Google TV devices and those also allow you to do what any Android tablet can do.Final words: I think that for the money, you could find something more competitive with more flexibility. I personally would never purchase this device for personal use. If you are already submerged into the iLife, however, then this device is neat simply because you can mirror some other apple devices onto the tv with this (play a game without having to have the phone 5 inches from your face!!)
summary: Android lover buys Apple as gift

reviewText: I really enjoy the Apple TV.  Kids love to watch netflix. I enjoy the air play feature. It's everything I expected.

The Roku LT has many more viewing options. I was put off a bit by the apparent necessity to register with Roku with a credit card. I don't want to register with my credit card to use this. I just have a relationship with Netflix. Apple definitely wants you to use their world of products but I don't see them as being price competitive with what is out there. It is easy to hook up, one HDMI cable and the power cord. It is always on but apparently energy conscious. Also, Apple products have a good resale value. If you are in the Apple world, you also have the ability to stream content to your tv with this device. Not important to me.  I would like Apple to loosen up the content of their system and allow me to add more channels. Ergo, the 4 star rating.

reviewText: I waited a long time to get Apple TV.  But now with the ability to stream from my computer or iPad through the Apple TV onto my flatscreen, I decided to buy myself a holiday present.

I want to play video on my Mac and mirror to my TV.  The Mac DVD player blocks mirroring, but I downloaded another player that allows mirroring.  Unfortunately, Air Play is use progressive/multiresolution rendering.  The image starts fuzzy and improves with time.  With fast moving images, like video, the picture never has the time to improve and stays fuzzy, so movies have poor image quality.It also does not work with Amazon Instant Video streaming.
summary: Air play does not do what I want.

reviewText: I was disappointed because I am unable to directly stream video from my macbook air through the apple tv (wirelessly), which i was told by an apple tech at a store that "yes that is how it works"....hello tech lady, you can stream "audio via iTunes" but anything visual requires a separate HDMI cord from your computer to the tv which is what I was trying to avoid in the first place. Since ITUNES competes with AMAZON and HBOGO. You are unable to have those options either ....However the "airplay" works great using my macbook or IPhone as remotes for certain HULU or NETLFIX shows !! There are other amazing options with being able to transfer data wirelessly (everybody hates cords).  As long as you understand what your buying it can be a great addition to any entertainment center.

I probably won't use it much for that purpose, especially for movies that are very involving, where a sudden freeze and buffer would ruin the experience!For streaming photos from iPhone, it is fantastic. Love seeing the photos on the big screen and not having to download them onto my computer, etc.

I was looking for something to mirror my iPad 2 with my tv. A friend suggested Apple TV and I took his advice. I don't regret it. I can now enjoy my iPad flics on TV. Plus, I can access all the great stuff on YouTube. It's easy to set up and, like all Apple products, easy to use. It's definitely worth the price. By the way, I use it with a five-year-old Philips with no problems.

reviewText: I was really tired of tethering my devices to the screens, and this has allowed us to just grab content from the computer.  Fast, works well over my wifi.

reviewText: I would like to know why the remote is made out of aluminum? It's always freezing cold! It doesn't need a heat sink. I mostly use airplay from my iphone and the remote app. I like it, I don't love it. Needs app store ASAP!

reviewText: Last year I bought A Roku and was looking forward to all of the channels I could add and watch and even though there are more than I could ever watch I thought it was a great concept. I also bought the Roku mainly for Netflix and HBO GO which are both native apps. Then I found out that DirecTV does not support the Roku's HBO GO app which was frustrating, to say the least.Anyway, on to the Apple TV.Setup was a breeze and Apple never disappoints in the ease on navigating around the menu. I immediately configured my Logitech Harmony One remote to work with it (which went flawlessly) and I was ready to go. (The Apple TV remote is so tiny I was afraid it would get lost). Using my Harmony One remote on the Roku (even though it works) was a clunky, lag fest and very frustrating to use.After configuring the Apple TV I tried Netflix and the picture quality was great, I think better than the Roku as well as the Netflix Menu which is much more user friendly on the Apple TV.Then I tried streaming the movie Battleship on HBO GO from my iPad via Airplay and even though it took a min or two to start, the picture quality was much better than I expected and dare I say BluRay quality.Even though the Apple TV doesn't have anywhere close to the amount of channels that the Roku does, it's a top quality product which once again shows that Apple is the best in the business and being able to listen to my iTunes library through my home theater is awesome.HBO is currently working on a native App for HBO GO on the Apple TV so that will be the icing on the cake but for now, watching over Airplay is solid.Very happy with this purchase.

Lets you play Netflix, Hulu, and iTunes videos, along with YouTube videos, some sports, and even Flickr photos and iTunes music directly on your TV. With Airplay mirroring, you can also watch HBO Go streaming episodes. If only Showtime would get with the program. And for the price?? Can't be beat. I already want another one for my other TV.

Lo uso en Costa Rica para ver netflix y trabaja perfectamente, como todos los productos Apple excede  las expectativas y tiene la ventaja de que trabaja perfectamente en Latinoamerica

Love IT!This is like the answer to cable companies and their pricing. I got Hulu+ and Netflix and stream EVERYWERE I GO!!!

reviewText: Not sure what the point of this machine is for. If your stuck in apples world the it's probably worth it but until they allow apps up I would say pass

Not too bad.  Hooks right up to Itunes.the Movie scrolling feature is attractive, but it would be nice to be able to use the remote to adjust the speed.I would like to see another option of seeing multiple DVD titles at once, like the main screen icons.  If I have200 movies, I dont want to scroll through a list of 200 movies, nor do I want to have to put the movies into folders.It would be nice if I could have an HDMI input and be able to record signal like a DVR and save to itunes folder, then I can record cable tv like a tivo.I can see how some bean counter might not like that.

Okay, bad on me for not doing my research, but the whole reason I bought this was because I wanted to watch Amazon Prime Video Streaming from my iPad to my TV.  I thought airplay and screen mirroring would be the way to go.  Little did I know Amazon and Apple are having a stand-off because Apple can't handle competition.  Well, I'm sorry Apple, but in my opinion, Amazon's services are better than your's and Netflix' combined.  In the meantime, I'll use my dinky little Wii to watch Prime content in non-HD.Seriously Apple, get over it and quit suing everyone for everything.Please hold while I step down from my soapbox.... Okay, on a positive note.  This thing is incredibly easy to use, I watch my video podcasts effortlessly, and video rentals are actually quite reasonable.  Also, I really like the ability to stream music from my PC (using iTunes) and have a slideshow screensaver display on my TV (from a specific folder that I chose on my computer).  Screen mirroring is pretty cool, but I haven't found much practical use for it.It was a toss-up between this and the Roku, and I'm glad I got the Apple TV.Good hunting...
summary: Seamless integration with other apple products

reviewText: Ok, so I bought a Roku.... I took it back after 4 days because the remote constantly. The Apple tv works flawlessly and the setup time is literally 3 minutes! Easy to navigate through the channels, and the best thing is if you have an IPhone, Wifi Itouch or IPad, you can mirror the device straight to the tv. Best $99 I've ever spent! I cancelled $100/month cable bill by the way.
summary: Does Apple ever disappoint? CANCEL YOUR CABLE!!!

reviewText: ok update I'm giving it 5 stars now the airplay is working just fine i just had to get a newer faster router. i guess one downside to this could be no amazon prime video on the apple tv lol. but it works great. i can just use my macbook pro to watch prime video and airplay stream it to the tv ^^
One perfect little tool no regrets

Pain to key in and link your accounts, it would be nice to just log into the darn thing from the web and or federate my accounts to content providers and call it a day.  Kids can navigate so it's simple just wish Apple wasn't Apple....

Perfect for watching Hulu plus, Netflix, streaming from my macbook air. It is very easy to use and set up. there is even an app for your iphone to have a remote control that helps with typing things in easier. Very satisfied and came in perfect new condition in a small box.
Perfect product, very good Service
Plug and Play. Easy to setup. NO HDMI is a bummer. However, for 100 bucks, its not really a con. The glossy finish is nice, will leave fingerprints tho.

Pretty disenchanted with what AppleTV provides. I have an iPhone. I have an iPad. I even have an iPod from years ago. Thought I'd get similar quantity and quality of selections.  I was wrong.  Very limited channel choices. If you are unlucky enough to not have high speed internet, forget using this streaming video player.  Streaming video from Netflix works as well as on any other system. Netflix is one of those that still provides a service below 1.5Mbps and its only saving grace.In typical Apple-fashion, requires iTunes account to access video in the cloud (or should I say the iCloud?).  You cannot use AppleTV to access your UltraViolet digital library.
summary: Not Worth the Powder to Blow It Up

reviewText: Pros: Airplay, 1080p output, ease of use, love the remote, very slim profile, matte black looks sleekCons: expensive ($100), no entry-level productIf you have apple devices (macbook, ipad, iphone, etc.), it's a great addition to have. I previously had a Roku HD, and this blows the HD out of the water. I'm not a huge Mac guy, and I prefer Windows. But, even my Gen 1 iPad complements the Apple TV in a great way. The built-in apps that I use (watch espn and HBO go, mostly), look great. Highly recommended.
summary: although it's one of the most expensive, it's the best streaming device out there

reviewText: Quick delivery, quality packing. No issues with the product so far. I would recommend this for anyone with a mac or new generation ipad.

Quit paying for cable tv now! It's a waste of money! Get apple tv and save a fortune and watch only what you like. I bought three of these. One for each of our tv's and love them! You make up for the cost of the apple tv in getting rid of stinky cable tv.
really enjoy it !!! thanks again Apple for creating another intuitive products. The only issue I find is that taking him to sleep mode is not easy - APPLE PLEASE FIX IT !

Regardless of the price, Apple TV is a nice product you will enjoy when sending the output of your iPhone/ipad/Mac to your TV wirelessly.I searched for 6 months to buy a "smart" tv, but at the end came to the conclusion that instead of wasting money on useless features of a tv, the combination of Apple TV and a simple but high quality TV works much better. Watching youtube clips is much more enjoyable now as you can see the video on the large screen of your tv in 1-2 seconds - thanks to Apple TV :) I can't imagine how the users of "smart" TVs can type using their stupid remote controls.My only complaint is the difficulty to get started with it. It took 3 computer scientists and 2 electronic engineers to set up the device successfully! It gave us multiple error messages (IP conflict, etc.) before starting to work. But now that the issues are solved, I strongly recommend Apple TV to the customers of Apple products.
summary: nice product, difficult to get started with!

reviewText: Saved $10 vs. Best Buy... This works amazing & bonus, you don't have to have cable! We already have two in the house and love the capability to control the televisions with our Mac products! Buy early and buy often!

Set up is easy.....and working within minutes....especially if you are familiar with Apple products, if not to worry, still pretty easy to use.The only issue is that almost daily my Netflix streaming will be interrupted, which immediately fixed by a quick restartThat's it.....hope this helpsSeveral months later the streaming interruptions seems to have become a chronic issue. I would appreciate some help on how to overcome this problem. I know some people that have no issues with this device whatsoever.....my wireless modem is less than a few inches away from this device.
Shipping time was great, product is exactly what I expected.  I can't wait to hook it up and see what it has to offer me. currently waiting on tv to do so.
Simply excellent. Highly reliable product is to recommend and enjoy.It can be adapted to any TV and turns it into Smart

Since I only get 2 TV channels over the air, the Apple TV box has enriched our TV viewing manifold. Netflix ,uTube,Etc as well as being able to stream news shows from my iPad directly to the Flat Screen TV is a definite plus.
summary: Since I only get 2 TV channels over the air

reviewText: So far so good.  Would like it to be a bit more open to other services though.  Like the idea behind Roku, but feel like I'm being forced into the apple family.

So I had last year's version, and it worked quite well. This year's model has the new UI. I'm not sure if it's the UI or the hardware, but this year's model is significantly more buggy than last year's. Sometimes I'll catch it turning on out of the corner of my eye. It'll turn on for an hour then turn itself off. Very annoying because the remote is IR, so you can't hide it behind other things.
summary: Good, but a bit more buggy than previous versions...

reviewText: some shows that I can see on the computer, but not on the Apple TV and there is no subtitle. NO GOOD.
that is very nice. i can watch many movies and share music and movies to other family. I love it

The 1080P HD Apple TV is truly a great product. I have had it for around a month now and have only one complaint. Ive bought two different movies in 1080P HD and I feel like they are not at this definition. Some parts seem pixelated and I have a great HDTV and have streamed 1080P movies from VUDU and they are at Blu-Ray quality.Netflix, Hulu look great though and it's super fast! The only other app I've used besides those is YouTube.Great Product overall!

The airplay function which will mirror your iPad, iPod Touch and iPhone is temperamental, sometimes difficult to access requiring rebooting of either Apple TV or the device itself to make a connection. When connected it frequently loses the connection and requires a few steps to reconnect. This can be tiresome when trying to watch a video. As far as Photostream goes, that is an absolute disaster and apparently inherent in the software. You will find on many forums discussing this that a good portion or the majority of photos which have been made available from your various devices such as your computer, iPad or iPhones in the Photostream will not appear on your AppleTV stream. This is an ongoing software glitch which Apple has failed to rectify for months. These two aspects of the device are very disappointing because they are two of the better features that a lot of people would enjoy using. That's why they were built into it in the first place yet they either don't function or only function marginally.
summary: Airplay and Photostream are a disaster

reviewText: The Apple message boards are rife with glitch complaints, and they do happen.  Sometimes it won't connect to the internet and I have to use Airplay from my iPad.  Sometimes it drops the connection during a show, but I found that moving the box slightly, to the edge of the shelf where the wood isn't blocking it, solved that.  In any event, I love taking it when I travel!!  Love it so much I have two.

The Apple TV has more options than I had expected... Different apps for different streaming services.  The best part, though, unlike other players I've used, it seems to store what was streamed, so if I want to go back half a minute or so, I don't need to wait for it to reload the movie.  It is ready to go!  Nice job, Apple!  My only regret is that it does not have Amazon Prime streaming - still that competition with Google, I guess, since their devices are sold at Amazon.  My work around will be to try streaming from my iPad to the Apple TV, since I have an app for Amazon Prime there.  Haven't tried it yet, but will update if something does not work.  The iPad ll could not do this, but the iPad lll and later are supposed to-- a great excuse to upgrade the iPad!

The Apple TV is about is easy to use as anything can be. After a relatively easy set up, the only thing you need to do to use it is to open your MacBook or iPhone and click on Apple TV. At that point everything on your handheld device or your computer is sent to your TV. You can also use it to get things from the Internet without a computer. But it's much more difficult to type on the little screen than it is to type on a regular computer.If you already have an Apple product and your comfortable using it. You will not have any problem using this add on. You can get the same effect by using a HDMI cable. The cable is cheaper but it's a lot more trouble. If the $99 is not a problem I would definitely suggest you get one of these and hook it up to your television set, you'll find that you use it a lot to show folks your slides, listen to music through your good speakers and watch streaming television shows.
summary: A great help if you already have an Apple computer or handheld device

reviewText: The Apple TV is a very useful device.  If you have other Apple products, make purchases from the iTunes store, etc it brings all of that to your TV and stereo setup in a simple manner.  It automatically gives us access to our iTunes purchased content, we use AirPlay to stream music from our Synology diskstation, use our TV to show photos and videos we've taken on our phone, etc.  It brings everything together nicely.The big issue I've had is that updates frequently break it.  A recent update has caused network issues.  Each day I have to reboot the device to get network connectivity and AirPlay to work.  It's like every night it forgets how to network.  I tried fixing this by reseting the system to factory settings, but that only made it happen less frequently.  Also, all of the content you purchased in iTunes must be verified with an online server before it will play.  I've been unable to access my purchased content on two different occasions because of the server going down.  Perhaps I just happened to find the two outages in the past year, or (more likely) this happens rather frequently.Overall, I recommend getting it if you have a lot of iDevices and iContent.  Let's hope Apple gets its act together and stops pushing poor quality software, though.

The apple TV is extremely easy to set up, but what I didn't like is the fact that everything is through airplay. I run on my treadmill and I liked the idea of being able to keep my iphone by me in case I got a call (so I could see who was calling) instead of having it connected away from me at the TV with the HDMI cable. Also, since I run on the treadmill and it's noisy I listen to the videos on my iphone with blu tooth headphones. Now with the hdmi adapter I can have the video go out through the cable and have the audio sent to my blu tooth headphones. With the apple TV it is all or nothing. If you send the video to the tv you have to send the audio there as well. And if you send the audio to the blu tooth the tv will remain blank.I see this as such an easy fix, but for some reason apple will not allow you to split the audio and video outs.
summary: Video is choppy if you don't have a good Wifi Router. Also can't split Audio and Video outs (ex: Video to TV Audio to Blu Tooth)

reviewText: The Apple TV is great. You can use it for netflix, hulu, hbo go, etc... You can use your iphone or ipad to control it. The air play feature is my favorite. With airplay i can wireless display anything on my iphone, ipad, or MacBook Pro. I stream movies and videos to my 50" tv with no problems.Other great features:ITunes RadioRent or buy movies right on the deviceCons:The only thing i wish would be possible on this model... Jailbreak!!!To allow for even more customization and applications.

The Apple TV UI is significantly better than the UI for streaming apps on my Sony DVD player. It starts up quickly and streams HD HBO GO and Netflix without any lag. I don't have an apple device but just for streaming, it's been great.

The Apple TV was very easy to install and use.  I am very impressed with it.  We use Apple videos, Netflix, and view Apple pictures and videos.  We especially like the ability to display iPad screen and music on the big screen HD-TV and sound system.  Our iPhone 4s also work well with the Apple TV.  Great product!  I programmed the Harmony remote to control the Apple TV with the HD-TV, receiver and speakers system.  Wow!

The Apple TV works, but setting it up is a challenge. I'm no novice to technology and I followed the prompts carefully, but could not get the Apple TV to recognize my iPad even though both showed up on the same WiFi. I searched the Apple website and internet for troubleshooting tips (not very useful) and ended up just trying as many things as I could think of, including starting over, shutting down, etc. I can't explain why, but it suddenly worked. I then attempted to set it up on a different WiFi in a different location, with the same results (long period of trial and error, followed by sudden connection after starting over, shutting down, etc.). Next came a different TV on the same WiFi, with yes, the same results. This is a pretty cool product, but my advice if you plan on using it for anything important is to set it up well in advance and leave it connected. No telling how long it will take.
The item is the same one that is sold for $99.00.  It may be the "latest" version but it is certainly not a new version.

The main reason I purchased this was to stream iTunes from my computer to my home theater speakers.  I spent a total of more than two hours, on two separate occasions, with Apple support and 1 hour with D-Link (Apple claimed it was my router, it wasn't).  Finally Apple said their software was not the problem and it was probably a problem with Windows and he referred me to an article in the "Apple Communities".  Of course I gave up and returned it.  Sonos, here I come.By the way, all other functions of the box worked fine.

The new 1080P Apple TV is pretty much the same as the Apple TV 2 except that it can output 1080P video. The Apple website says that to stream HD movies you need a internet connection at least 8Mbps but our internet was capable of streaming it smoothly after about a 10 minute buffering period.

The order arrived a day ahead of schedule and was packaged very well, with multiple air packets to keep it secure. The box was in condition as good as or better than you'd find on the shelf of an Apple Store.
The prufoemance of the product is slow, I dont know if it just internet connection (comcast) but it skips alot.
The rating is based on fact HBO GO, Amazon Video, as well as others can't be streamed by Air Play.  If Air Play could be used,  this product would get a 5 star rating.

This and my iphone 5s are the best purchases I have made in the last 20 years!  I stream all my movies from my computer through it, plays music, streams all my photos on my computer though the screen saver and so much more.  I use it every day and love it.  I had it hooked up to my wifi in 5 minutes.  Ultra user friendly and even my great grandma was able to hook it up no problem.  Love it way more than my Roku since Roku won't stream movies from my hard drive, Roku won't play movies and slide shows directly from my iphone to my 52 inch TV and Roku won't stream photos from my computer hard drive.
summary: This is the gadget of the decade!!

reviewText: This Apple TV works exactly as advertised. Took a little getting used to commands and prccedures but it works perfectly.

This device is a little larger than a hockey puck, yet it does so much more. Altough I do suppose you could play hockey with it. Wouldn't be the wisest thing to do, and probably doesn't meet hockey regulations. So, to those of you who relegate to using the Apple TV for media viewing here is my review.It's only connection is via HDMI. I tried a HDMI to DVI connector for an old TV and it didn't work. Apple TV has worked on all newer TVs i've tried using HDMI.You get Hulu, Netflix, and a few others. Sorry no Amazon Video with it... yet (hey Amazon take a hint - we want u on Apple tv).The Apple TV is very reliable, requiring almost no reboots. System errors are so rare that I've yet to encounter one. Software updates are occasional (quartely'ish) and do take about 15 minutes to fully apply.
This iis the second one I've purchased.  This time for the bedroom tv.  Easy to install.  No problems. Now  I can watch my PC ITunes movies in the comfort of my own bed.
This is a good device, works well with my Panasonic 42 inches screen, with my MacBook Pro, Iphone or Ipad. It's good made but a little bit expensive.

This is a great addition. Now stream your music from iPad  iTouch 4 using airplay and the cloud. Everything works great! You can't beat the price and just to be able to watch iTunes festival it's worth the price.  You will need a good broadband throughput, I have 15mbps and together it's excellent in 1080p.

This is a great streaming device. My only complaints are as follows.1.) It has to use iTunes which is inconsistent and full of bugs.2.) Once you import your media library to iTunes, it is an unorganized mess.Essentially, if you want it for Netflix, ESPN, HBOGo or Hulu, its a great little box.

This is a must have accessory for anybody that has a iTunes on their computer. The simple ability to stream to my new TV was reason alone to get this product and the ease of setup and use makes this the best.
This is an incredible device that allows streaming of ITune content stright to TV. I'm sure it does far more and does it well. It's Apple after all

This is a solid product and works very well.  I am using it with the 3rd generation iPad and am very happy.  I am also using the built in Netflix's and Hulu apps and they work great.  This is an inexpensive way to upgrade a TV to have "smart" features as well as getting the content of your apple device on your TV.

reviewText: This is a wonderful product.  It is less expensive than buying direct from Apple.  Easy to install and operate!  So glad I invested in this.

This is not as polished as their phones, tablets, and computers, but it is okay.  Obviously no Android phone-based remote control, but Apple people could care less about that anyway.  I like that it doesn't ask for a credit card.
This item works great and meets all expectations.  It is a great value for price.  Have used it for over a month with no issues.

This little box is fantastic!  Unlike cable where I have been paying for lots and lots of channels I never watch, here I can choose what I want to pay for.  This, along with the antenna I bought from Amazon so I can receive local channels, will allow me to get rid of cable.  I have figured costs with this setup compared to cable and I will save a lot of money.  Thanks Apple!!

This small but powerful little device  has exceeded my expectations.  If you have an iPad or iPhone you can see all of your videos or pictures on your TV... Some great third party apps as well... Well worth the $99.  Did I mention it now comes in HD for a great looking picture.

This thing is slightly proprietary, in that it is very easy to use, not that easily customizable. There are cheaper products that do the same thing, but for system integration, this thing was a charm. It also helps if you can afford to subscribe to all the services that you can stream
This was a gift for my husband and we both love it.  Still finding out all the things it can do.
too slow and not enough channel options.

To start with, yes I am a little bit of a techy. Have Cablevision along with Sat TV subscription so why would I want to have not just one Apple TV but 7 you may ask?Quite simple.... If you own either anApple iPhone 3G 8GB - Unlocked,Apple iPod touch 32GB Black (4th Generation) CURRENT MODELorApple iPad MC705LL/A (16GB, Wi-Fi, Black) NEWEST MODEL, the AppleTV goes together like peanut butter and jam! Even if you use the most basic feature of air play in order to play photo's or video's from your iphone or ipad through the Apple TV and bam! onto your 55 inch TV (in my case) or you get a little more creative with yourApple Mac Mini MC815LL/A Desktop (NEWEST VERSION)orApple MacBook Air MD231LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop (NEWEST VERSION)and setup your Apple TV to work with your iTunes music so that anywhere you have a TV in your home you can basically have your music library.Then you have to add the fact that if you are a NetFlix subscriber (USA or Canada) that is another reason for an Apple TV.If you want to watch or listen to your favorite video or audio podcast, presto Apple TV delivers again (sometimes drives my poor wife nuts with me watching technology reviews - but hey each to there own)!Hands down, for the small cost of the Apple TV, this mainly PC guy loves the bang for the buck that the Apple TV delivers.Okay, so why do I say almost perfect? Well the only issue that I have is that putting the Apple TV to sleep is not a simple one button or timed task and well sometimes very rarely the Apple TV remote does not response as quickly as preferred.
To watch a movie from iTunes takes for ever. I want to see the movie right away, like, google play.
Two weeks later. The remote stopped working. I was so upset. After trying different options, I found out the remote battery is dead.
Typical Apple product, very simple to set up and works  without bring in a team of engineers. This is my second Apple TV and I highly recommend it.
Un excelente producto . Trabaja muy bien con el internet de banda ancha. Da una nueva dimensión a la televisión y el cine en casa. Muy satisfecho , lo recomiendo sin reservas .
Unlike some other electronic equipment, this was easy to install and begin using.  It was reasonably priced and is small enough to be tucked away in our media cabinet. It works perfectly.

Very easy and with a little setup for wi-fi, your up and running. The only thing it does out of the ordinary, is the remote shares volume and starts movies on the Mac. Could be operator error. Happy with this device.

VERY easy to install and the price was better than the Apple store when I purchased this unit. Love that it synchs up so easily with my other Apple products and my TV. Be sure to order an HDMI cable too. I highly recommend Amazons Basic HDMI cables. Inexpensive and they work great without fail.
Very limited on what content is availble.  Price for device not bad but price for movies,shows to much.  And limited to iTunes
Very pleased
We have a smart TV in our living room, but nothing in our bedroom. This has been great to access Netflix and other apps. Good purchase!

We have just about all apple products we love it we had an older version that he gave away to a friend then he found himself missing it so I brought this for his birthday and he loves it like-he did the older one

We liked our ROKU and love our Apple TVs.This is our second (first was only 720i). The 1080p of this allows Netflix's SuperHD to show the pores on the noses and hair in their ears (OK so that's not as pretty it's cracked up to be).Quicker and smoother than the older model, and we love being able to stream the pics from our iPhone, iPad to it to stir up memories. Heck, even other people's pictures from their iPhones as well!And we travel quite a bit, so we often steam the movies we purchased on it to the iPad when in remote locations - to the RV and Hotel rooms.

reviewText: We love our Apple TV for its ability to consolidate and use minimal steps to get to programming. Highly recommend!

We're still not sure this is really working in sync with the TV's (2 in home). Granted we have a 2007 iMac running IOS 10 updated as far as we can go with IOS and iMac; so we are not really sure when there appears to be conflict and we get odd messages on TV.  Since we are not die hard Apple users, the jury is still out.

reviewText: We use it primarily for Netflix, and I have to find the movie on my computer and type it in to  the TV because this is hard to navigate

We use this daily. It is great for streaming tv shows to our tv since we don't have cable. Love everything about it!Update 6/24/2014We still use this daily. We just started using it to stream games from ESPN and that has been great for us!

When I use Airplay to put my Macbook Air's screen on my TV, the audio doesn't come through. I did everything I could think of and went to Apple's support forums and learned this is a common problem ever since Apple's latest software update.For now, the only work around is unplug the power cord from the AppleTV and let it do a "hard" reboot, and to reboot my Macbook Air... then they will play nicely together for a session.When you think about it, AppleTV's OS, OSX Mavericks, iOS7 and iWork all have problems right now. Apple's software doesn't seem to be keeping pace quality-wise with its hardware these days.
When you finally decide to let us add or remove channels freely like a roku device, I will change this to 5 stars.

reviewText: Why would anyone waste money on cable ever again? This changed my life, and saved me about $50 a month.
Wish I HAD KNOWN when ordering that I HAD TO HAVE THE CABLE (WHICH WAS NOT INCLUEDED) I ordered a week or so later to set it up!!!  Sissy Quinn

Without the ability to watch amazon and add content apps not games my tv alone does 99 % of what this thing does.If I had a tv without internet I would not recommend this unless your entire library of content is on your computer.  Look elsewhere.

reviewText: Absolutely one of the best purchases I have ever made! It was affordable, and keeps me entertained in my down-time.

Advertising for the AppleTV states that you can mirror the monitor of a Mac (say a laptop) so long as you have OS X 10.8 (Mountain Lion). The fine print is that you need to be running a laptop from 2010-2011 or newer. If you have older hardware, even if you are running OS X 10.8, you are out of luck. It is interesting (if not, telling) that Amazon's product description for the AppleTV only describes iOS mirroring. To me, that seems like a subtle warning that Apple does not strongly promote the use of AppleTV for mirroring a Mac's display.
Another great Apple Product. Would be a six star if Apple and Disney would develop the WatchESPN app for the Apple TV

Apple makes good products but I was hoping to stream hulu or NFL Sunday ticket to my Apple TV. Well those apps and many others do not allow for streaming video to Apple TV. It really only works for iTunes purchases and then make sure you have a fast internet connection because it takes as long as the tv show or movie to download it before you can watch it.It did not fit what I was looking for and wanted.  Make sure you know that it is limited before you buy.

Apple TV has a serious contents issue - Every stream service cost money and/or more expensive than Roku. For instance, same movie cost more to rent from Apple TV than from Roku. Unless you have definite needs or you're an "applenatic"; the Roku box is a much better buy.Another problem is its wireless capabilities, although both the Apple TV and the Roku boxes are located next to each other, the Roku box can stream faster and more consistently than Apple TV (go figure!). If you do decide to still buy an Apple TV, then make sure to connect it using ethernet, no wireless

Apple TV, like most Apple products is well designed and very easy to use. My 4-yr-old loves using the remote and selecting his own Netflix shows. It does everything Apple says it can without a hitch. No complaints here.

Bought the Apple TV because we have other Apple products and expected the interface among products to be least problematic. Found a bit of a learning curve, but not bad. Wife was disappointed because she expected more from the TV than what it was designed to deliver. Be sure you know what it does and what it is intended to do before you buy. We hooked it up via an adapter to an older analog TV which does not do it justice. Pictures are pretty good, but text on the older TV is blurry. Not good enough to allow sharing emails with a larger family audience on the TV screen.
Christmas gift looks good it's for my grandson he will be flying in for holiday won't no anymore until after holidays

Easy to hook up but all of my purchased movies don't show up.  About 1/3 of my collection can't be streamed from the cloud because they aren't showing up as purchased.  After about a couple hours of "Apple Support" still can't access them.  Also, there are not as many choices to stream from.  Overall okay, but disappointed at the $99 price point.
El apple tv llegó a tiempo y bien empaquetado. Lo probé en mi tv  y funciona de maravillas, es ideal para ver películas y series con netfix
fast, HD, airplay, nice looking, good quality.fast, HD, airplay, nice looking, good quality.fast, HD, airplay, nice looking, good quality.
Great
Great product by all standards. Got it as a gift and it sure does what it promises! Its amazing how the remote control works seamlessly with other devices such as the mac. Couldn't be happier.

I bought an Apple TV when there were fewer options on the market for a streaming device (no Chromecast, no Amazon box, fewer Rokus) and since then it has been utterly eclipsed in functionality, reliability and price. Many of the functions require you to be using ONLY Apple products, and NEWER Apple products. My 2009 Macbook Pro (with updated software) cannot mirror screens to the Apple TV. But that is far from the worst of it.Apple TV will not allow you to install newer Apps, so there is no Amazon Instant Video, no internet browser or any other useful apps. You can stream from your iOS device, but it is slow. The remote app for iPad or iPhone seems like something that was made in an afternoon and then forgot about for years. Useless.My top issue with the Apple TV is reliability. Almost half the times I try to stream Netflix I get errors or the connection drops out. Buy a Roku. Or a Chromecast. Apple TV is an outdated, forgotten product.

I bought Apple TV mostly to be able to wirelessly stream movies and other programs from my iPad.  The channels directly available on the device were pretty much the same that I could get from my Samsung tv, so the airplay from my ipad was important. Well, I just can't get the airplay to work.  I went to all the blogs and support sites and it seems like it's a common problem.  So, I gave up and bought a roku 3 and it's great. I can get all kinds of new channels, many fee, some paid. I think it will allow me to downgrade my satellite tv channels and save a lot of money each month.

I bought one as a present and ended up buying one for myself as well.I was mostly won over by Airplay integration and figured the default apps would be a nice add-on.I come to find out that Pandora is missing and you can't control the volume on Netflix or any Home Sharing or any other way besides streaming a song via your iphone.Pretty disappointed.I will be either taking it back or installing Plex on it if a Jailbreak becomes available soon.

I find that I enjoy my roku so much more than this.  It's ok, but it doesn't have the channels I'm used to with the roku.  The only good thing about it is the airplay... when it works.  Airplay is really only good when both the iOS device and the Apple TV are on a fast wifi connection with good signal strength, or when you can plug it into ethernet.I don't think I'll be keeping this, the roku seams to have more of the content I am used to, with an easier to use interface.
summary: Don't like it as well as the Roku

reviewText: If you don't have an Apple TV, time to remedy that! So easy to set up and so convenient to watch anything on your TV that can access on your computer.

I got an Air recently and thought this would be a great replacement for the PC plugged into the tv.  Airplay would be really cool!Nope to both.  The apps were slow and clunky and the video quality was worse.  The home screen is full of stuff I don't want on my home screen (that's very very minor, though).  The Apple TV only works on wifi, so despite being 1 foot from my router and having an Ethernet port it still had to be wireless.  Not sure why they won't just let it work on the Ethernet port.  But airplay only worked (the little it worked) on wifi.Netflix is something we use daily.  We both hated the app on Apple TV.  Slow and clunky.Same for crunchy roll.I didn't notice an Amazon instant video app, so that means we still need the PC.I'd have still kept it if airplay worked well.  But it didn't.  In fact airplay got netflix to work ONCE.  After that it didn't work again.  I wasted my one use on Red Dwarf.  (The holoship episode).Sadly that was also the case for airplaying my display from the Air.  It worked one time after trying half a dozen times.  That one time it was not impressive, the display was in a window on screen.  At no time did the display scale and fill the screen so it was too small to really see.  I tried it a dozen times after that and it didn't work again.  The Air would try and try.  A couple times the Apple TV went black but didn't display the Air screen.What was cool is that my TiVo came up when I tried to airplay one time.  I will have to check that out.  The letters wore off my TiVo remote so I couldn't get my password punched in, but I'm intrigued.  If I can airplay to my TiVo I really don't need Apple TV.I wanted to love it as much as I f'n love this ipad Air, but I couldn't.  It just isn't ready to replace a PC plugged the tv.  I want to give it two stars, but I realize that not everyone has a PC or the layout for that to work.  If I didn't have a PC I'd have probably loved it, even without the airplay. I'd have said 4 stars in that case.  Hey diddle diddle, a three.
summary: Underwhelming compared to my current setup of a PC hdmi'd to the tv but cool if you don't have that

reviewText: I got this along with the TimeCapsule 2 in hopes of being able to stream my movies from one to the other directly.  Turns out it will only stream media from a computer running iTunes.  That greatly limits the formats that can be played and is a pain having to turn on a new device.  Worst of all, you can't jailbreak this model so for me, it was practically useless.

I  had great hopes for Apple TV but no such luck. To start off if you want to use the remote you hands better be the size of ten year old, so useless for me. This by itself makes the device unusable, but there are other problems, I have wireless extender so I can get a signal in my back yard. Well at some points in my house you get both signals, if your Iphone is not on the same network the Apple TV, you are out of luck. You have to stop and change to the same network. So do buy if you have mulitple networks in your house. The media choices are pretty limited, so unless you plan on spending a lot of money at the Itunes store you are out of luck.All I wanted was a device that would project my Iphone to my TV. I think I will just hook up a PC and get a wireless keyboard and mouse.

I have been wanting this little gadget for quite sometime, and just went ahead and took the plundge! what an awesome device!!! No more blu ray purchases. Its amazing how much one can do with this thing. I got it at best buy and used my reward zone card and saved 10.00. Nice! never a boring moment. I do not recall watching regular t.v since I got it. To busy watching youtube videos, and downloading music and movies. Also...watching trailers. Was excited to watch the cross fit games on ESPN. Very coool. Screw cable! who needs it!!! just an extra bill!!! No thanks. So run!!! go buy one..and for the record. I did do my research, and this apple tv...might not have as many apps as others..but its UI is easy and simple.  =-0)
summary: GOOD BYE BLU RAYS!!! AMAZING GADGET!!!

reviewText: I have most Apple products, iPods, iPads, iMac and iPhones. I must say I preferred iOS6 to iOS7 but by far the worst Apple product I have used is Apple TV. It frequently requires power cycling, loses network connectivity in the middle of streaming and has one of the worst user interfaces anyone has produced. They keep adjusting scrolling speed in every release, but don't seem capable of producing a usable one. They need to look for a radically different solution obviously, but they keep beating this dead horse.What is shocking on top of it is how bad the Apple Remote app is. What is wrong with the team designing these? They should take a look at "Mouse Pro" to see what a touch remote interface should look like. If Apple TV is a hobby, then Apple should look for something else to spend their free time on.

I have no quibble with the product itself, but what's the deal with absolutely NO setup information accompanying the tv unit? Not even a web address to go to for support and/or hookup instructions! I was left on my own to cast about Apple sites to find any instructions. Once I found them they weren't as helpful as they could have been for a technology tyro. It didn't help that the illustration of a remote didn't match the remote provided. The buttons that were illustrated aren't the ones on the actual remote, and the instructions only refer to the illustrated buttons, not the actual buttons. This made setup a miserable, frustrating experience. Nothing like the ease with which you can use any other Apple product "right out of the box".

I like the Apple TV, it lets me share movies from my Mac Mini to my TV as well as ITunes and HuluPlus. But I wish there was a way to shut off that EXTREMELY annoying women's voice every time I click on a new link. It is often too fast, whiny and mispronounces words. Apple representatives if you are reading, give us an update to shut off her obnoxious voice. Thank you.
summary: I like it, but the voice is irritating!

reviewText: I'm an apple fan and really wanted to like this product. I gave it six months before I finally got fed up with the limitations. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone when there are so many capable and more economical products out there. Look elsewhere.
summary: Nowhere near as good as the competition.

reviewText: i'm not sure if it's my lack of technical expertise or the fact that all my other apple equipment experience has been so good but, so far, the apple tv is a waste of money.

Ingenious toy coupled with absurdity by Apple thuggery, form over functionUnless you're a complete Apple monastic like myself, owning everything Apple makes, ala iphone, mac air, macbooks etc (and even, myself, having the apple logo tattooed on your wrist)., the intrinsic usage of the Apple TV box will infuriate you to the point of hanging a noose over a rafter to 'end it all' vis a vis the infuriatingly useless and pathetic remote that comes with this unit. Wonderfully downloadable from the Apple app-store is the "remote" program such that I can with my Ipad or Iphone do quick and easy searches on youtube or netflix quickly and wonderfully scrolling thru the screen and using a genuine though small keyboard on the ipad and iphone;  however if you are not the owner of said device(s), you will find Apples typical insane thuggery and near-perverse dedication to packaging its products in the smallest oragami sized packaging possible along with equally small and form over function (vs. ideal form following and mirroring/mating with function) hardware.Such is the case of the Apple TV remote, which is creepy to hold, thin as a bookmark, and feeling (to the blind) like holding a surgical knife, and having only 3 buttons, of which if you want to do a search on your wifi network for youtube vids etc etc. you will scream havoc and damnation upon the heads of Apple for making what I'm sure they thought at the time as a "cute understated and 'hip' looking remote control".Answer would have logically have been to include a touch sensitive pad to the top of the remote as the Apple magic mouse has and a $5 HDMI cable and charge $20 more for the unit package to cover the hardware production costs to the enduser to accommodate those who, unlike myself, are not monastic devotees to Apple and its array of products. I own 18 Apple products and have branded my body permanently with its corporate logo and advocate heavily for its OS and computers, as such I feel both logically and with evidences from experience in use of this product, to not only cry foul upon this absurdity of user-interface insanity, but proof of my dedication to Apple Inc. and not be, as there are out there, many Apple-phobics/haters. Dont buy this product unless you ALREADY own another Apple-created search tool (iphone or ipad). Searches and typing with this remote are an utterly insane non-starter; all the more so important since many buy this as a web portal video search interface for their TV.
summary: Ingenious toy coupled with absurdity by Apple thuggery, form over function

reviewText: I no longer had my original Apple TV, and would NOT settle for anything less. Roku is cheesy, and half the product that the Apple TV is. I would buy one for every TV if I watched that much
summary: Apple nailed it with this product

reviewText: 'iPad3,  ''Appletv3'''''! Very good ! Air play is wonderful on Youtube and PPS.note:Mirror display quality is not so high. Just accepted .

reviewText: I really like the ability to throw my iphone or ipad up on the tv with this easy device.  This is my second one, and it seems to work a bit better than the older one.  This one is available to my iphone when the older one sometimes doesn't want to be found or stay connected.  Super device though!
I really like this camera. It is relatively inexpensive and works very well with Blue Iris. It has a nice wide clear image and does not need to be reset often like the other cheap knockoffs.
It's like a high-end Roku box...Apple knows how to do content well.  We use it everyday with iPad, iPhone and TV connections. Nice wireless viewing from laptop too.
I use this device to stream content to a TV that is not connected to a cable line.  It works very well.  Highly recommended

I've had my Apple TV for about two years now and a month ago I bought a BluRay player with wifi. I spent $99 on my Apple TV and $55 on my Sony BluRay player, and if I had to give one up, I'd give up my Apple TV. The BluRay player lets you access everything the Apple TV does and much, much more including your Amazon purchases. The only thing the BluRay player doesn't have is iTunes, but that's something I can live with. In addition, you can also play BluRay discs and regular DVDs as well. The only pluses the Apple TV has are that it has a smaller footprint and the interface is more attractive, but I have plenty of room and as long as it does what it's supposed to do, I don't care what the menu looks like. Like Apple TV, you can also control the BluRay player using the TVSideView app on your iPhone. I love Apple products, but save your money and get more bang for your buck with a BluRay player with wifi instead of this.
summary: Save some money and get a BluRay player with wifi instead

reviewText: Sounds like it works well, but what good is it to me if I can't get what I want. I have most of my movies digitized on Vudu so if Vudu is not available on apple tv why would I want it. Also I don't see being able to access Disney Movie Anywhere, so again why would I want it.

reviewText: The description on the Amazon product page says it mirrors "ipad content" but I didn't learn that actually it only mirrors iPhone 4 or iPad 2 and 3 until after I bought and hooked up the Apple TV device.  Well, guess which two products I have that I wanted to mirror the content with but can't.  Very disappointed the description didn't state this.
