reviewText: The first step in my move away was an indoor leaf antenna.  This is vital for getting the local channels.Next up, purchasing an Apple TV.  I own a PS4 and PS3, so I already have access to the majority of the apps.  However, the ESPN app was unavailable to me because I guess MS is paying to keep that app off Sony consoles.  Me being a sports fan, I had to have ESPN.  So I purhcased an Apple TV.What I loveThe design.  This box is tiny.  It takes up no space. Set up was very simple and easy.  Understand to activate ESPN and HBOGo you're going to need go on their websites and enter a code.  The picture is great and the airplay feature is kinda cool.What I'm not so in love withThe remote.  It's friggin small and begging to fall into the couch vortex.What I'm disappointed with:Airplay.  There are a few apps that aren't available on apple tv that are available on my ipad and I was really hoping I could mirror what's on my ipad to my tv (like watching the TNT app on my tv).  Unfortunately, you can't do this for whatever reason.  You can mirror photos, music, games, etc...but not certain entertainment apps.Overall, I'm happy.  I got what I wanted. ESPN!!!! And I'm sure the other stuff will be useful as well. Great product.
summary: I guess this is goodbye forever, cable companies

reviewText: The good: It's an easy to install little box that connects to the local WiFi network easily. It's pretty quick to go from in the box to up and running. The controller is sleek and stylish, and it's pretty intuitive to use.The bad: Do you use Amazon Prime to watch videos? Too bad. This thing won't do that. In fact, if you use anything other than iTunes, Netflix, or Hulu+, you're out of luck. Like Spotify? Too bad. Pandora only. It's very limited, and there's really not much chance of getting anything else any time soon here. It might be a better idea to look at a Roku. $50 less and you can do more. Even if its controller doesn't have Apple's classic, minimalist, styling, it's a more useful box.
summary: Too locked in to Apple to be useful if you aren't.

reviewText: There are two bad things about this Apple TV(1) When I play YouTube, and I hit the history video, it always shows the title image of that video and then show "This video is not available"If I type the video site directly, I can get it. I am sure this is Apple's software bug. This never happen when I use PC.(2) It is very difficult to type the characters and numbers. Not very user friendly.

This is a tuff review because it depends on how you are reviewing it.  If you are reviewing it as a upgrade to the 720p appletv, then it can't be anything but negative.  if it's about the device in general, there are real positives about it.  My score reflected the upgrade route.  In general, you may hardly ever get to that point where the 1080p upgrade is noticeable.Your mileage with appletv is going to be dependant on your adherance to the IOS environment.  If you are a massive investor into purchasing/renting from the itunes environment, this device is absolutely fantastic.  also, if you are heavy into the ios environment with other devices, the airplay feature can potentially be very nice.  I like the fact that past digital movies activated via past dvd/blu ray disc purchases are there available for streaming.  The negative is the stream you get is sd.  Conversely, if you did an ultraviolet digital movie from a dvd/blu ray purchase and that movie is available on vudu(the setup on this is convuluted), via a roku, xbox or ps3, you can get a hd 1080p digital stream.  on the airplay front, its convenient to be able to do that to the appletv but if its for a game, the resolution hit can get gross.  airplay is a ridiculously finicky piece of tech and even under the best of the best network environments, getting a great resolution is rare.  when compared to using a direct hdmi connection to an ios device, its night and day on the quality front.  I have gotten it to the point where it does look really good over airplay but compared to direct hdmi, no comparison.  and to even get it to that, took a bit of work.If you don't airplay or don't purchase much from itunes, you are probably buying this for netflix.  in this situation, buy the roku.  the roku is an app beast, you get amazon prime video, hbogo, vudu, and on and on....the app offering on the appletv is paltry at best.for me, it's a mixed bag.  I do airplay quite a bit.  Also, I am heavily invested in to flickr which is one of the rare apps the appletv does have.  I love controlling the appletv from my phone or ipad as we watch our family photos thru the appletv from flickr.  I also have the fortune of owning many other devices so I can get my app fill from my network smart tv, ps3, 360, etc so for me, what roku offers in spades as it's advantages, i get from other devices anyways.  it leaves the appletv as a great device for me from which to do so airplay gaming or browsing and flickr.It's an extremely limited device, if you fall within that tiny, tiny sphere, you are going to love it.  if not, way, way better purchases can be made.
summary: not an upgrade, very limited in features

reviewText: This is the second one I've bought.  My first one was given to me as a gift and now i buy them as gifts.  I love apple tv!
This is usable if you have plenty of apple devices used home,I have taken 1 star out cause it is not customized and you have to take what available their to watch...

This thing is amazing. I can't believe it does everything that it does. I was disappointed that it didn't have ITunes but then it did (BAM!)an update and had it. I have to give it 5 stars though I'd like to take away 3/8 of a star for the awful, terrible, annoying voice that announces new screens. I guess if that's my only complaint, then I'm pretty satisfied.

UPDATE: based on the following comment from Diane O., I have upgraded to 5 stars:Dianne O. says:Apple TV now supports Amazon Instant Video : http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/amazon-instant-video-app-now-supports-airplay-and-apple-tv/Bought this when I was first finding out about streaming video. Had already started streaming through our Wii and thought it was great and a friend recommended Apple TV. The graphics and video interface is really nice, and I like the slim metal remote (though it is EASILY lost in the couch cushions), however had I known then what I know now, I would have skipped Apple and went right for Roku, simply because Apple does not have an interface for Amazon Prime Video.  Later on bought a Roku 2 for $58 and love it, supports both Netflix and Amazon Prime, plus a whole bunch of other free streaming sites.

We have been using our Xbox 360 to stream Netflix for years and love it. We got this apple TV for Christmas so we could stream netflix in our room (so the Xbox can stay in the family room) and so far it is not living up to the hype. We've had a lot of problems with the streaming quality and freezing up- every time we think we've solved the issue it happens again.My husbands biggest complaint is the remote, which is very small. Tiny, in fact. It's probably 3 inches long by about an inch wide. It's very hard to keep up with.My biggest complaint is that the netflix format/commands are different from the xbox version of netflix, which is more user friendly. I suppose this could be a netflix issue, but regardless if you are like us and have both -- it can be very frustrating. There is no "play next episode" option or auto play 3 in a row --every time an episode ends you have to go back two menus and scroll down to select a new episode. Maybe not a problem if you are just going to watch one movie, but if you want to watch multiple episodes of a season - it's annoying.Pros: Good price for streaming device (vs. another xBox 360), some cool features like photo-synching with iPhone and ability to watch Apple Movie Trailers.

We like our Apple TV. We have a Samsung Smart TV too but we prefer Apple's clean, clutter-free interface. It is quick and intuitive and the remote is the perfect size when you already have a clunky TV remote taking up table space.It loses a star for its non-customizability. You can't move any of the apps around or add/remove the ones you use the most. Something I didn't realize when we purchased it... The Apple TV 3 is not jailbreakable. If that matters to you, buy the 2 instead.
We use this to stream Netflix on my ipad mini and it works great. It took some time to get it working through the wifi, but well worth it.
What can I say it's apple so why wouldn't I like it yea you should buy itIt's awsome  co

Worked great for a few weeks, with a few minor connectivity issues. Now after I can't return it, major connectivity issues. I tried all the help recommendations relating to connectivity, but it was only fixed temporarily.
Worked well and easy to install....just needed a little  walk thru on the TV  itself.I can wait to use the full potential of the system..Price on Amazon always  less than outside retailers

reviewText: I bought this to allow vendors to Airplay on to my large format display, to this end the product is a failure.  The key issue is that both devices must attach to the same network, unfortunately Apple TV will not do Enterprise Security, and you can't likely allow a vendor to join that network even if you could.  Needless to say this is not for use around any business network.  As for home, I have a ROKU box that gives me infinitely more choices than Apple TV.  Basically, if you have an Ipad or Iphone, Airplay at home would be cool, but on the whole this product fails as a streaming media player, you are essentially limited to Itunes, Netflix, MLB, and a couple useless other channels.  Cannot add channels from what I can tell.
summary: Not for Business Use on Large Format Display

reviewText: If you are buying Apple TV for Airplay and Netflix and Hulu and other things, it works great and thats the reason I have given 2 stars. If you are buying it for Home Sharing.. GOOD LUCK!!! At one point of time, Home Sharing worked great but now my 2 Apple TVs cannot play any iTunes content from my PC or Mac. Forums and Blogs are filled up with this problem. I paid Apple to resolve the issue and they were absolutely clueless. It was a total waste of money. I have tried every solution that was posted to fix this issue for few months now. Fortunately, I did not sell my WDTV Live boxes and I have now gone back to using them to play my content. Best thing about WDTV is that you don't need to convert the media in Apple readable format. Coming back to Apple TV, for me, its a paperweight at this point. I have run out of all the options and solutions. Home Sharing is a major function of ATV and it does not work as advertised. Apple needs to fix it just like their new maps. Unless they fix this, I DO NOT RECOMMEND this product to anyone.
summary: Its a Brick when it comes to Home Sharing

reviewText: I get these to mostly do airplay wireless mirroring to my TV's from either my iPhone 4s, ipad or mac-book. they're pretty cool, but beside from that, it's lacking a lot of feature most other cheaper media player has. like theRoku HD Streaming PlayerorD-Link Boxee Box HD Media Player with HDMI, USB and 802.11n Wireless-Enabled Ethernet Port - Refurbished (DSM-380/RE)

I have become a convert to Apple because of how easy it is to use their products. This is the first time I have been disappointed. I wanted to use the mirroring feature--wirelessly project whatever was on my laptop to the flat screen in my bedroom. It was easy to set up, but I tried to play a movie, and I could not get audio. I called Apple and they told me that my macbook air was probably not compatible, which was not true. Then I was told that my router was probably not powerful enough. (I just bought a time capsule so that was not it). I then was routed to technical, and talking to them, it sounded as if other people were having this issue. Final resolution was that I probably had some type of interference that was disrupting the audio. It turns out when I tried the apple tv in another room it did work, however the volume thru the flat screen TV is still supressed. Apple's final recommendation is that I connect the device with an ethernet cable. If I wanted to go that route I could just have connected my laptop the flat screen to begin with.

I jumped on the Apple bandwagon years ago starting with a classic iPod.  Back then, they were so far ahead technologically - there was little choice.  Over the years, their interface between their products and iTunes has drastically declined and become more frustrating and buggy.This new Apple TV was bought to replace my old Gen 1 when the old one quit accessing the Apple Store due to a bug in the software (which Apple still has yet to fix!).  I get this new unit all set up and it's got a problem staying connected to my library.  Yes, my computer stays on all the time.  However, IF you let the Apple TV SLEEP - it WILL DISCONNECT & NOT RECONNECT until you shut off your computer and the Apple TV and re-boot.Apple leaves it's users to post hundreds of posts trying to get help from each other - rather than supporting their products personally.  It's alarming.  I'm seeing more and more of my friends switching to other products - especially phones (Android, Samsung, etc.).  I'm appalled that they'd switch - then I run into these issues.  Apple is slowly dying.  I'm sad that they are focused on the volume - rather than fixing & maintaining the products they already produce.Bottom line:While the new Apple TV is an improvement over the old - it's frustrating to keep connected and why bother having a power saving feature that you can't even use?  The price is right - but you get what you pay for!!  I paid $300 for my original Apple TV - and loved it - because even if you were disconnected - you had a hard drive full of content to play anywhere.

In Feb 2011 I purchased a MacPro 13 which I expected to interface with the new Apple tv about to come out. But, `No', Apple did not grandfather my virtually new Apple laptop so my Apple TV is worthless to me as a wireless streaming device. But even as a wired-in device I've found it doesn't handle the video formats I need, and has no capacity for add-on memory. But...I also purchased the next-to-last generation ROKU-2XD which has a BIG memory upgrade slot (USB) which I use with a 128 gig (!!!) flash drive - plenty for movies, family shots, music.  Enough said.
summary: Extremely Limited Apple TV - Buy Roku

reviewText: It doesn't work with Netflix....locks up, freezes, loses the netflix connection, one or all of the above. If you like Netflix don't buy this product.
summary: If you like Netflix don't buy this product

reviewText: It's basically what I expected, but the account logic process was more difficult than it should have been, and it still won't run a software update, every time I try it, it fails. It also still won't see my iTunes library, even though everything is set up correctly. The video portion of AirPlay works great, but mirroring the screen of the iPhone or iPad, or laptop looks like crap. I still like it for airplay, but it's not anywhere near my expectations for an Apple device.
summary: Decent, but not up to my expectations for an Apple device

reviewText: It's no AppleTV2. Until it's jailbroken Ruku is cheaper, has more apps and works with analog TV. Itunes comes out ahead with AppleTV3.
It was what our daughter wanted for a present. I do not know what it does but it was what she wanted.
I was kind bought this item because I bought an iPad.  It's working fine so far.  But I don't use it that often.  I would not recommend it to just anyone unless you have $100 to spare.

Several Apple TV community discussions complain that they can not navigate their iTunes menu on Apple TV.  The problem started at about the same time as the most recent ATV update.  A user's iTunes menu should be navigable on Apple TV when Home Sharing has been turned on.  Lately however many ATV customers have taken note that whenever they attempt this, Home Sharing crashes and an error report pops up on their Mac/PC.  Some users continue to play their itunes selections on ATV by navigating their iTunes menu on their Mac/PCs instead.  Home Sharing is less likely to crash under those circumstances.  Nevertheless, the problem returns whenever the user tries to navigate their iTunes menu on their Apple TV.  Users have expressed their frustration on ATV discussion threads, but there is no patch available nor any word from Apple as of this post.
summary: ATV Home Sharing Crashes When iTunes Menu Navigated

reviewText: The device works fine and it is very usefull to access content on your iPhone, YouTube and etc. However, the most disapointing aspect is that you will not be able to watch other kind of content from your computer, like downloaded videos, dvd's and more. It could be better.

This device is damn near useless. The only thing making it worth a damn for home users is an open source project called plexconnect. I ended up just bringing it to the office for conference room use as an airplay endpoint for wireless mirroring.
summary: Who exactly is the target audience for this?

reviewText: This is the second unit I purchased. I did so because the remote died on the first one and I had no option to replace it. This time it failed two weeks past the replacement date. While the unit itself works quite well, that means very little if I cannot control it. Thought I'd install the remote app on my iPhone; but now it's restricted to IOS 5.0 and above. I have a 3G which can only be upgraded to version 4.2.1, so I get the shaft again t from Apple. I will not buy another unit nor anything else from Apple, for that matter. I would give the product zero stars if such a rating were possible. Apple has shown itself to be arrogant and completely unconcerned about its customers.

This may be the worst Apple Product I've ever owned, however; I haven't owned too many Apple products anyways.This wouldn't have been that bad, if I was able to watch it on a television with a Receiver.....it displayed a resolution of 480p on any of my HDTVs with receivers, and could not display 1280x720p/i or 1920x1080p/i either.  These problems basically renders this device unusable for me, I got a Roku Box instead, way better.Again, it worked when I plugged it in directly to my TV, but that won't work for us users that have a surround sound system.
summary: Probably the worst Apple product I've owned.

reviewText: This thing is the most archaic piece of crap I have ever used.  Apple should be ashamed to put their name on this garbage.  I own several iPads, and several iPhones.  I am a huge fan of Apple products, so thought the Apple TV would be a great addition.  WRONG.  The remote looks and functions like something out of about 1983.  But by far the worst part of all is the Apple TV has a mind of its own.  Frequently (meaning several times a week) will not connect to the internet, despite being wired direct to my router via ethernet cable (I tried wireless, it was exponentially worse).  Sometimes it won't work on startup, other times it will just cut off mid-movie and stop working.  Restart sometimes works, sometimes not.  Absolute piece of garbage.  Wish Kindle TV would have been available when I got this.  Lesson learned.  Thankfully Amazon has phenomenal customer service.  I am going to try a new Apple TV unit (would much rather get the Kindle TV, but since I own so many iTunes movies, would really be nice if the Apple TV worked), and will report back if that one works any better.  But so far with all my Apple products....everything else A+...Apple TV...F-
summary: I wish I could give it zero stars and still write a review

reviewText: We got the Apple TV for our home after my wife was provided one at her school where teaches music. For streaming of music it is excellent (4 stars) but when chose to rent movies another result occurs... The phrase your purchase will ready for viewing in 19 hours arrived. It was not that long but we still have yet to see a whole movie that we have rented.

After a ton of research, I couldn't get an apples to apples comparison of a Roku 3 to an Apple TV.  Since I have all newish Mac devices (iPad, iPhone, and a MacBook), I gave Apple the benefit of the doubt given its reputation for devices that work well together.  In short, I've been gravely disappointed--few of the features work well, and in particular the "mirroring" feature basically doesn't work at all.  It does at least do an OK job with YouTube and a good job showing pictures from my devices on the screen.
summary: Not the Easy to Use Product I Expected

reviewText: Airport Express to Airport Extreme to ASUS N66U routers. Streaming from my iPad or iPhone to the Apple TV is just a pain now, always lagging or shuttering. Audio and video goes out of sync at times too. This doesn't happen before and I thought it is the router not fast enough, but no, it is the recent firmware update of the Apple TV and the latest iOS, rendering Airplay of videos unsmooth in a lot of situations.
summary: Airplay heavily flawed with recent firmware and iOS. Does Apple really have no future without Jobs?

reviewText: bought the apple tv to mirror my macbook pro to, only to find out that mirroring is not supported in any computer much older than 2 years old. Total disappointment. When using the remote on the apple TV it changes the volume on the macbook pro.IMO, If I had known the shortcomings here I would have invested the extra $20 and bought the roku. I guess I'll have to ebay this piece of crap off to someone else....
By the time I got it, the person I ordered it for had found it elsewhere and bought it for himself.  So, I returned it.

Got apple TV for Christmas and I couldn't be more disappointed.  Any movie is 2.99$ or more, even movies from 1986 are $2.99. I feel ripped off paying for movie. And each episode of a series is $2.99 as well. Just to watch and catch up on shows. It's ridiculous. I have never been an apple fan, but I tried apple TV and I really wanted to enjoy it. Turns out I was right not to be a fan. No I wasted $100 and I'm stuck feeling disappointed. Don't wAste your money. Rocu has more to offer.

I am not happybut i was expecting more channels to see for free, but look apple didn't want to put to much content for free,I am really disappointing w/My purchase, cause I can have a much cheaper streaming device w/more content and I think this is solely to got more money from your pockets to sell even the TV shows already aired a long time ago,

I have one in my bedroom works good but the one I brought from Amazon I have in my living room dose not work right
I was hoping it will work easier and will do more. I am little disappointed. My son has think from google and it cost 1/4 and works better with all computers and phones. Well I am stuck with it.

reviewText: I was looking forward to this as a Christmas present, and to say this is a disappointment is an EXTREME understatement.Slow user interface, no app support for anything Ultraviolet (flixster, vudu, best buy, etc) - somehow iPad and iPhone have no issue here.Buffering is close to miserable on a hard wired line to my Mac....not even worth the $100....save your money to buy something that has a little better flexibility (Xbox, PS3, and Roku have much nicer interfaces) - Roku is even cheaper.

reviewText: Know very little about this product.  This was a Christmas present for someone.  The person who wanted it always spoke very highly about it.
Many times, while a video is playing on my iPadMini, it stopped displaying on the TV.  I had to restart everything to get it working. Sometimes, I have to shut everything down. It is useless to me.

The airplay mirroring is horrible with quality varying widely depending on mirror device.  My macbook pro retina (2013, Mavericks OS) mirrors with 1 to 2 second lag making it impossible to use as a mirrored or extended display.  It seriously will give you headaches to operate a cursor with this much lag.  Videos playing from websites lag horribly with terrible refreshing of HD content.  The audio quality is also degraded.  This issue is even further exacerbated using a macbook air (2013, Mavericks OS) and impossible for use.  It's even worse than remote access many encounter with IT departments.  Yeah, crazy.It's appalling that apple would market this feature.  It's the only reason I purchased it.  Now I have a 100$ glorified Netflix, HBO GO box.  YEAY!  It's like Netflix heaven at my place.  You can watch it on my PS3, PS4, my HTPC, and now this wonderful 100$ paperweight.Now about apple customer support.  Just terrible.  When I first brought up this issue they sent me to a troubleshooting page of iOS devices.  That's right ladies and gentlemen, they sent me to a troubleshooting page for iOS devices even though the problem was associated with a macbook pro and a macbook air. FFFUUUUU.......Then they blamed the router.  But wait for it. I had the best router possible from their recommendation.  What the fu....So then we hooked up the AppleTV AND Macbooks through ethernet directly to the router and still got terrible lag.  With a direct connection?? What?  This is Apple quality?  The same people that made the MacBook Retina made this garbage. Really?So then we tried another TV and two other monitors.  Yeah that was waste of my time.  All in all I lost around 4 hours and 100$ because Apple can't get their you know together.In conclusion this 100$ box of failure is worse than a 5$ HDMI cable.If you think I'm raging...well you're right.  That's all this box is good for, a good rage.  But in my defense this issue is all over their support forums with absolutely no solutions offered.  So I'm not the only one experiencing this issue.
summary: ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE WITH HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SUPPORT, WORST APPLE PRODUCT EVER, WASTE OF MONEY

reviewText: The only thing this so called "apple TV" mirrors well is youtube .. games are sluggish .. and very sluggish .. i have a 50 mpbs connection ..so network was never an issue .. streaming from my laptop to smart tv works flawlessly .. Stay away !!

There's really not to much good that can be said about this Apple product. The good first: Great design, the unit produces a really good 1080p picture. Now for the not so good: the extremely small, hard to hold remote control- lack of buttons. Entering your wifi password along with your Apple id and password is very difficult with this poorly designed remote. It is anything but fun. The Air Play feature is unstable. It just quits when it wants to. The Mirroring feature works great for your iPad 2,3 or iphone 4s only, until it decides to turn itself off.The app selection is much better now than when the product first came out BUT, if you're looking for free content, you will be disappointed.The bottom line, is that this product only exists to help Apple sell program content from the iTunes Store.Other than Amazon's good price and fast shipping, I really can't say anything else that is positive about Apple TV.

Totally blocks your internet connection. Recurrent messages "cannot access itunes" and "failed to login to account" . Constantly having to unplug and reset. If you have anything less than a very very fast internet connection be wary here. While movies download - and this routinely takes hours, using other internet devices in your home is severely impacted. Very slow, often totally blocked.  Movie says ready to play and then into the movie it freezes while more of the movie downloads for another 15 minites to hours. Often at this point you have to unplug to reset. Somehting is very poorly thought out in the design of this product. Movie downloads take hours. No instant watching. Disappointed. Works as supposed to occasionally but far more as described above.
summary: Say Goodbye to your internet connection

reviewText: UPDATE 6/16/12 - Added a star because the Airplay functionality is indeed wonderful.Yes, its worth buying an Apple TV just for the Airplay function alone.  Its the perfect compliment to my iphone and ipad.First off, i have many apple devices so i am more or less commited to the platform.However im getting dissapointed by where things are going with them-less about making computing easy, more about controlling and selling content.So i was disapointed to discover that Apple TV is really just a "buy" platform for iTunes now.With the new interface they've made all the sharing and viewing of content off your PC stuff really hard to find and manage.Basically the utility functionality of it is going away in favor of accelerating monetization for apple.Its great for on demand buying of content from apple, but I really dont need another electronic leech on my wallet.We decided to keep it because of the Airplay function.  Thats sort of worth the $99.Too bad. I also have a roku that i wont be getting rid of.  Roku with airplay and itunes connectivity would amazing.
cant jail break it and probably never can, works great if you only want to use netflix, hulu  etc s
Downloading movies is constantly spotty, so much to the point that we won't use the product any more.  A very expensive $100 paperweight.

I have purchased an AppleTV sw ver 6.0.  It works well with my HP system (Win7) with Itunes.  I does not work with either of my 4s iphones  or my Ipad(3)  It will mirror both screens but refuses to connect with home share.Will be returning this to Amazon.

reviewText: I spent way too much time and money on adaptive cables trying to make it work with my 6 year old tv that didn't have an HDMI outlet.  Once again, apples proprietary policy makes life difficult.
It's a pain to set up. But I expected this. It doesn't offer anything any of the other type products offer. Nothing special with this thing.

Just recieved this with high hopes and IT DOES NOT WORK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! After an hour of trying to set it up the dumb thing tells me it needs an update? When im thinking why does a brand new item need an update? And then the thing shuts down and is stuck on a stupid apple logo with a picture of a usb cable that they didnt give me!!!!!!!!!!! Dont buy this save your time  cause you will be returning it

ok, so i have finally figured out how to get this thing working. no thanks to applecare, whom i called and they could not help me at all.basically, i had to retire my airport express (which was actually from about 2003 -- maybe the longest used apple product ever?!) and purchase some extra products to connect this.so now i use the appletv to stream music from my imac and my iphone to my home stereo, and am using a wireless router to get internet, instead of the apple express for both those uses. so its a bit redundant but supposedly has a more steady connection.what i had to buy (from monoprice, i spent about $30, whereas radioshack would have charged like 60) was an optical audio cable (toslink or something) and a digital to rca converter (which has to be plugged into an elec. outlet)so now the optical audio out on the appletv goes through the converter and into the rca jacks in my stereo receiver. now i can get audio when i rent a movie or soemthing from appletv.*****************ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW***************super bummed by this purchase.so i have an airport express hooked up to my home stereo that i can airplay music from my imac or iphone to.so after reading the box and specs, i purchased the ATV so i could watch video on my tv. i can watch video but i cannot have the audio play thru my airport express-enabled speakers. you can only get audio thru the tv itself.i can stream music thru the ATV thru the airport speakers, but not audio to accompany video.so why do i need this if i can already do this with my imac & airport express.and no, i dont want to listen to the audio thru my tv, i bought the ATV because it said it would work with the airport.oh, and the UI sucks. not intuitive or "pretty" at all. what a waste of a product.
These were my best buy of the whole year! Love them!! Super comfy and I'll buy more when these wear out
This is a really great-tasting coffee and even better than what I usually have at our local Starbucks. Now if only I can keep making a cup of this whenever I need, it would be perfect for me.

After spending over 40 hours working through various potential resolutions and trying to speak to Apple support... I am still unable to get the Apple TV to synch w iTunes on my PC... After much frustration I purchased a new Roku and was able to communicate with my PC within 5 minutes... The Apple company should be ashamed of this product.
summary: Never able to synch with iTunes

reviewText: Haven't deployed this yet but the item arrived on time. Packaging etc. is all good. Got what I had expected to buy.

If you predate Hdmi you're out of luck. Does not operate without a straightforward Hdmi connection. Not only that but it like clicks into this weird visually impaired mode when it only has an audio connection. Very annoying.
summary: Does not work with Hdmi to dvi.

reviewText: This device is not worth the money.  We consistently have to reset the device spending 20 minutes recent reentering the wireless info and password.  It eventually locks up, requiring a total disconnect, several prayers and adult refreshments in Hope that the little white light shows brightly.  I estimate it does not work as advertised at least 60% of the time.If you want to reduce the stress in your life, your marriage and with your children, DO NOT purchase this thing.  Oh. And try to go on the Apple forum and get feedback or leave feedback... Enough said.This is the ONLY one star review I have left. Apple TV is a total zero with this family.
What a complete waste of miney! poor wireless connectivity, hard to use....waste. I can get cable much easier or NetFlex

Bought the AppleTv back in 2011, worked amazingly well until 3 months ago.  Now all it does it say "An error has occurred".  We've tried factory reset, and other means, but whenever we try loading via AirPlay to our homecomputer, just doesn't work.  Netflix still works though weirdly enough.  We tested the computer movies and they still all work, it is almost like the Apple TV box stops working after 18 months...  Apple, if you're listening, please explain this, because when I search this on the internet; there is literally thousands of folks complaining about this issue as if it is an update issue!

bought this last year, thought it was great, had netflix, youtube, vimeo...just updated it today, no more youtube or vimeo.well, going to get something else now.really, Apple? can't have competition?so much for that.

It worked great for about one month, now it is giving me problems all the time, it constanly giving me a message "an error accured loading this content". I have to unplug it a few times and it might work eventually. I have ROKU in the bedroom and it always works great. I am wondering if I got a defective product.
Like all things Apple, it's over-controlled and more trouble than it's worth.  I'll buy Chromecast for $30 instead thank you.

reviewText: The only reason I got this was so I could stream movies from my computer to my television. This does a terrible job of this, the video is broken and laggy. I have 10 other devices I can watch netflix from so this helps me in no way.

While I found the base functionality to be adequate, being locked in to the universe of Apple supplied media is a nightmare.  Fortunately I gave this as a gift and that person has already had a full glass of the Apple Kool-Aid, so they're used to a limited selection at premium prices.  All I can say is...I'm glad they like it.  Ignorance is bliss.
You can get this item for 50.00 at some other place. It must have gotten popular thus the price increase.

I find I must revise my rating of this product to be fair to it.  As you see below I was really frustrated but I couldn't believe that I should have the problems I was having since so many people gave it a 5 star rating and their reviews were expressing things I wanted with my Apple TV.  Well, I decide to go to the Settings-General-Reset and give it a try.  I did and much to my happy surprise it seems to be working without any buffering problems.  I was able to watch a show on PBS and a show on Netflix.  I'm going to try Airplay and keep my fingers crossed that it works.------------------------original---------------------I wasted $100.00 on this thing.  I was hoping to be able to Airplay from my iPad or Mac to the TV, well that doesn't happen.  What happens is every 10-15 seconds the thing stops to buffer another 10-15 seconds of viewing, you need a whole day to watch an hour show.  I'm blown away that this happens with an Apple product after all they aren't they suppose to be the "best ?".  I have Roku and I have no problems with buffering issues.  Save your money on this and get Roku instead and be happy not frustrated with Apple TV.
summary: Must Revise my Rating - I Like It and I'm Happy Now

reviewText: It's cheaper and you have more options! I got mine to mirror from my phone or iPad and it won't mirror my cable subscription!
my beef with Apple TV is the unreliability of their server. Apple TVSUCKS because you can never tell if their server works.
this device is frustratingly restricted. No use taking it. Itunes are rediculously costly, u get same thing cheaper  at other places.
Thought this device was really wireless- it wasn't - had to be connected to TV and that is not what I wanted- ordered an iHome device in it's place

I bought this product because I LOOOOOVVVEEEE my iPhone.I love the simplicity of the interface, the user experience design, and the fact that everything works.  It just works.  No time messing with settings, or tweaking this or that, or having to update codecs, or any of that.  Everything just works.So, when it came time to ditch my cable, I thought this was the no brainer.Let me just save you the trouble, and tell you to take your $99, stick it back in your wallet, and go get something else.  Anything else.  Get a box of crayons and a notepad and make yourself a flipbook - because at the end of the day, you'll at least be able to watch it.Lets start with the crux of the problem - iTunes.  iTunes is a disaster.  It hasnt aged gracefully, and it really needs to give up the goat and allow something better to come along and replace it.  Call it iMedia, or iVids, or iDontGiveaRatsass what you call it - just dont call it iTunes. Because I (and I'm sure I'm not alone) will avoid it like the plague.Aside from completely destroying my folder structure after I specifically said "NO" to the reorganize my media option (still pissed about this) - it placed about 90% of my library all willy-nilly into a single "not added" folder.  Yeah.  About 500gb worth of songs/videos/etc in one folder, with no naming convention, and no way to play them in iTunes.Then, what it did add, it added about 3 copies of to my library.  And guess what - apple is obviously keenly aware of this problem because they created a "handy" option to show all duplicates.  And thats great, because it highlights all the duplicates so you can manually go through them, right click, delete, and hope you go the right one and dont wipe the file off your disk.  Super helpful apple, thanks!Oh, and it only plays MP4 videos.  And even then, even if all you have are MP4s, its VEERRRRYYY picky about which MP4s it will play.Its a joke.  Its useless.  I get a warning message about 10 times a day telling me to update the software, which has come up since I bought the damn thing, and yet every time I've tried it fails.  It spends about 20 minutes going through the whole process, reboots, and tells me it failed.  Every. Time.Seriously worst product ever.Apple, you've lost someone who was a BIG supporter.  I still love my iPhone, but just not apple.

I guess if you want to figure out how to use something called airplay and use your computer to control your tv (instead of just a remote) then somehow it's possible.  But I didn't buy this device to go to a lot of trouble to watch movies.  So... no Amazon channel, on the other hand I don't know how to access my iTunes library with Roku.  So... what a pain.

I ordered a Refurbished Apple TV shipped from Pro Sell, but I received a unit that was clearly USED, not Refurbished, as noted by the following:- return address on packaging was from a person, not a business;- a hand written note on a scrap of paper was in the box saying, "When updating a software TV turn off. After this TV do not connect to wifi" [sic];- when connected to my television, the unit was already configured in a language using the Cyrillic alphabet and was not in a state such as a Refurbished unit would have been; and,- the Aluminum Apple Remote which is supposed to be included with any New or Refurbished Apple TV was absent.

I bought this thing to be able to play DVDs off of my MBP without having to deal with dongles, hdmi cables, etc.  Well, it can't.  Web search on "apple tv dvd checkerboard" and you'll see what I mean.  Thank you Apple.

I like that we can watch a picture slide show in our livingroom now. I like that we can listen to iTunes in our livingroom now. I like that we can watch some of our movies that are on our iTunes and nowhere else in our livingroom now. But we had to spend $20-30 on the new operating system to have it be compatable with our Mac. Then, we had to spend another $100 on Microsoft office because the version we had was outdated and not compatable with the new operating system we just got. Also, now my iPhoto has a hard time recognizing my memory card from my camera. And now Disney is no longer giving the iTunes digital download code with its DVDs so my kids won't be able to watch their Disney shows on our iPod, phones or Apple TV. The set up was extremely easy... But just not worth it, really, for us. We still have and continue to use it for what we can, but it hasn't changed our life or anything. It was a bday gift for husband and I wish I would have gotten him something else.

Wish apple would raise the price by a few dollars and include the necessary HDMI cable.  I didn't see the fine print anywhere that says the cable necessary for hookup is not included.  Totally annoying.
summary: Doesn't come with everything for set up

reviewText: I have contacted apple about this because it is now useless to me. I would give it zero stars but I had to give it at least one to write a review. The product worked for one week before it pretty much went on the fritz. I do not want to have to return it to the seller because of the hefty fee involved. I am waiting on apple to send me the materials to send it back. They said they would send me a new one when I sent them the broken one. Thank God for the 90 day Apple complementary service on it. reviewText: I just got it and set it up.  nearly useless. I expect to have a browser to watch news.  thinking to return it.

Folks,Most of the reviews for the Apple TV Box are from non-verified Amazon Customers which means in my opinion, they were hired by a stock broker, Apple, or some other PR Firm looking to try anything to make the Apple stock price go back up to the $700 per share price which it should not have been at in the first place with only 2 major products generating almost all the company revenue. Let me say this, my brother bought the Roku Streaming Player and loves listening to Pandora, but he pays for the service on top of his cable bill. Here is the truth about all these "HYPED" streaming TV devices...Ready...My brother thought, oh great, I can get rid of cable TV and not have the bills every month! Guess again, with any of these streaming media boxes, you pay per series or episode, do I need to say it again louder? YOU WILL PAY FOR EVERYTHING YOU BUY USING THESE STREAMING DEVICES ON TOP OF YOUR CABLE BILL! You need cable TV and to say it louder, YOU NEED TO BUY EITHER THE MIDDLE OR TOP SPEED INTERNET PACKAGE BECAUSE THEY DO NOT TELL YOU WHEN YOU PURCHASE THESE DEVICES THAT YOU NEED A HIGH SPEED CONNECTION TO STREAM THE CONTENT...DECEPTIVE BUSINESS PRACTICES IS THE WORD FOR IT! All the streaming boxes are worthless, a fad, and will not survive! People, do not waste your money on any streaming device when you can use almost any Tablet, Notebook or Desktop Computer and do the same thing. If anything, spend an extra $100 and you get a full tablet in HD from Amazon! Buy the Kindle Fire HD Tablet by Amazon if you want streaming content but at least with the Kindle Fire HD, Amazon gives you a free tablet that the company is losing money on just to capture a good customer base! The Kindle Fire HD Tablet is a hands down winner above and beyond any of these streaming "Falsely Hyped" TV Boxes!F.Y.I. Mr. Jeff Bezos, your new TV Ad comparing the Kindle Fire HD to the Apple iPad is the best Ad I have seen in a long time! Your marketing department nailed Apple face to face, world-wide with that ad. IN fact, I wish the marketing department went one step further and actually showed more of what can be done with the Kindle Fire HD compared to the iPad with hardly any useful features. Folks, again, the Kindle Fire HD is feature rich! Spend the extra $99 to $100 and buy the Kindle Fire HD and let the so called streaming devices die a nice slow death.F.Y.I. - 2.19.2013Update on the Apple TV Boxes...The price is declining because people are starting to figure everything out! You do not need this box to stream anything as I said above in my post. All you need is a $100 CD Player with Wi-Fi and you can get all the streaming content, i.e. Amazon Streaming Content, Netflix, etc. The prices from what I have seen today are as low as $79 for this empty black box by Apple.
summary: Stop the MADNESS! $99 for the box and then what...SAY IT..

reviewText: $100 one time fee vs $95/month to Dish Network. And that's with no movie channels. Here are 5 more words.
Absolutely love my Apple tv. Love the airplay feature. Can stream music straight from my phone via surround system that is connected to aplle tv. Good choice of movies to rent as well.

A friend recently purchased this as a gift, and though it's a little expensive and not something I would ever have bought for myself, I have to admit that I enjoy it immensely.  It's easy to install, even if I had to go out and buy an HDMI cable that wasn't included, and it's very easy to use.  It also doesn't take up much space, which is always appreciated.  The box is maybe a little bigger than a baseball.The device comes with access to a variety of programs--Netflix, HBO, and a whole lot of sports channels I don't care about--but most of those need subscriptions.  People with HD TV's probably wouldn't need Apple TV at all, as most of those come with the TV, but this makes access easier.  It also comes with YouTube, and who wouldn't love watching "Ghost in the Stalls" on the big screen?I believe there's also a way to hook up an ipad to the box so I can have the contents of my ipad on the television.  I haven't gotten around to doing that yet, but it doesn't seem difficult and would make purchasing one of these worthwhile just for that.All in all, there are easier ways to gain access to what Apple TV provides, but it's still nice to have them all on one convenient box rather than having to fight Internet connections and all the other nonsense that goes with.

After buying 4 units in the past 3 years I can honestly say "WOW". I've had every generation since the beginning (2007) and they seem to always get better while getting smaller in size. These little boxes are powerfull, full of features and potential. We use them all daily for watching movies and Netflix. The Netflix experience is like no other. It's really hard to buy the competition when Apple has mastered this invention. Looking forward to the future models as well.GO APPLE!

After purchasing a Roku 3 and Apple TV at the same time, I returned the Apple TV, although, in my opinion they are almost different devices and I could see a need to have both of them. The greatest thing about Apple TV is the wireless integration with an Apple phone or Tablet. As a streaming player however, I was not as impressed. I had both devices connected to different televisions in my home, so if I had a problem with one, I would go to the other and see if the same problem existed. On several occasions, the Apple Netflix would not connect (or would show an error) while the Roku connected every-time. Almost everything on the Apple requires a "subscription" (incurring additional costs) while the Roku offers many free viewing selections. (The food channels for recipes and the fitness channels for home workouts are awesome). Since Roku 3 allowed me to stream pictures, music and video from my apple devices, I made the final decision to send the Apple back. But with that being said, I do want to state again that I can see where it would be nice to actually have BOTH of these machines. Just be sure of your specific needs before you purchase is my advice.
summary: Be sure of your specific needs before purchasing

reviewText: A gift was for my husband, who is an apple lover.  He loved it. The instruction were easy and installation a breeze.

a great product for a great pricei have been using the old apple tv (with the hard drive) and love that and still use it much more than than this new Apple TV.  The only reason I bought the new apple tv is because Apple has decided to stop upgrading the software for the old apple tv (since it wants to exclusively focus on this new apple tv).  Specifically, the new apple tv does the following which the old apple tv does not do:-- you can send video and audio directly from you iphone/ ipad to the new apple tv (for your old apple tv, you can send stuff only from itunes on your computer)-- the interface is much better on the new apple tv-- the old apple tv does not have netflix (not relevant to me because i do not have a netflix account since i watch 2-3 movies a year)As an aside, since Apple has abandoned the old apple tv, you cannot "send" music from the old apple tv directly to any air-tunes device (like the zeppelen air); you can only send music from the old apple tv to an apple airport express
summary: a great product for a great price

reviewText: Airplay is easily the coolest feature of Apple TV.  You tap the airplay button in spotify or any other app that supports it (youtube, videos, you name it) and it's instantly on the screen.I have it hooked up to my surround sound via optical, so even if my TV is off and I'm doing housework or hanging out in the backyard, I can adjust the volume and track right from my phone.Other than airplay, the entire system is smooth and intuitive.  You can sync a bluetooth keyboard as well for easier browsing.  I recommend the Kensington keyboard.
summary: Awesome compliment to your other apple devices

reviewText: All I can say is my family and I love it. Since we don't have cable tv it allows for is to watch tv show from our apps for free. I love how we can listen to music too and look at our home videos and pictures. If you can afford it buy it. Only complaint is it does not come with an HDMI cable.
All of your media form iTunes, all device screen push, netflix, hulu... who needs cable now?  Not me thats who!
Although the channels are more limited than the Roku, both the menu system and the picture quality are far superior. iTunes Radio makes this a no brainer.
A must for anyone who uses iTunes. Easy to use, very convenient for media streaming. You won't regret it. Promise.

A must have for anyone with an apple product (i.e. mac book, ipad, iphone). Basically integrates your tv with almost every app out there. MUCH BETTER than using a smart tv that requires a clumsy remote.

and this product provides a solution:video streaming from a main server to eliminate running new cabling in an older homewe live in a digital ghetto, surrounded by FIOS and high-speed cable - but we can only get less than 1Mbps DSL and wifi cellular connections are too expensivethis product provides a way for for us to stream movies and music from a stationary server in the house (an iMac) to our HDTVs placed around our home - and to do it wirelessly!very clean, very easy to set up:1. attach an AppleTV to each HDTV2. configure each to connect to your wifi router3. set up VNC (RDP) on your iMac4. sit in front of the desired TV5. initiate a VNC session from a netbook into your iMac (i use low-compression/quality settings which seem good enough)6. log in, then remotely select the desired AppleTV from the Finder's AirPlay menu7. launch VLC to play your movie8. eat popcornmost 'normal' AppleTV users will use their high-speed Internet to watch streams or info through a pay wall, but if you're like me and live in a digital ghetto, the AppleTV provides a way to conduct media sessions and enjoy entertainment in a closeted garden!
summary: we live in a digital ghetto

reviewText: Another milestone in my quest to replace ALL peripheral video services (ROKU, cable company, satellite, DSL) with internet based content streaming.Coupled with my Airport Extreme,  iPad 4 Retina, iPhone 4S, and soon-to-replace-cable-internet FIBER feed - I can access virtually ANY video streaming content source  and AirPlay to my plasma set!Amazon Prime, HULU+, Netflix, HBO-GO, major network apps - all play flawlessly through this compact, reliable device!
summary: THE best method to wean yourself from media providers (cable, DSL, satellite)!

reviewText: Apple is know to have user friendly products and this is also seen in the Apple TV. Extremely easy to connect and use. This product is everything I was expecting.
Apple is know to have very user friendly product and this is also seen in the Apple TV. Extremely easy to connect and use. This product is everything I was expecting.

Apple is the best digital delivery system period. The future of TV the future of information transmission is here. Top design and performance. I also have a Roku and though both work I would place the Apple TV head and shoulders over Roku better design better interface faster delivery

Apple means different things to different people.  I personally love apple products, but I don't live completely in the Apple ecosphere, meaning I have a windows laptop and use google for a lot.The major plus of this devise is Airplay!  I have a iPad, and iPhone, and I would say 85% of the time it works perfectly.  There are occasional hiccups getting it on the TV, content will randomly decide not to work on Airplay.  Overall I love this dongle technology stuff!I primarily use it to stream content from a NAS drive I have hooked up to my home network.  Of course the NAS drive has an iOS app which lets me Airplay it to my TV via the Apple TV.  Fantastic!The downside is that it's not an end all solution for television.  I dropped TV service completely so I've tried every other alternative, including watching TV shows through websites.  Netflix and other apps are supported here, but they don't have everything, so beyond that its out of my hands whether or not a website will let me Airplay to the Apple TV.  iPad mirroring is cool, but the aspect ratio is different so streaming full screen video isn't full screen on your TV (I don't like that).However if you're looking for TV solutions consider this: the average TV service is about $50 per month.  On Apple TV you can buy a full season of a TV show for about $30.  So in a year's time, you could own a full season of 20 different shows for the same $600 you would have spent on cable or dish.  I say that plus an antenna is good enough for me.  Of course you have to have good internet to make this work, so factor that in.

Apple TV brings everything together in one place for easy of use.  From HBO, to Hulu, Netflix, ESPN to streaming the latest movies. Small enough to take with you when you visit family and friends. Setup was simple and easy, just purchase your HDMI cable and connect that to your TV and enjoy.
Apple TV is a great product, bought it for my parents for Christmas and they love it, highly recommended to anyone, especially if you have Netflix/HBO Go

Apple TV is amazing! It's so easy to use and such a great purchase. We love being able to pull up anything off of HBOGO & Netflix and syncing our iPhones is a great feature! We are even thinking of getting another for another room. Apple never disappoints with a quality product!
Apple TV is another great from Apple, just like everything they put out. Very easy set-up. No problems with connection or use.

Apple TV is great! I love having a smart tv without the price of one! I have access to Netflix, Yahoo, YouTube, etc on this device. I bought it for my 21 year old brother as a Christmas  gift and he loved it! He has an iPad & iPhone which he mirrors to the Apple TV and uses the ipad/iPhone almost as a remote control, it's a pretty neat little invention. When it goes idle on your tv it starts playing a slideshow which is pretty cool, could be random pictures or you can stream your iCloud and your personal pictures would come a cross the tv screen. Best thing is it's small and doesn't take up much space at all! all you need is a HDMI cord to connect it to your television because it's not included in the packaging! After seeing how much he liked his I decided that I wanted one for myself! best purchase ever, Apple has never let me down.
Apple TV is super easy to set up and use. I even move it from room to room every once in awhile, because it is no hassle to reconnect. The minimalist remote design is a plus for me.
Apple TV is truly awesome.  I love the apps and content that can be streamed or shared.  Quality product as always from Apple.  Going to get another one for the living room.
Apple TV works great with my iPhone 5, my ipad and my Mac Book pro.  I would recommend this device if you have a lot of other apple products.  It works great together.
Apple works great.  I play my own music on it that is loaded on iTunes.  I use my iPad as the controller.

As always, Apple delivers!  Quality product that works seamlessly with our phones, tablet and computers!  We plan to use the streaming features to show our clients their wedding photographs during the ordering process!

As an owner of all kinds of streamers including roku 3 and PS4, Apple TV has is really climbing the ranks for me. Of course it's dependent on your wireless connection but everything I've watched so far has worked beautifully and picture is crystal clear. The new remote for the newest 2014 version is a little too small for my tastes but I'm getting used to it as well as the button layouts on it. For me, the real draw of Apple TV was to be able to stream my iTunes content to my hd TV. Again, I've had no issues at all and everything loads relatively fast(depending on connection). Lastly, another big draw is the AIRPLAY function which is pretty cool. This allows you to play whatever is on your iPad or iPhone on your tv through Apple TV. Comes in handy especially with apps that aren't available on the device like amazon instant video. And that's the one drawback of Apple TV, not enough apps available yet. It's got netflix and hbo go(which are the two big ones) but not much more. But something tells me that will change in the future.
summary: One of the best streamers out there!

reviewText: As far as I know, iTunes is the ONLY one that provides alternative audio tracks for digital copies of movies or shows you can buy or rent. My children like Disney movies and many of them come with a Spanish or French audio track alternative.  I do wish Apple offered more movies and shows with this feature though. What I do not understand it that this is a standard feature on DVDs,  but not on digital copies. We are raising or children bilingual and because of this very simple but very important language feature for us, it is the main reason why I prefer the Apple TV over all the other alternatives.
summary: If you like Spanish or French audio option in movies you buy, this is the ONLY box.

reviewText: As I received this device I was first impressed by the quality of it. it was even packaged in an impressive way. I loved the easy setup and its software. I had many of the applications in appletv already on the PS3, but the truth is I never experienced that quality of service from the same apps on the ps3. for example the Youtube app in ps3 compared to the appletv sucks!!.I would recommend it for everyone, I can't see a reason why someone should not have this device.
summary: Never imagined the quality of this thing

reviewText: As it is with all products made by Apple, this was very easy to set up. It took my boyfriend like probably all of 3-5 minutes to set it up and have Netflix streaming over our Wi-Fi network on the TV! How awesome! The Apple TV is compact, really small for what it does, not that it makes a difference because it's kept in our cabinet. But anyway. The remote is super sleek though I do wish it had additional functionality while watching movies. But overall for what the product does, it is great and is just what we had been looking for. Thank you Apple!

A small, simple (we old folks like simple), easy to use device that greatly enhances the utility of our TV.We are great fans of PBS, and Netflix subscribers.  Having the ability to access both thru our TV is very convenient, instead of trying to watch content on our iPads or sit in front of the computer.  We are not constrained to watch only what PBS is showing at the moment; we can watch the current programming at our convenience and access programs that we have missed.  I also like the ability to access my iTunes music library and play music thru the TV.  No doubt there are other features that I haven't discovered yet.I combined the Apple TV with a 5-port HDMI switch to simplify the setup and allow multiple devices to be played thru the TV without the need to change cables due the limited number of HDMI ports. The combination has greatly enhanced the simplicity of operation and our enjoyment of our entertainment system.
summary: Enhances the utility of our TV

reviewText: A very clever little box, seamless setup and interface.  I've barely scratched the surface of what it can do.  I only wish Apple would make a smart TV/Receive that integrates everything and takes home entertainment out of the 90s where it seems to be stuck right now...

Been looking at these for quite a while - I'm glad I purchased it.  The video quality is amazing and it's so simple to use from the remote or my phone.  Wonderful purchase, I shouldn't have waited.  Well worth the money for streaming video on apple products.

best feature is airplay. I watch a lot of netflix, so i just use the netflix app on my iPad and stream it to the apple tv. Not only does it play full HD but i can still browse around on the iPad while watching.
Best tech buy I've made in years. This thing is super cool. Many apps for many diff tv/movies. And the airplay to stream music or video to any connected device is clutch.

Best TV companion, has all the popular services and more plus you can share videos from you PC or MAC.  With support for Airplay you can broadcast to one or more Apple TV equipped TVs at the same time. I have one on every TV.
Bought as a Christmas gift for my hubby.  He likes what he can do with it and his iPad.  Great gift!
Bought one for my living room and it's the greatest thing ever. It hooks up to my iPhone iPad iPod and my Mac just fine. Love my apple products

Bought this as a gift and my son demonstrated it for us on Christmas Day. If you take a lot of photos with your iPhone and like to show them off, this is a must have. Great for Grandma and Grandpa to show off the a Grand kids. If your not familiar with the tech, have the kids hook it up for you and show you how to use it.
Bought this as a gift for my techie husband who says it's a 10/10.  Exactly what he wanted, works exactly as described--"perfect."

Bought this for christmas for my husband and kids and they love it! I was going to purchase it through the Apple store but I always check Amazon before I buy anything because it tends to be cheaper. I was surprised to see that it was being that generally Apple products are the same price everywhere. Even got the HDMI cable through Amazon together with the Apple TV and it was cheaper than purchasing just the Apple TV through Apple!
Bought this for my girls room. Play Netflix and Pictures on it for my kids, easy to setup up, wireless connection works great.

Changed our lives.  Love that we can buy iTunes movies for the kids and have them all the time on apple tv.  No more scratched dvds.  We also use it to access Netflix.  The slideshow of pics from iPhoto when it is idle is also a big plus!

C'mon apple—I know you create supply and demand by keeping your tech behind the times. But, this most certainly does not follow Apple's design principle of providing the best user experience. It takes a million clicks going back and forth page to page to find what you want to watch. I'd rather have a larger, less minimal remote with more buttons if it means I don't have to click back and forth hundreds of times.And just a few weeks ago apple finally decided "Maybe users should have the ability to hide all the weird channels / providers that they don't ever use"
summary: Great, but very behind the times.

reviewText: Comcast will not allow their customers to access HBO Go on the TV unless you are an Apple owner and have an iPad or similar device to project movies downloaded from the Internet to the Apple TV device.  It works great
summary: A must if you are a Comcast customer

reviewText: Constantly finding more uses for it as apple "tweaks" the Apple TVs functionality.  Bought this version for a HDTV and shunted an earlier Apple TV version to an analogue TV to  give the TV a longer "functional life"  (using a Sabrent HDMI to Composite/S-Video Converter 3RCA DA-HDRC to connect the HDMI from the apple TV).
Could not be easier to use!  Recently added ESPN and Hulu plus.  Will be perfect when they add Amazon Prime.

Crazy fun.  So very cool to throw YouTube from your iPhone over to the Apple TV and have it play on your system with the big screen and big speakers.  Download movies that you rent or purchase.  It will only keep getting better.Plays off your home's wireless network.  Can pull iTunes from your home computer.  For those of us who grew up with 8 tracks, this is pretty amazing stuff!
Delayed screen on Wifi... cannot use for work purpose. Good for watching movies. You will notice delay what you type and what you see on screen.
summary: Delayed screen... cannot use for work

reviewText: Device is great.  Simple setup, easy to use.  Video streaming is good even connected with wifi.  I love this box!!
Easy installation. Already had the apps I wanted on there. Couldn't beat the price of $84 versus the price in-store. Dad loves it!

Easy set up and use. Integrated controls using iPad or iPhone. Wireless access anywhere at home to movies and music on any device. Needs more apps but we have other devices that cover the channels it does not have.

Easy to install, the kids love it. We can review the entire week with the family on Sunday evenings with the entire family. Everyone has an I-phone so we all get together and share pictures as a family. Havent used all the capabilities yet, we are still learning.
Easy to set up and definitely worth the price.  Use it every day and am actually thinking about purchasing more for other TV's.
Easy to set up, easy to use. Looks sharp. I mainly purchased this to steam directly from my iPhone and iPad which works great.

Easy to set up.  The hardest part is going to the internet gateway and finding the wireless access password.Portable.  I went to my in-laws yesterday.  They don't have a lot of channels for kids.  We were going to be there for a few hours and the kids have always gotten "bored!" in the past despite our best efforts to keep them entertained.  Who wants to pull out toy after toy and hear the complaining while we're talking and eating dinner and playing cards? So I took Apple TV with us.  The cables (two of them) and the box fit in a grocery bag.  I hooked it up to my in-laws TV and the kids watched cartoons and their junk while the grown ups did our thing.  After dinner I went on YouTube and played songs for my 75 year old father in-law that he hadn't heard in years, that he loved, etc. etc.  He loved it! Then we watched clips of sporting events on YouTube.  He loved them.Portable is a HUGE pro for this product.  Other products like the Roku will be portable as well but this is so easy to set up, so easy to use (my six year old can easily navigate the interface), and just so...great!Be advised that you'll need a HDMI cable.  We bought an Amazon brand 6.5 foot cable for about $6 at the same time as when we bought this Apple TV and I had it hooked up in under five minutes.  Love it.  Chef recommends!
Easy to setup, watch Netflix tv shows and movies on our tv. Makes it easy to look at our hundreds and hundreds of photos and movies.
Easy to use. It's a fantastic product. Make sure to buy the hdmi cable with it. We like it so much we are going to get it for our other tvs

Exactly what I hoped for: a cinch to watch Netflix, Youtube, etc. on the big screen, to look at photos from the iCloud, and to mirror the iPad or Mac.  One downside is that streaming still not as good as Blue-Ray:  movies jump a little, but this is not Apple's fault.  And really a bargain at $99.
Excellent performance from this unit main use is for netflix use and works excellent, easy setup and performance from a unit so small yet packed with performance
Excellent product.If you're thinking to buying one now, you might want to wait a few more days until Apple will announce/release the new version.

Excellent product.  Very happy with the quality of the device, quality of the video, the interface, and the video offerings.  I would give it 5 stars, if Apple would allow Amazon to utilize airplay.  Currently you can't use airplay within the Amazon Instant Video App, which is disappointing.

Finally the perfect device for watching Netflix, Hulu Plus, and even streaming things like NFL Sunday Ticket over Airplay from my iPad or iPhone! It's plugged in via ethernet so it's super fast. No complaints at all!

first week a had it totally used all my data plan up on verizon. now just plug it in when i want to use air play which works great. wish it could cache movies so wound't have to download them every time for playback at least the last three or something.
for 99 bucks... im contemplating cutting off my cable. runs netflix nice, hulu, espn. very sweet and hope that they continue to add content like they have been doing
For a relatively low price, I think this is a great gadget and does a lot of neat things. Remote control is not good.
For the price (100 bucks) it's one of the best devices you can hook up to your TV. I've never seen netflix run faster and/or with such good quality (tried it on my PS3, computer and ipad).
For watching video streamed to your tv. But the thing I don't like is that you can't turn it off with a power button selection.
From iTunes music and movies to netflix movies. You can use the iPhone to watch stuff or the iPadI like it a lot

Good Apple product, extremely easy to set up.  It's nice to have, I use it to watch movies, shows and it's really handy to watch any videos you take from your iPhones.  I video my son wrestling and we come home to watch it/review technique.

Got the Apple TV and started updating it. Completely shut off and no connection. Then i had to actually purchase a MicroUSB cable to connect it to the computer so that i can restore it through i tunes. I think if APPLE wants us to restore through computer should have included one. Limited channels but i can see few more channels like Willow Tv and some international channels through AIRPLAY. This is a must have if you own an ipad or iphone. Otherwise Roku 3 is a much better choice.

Got the Apple TV, plus Amazon HDMI and audio cables. The setup was easy, and mirroring our apple devices allows us to get more value out of our big screen tv. We are not into paying extra for subscription services, but our kids used their subscriptions for Hulu Plus and Netflix, and the device worked as advertised.  We mostly will just use this for mirroring. Great for showing a group your photos on iPhone or computer. BTW, a program called AirParrot is great for getting older macs mirroring capable without the risk of an OS update.
Great alternative to TV and very useful for netflix.  Need to add Amazon Prime.  As usual Apple is a little stingy with products that do  not send money directly to their bottom line.
summary: I have two and love them

reviewText: Great! I've had an Apple TV for a while, and I was due for an upgrade. The newest model doesn't offer a ton more, but it's still solid and has some worthwhile improvements. For me, the full 1080p is the most noticeable aspect. You can really see it, and it allows you to play more media types (e.g. if you have a library collection with lots of 1080p vids).I'm an Apple-enthusiast, so keep that in mind. =P
summary: What You'd Expect! A Great Set Top Device.

reviewText: Great little streaming box with a simple-to-use interface.  I can't give it 5 stars since there is no Amazon Video app.  I'm sure it's because Apple doesn't want to compete with Amazon for purchasing and renting streaming movies.  I bought this as a present for my daughter and I'm considering buying one for myself, but due to the lack of Amazon app, I will be giving more consideration to some of the more popular competitors.
summary: Love it, but with one drawback.

reviewText: Great performance and UI, 1080p and Netflix 'superhd' playback is awesome, tons of content. Get an Apple TV and ditch satellite/cable!
summary: Great content and performance; easy to use

reviewText: Great product, easy to set up and use. Use it daily for Netflix and music. Sharing capability between the apple tv, iTunes, and iPhone is very cool.
Great product. Easy to use and does everything promised.  One two three four five six seven eight nine ten words!

Great product.  HOWEVER, a couple of useful tips:  You need a good wireless router, and, itunes should be your main storage source for your music, films, and photos if you want to fully utilize all the features this product has to offer.First, the router I had just didn't have the strength, so I got Apple's Airport Extreme which did a superb job.  Very few drops or buffering issues when streaming.Second, I love the features it has in regard to itunes - once you sync it with your itunes account, any movies, music, or photos you have on your computer can be streamed onto your TV with your Apple TV.  It also has a screen-saver feature which will "slide show" any picture collection you want to show up on your TV screen.  It also gives you multiple ways to present those photos in your screen-saver mode.You can also set up music files through itunes to play through you TV.  Very nice for dinner parties, holiday season, or just want to have music going on in your house while you do chores or whatever.It will only work for one TV so you will have to have an Apple TV for each television you want to stream on.  It does stream Netflix and Hulu Plus, but not Amazon.  It also has a "movie-clips" site from which you can view the latest movie promos.Overall, a very nice quality product - if you are committed to itunes.
Great product however I just realized I would need aHDMI cable when trying to install it. The vendor shouldhave specified that the cable is not included.
Great product, it's like having a computer on your tv. It's also works well if you have itunes. Inexspensive product.
Great product! This little box has saved me a ton since I was able to discontinue my cable service. Easy to use. Lots of features.
Great product.  Very easy to set, just plug the cables in and connect to internet....then enjoy your media content. Recommended!

Great product. We use it for everything: movies, music, radio, podcasts, family picture screensaver. The only problem is for audiophiles; if you have your CDs ripped at 16bit/44.1KHz, the AppleTV 2nd and 3rd generation will up-convert your music to 48KHz, whereas the first generation Apple TV would keep the 44.1KHz rate.This problem will not bother most users in the least, but it's worth mentioning if you are an audiophile and are thinking of streaming your lossless files to the Apple TV.

Great replacement for cable when you add Hulu+ and NetFlix. Other streaming boxes are comparable, but if you are a primarily Mac household, then this device is a no brainer. Recent additions of the Disney Channels, and Smithsonian make it even better.
Great system.  Works well and my son stated he was enjoying it as well.  Syncs to apple devices very well.
Great unit at a reasonable price. Would buy this unit again!This unit defines the words plug and play. Thank's!

Great way to get additional programming on my tv and share from my other apple devices!  All we need is Showtime! AirPlay is fantastic and access to iTunes movies. Downside is no Amazon instant. If that's important to you or you don't use other Apple products, get a Roku (unless you want You Tube as its not available on it yet). We have a Roku on another TV and love it, but the Apple TV is great with our macs and iPads, iPhones.

Hello Apple TV. Goodbye cable. We're saying money every month and enjoy tv more. We bought a hd antenna so we could watch basic channels. Between hulu and Netflix were set. I wish they would add more options for the news.

Here's what I love about the Apple TV.1. AirPlay....it's worth it's money alone.2.  AirPlay mirroring...it will mirror your Mac with ease....very useful for streaming video.  If you watch a PPV via Stream online...you can now watch it on your TV.3.  Uses very little power4.  Very small, you can tuck it anywhere.5.  NHL Game Center Live games run at 60 fps as opposed to PS3, Xbox, or online which run at 30 fps, this will really make you feel like you're watching it via Satellite/Cable.
summary: Better than Roku or any streaming box

reviewText: Hulu has been added which is very nice.  This thing works great with my iPad and iPhone as well.  I am extremely happy with it.  For 99 bucks it is a great deal.
I absolutely love being able to stream iTunes purchases from both mine and my husband's accounts directly from our TV. Extremely easy to set up and use.
I absolutely love it, the best gadget I have bought in a long time.  Multiple uses but perfect for watching NETFLIX.
summary: Exactly what I needed, multiple uses but perfect for NETFLIX!

reviewText: I added Apple TV to my Mac, Macbook, Ipad (X2) and Iphone (X2) home. It's a great addition that pulls all the technology together. For the cost it really can't be beat if you are running mac products.
summary: A Must Have For Wired Homes

reviewText: I all of a sudden have these all over the place. 2 in my office and 3 in the house. Mirroring any Apple device on the TV is great. In the office I share work on my TV or TV in the conference room. At home mostly Netflix plus some other channels. Also great to throw up pictures. Great to mirror TV stations from websites you don't get from your provider such as the local news station during a storm which I do not get on DirecTV. iTunes Radio, etc. This gives you a small taste of where TV is probably going in the future.
summary: An inexpensive way to Upgrade your TVs
