reviewText: I am disappointed with the limited availability apple TV offers.  The interface is excellent and it is easy to use however.
I am glad I read reviews.  It was very easy to operate once we figured out how to synch it up with our tv.  Totally worth the money.  We paid $80 on Amazon but it costs $90 @ appletv.com...

I am running 18 mbs internet speed and still have constant issues with "cannot connect to itunes store", takes forever to load previews. I do not have issues like this at all with the 2 chromecasts I own. But, based on the overall reviews, there appear to be many that love this thing. I hate it!
summary: No clue why it is popular

reviewText: I am simply getting a ton of enjoyment out of this little device.  I enjoy being able to interface my iPad to my HD TV displaying my photo albums, playing games, etc., etc.  It was also the catalyst for my subscription to NetFlix through Apple TV and I am currently enjoying the free month offered by NetFlix.  I also enjoy streaming my music collection through the device to the large screen and audio system that I have hooked up to the TV, and also enjoying the endless radio stations available through Apple TV.  One of my best purchases in a long time!
summary: A super addition to our entertainment center

reviewText: I am so glad I got this. I use it daily and it is so much faster at loading Netflix than the bluray player I was using before. It is also well integrated with other apple products

I bought a Google Chromecast for another TV in our home after having two Apple TV boxes elsewhere.  As the price of the Google product was approximately one third that of Apple TV, I wanted to see if there is a significant difference.  Disclaimer: all of my computer/tablet/phone products are Apple and that may bias me as the interfaces for Apple TV and Apple products are seamless.The set up of the Chromecast was simple enough using the app, however I was really disappointed as to how slow the streaming of videos were either through youtube or netflix.  I put the Chromecast on one of the two HDMI ports on my TV and then Apple TV on the other while timing how long an one hour long episode in HD would take to start streaming.  Needless to say, Apple TV was exceptionally faster and appeared clearer without pixelation that was seen on the Chromecast.Bottom line for Apple users: you get what you pay for.  Simple to install with clear GUI and integration with other Apple devices.  I'm not certain if I would be so critical of Chromecast if I had an Android device.

I bought it to interface with my PC and IPad for displaying pictures video etc on my TV. Works well with Netflix Hulu etc. the ATV3 works well with HD HDMI CABLE IS NOT INCLUDED so 1 make sure you have HDMI connectors on your TV and pick up the cable.

I bought the Apple TV for my parents who love watching shows/movies on Netflix, but don't have a game consol/wifi capable dvd player that allow streaming.  Apple Tv is great for all them because it is so simple and what it does, it does great.The apps that work with Apple TV are great, my favorites are HBOGo and Netflix, but the ability to wirelessly stream any apple device to the TV is Apple TV's best function in my opinion.Now for a couple negatives. the apps on the device are great but there could be more. You have to purchase an HDMI cord or digital optical cords separately.A few little complaints aside, Apple TV is a great way to stream movies, shows, or music through your TV via apps or your own Apple devices.
summary: Great and Simple way for Streaming on TV

reviewText: I bought this about the same time I bought a Roku Stick for a different TV.  The Apple TV was SUPER easy to setup with my iPhone (use bluetooth and it does everything for you).  It works fantastic as a Roku style device, streams Netflix etc beautifully and has optical and HDMI output etc.Disappointment comes from a couple of things.  Mostly Airplay.  Airplay is awesome and works perfect from an iOS device, but is very sub par on my macbook pro.  We have a variety of movies in various formats on my computer and I have had to do a lot of messing with my router to try and make playback watchable.  Streaming TV from a website for example is borderline watchable with the jumpiness.  its like I am getting 5fps instead of 30.  Sometimes if hangs for a half second or so.  Doesn't seem like a big deal until you are trying to watch a show and its so distracting!I also wish I could do the "private listening" that the Roku offers.  I have watched a couple shows while my wife sleeps and it would be epic if I could listen from my headphones rather than the speakers.  You can't do it however, even with apps etc on your phone that say you can (at least  that I have found so far).The Roku Stick couldn't even hook to my wifi.  I get an excellent signal (checked with Air Radar mac app) right in front of my TV but the Roku was terrible.  I sent it back.  I have a Roku 2 on the way (previous was the stick) I hope it works better....

I bought this after purchasing my iPad 3 and I absolutely love it! Easy to use out the box. You are able to stream true 1080p movies from iTunes. My favorite feature is the ability to use my photos on my PC as a screensaver and still play music.  It's great when I host parties.  My guest enjoy looking at the thousands of photos of family and friends.  The mirror feature for the iPad is also wonderful.  I recommend this product to anyone with an apple mobile device.  A++++++++

I bought this because the Roku does not have YouTube.  That's all I use it for.  It works very well.  It is nicely designed as any Apple product I have ever dealt with.  If you have trouble signing into YouTube through the interface, you may have to go to your email settings and 1) turn off 2 step verification or 2) set an application-specific password.
summary: Like it a lot, wish Roku had YouTube

reviewText: I bought this device in order to watch my YouTube videos on my HDTV.  I have Time-Warner Turbo Internet service and so streaming videos from YouTube works very well for me.  Set-up was straight-forward following the instructions provided.  Be aware that Ethernet & HDMI cables are not supplied, but the included remote contains an excellent battery.

I bought this for only airplay but have found the YouTube and NBA to be great. What I don't like about it is that the movies are expensive - there should be some free movies. Also, instructions do not mention that the software update should be done via wifi, and not Ethernet connection.
I bought this for the use of Netflix in the home.  We placed this in the living room but will buy another for my daughter;s bedroom!

I bought this for two main reasons. I wanted to add it to an old plasma TV that has no built in apps so I could watch Netflix and I wanted to be able to use all my other Apple products with it. Works seamlessly. It's a little dated given the features on the new Roku products but it does everything I need. I paired an Apple wireless keyboard to it so I don't have to chase letters all over the screen when searching for things. It works great too.
summary: Great of you have other Apple products.

reviewText: I bought this specifically for the airplay/screen mirroring. We wanted to watch what was on the computer screen on our 55' inch TV. Unfortunately, the quality of tranference from the AppleTV from my Macbook Pro is very low. It lags, takes awhile to load and doesn't sync properly. After looking around online for a solution, it seems everybody with a Macbook has the same issue. Thankfully my roommate has an iPad and it works flawlessly with that and his iPhone5.
i bought this specifically to use in a slideshow picture frame. incredibly easy to set up and get going. had it running & showing pictures in less than 20 minutes. highly recommended!

I bought this to replace my faulty Apple TV version 1. It is a definite improvement in all functions. It is smaller, uses less power, and has an auto-off function that I don't think version 1 had The programming options are many, although similar to all the other boxes out there. It hooks up seamlessly to my network and is a no-brainer if you have an iPad or iPhone, because with Airdrop you can stream easily from either device to the set.
summary: A great upgrade to the original

reviewText: I bought this unit primarily to access Netflix and Amazon Prime  (using Airplay).  It works great for both.  The Apple TV interface for Netflix is much better than the one provided with my LG Blu-ray player and streaming is more reliable.  It is also great for viewing your photo library on TV and accessing music on your networked computer with iTunes.  With Airplay you can mirror on your TV pretty much anything you can display on your iPad or iPhone and it works great.  There are quite a few other supported services and features that I have not used.  Using just one of the supported services would justify the purchase.
summary: Apple TV Provides a Great Front End to Netflix and Amazon Prime and other Services with Aiplay as a Bonus for Apple Devices

reviewText: I bought this without really reading into what it does. I originally just wanted to stream shows and music videos from Youtube from my Ipod. Imagine my surprise when I finally figured out it comes with it's own apps for those things installed. I've had this for a few months now and I enjoy it. Make sure to buy an HDMI cable since it doesn't come with one to hook into the TV. It's easy to set up even without a keyboard. No complaints so far. Don't lose the remote!

I can not emphasize how much we love Apple TV. It's so simple to set up and use. Not only does it stream movies and television show, but music, photos even facetime. We liked this so much that we gave them as gifts to our adult children for Christmas this year. They have been just as pleased.
I can now watch all of the HD movies I've downloaded in iTunes on my 55" HD TV.  I'm now renting movies in iTunes, instead of OnDemand through my cable company.

I can play everything streaming from my iPad beautifully on the tv screen. And while the alternative choice to this has more stations, the amount of Apps that can perfectly stream video onto your tv is endless. Netflix, HULU PLUS, NBC, ABC, TED TV, NBC NIGHTLY NEWS, and Video file, PBS, ESPN APP (THE BEST!). Either way if you own apple you NEED this for your HD tv. Cable will never be needed again!
summary: If you own and iPad or iPhone This IS a MUST!

reviewText: I did a lot of researches online, and read a lot of reviews before I decided to give this small black box a try.  This Apple TV does notdisappoint me. It's easy to setup, and easy to use; I can use either my iPhone or my ipad to play movies on big screen HD TV's byusing "Air Play".

I did not have a previous Apple TV, but with the update it received this year I was intrigued enough (and $100 seemed reasonably low enough) to give it a shot.I like it quite a bit. I have liked it enough that I bought one for a relative whom I thought would enjoy it.I like being able to have all TV shows and movies purchased on my computer's iTunes immediately available to watch on my main entertainment system. I think in the past the Apple TV had a storage capacity but as far as I can tell this doesn't so much store things as instantly retrieve them from the iTunes store as soon as you ask for it.I have iTunes match so that means all my music, even stuff I didn't purchase from iTunes, is easily accessible to listen to through my main entertainment system.I like the AirPlay functionality with my iPhone.I use the Netflix and Youtube apps a lot, those are great. I use Pandora and Vimeo sometimes. I have experimented with the radio app which is interesting but haven't used it much.As other reviewers have noted, I would have liked to have the ability to add apps over time, and/or get things like Hulu Plus, which the Roku has. But, the smoothness of the presentation and easy integration with my existing iTunes stuff is pure Apple.UPDATE 9/5/12: As you probably know, the Apple TV has Hulu Plus now. That is a great addition! The only other thing that would be extra great would be Amazon Prime Video but I doubt that will happen due to direct competition between Apple and Amazon. I did hear that the iPad has some kind of Amazon Prime app, though, so you never know.I am continuing to use the Apple TV about 50% of the time that I have my main TV on now. I still have cable and will DVR network and cable shows that I want to watch as they are broadcast. I find the interface and remote for Apple TV more pleasing than that for my cable box. I use Netflix and Hulu Plus fairly often. I am using YouTube, with its channels and subscriptions a lot more than I ever thought I would.
I don't have a tv yet and have been using this with an hdmi compatible monitor and some external speakers. It's been great. Will probably get another soon.

I don't have cable, and we watch our stuff on iTunes or NetFlix.  I wanted something for streaming to the TV.  I looked at the Ruku, which has more content and is cheaper, but after playing with a friends Apple TV, I realized how much nicer an experience the Apple TV is.  I have all Apple products, so that may have influenced me... but I like the product.  Small, clean, easy to use... perfect!  It runs NetFlix and iTunes very well... I wish it had Pandora... maybe they'll add that.

I don't know why I have waited so long to get Apple TV. After installing in my main homes living room I quickly ran back to the computer and ordered another one for our 2nd home as well. Awesome for sharing videos, pictures, and business presentations and documents. I work from home and clients love when I push documents and charts to the 50" screen. Great for personal use and business! If you have a Mac or iPhone/iPad this product is a MUST!

I don't like Apple products in general because I hate the simplicity in design and likes more control. However, Apple TV is the exception here since it does its only job very well: watch TV. Of course, searching youtube for a particular video can be pain when you need to type something using the awful control pad to search each character at a time.If you are Chinese or like to watch Chinese programming, Apple TV provides great access to a large libraries of Chinese programming for free.
summary: if you like to watch online programs, this is the probably the best out there

reviewText: I don't think there is one negative thing to say about any Apple product. This Apple TV is the perfect example of that. I love this! Anything that is on my iTunes, I can now get on my tv, not just movies and shows, but music and pictures as well. This Apple TV was delivered to me in less than 24 hours!!! It was awesome. It also came with two Apple car decals! Make sure you have an HDMI plug because it is not provided with the Apple TV, so maybe one negative thing but not that big of a deal. I am extremely happy!

I first must say that I develop private apps for both apple ios and android.  In saying that i want it to be clear that i like both platforms.Ok to the review.  I own this apple tv , roku 3, chrome cast and amazon firetv, I'm a cord cutter, tired of paying the huge cable bills.  So this review will have a pros and cons that considers the four "tv boxes" versus each other.ApplePros: smooth operations as far as the software goes (best  i have used), works great with all apple productsCons: software is smooth because apple limits the developers by only allowing certain looks and interactions, doesn't work with some other branded products, very limited apps. limited processor versus some of the others.Roku 3Pros: great overall box, largest number of apps (channels), smooth operations.Cons: no real cons except the slower processor (doesn't have a huge effect now but may in the future)ChromecastPros: Cost (cheapest of the four), easy install, size (smallest), cost, cost, costCons: need a computer or ipad/iphone/tablet or some other type of controller to operate, wifi reception is a little weak, buffers more than the others, has limited number of apps, has a limited processor.Amazon FireTvPros: best processor, with newest firmware as of may 29 2014 is very smooth, rapid growing number of apps, the voice search is nice and has improved.Cons: not many, i love this guy and will probably buy another one.To conclude i hope apple will allow for a little variety in their apps and open the API to the public.  I also hope that apple releases a new apple tv with improvements (basically to match the other in hardware).People who are apple fans will love this product, people who have a lot of apple products will love it, people with no apple products will be ok with it, and people who prefer other operating systems (windows, android, linux, etc) will probably prefer the Roku 3 (or maybe chrome cast,or amazon FireTv).

I found myself buying 4 of these each for four of my T.V's in the house. Just had to have access to my iTunes  account when I wanted to watch my movies. If my wife was in the family room and my daughter in the living room I can run to the back bedrooms to watch my movies or see other apps and what's playing on them in peace. Everyone who has an iTunes account should get these. My whole house is apple and they are wonderful products to own.

If this doesn't connect to your iPhone or computer right away just restart your home router or hub.Download a free program called handbrake to convert and video's you have that isn't an mp4, then add video to iTunes.If you don't have a Mac you can buy a program called AirParrot and you can mirror your PC to your TV, it's about 10 bucks.I love this thing and use it all the time to watch shows, movies and pictures from my iTunes or iPhone.
If you are a fan of apple products, this works great. Very easy to connect and use. It is uses almost daily in my home.

If you are looking for a streaming box and use Apple products, the AppleTV is the way to go.  The processor is not the fastest in its class.  It doesn't offer the largest variety of channels (though there are rumors this will change in the near future).  But, if you have other Apple products (iPhone, iPad, laptop) you can use the Airplay feature to project whatever is one your device onto your TV through the AppleTV.This helps to cancel out the lack of channels.  The feature does not work in all instances.  There are certain apps that do not allow the use of Airplay (the March Madness app is one example).The Roku 3 has more channels and a faster processor, but it does not have an airplay feature.AppleTV also works best when connected via Ethernet as opposed to wi-fi.The appearance is small and discrete but requires sightline for the remote to work. Also, concerning the remote, if you have an Apple laptop the remote controls the volume on your laptop.  This may be an added bonus unless you are on your laptop and someone else is browsing through shows on the AppleTV.  Your volume will increase and decrease with the familiar *blip* each time.  This gets old quick.  I've given up on using my laptop and AppleTV in the same room unless I'm Airplay-ing something from my laptop.All-in-all it isn't bad.  Definitely worth it if you already use Apple products.  If you aren't an Apple user you're best suited to use a different product.
summary: A Good Product, but not yet perfect

reviewText: If you have all elements in place IE: HDTV internet access this thing performs flawless out of the box set up takes less than 5 minutes. I recently dished dish network and the countless channels that I had to get this. I put it in myson's room so he could access my Netflix account granted there are not a lot of channel selection with this however, for the reason I bought it the unit gets five stars for it's quality speed and no loss of service great unit and with the ability to share from your iTunes under home sharing and push from i-cloud can't be beat I don't even leave feedback's that often but had to on this one and no I don't work for apple I am a blue collar worker with a white collar lust for products that work like this.Thanks, Patrick

IF you have a Macbook, iPhone, iPad, or any other products this is a MUST HAVE, its no roku but it will give you more use from your products and well worth the purchase. I would recommend this to anyone that likes what apple makes, and it even comes with apple care for the first year for free with tech support to assist with any issues. BUT!!! i would recommend that you buy a High Speed HDMI cable as none others will work and cause issues. amazon sells some for much cheaper than anyone and they are just as good.

If you have an iMac, MacBook, iPad, or iPhone and you use iTunes, then the Apple TV is an invaluable addition. Hook it up to your tv and stereo and you can rent movies, stream music and movies from your computer or iDevice, and even mirror your display to your tv via Airplay. Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, HBO Go, and a slew of other channels round out an all around wonderful device. Easy to hookup and get running, like all of Apple's products.

If you have any Apple products the Apple TV is a must.  Airplay allows you to stream videos to your TV.  Great for Youtube, Netflix, and HBO go.  I traded in my Apple TV for a Home Theater PC, the only reason was because I wanted to DVR live TV.  If you have lite streaming needs the Apple TV will meet all your demands.
If you have the whole package, iphone, ipad, and a mac, this device is very useful. Can stream all your data to any TV. Great stuff from apple
summary: Very good device for data streaming

reviewText: If your an iPhone / iPad user Apple TV is a must. On one hand Apple does isolate their products but on the other, they provide components like Apple TV that allow intervention of music, photos and videos to be shared with some of the most user friendly software and components on the market.

If you're in the Apple ecosystem this is a solid choice, but probably not the best one. Overall, the Apple TV has serious limitations compared to competitors like the Roku 3.Some are obvious. The Roku allows user-created apps and, therefore, has almost limitless possibilities compared to the Apple TV. (No Amazon Prime video on the Apple TV!) Other limitations are subtler. For the Netflix app, there's a 150-title limitation on the Apple TV -- a serious issue if your digital cue is as large as mine!The best feature of the Apple TV is Airplay, which works more smoothly with Apple products than the Roku's similar mirroring feature.But, beyond Airplay, you're better off going with the Roku 3 (or, perhaps, the Amazon Fire TV, which was released after I purchased my Roku 3), even if, like me, your computers and phones are Apple products.
summary: Solid, but much more limited than its competitors, even for those in the Apple ecosystem.

reviewText: I give it 5 stars. It is exactly what I expected it to be. It also comes at a reasonable price

I got Apple TV as a gift for Xmas this year.  It is a great little box.  Very sleek looking, uses little power, and integrates with all your iPhones and iPads.  The quality of the video is awesome.  Mine is streaming over 5ghz wifi without a hitch.  Perhaps those that complain about video quality do not have the proper router.  Regardless, mine streams perfectly.Here is why this works for me: I subscribe to DirecTV.  I have two set-top boxes (one in the family room and one in the living room).  Each of those TVs also has an Xbox 360 and a blue ray player attached.  The TV in my bedroom has no set-top box, no 360, and no DVD player.  It simply pulls in beautiful free HD over the air.  Enter Santa and my Apple TV.All in all I am happy with the unit.  The Netflix app is not as user friendly as the Xbox app, however, it gets the job done.  I like that I can pull content from iTunes and or my networked computer.  Air Play is really cool.  Where it is lacking is APPS!  I would like Flixster, Amazon Prime, and just more content.  I will use ESPN, MLB, NETFLIX, and the Disney apps when the kids come in and snuggle with my wife and I on the weekends.I like the unit and am glad Santa brought it.  However, it may not work for your specific needs.  The Roku may be more of what you are looking for.  They need to crank out more apps!UPDATE 1/6/2014:I bought a Roku 3 as well.  Both are great boxes but I think I actually prefer the Apple TV.  I ordered another unit and just canceled Direct TV.  I have the best of both the Roku and Apple TV.  Prefer the Apple TV for the integration with my iDevices and AirPlay.

I got ATV 3 after getting rid of horrible D Link DHD 131 and I could not be happier. Biggest negative about ATV was the lack of apps ,well they just added hulu app yesterday and launch of amazon videos app on iPad makes me beleive that amazon video app will follow suit. As far as the graphics and streaming quality goes its top notch. I use my laptop as server and stream all my music (including FLAC files) using audiogalaxy app which works very well. Same for all the movies in different formats (.mkv, Divx etc) works great with online conversion. Those are two great things (besides obvious airplay etc) that i like about apple tv. I have my entie music library availabe to me without actually storing any music on iPad and i stream it to my Home Theater System..Would definately recommed this product over roku , D Link (not even close) .

I got the Apple TV for my best friend and she loves it. Very simple to work, simple setup. I got it for her dorm so the airplay doesn't work but she uses it for Netflix all the time which works great and YouTube and it has tons of features.
summary: Birthday present for friend and she loves it!

reviewText: i got this after trying out the google chromecast and i fell in love. i can play all of my movies and music off of my multiple computers via itunes and it is always hd quality and never laggy. the interface is extremely easy to use.

I got this for 2 reasons. 1st my Sony str-dn840 has airplay but uses an awful high contrast graphical display with no screen saver that burns and image into my plasma tv. The Apple TV's Airplay playing capability is better. It allows browsing from its gui of networked shared libraries, and it has a nice screen saver. 2nd, the Apple tv allows for Airplay mirroring and iCloud photo sharing. This allows you to easily watch videos taken on your iDevice on the big screen, or view your iDevice photos saved to iCloud. Yes, you can do this with any tv or blu-ray player with HDMI and a Apple AV cable. However, the proprietary cable costs $50 and the Apple TV costs $85. To me its a no-brainer to by the Apple TV for this use case for an additional $35.Of course all of this assumes you are already heavily invested in the Apple universe with iPhones, iPads, Macs and iTunes, and care about watching iPhone videos and photos on your TV. There is another issue as well. Apple is a content provider though iTunes. They really don't compete with Netflix, as they don't provide a subscription service, so you get that, but they do compete with Amazon for movie rentals, so you don't get an Amazon app. You still need another device to use your Prime streaming or rent movies from Amazon which are cheaper than iTunes. Roku on the other hand isn't an Amazon competitor, so you get Prime along with many more streaming services.Performance wise, the Apple TV has plenty of storage so that buffering and streaming quality don't seem to be an issue. Also the Apple TV has some other potential. They do add content, and there is word that Apple with update the software with more app store-like functionality, so that developers can make apps for it. We'll see. For now its a good unobtrusive player, with Apple universe integration and less content than Roku or XBMC. Well, that is, unless they develop an Apple TV 3 jailbreak.One more thing. Airplay mirroring ONLY natively works with newer Macs with better graphics hardware and iOS devices. To use AIrplay mirroring on older Macs you need to buy the AirParrot app. I can attest that this works well on a ram upgraded late 2008 MBP, but it does use a lot of system resources and spins up the fan quite a bit.
summary: If you want to use Airplay, Airplay mirroring, or iCloud photo sharing get this, otherwise you may want to consider a Roku

reviewText: I got this form my father hoping he would be able to work it easy. ChromeCast requires a smartphone really, which he doesn't have.
summary: The wireless remote is an advantage over ChromeCast

reviewText: I got this for my living room. It was very eas to hook up to the tv, you will need to make sure you have the cable to go from it to the T.V.  The only other is it's plug. Then it is just a matter of hooking it up to your wifi, syncing with you iTunes library, and if you have a Netflix account imputing your account info. It is very easy to do. It comes with a remote, but if you have an iPad, iPod touch, or iPhone, you can use them as a remote. The menu is very easy to navigate and understand. Going through the music, movies and anything else that you have in iTunes is very easy to accesse and sort through and navigate.
summary: All I need and easy to hook up

reviewText: I had a 720P one at home and found it so good to watch anything I like. It uses more than anyother similar devices. I also found it a good gift, so I bought two new 1080P version, one for myself and one for my friend. Like it!
summary: I bought two at one time.

reviewText: I had a hard time with the idea of purchasing this, because my LG 50PZ950 TV has interfaces for many of the online streaming services.  I couldn't bring myself to spend $99 for an item that might not be any better than what I already have.Fortunately I received one as a birthday present, and I love it!  I use my personal Apple TV primarily for Netflix, and to play music.  I purchased a second Apple TV for my bedroom for the same reason.  Being a part of the Apple ecosystem, I find that the device works really well.  I found that iTunes runs far better on the Mac than its Windows counterpart.  When Vista came out, I made the switch to Mac, and haven't regretted it.PROS:I find the interface far more intuitive than the one on the TV, and easier to use.  Using my iPhone and iPad as a remote control adds further ease of use, as I can use the touch screen to type, rather than the Apple Remote.I like the ability to stream music from my computer to my TVs.  Being a Mac user, this is an easy link to set up.  I turn on my TV many mornings just to listen.Airplay Mirroring is a great feature.  On occasion I use my TV as an additional monitor for my laptop.  This is an important feature at my office.  We hooked one up in our conference room to enable an easy hook up to our TV display.  It makes connecting extremely painless, and wireless.CONS:The biggest downside that I have is that they don't have an Amazon interface.The iTunes movie store / rental system is a bit pricy.  If I wish to rent a movie, I will usually switch over to my SmartTV to save a few bucks.

I had an apple TV almost two years ago before I had internet at my home (yea, there was no point). A couple years went by and I acquired a few more Apple devices and found myself wanting to stream music wireless, watch TV shows without cable and use my TV to show other media during get togethers at my home. I debated between all the competitors to the Apple TV and highly considered Google chrome cast because of it's low price tag, but when it came down to it, the Apple TV is the best device of its kind for connecting your iOS device to your home entertainment setup. The Airplay feature made my decision since the other streaming devices relied on apps and not the actual iPhone, iPad, etc. I can mirror anything on my device and not just a tab or stream from just a certain app. My whole device can stream audio and video to my TV which is exactly what I wanted.It is limited on the amount of apps it has and while I thought mirroring my Macbook or iPad would be the same it wasn't. The aspect ratio of the device is transferred to the TV. This isn't an issue with the Macbook, but who wants to relax and watch something using your computer to control it?! The iPad and iPhone create odd black space around the video which isn't ideal.Overall I'm very satisfied and although there's rumors of a new version coming out very soon I was excited to have this device and at the discounted price offered by Amazon.

I had an apple tv now for a year and three months and couldn't be happier. This product has only gotten better over time because Apple keeps adding more apps and improvements to the device. I believe that Apple will only continue to add better apps and more content because of its rumored interest into the tv market. I love being able to access all of my itunes music and playing it on the surround sound, the free itunes radio is decent too. The only thing I wish it wasn't missing was an NFL app. I also hope that once more apps are created for the device that the user will be aloud to move and delete apps like on the ipad.
summary: Great device that will probably be built into a future apple tv

reviewText: I had a reasonable idea of the limitations of the Apple TV from reading the reviews.  I decided to pick one up anyway just to replace my composite video cable adapter that was busted.  That cable costs around $40-$50 and I was able to get the Apple TV for $75.  So instead of hooking a cable from my iPad to the TV, I transfer the video/picture/audio to my TV via the Apple TV and the Airplay function.  When I bring up my video on the iPad, a rectangle with a triangle under it shows up.  If you click on that, my Apple TV shows up and I select it.  When I hit play, the video is transferred via the wireless router in my house to the Apple TV and from the Apple TV to my TV.  As a wireless extension to my iPad, Apple TV seems to work well.  That's worth a solid 3 stars.However, the Apple TV has pretensions of being a multimedia player.  At that, it fails miserably unless your primary source of video and music is from iTunes, Netflix, or Hulu+.  Quite a few folks have raved about the Apple TV menu.  The reason it is reasonably clean is due to the lack of options.  You cannot watch any of your own content unless you have purchased it from iTunes or have it reside on your computer iTunes account.  I knew about this limitation before purchasing this box but I was still shocked with the lack of functionality.  One nice feature is the ability to display your Photo Stream from your Apple iCloud account on your TV as a screen saver.  All in all, I give Apple TV perhaps 1/2 a star on the Photo Stream support but nothing else.So if you are looking to extend your iPad/iPhone/iPod to you TV without wires, this is a nice box (though you need to have a wireless network in your house for it to operate).  If you don't need that wireless extension, don't pick up this box unless you are a big iTunes user.
summary: Good iPad Extender and Not Much Else

reviewText: I hadn't been able to get one of these to work in hotels before, but now that I have a hotspot through my 4G LTE phone (with unlimited data), I can use this just like I do at home.  Great to have the options to watch Netflix, MLB.TV, HBO-Go, ESPN WatchNow, etc. when I'm away from home.
summary: Had one at home, finally decided to get a 2nd to take when I travel.

reviewText: I had the original hard drive based apple tv and was disappointed by it. Too much syncing/buffering. Quality of video was good, not great. And no services other than iTunes video.This has all changed. Netflix, Hulu, NHL, well you know the rest. Tons of streaming subscription services built in and then iTunes pay as you go to fill in the rest.Plus AirPlay from my iPad is AWESOME. just had a fantasy football draft and mirrored the results to my big screen from my iPad.I usually leave my tv on in the background when I'm sitting around and it's nice to play music through my surround sound and have the photo stream screen saver pull up all my photos from the last 30 days or just coming across a random Internet video or highlights from last nights game and being able to have them play automatically on the TV is nice.VERY happy with this version, thinking about picking up another one for the bedroom! Great device for cutting the cord and breaking free of cable/sat!

I have 5 of these, one on every TV.  For $99, this is the cleanest and easiest way to access your iTunes & iCloud content, use Airplay from your iPhone/iPad.Really slick, and affordable techno wizardry!

I have an apple centric set up so it was natural for me to choose this over the competing Roku3.  I was worried though as I obtain my movies via DVD and BR rather than through iTunes.I adjusted my ripping process to target the ATV standards and along with iFlicks I have a great workflow for my content.  For playing back the device is great.  Airplay from my iOS or iMac works better than I expected and this makes up for the lack of Amazon Prime on the device.I took a star off because the device does not support DTS or higher audio standards and it also is not capable of transmitting 3D, so I still have to use my PS3 and 3D bluray disks for that.  If it did, I could place my entire collection on my media server....

I have an old Sony Bravia LCD TV, and it doesn't have a wireless connection. Well, it didn't. As soon as I connected Apple TV to my TV, I was able to use Comcast remove app with my iPhone because my TV got connected to the wireless network through Apple TV. So right now, in addition the great benefits of Apple TV, I can also control my TV from my iPhone, which allows me to get rid of at least one remote controller... I recommend this to every Apple user...
summary: It changed my entire TV experience

reviewText: I have a Roku also. Apple has the better quality especially in the super tiny remote, but some channels I want are not available. These things should all be open platform for any dern channel I want.
summary: Like most products from Apple, this is quality that limits you

reviewText: I have a Roku and an Apple TV.  I like both of them but I prefer the Apple TV.  It's so much faster than the Roku and the picture is substantially clearer.  The Roku was then moved to one of the bedrooms and the Apple was moved to the living room.  I liked it so much I also bought one for my father who also then moved his Roku to his bedroom and put the Apple TV in the living room.  He also preferred the Apple TV over the Roku.It's also easy to install and to use.  If you prefer streaming content over watching cable, then this is an awesome device for you.  Many people think you have to have Apple products in order to use Apple TV properly.  This is untrue.  You do NOT need an iPhone or Mac.  I don't have a Mac and my father doesn't have an iPhone or Mac and he loves this device.Another plus, the remote is durable.  I washed my throw blanket and didn't realize the teeny tiny remote was tangled up in it.  In fact, the remote is so tiny I didn't even notice it until after I heard it clanging in the dryer.  After I made my discovery I removed the battery, put the remote on top of some rice and let it sit for a few days near the window.  I couldn't believe it when I tried the remote and it worked perfectly fine.  It doesn't even have a nick on it.BTW - I'm not one of those people that thinks Apple can do no wrong, but this is one product that I absolutely love and stand by 100 percent.

I have a Sony Bravia 32 inch flat screen in my bedroom that I often would use Apple's HDMI enabling cable (Apple $39.99) and physically link my iPad 2, so I could watch movies.  The downside was that my iPad was physically tethered to the tv and I could not read, check email or do anything while watching a movie.After my iPad 3 arrived, I decided to try the Apple TV 3rd Generation.  It took under 5 minutes to set up, both physically to the tv and to the wireless network.  I also downloaded the FREE Remote app from the App Store for the iPad and iPhone, so I can control the Apple TV from my iPad while wirelessly streaming movies.  I am thrilled to be able to read a book while I am watching a movie!  The Apple TV does exactly what I had expected.For those who experience problems make sure your software is up-to-date (on the iPad/iPhone/ATV/iTunes), that you have turned on Home Sharing on ALL devices and that your wireless signal is STRONG.  If all these are a "yes,"  then you will love your new ATV and what it can do!Network Specs:  ATV3, iPad3, Airport Extreme, AT&T; U-Verse
summary: Great Device for Streaming Video from my iPad 3!

reviewText: I have bought into the Apple eco-system and so decided to go with the Apple TV instead of a Roku 3. I actually did have a Roku 3, but realized quickly that I was really only going to use it for Netflix, and not much more. While the Apple TV allowed for more flexibility within our household. Two iPhones, two iPads, and regular use of iTunes for media management. Plus, Comcast supports the HBO Go app on Apple TV, while they don't (as of this writing) support it on Roku. We use the Apple TV for Netflix, HBO Go, and iTunes media access. I have a hard wire internet connection which provides buffer free viewing of HD content through those services.The design is dead simple, all the way down to the box it came in. I was honestly really impressed with the simplicity of the box/packaging design. And that was before I even plugged the unit in. Once I did that, I continued to be pleased with my decision. It just works. There is some authentication/signing in for the various apps, but once that's done, the device just works and works well. I do recommend making use of the Remote app for iOS during setup. Entering usernames and passwords is much nicer on the keyboard on the iOS device instead of the onscreen keyboard.I honestly don't have any complaints about this device. I even love the remote. It is sleek, simple, and easy to work with.
I have canceled my cable since I got this... Rent movies from iTunes, have Hulu and Netflix... The one disappointment is no amazon prime...

I have grown to love this product and how it integrates with my other apple products.  Is a consistent performer on a solid platform.  i am a cable cutter and this has been best tv product I own (I only wish Apple could integrate some skip-back functionality in the remote (not another button (but maybe a double-click left or right for a short skip back and a triple-click to skip back or forth, a chapter...just saying).Would highly recommend if a new version wasn't due out soon.  I also own a Roku 3, but the Apple TV is a much more polished product and has noticeably better image display properties.  (not to downplay the Roku 3, it's a fine product and I use that daily, as well.  It's image display is not unwatchable, but the AppleTV displays a much crisper image).

I have had my Apple TV for several months and love it! I use it mostly for Netflix and Hulu. The only thing I don't like about it is the tiny remote. We lost it a long time ago, but that is fixed very easily with the "remote" app. It works very well also.

I have had the Apple TV for about a month now and absolutely love it. It works seamlessly with our iPhones and iPads through the airplay functionality and I love that it streams any purchases from the Cloud rather than taking up memory on the devices.It is a must own if you have apple tablets/phones.

I have now had Apple TV for nearly 2 years. We got Apple TV to watch Netflix instant on it. But it's been so much more. We now rent movies from iTunes at least 2 times a month, plus we listen to music, watch YouTube videos, and now it includes HBO Go and Watch ESPN!

I haven't met an apple product I didn't like. This is a seamless product. The only thing to note is that if you want to connect it to your surround sound is that you need and optical cable and input on your stereo or an adapter. Doesn't cost a whole lot to get that set up. But worth mentioning

I have owned a 1st gen Roku box almost since they were released and I use it nearly every day.  As an Apple heavy household (MacBook Pro, iPad, iPhone, and two Apple AirPort Routers, etc) being able to mirror those devices onto he Apple TV was very appealing. It is wonderful and was easy to set up. For other Apple households I highly recommend it. It may be somewhat less interesting for PC homes, especially if without any iOS devices.But the following is why I'm writing this review:I just bought a refurbished Apple TV from Apple last weekend. I had a hiccup getting Photo Stream to work and called Apple Tech Support. Along with their world class tech support from the Canadian tech I spoke with (we solved the issue quite quickly), she told me something that is not well known. If you buy AppleCare for your Apple TV, the coverage extends to any AirPort Extreme or AirPort Express routers you may have, as long as they are less than two years old. (Of course all Apple products have 90 tech support from date of purchase.)AppleCare, for some reason, isn't available for the routers on their own, but being able to get it via Apple TV was wonderful news. For $29.99 (list price) you can ensure you get two years of tech support for any networking issues you may develop. Since a one time tech call for products out of tech coverage is also $29.99, why not cover all your bases at the start, and for as many issues that arise?My original AirPort Extreme router was over four years old, so I decided to upgrade to the newest dual band version a couple of days ago.  Although I did call tech support to walk me through the set up, it couldn't have been simpler with the AirPort Utility App that is included in Lion and Mountain Lion as well as on iOS 6 devices (iPhone and iPad, for example). Again I received world class service. Last night it turned out I needed to fine tune one setting, and the Canadian tech I spoke to also suggested investing in AppleCare for the Apple TV for the reasons I've just given, and I have done so.This "wrap around" coverage to the routers also come from Apple iMacs, MacBooks, MacBook Pros, and iOS devices. For some reason this isn't commonly known, but it should be.  Networking issues can crop up, and having someone troubleshoot them for you can be very expensive. They also drive me crazy with frustration and knowing I have Apple to lean on is a huge relief. Their support is incomparable and North American-based. Every time I've ever had to call (and not many that) I am more impressed by their level of training, their patience and good will. They are my tech angels!
summary: Wonderful supplement to my 1st gen Roku box-consider adding AppleCare that will cover your newer Apple routers too!

reviewText: I have this and a few Roku players around the house. I mainly bought this because I wanted to hook it to my stereo so I could airplay my music directly from my iphone or Ipad. It works great and uses a digital output cable for the sound (sold separately). I do use it to stream Netflix and just noticed that Apple included some free channels like the Red Bull and Smithsonian channels where you can watch some cool stuff.

I have this and a roku. The reason I have roku is because Apple TV doesn't support Amazon video. LAME!!!!! Apple needs to stop being like this and let people use their products how we want to after we buy them.
I have three of these and each has been perfect. Bought the amazon five dollar Hdmi cable and had it going in minutes.

I have to start with this preface: if you are choosing between an Apple TV, Roku, Chromecast, Amazon Fire, etc and you are already within the Apple Ecosystem, I'm 90% sure you will be most satisfied with the Apple TV.All of my electronic devices are on OS X or iOS. The Apple TV centralizes all of my devices. It connects and streams off my iTunes library and iTunes account. I use it for iTunes Radio as well, but can watch movies and listen to music straight from my computer (good thing because I'm tired of buying HDMI cables that stop working). Additionally, I love AirPlay. If I'm too lazy to go on the YouTube app or can't view something on the Apple TV (because there is not ATV app for it), then AirPlay will just throw it on the screen.That said, there are two things you should also consider that would actually make this thing useful: a good Wi-Fi connection and subscription to services like Netflix or HBO GO etc. The latter is not as important because I know a lot of people just use it to stream from their computer or use the free services that are included, but you can maximize how amazingly convenient this thing is through Netflix or HBO Go services and the like. But I can't stress the importance of Wi-Fi connection. If it's slow or unreliable, it will really diminish the enjoyment of this device.Another thing that I like? I can watch stuff on my own time and interest. I stopped watching TV years ago but I still see how people just mindlessly watch whatever is on, no choice and limited to time (even if they have DVR). Not only that, you don't have to pay $50 for like 4 channels you actually want and 600 others you don't care about. If you Netflix and other services can suffice your selection, you can either save money on entertainment subscriptions OR allocate some of those savings towards faster internet (and you'd probably still have some money left over for gas or food!).
summary: Very versatile and useful; prefer it way over U-Verse and other cable/satellite services

reviewText: I have two of these, they work very well although slow to go through the menu and options. The toughest thing about the Apple TV is you are at Apples mercy when it comes to updates at which time they may add one or two new channels, so it really is limited. They do not have Amazon Prime, so I recently purchased the ROKU 3 for that purpose.I guess it's about how you use a streaming device, I don't care about AirPlay; I don't listen to my iTunes on the TV, I don't care about having photos up and I don't rent / buy movies from iTunes. But if you do or like all that this is a five star unit. I just want Prime and maximum streaming options and flexibility, ROKU does that. So don't get me wrong it's like serving a beautifully prepared filet mignon to a vegan! The Apple is best if you; 1. own Apple devices and  2. use them in conjunction with the TV.The other issue I have is the remote has to be very close to the unit and nearly in front to change channels, very annoying. There is an App that takes the place of the remote, and that is certainly useful.Frankly with ROKU at the same price the  Apple doesn't make sense, it  is too limited and not flexible, I should be able to buy Apps the way I do on any Apple product. I cannot recommend.UPDATE: to be fair in reviewing this I am trying out the music channels and they are wonderful! Very surprising fidelity, excellent. Set it up through my receiver and the music reproduction is awesome. Again I continue to feel there are not enough APP options and flexibility compared to the ROKU, but I am among the converted when it comes to what it does offer. I will add I have it connected directly to the router, not WiFi so that helps.I continue to feel it is largely geared to Apple products users, and frankly if it had Prime I wouldn't feel the need for the ROKU. Since I have both I would say if you have to buy only one and want Prime, ROKU is not a compromise. If you don't have Prime and don't care and want the best in Audio/ Video reproduction quality Apple is the way to go.

I honestly couldn't be more happy with this product and will be purchasing additional units for other parts of my home. It does everything it says it does and makes streaming audio/video from my family's iPhones and iPad a breeze. The user-friendliness couldn't be any better. The primary uses of my Apple TV include streaming Youtube videos, Easy Access to radio stations and my iTunes library. Works great for Netflix which I use the most.There is so much more you can do with this fantastic little box than the apps that come preloaded. Download the free remote app and you can loose the remote that comes with the device. "Mirroring" your Apple devices is also a breeze. Fantastic product. Fantastic value.
summary: Needs To Add Amazon Prime Video

reviewText: I just got this product and for the price you'll won't be disappointed. There's like millions of movies and shows to choose from. But you do have to rent or purchase certain movies. For example: If you purchase nexflix for $8.00 a month you'll get to choose from hundreds if not thousands of movies and tv shows. Then there's another I think 15-20 more apps on there. You tube is free, I've only used it for about an hour so I can't tell you too much. I forgot to mention one important thing, you need to have a internet service wireless or hardwired.

I just received my Apple TV box and I love it.  I already have an iMac and an iPad, so everything is compatible.  I use it to put anything I find on my iPad up on the big screen.  Last week, I put up a college wrestling meet from the PAC 12 network. The picture was perfect as was the sound.  I found that anything I want to share with someone else in the room is easily readable when put up on the TV.  I can also send my music collection easily out through the TV sound system.  So far, this product everything I hoped it would be and more.
I just recently bought the Apple TV and have used it for Netflix and for streamingof the Winter Olympics events. It works very well so far and I would highly recommend it to others !!

I love all my Apple products AND Microsoft as well.  Apple TV kicks the butt of all the other streaming devices including PS3, roku, and all others.  I stream from a recent year Netgear router in the $80 range and wirelessly with NO ISSUES and rarely any hiccups.  Netflix, PBS, HULU, and the dozen or so channels all perform flawlessly.

I love AppleTV after waiting for years to try it, I recently gave it a shot and love it!  I did have to convert all my home media to Apple MP4 or M4V format, but once done I am very happy with it.  The Netflix client is fast and easy to use, visitors no longer have trouble using my home media devices and having AirPlay to stream content, like movies, videos, or even just music is super convenient now.  I don't know how I managed before the AppleTV came along.  I highly recommend it to pretty much anyone, but if you have a lot of content in other forms (home media) converting it all over is a pain.  So its not for everyone.  But in any case, this is a great product, it can handle super huge HD Media files and even 3D.  I'm very happy with it.
summary: Fantastic product, works perfectly and is my new home media standard

reviewText: I love Apple TV!! I love streaming my music from iTunes and my movies. I really think this is a remarkable item.
I love Apple TV, it is much quicker/easier to navigate Netflix and other features then other streaming devices I have seen.
I love AppleTV. This thing gets way more usage than our cable box or any other system. Watch Netflix, HBO Go, Hulu, and stream content from your iTunes.
I love it ,i love it...... This item is very cool and we used it every day to watch our iphone-ipad,iPod and my iTunes in our big screen tv.. Love it yes i recommended

I love my Apple Tv I no longer pay for Cable, I watch all my content via Apple TV whether its from Netflix or YouTube I can watch it all! The future of entertainment is with streaming devices like the Apple Tv.
summary: SAY GOODBYE TO CABLE AND SATELLITE

reviewText: I love my Apple TV.  I wasn't sure how I would like it since I"m not into the fanciest electronics available but I love having Netflix available and only wish they had more of a movie library but that has nothing to do with my Apple TV.  It works great and I have not had any problems with it in the last few months.
I. Love. My. AppleTV.  Plain and simple.  It's easy to use and intuitive, it integrates flawlessly with my MacBook and my AirPort, and it's become the only peripheral I even use anymore.
summary: One Box to Rule Them All

reviewText: I LOVE my apple TV.  The only complaint I have is that it doesn't have browsing capabilities.  Would recommend for the i-tunes, movies, and netflix.
summary: Love it!  If only it browsed.

reviewText: I love streaming my music, movies, and TV over Apple TV. But I wish it would also allow non-Apple streaming services (i.e. Amazon) on the device without having to use laptop mirroring.
I love the Apple TV.  I am asking myself why I didn't buy it sooner.  The ability to view the screen has been great for sharing information with my family.

I love the apple TV.  I mostly use it to stream my huge library of music, TV and movies over my local network.  However the web apps I have tried work  great too. Video quality and network streaming are excellent.

I love the apple tv, it pairs seamlessly with other apple devices, such as the iPad, iPhone, and iPad and the iTunes accounts. It does not have the wide selection of apps that my Roku player offers (such as amazon prime movies) however it is very user friendly and the overall navigation is extremely simple. I have one for my main tv, and I also bought one for my not so computer savy parents that are mainly enjoying Netflix on theirs, they have a hard time doing much else on it since they do not own other apple devices.

I love the apple tv.  I used to use my wii to watch Netflix but it wasn't in HD.  This is so easy to pick up and move from room to room when necessary.  Got a great price on it too.  Highly recommend.

I love the Apple TV. Just like all other apple products, it is extremely user friendly. It is the smoothest and easiest streaming device I have ever seen. Also, not only can you stream Netflix and Hulu, you can watch YouTube videos, movie trailers, various sports, and much more. And it is so inexpensive! A must have!
summary: Will never watch tv without it again!

reviewText: I love this Apple TV.  I bought it for my wife for Christmas, since she had been asking for it... She loves it, I love it, my son loves it, everyone that see's it loves it, etc!  I love that I can setup sharing and easily stream movies, music, pictures and more from our iTunes on any computer.  I also love that I can use my iPhone to share my screen from my phone right up onto my big screen TV, so I can easily show pictures to people that are over or anything else.  You can rent movies, it has a ton of free radio stations, I love watching YouTube or finding Disney stuff on YouTube for my kids.This thing is worth every penny!

I love this device.But then again, I own an iPad, iPhone and Macbook Pro.It plays nice with all my devices.The thing I like most about it is that I have A LOT of iTunes music.If you have iTunes match and want to listen to all your music through your TV/stereo, it's totally worth it!I've heard some people say they wish it had most content, but I beam other content like Amazon Instant Video through my iPad so I don't feel like I'm losing in the content department.
summary: Should have bought it long ago!

reviewText: i love this item i can watch any movie stop it, cut it off and it picks up where it left off and i can watch the lastest movies anytime i want.

I love this little thing.  It was a snap to set it up & I hooked it up to my Bose 321 system.  So now I have excellent music coming out of my Bose speakers because of this product.  I can listen to all my music from my iPad, iPhone, or iTunes.  This is the best thing I bought for myself & everyone in the house can use it too.  Incredible little thing.  Pictures looks great too on a bigger screen TV, along with videos.  Plus it doesn't take much room at all.
summary: Excellent all around music, pic, Youtube, movies player

reviewText: I LOVE this product especially the remote functionality with my ipad and iphone.  Mirroring and airplay are very convenient if you are an owner of other iProducts.
I luv using my Apple TV for watching netflix and other shows.  Very easy to install.  There another brand (roku), haven't had a chance to really see how it compares to Apple TV.

I mainly bought it to use it with AirPlay, mirroring local video files on my MBP.  After a few minutes of usage, keeps freezing.  Tried several times and the issue is consistent.  Couldn't be bandwidth issue on my local network/router, as all other devices are working fine when this issue is occurring with Apple TV.  Just returned it.

I'm currently using the Apple TV as a replacement for cable or satellite TV.  I'm currently running the Apple TV through a Pioneer AV receiver and a Samsung 65" LED TV.  I couldn't be happier with the Apple TV's picture quality.  The sound quality is also superior, but it is limited to a 5.1 output.Without cable, I'm using an off-air antenna to provide local channels and supplementing with Netflix and iTunes through the Apple TV.  I'm thinking about adding Hulu Plus as well.  I've used the built-in apps in my Samsung TV and a PS3 to stream Netflix before.  While I had good results using the PS3, I prefer to use the Apple TV.  The Apple TV also allows me to access iTunes, which is great for shows which are not on Netflix.  I'll gladly pay $40 for a season of a show that I want to watch vs paying $80+ every month to the cable company.When using iTunes, the picture is a full 1080p.  The streaming is very smooth and it takes almost no time to buffer.  My internet connection is through AT&T; U-Verse and is 18MBPS.I also subscribe to iTunes match, which allows me to play all of my music through the receiver which is hooked up to the Apple TV.  It also runs very smoothly and is fully controllable from my iPhone or iPad.  Additionally, I often stream Pandora from my iPhone via AirPlay through the Apple TV.  The Apple TV even displays the album cover art when listening to Pandora in this fashion.Overall, I'd say it's an excellent replacement for cable.  The setup was easy (HDMI cable hookup and the software walks you through getting it connected to your WiFi).Pros - Excellent quality picture and sound, full access to the Apple universe, streams/mirrors iPhone, iPod, and iPad, easy setup, great Netflix interface.Cons - Limited to 5.1 surround sound, can't download apps (as of yet).
summary: Using as a replacement for cable/satellite

reviewText: I'm no techno wizard but I can tell you this ... if you have a hard time with your WiFi connection while trying to view a streaming Netflix movie, this is what you need ... now that I've installed my Apple TV not one movie was interruped with annoying message "There's a problem with your Wifi connection, try try again".
summary: If your WiFi cuts out on your Netflix streaming viewing ... YOU NEED THIS

reviewText: I'm pleased with this version of Apple TV. However, I may not be the best source for a comprehensive review (yet) since we've only used it for airplay from our ipad to stream programs - this part does work quite well.

Im still learning this product, but it works great for what I was wanting to do. Press a few buttons and you are instantly watching Netflix or checking out music and apps. You will love this Apple TV. I do.

In a sea of media streaming, network ready, HD capable devices on the market, this Apple product is a solid contender. If you are an Apple person, with the ipad's and the iphone's and such, then this should be your media device of choice mostly due to the inherent compatibility with this unit. And the extra Apple feature of Airplay, to throw anything that is on your mobile device onto your big screen TV. We are enjoying it.

Initially I got this for the family to use with all our Apple products.  Seeing how simple it made viewing videos, movies, photos...I gave it to my grandparents to use and they LOVE IT!  It was so simple compared to a WiFi Samsung DVD player they had, that I bought another Apple TV for their bedroom.They enjoy watching youtube music videos with the Airplay, my kids love Netflix when they are visiting, the rest of the family can relax and not have to mess with troublesome apps/connections/UI to port media to the TV for viewing.Happy Grandparents = Happy Grandkids & Great Grandkids!Since I bought 2, I give it 10 Stars.

I now have all three generations of the AppleTV and must say I really DO LOVE them.  We are an Apple family so we're pretty intertwined in the whole iTunes system.  Movies, music and such.  We have iTunes Match which works AWESOME with the ATV.  It allows you to watch all your movies and listen to all your music from the cloud.  IMO, it doesn't get any easier than that.  We don't buy DVD or Bluerays, because we can grab it on iTunes and play it on our iPhones, iPads, Mac, or AppleTV's.  Have you mirrored your iPad II or iPhone 4 and up to your ATV yet?  It's nice to be able to surf the net on your TV and show the other people in the room the same stuff.We're hooked...  Have been since 2004 when I got my first iPod.The AppleTV is NOTHING without the app to control it.  If you're using the remote it comes with, buy a used iPod touch at least so you can download the app and run it the RIGHT way.  Well worth it.Signed,Apple FanFamily.
summary: As good as the Gen II

reviewText: I ordered the newest version of the Apple TV and absolutely love it. I had the first generation Apple TV and this is replacing it for all the new features (like Netflix streaming and Air Display). My OLD Apple TV still works and rents movies from iTunes but its much larger, runs very hot, wont stream netflix, and is overall just a bit clunkier than the new model. The NEW Apple TV is small, quick to start up, consistently pops open when you touch the remote button and swaps from room to room quite quickly. The AirPlay feature is quite nice and allows me to play my Spotify playlists through my tv/stereo and even pops the name of the songs on screen. My only grips about the product might be the streaming speed. The old Apple TV had a hard drive where the rented iTunes movie would download directly and play - this has a flash memory that temporarily stores the movie for playback... if you start an HD movie then stop it so you can finish up the movie later, you seem to have to wait for the buffer to start the download again (like it never fully downloaded the movie the first time. I only noticed this when downloading an HD movie off itunes (which are quite large anyway) and have not noticed such a lag when watching HD Netflix streaming movies. Other than that minor quirk (which may be addressed in a future upgrade - or may just be wifi speed related) I love this thing and actually am considering buying another for our other room so I dont have to keep moving it back and forth.
I ordered this after I cut my cable. I have had no problems installing or using this product. Kids enjoy it as well.

I ordered this so I could watch all of my iTunes movies & TV shows through the box. I already had Netflix through PS3, but accessing Netflix through AppleTV is much smoother. It is completely silent VS the hum of the PS3, and load-up time for the AppleTV is 40 seconds for Netflix VS 1:20 for PS3, so thats a huge plus right there. Worth the buy, hopefully they can get NFL on here sooner rather than later.Update: I just found out I can stream all sports games from my MacBook Pro using AirPlay, so not only is this thing awesome, but it also completely removes your need for cable. Quit living in the past, buy AppleTV!

I originally sought Apple TV as a way to display Ipad Mini on a monitor/television using Air Play without a relatively costly hardwire connection (The Apple adapter alone is $60.)  I wanted to show videos and slide presentations loaded on the mini Ipad to a larger television screen. This gave me that capability but also is a great way to access photos and ITunes music playlists through my home network (As long ITunes is up and running on the Windows 7 PC in my home office).  Thirdly, it's a very good way to access streaming video applications such as Netflix or Hulu. The streaming capability seems to produce better sound and picture clarity than my Sony Blue Ray DVD players or PS3 with less buffering.  I hooked Apple TV through my Bose home theater system (which even had a setup expressly for Apple TV). Apple TV produces Dolby 5.1 surround sound through my Bose system quite nicely. It seems like a cost-effective way to add service to a television in that part of the house where you don't have cable or satellite television service connections.The main down side is that many of the applications do require that you have a service such as Direct TV or Xfinity somewhere in the house.  And you will need a home wireless internet network. Hulu Plus, HBO Go, and Pandora are now among many services offered by Apple TV, so there's a nice variety of applications available, some requiring subscriptions service (such as Netflix) or service from a tv provider (such as ABC, Disney, and HBO Go applications.) Regrettably, Apple TV does not offer an Amazon Prime Application.
summary: A good option for Ipad display, Itunes on your TV, and streaming video/audio

reviewText: I own 2 Roku devices and decided to give the Apple TV a try. It is a great device and I recommend it.

I own an apple tv and a roku. Both have their strong and weak points.Apple TVPro:Airplay musicEasy to usePhoto Stream from your iPhoneYouTubeCon:Can't Mirror Play older macs or iPhonesNo ability to add appsRemote must be aimed at the apple tv (unlike roku)Overall, I would recommend Apple TV if you would like to Airplay/Mirror Play with your Apple devices.

I own two of these as well as a newly required roku 3.  I'm tired of apple locking Dom their devices so you can't access the competitions apps on them.  Vudu let's you access everything including amazon instant video and vudu which apple doesn't.
I purchased Apple TV so I could stream my laptop to the TV as second monitor.  Works really well with the iPhone app as well.

I purchased my Apple TV a few years ago and it was so simple to active that I have purchased others. The Apple TV walks you through the setup and is very simple. It also connects to my WiFi from long distances (I guess if you have a good wifi). Enjoy this item.

I purchased my first one 3 years ago to be able to stream Netflix movies in my living room and to also steam my music.  Then a few months later I got one of those Blu-Ray/DVD/Digital movie packs of "Bedtime Stories". So I downloaded the digital copy to my iTunes account and was instantly wowed with the fact I could stream my digital movie collection to my apple TV, in essence, my very own Netfilix.This go me thinking about my second ATV, this one was going into my child's room because I was always finding DVD's laying around in the room that was previously watched but never put back, (Probably due to the fact I had a 400 DVD Changer).  This began my search, no my quest to figure out how to rip my movie collection to digital copies from the DVD so that my child could stream them to the TV in that room.  Eureka, I figured it out and I was off to building my very large digital movie collection and now not having anymore damaged dvd's I can save these in the cases to always come back to them if needed.Now, because my child had there own ATV, I figured...heck I should have my own for my room.  So, I got one for my room to enjoy the contents before bed.  I love these ATV, if I was watching a movie in one room and wanted to continue where I left off in another room, YUP it does that.  I love having the ATV remote app for my phone too, it makes it easier finding the remote with my phone then looking for that tiny silver remote that comes with it, so those are stored away as well for backups.I have since expanded my ATV to 2 other rooms in my house and I have a whole different network for my camper with its own ATV setup to use while on camping trips when its either too cold out or raining.If you are a Apple fan, you will love these small black boxes of joy.  I sure do!!!
summary: I have 5 of these and counting

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV for my mom and she loves it and I really enjoy using it whenever I am home visiting. The controller and device are sturdy and feel like quality products like most of Apple's branded products.Pros: Usability and functionality are nice. It interfaces seamlessly with Apple products.Cons: Apple proprietary, so no go on other wireless devices, which for any Apple user should know this anyways. Limited amount of channel options such as Netflix, Hulu, etc. This is why I gave it 4 stars. The price is a little steep to have such a limited selection compared to Roku, but the quality of the product is better. Don't forget you have to buy a HDMI cable for this product!
summary: Nice product, wish there were more channel options

reviewText: I purchased the Apple TV so I could wirelessly relay music from iPhones and MacBooks to the big stereo system in the living room. I'd used a wire before that, and besides all the hassle trying to hide it, it was picking up hum from the power lines. No such problems with the Apple TV, and as an added bonus we can also look at photos and watch movies from the iPhones and laptops, too. Even better, the Apple TV was actually less expensive than the Apple Express that would have relayed only music. I can't say much about using Netfilx and other streaming services as the data caps that come with our satellite Internet service don't really allow much traffic, but if there were any other Internet service available here I might consider dropping our satellite TV service.The only draw back is that it takes the Apple TV a little while to come on when power is first applied, but that would be a non-issue if it was powered with an always on outlet.

I purchased this for my brother who is a graphic designer and has Mac computers all over his house.The Apple TV works very good and now he streams the videos in his libraries (laptops, iphone, etc.) and we can all watch them in his TV.As soon as he connected the device, it was recognized in all his Apple devices and was ready to work!I have read that it may have some buffering issues but my brother hasn't experienced any problems in this regard yet.

I purchased this product solely because I wanted a better way to watch Netflix.  I did have access thru my computer and an older Wii, but I wanted to get HD quality.  For the most part, Apple TV does work fine and is easy to operate.  If you are connected to a cable network, the other uses for this product are unnecessary in my view.  The newly released movie rentals are more expensive than my cable network charge, the other uses are for apps like youtube and internet radio, which again you get with cable.  The one feature that I have used that is useful is Airplay.  That feature allows you to take content from your  home computer or other portable device and show it on your TV.If you want nice quality movies thru Netflix (based on your internet service) I would recommend this product.  It's reliable and not overly expensive.
summary: Good product with nice features, but some are redundant

reviewText: I really enjoy this device.  I should note that my family has many other apple devices that work with Apple TV, and as many other reviews have stated your experience with apple TV is likely to be more enjoyable if you already have a macbook, iphone, ipad, etc…What do I use apple TV for?  Personally, I use Apple TV for watching TV, Movies, and for airplay (mirror what’s on my iphone or ipad right onto the tv).  However, the device offers far more options that I have not yet taken advantage of.How do I watch TV and Movies?  Well there are mainy ways to do so with Apple TV.  Here are the ways that I’ve tried and enjoyed:1) HBO GO channel:  If you subscribe to HBO already, this is a fantastic way to watch HBO content.  This is one of my favorite uses of Apple TV and probably worth the cost of the device in and of itself (for me).2) Netflix Instant:  Another great channel and you can set it up so there’s a designated area for kids or adults.  We have it set up so the kids have one channel with only acceptable content.  We use this a lot.3) Airplay: I sometimes use this to mirror what’s on my iphone or ipad right onto the tv.  Great for pictures or videos I may want to show family members.  That’s mainly how I use this feature, but you could do more with it (like watch movies or shows).4) Other Channels:  Youtube, Disney, and a few others I use on occasion.5) Itunes:  I rarely rent or purchase shows or movies from itunes, but easy to do from Apple TV.  Plus it’s easy to access old content you may have purchased.Other Information:Set-up:  I thought the set-up was easy. Opened up the package, connected device, and it turned on.  It took a few minutes to log-in and link to my wi-fi, but pretty straight forward.Remote:  Small and simple to use.Apple TV Device:  Very small and looks exactly like the picture.Cords:  Comes with HDMI connector.Picture:  I’ve had no issues.  Everything seems to work just fine for me, but I imagine this could be a factor if I had a very slow network at home (glad I don’t).  Something to keep in mind though.Automatic System Updates:  This is a plus since there are periodic updates (adding channels or features).  Like other apple devices this runs smooth.I’ll update this review as I try more features, but overall I haven’t noticed anything that’s made me regret purchasing this.  Based on my 5 star review I would recommend buying.

I really like this product a lot. I can stream my class lectures (using downcast) on my phone and mirror them to the TV!! I also like that you can watch netflix or hulu plus. The only reason for the 4 star .... I wish I could watch my Amazon Prime movies/tv shows using the Apple TV device. Even if you try to mirror it you can watch the trailers but it does not allow you to watch the movies. Very disappointed about that and I am not sure if that is an amazon or apple thing.
summary: No Amazon Prime watching on this baby!!

reviewText: I really like this product. never had one , i think i will by one for each tv in home

I received this as a gift and at first thought didn't think I would use it much. On opening the box and setting it up (very easy to set up) this became my primary way of watching shows. I have an older tv that doesn't have netflix or other apps built in. However, t ended up getting rid of my cable because I am able to watch hulu and netflix, and use the Airplay to stream any other shows I have. I think considered getting a Roku as they are reputable as well. However, with me having an iPhone, iPad and MacBook Pro, it's a no brainer of having the Apple TV to work seamlessly with all other Apple products. It excels extremely well at this. Being able to mirror whatever on my iPhone or iPad is one of the best features of the Apple TV. Definitely a great product, very satisfied customer!
summary: Great way for all your viewing needs

reviewText: I recently bought a macbook air (already own a few ipads, and iphones) and this product really makes viewing movies on my TV easy. Previously, I was using a Western digital WebTv HD with a jump drive to stream movies. It was a little cumbersome having to load the movie onto a jump drive or hard drive before I can watch a movie. Now I can just stream it right off my laptop, iphone, or ipad. Also the user interface is easy to navigate and use my HBO Go account.
summary: must have for those with multiple apple products.
