reviewText: I recommend this product absolutely! If you are an Apple user, you need to get this, belive me. I use it to reproduce my music and videos from my iMac to my living room's TV and Home Theater system. Features like Youtube and Netflix are simply cool.
I saw a friend's Apple TV and didn't realize until then all the things it could do, especially mirroring my iPad. It's GREAT!
It cost more then the other similar electronic however it has a lot of feature that you don't get with the cheaper one I have two of them.

It does what it's supposed to do very well. Set up was quick with no issues. I love being able to watch various channels and listen to iTunes Radio. Kids love Netflix and Disney channels. We bought it mainly for Netflix and iTunes music. Disney channels turned out to be a wonderful surprise.
It has exceeded our expectations. Easy to set-up and use. Good value for the price and gives us a lot of choice.
I thought it would give me more access to free TV and Movies.I like the gadget because I can port things from my iphone to it.Yes, I would recommend this product.
It is a great product. I mostly use the airplay feature and love it.It does not have the limitations of other products like chrome cast.
It is a very good product but not much free service from apple. It is very expense to operate the apple TV.
It is great and we use it a lot.  What a great tool to watch tv shows!  Very easy to use also.
IT IS VERY EASY TO FOLLOW......SIMPLE.....THE APP IS VERY GOOD TO THE EYE...EASY ACCESS IN AND OUT OF APP..WILL RECOMMEND IT
It plugged in just fine, found my LG  TV, and was up and running within 5 minutes. Good quality picture and sound. Pandora and IHeart radio work great.

I tried an android based dongle first, but disappointed when it could not mirror my ipad.  So, I broke down and got this.  I am very happy, airplay, and mirror work great, and quality of the image in HD is great.  Yes, the built in apps are limited, but truthfully, I only use Netflix, and YouTube and on occasion rent a movie from itunes, so I don't find this an issue.
It's a great device. Video, pictures, music in streaming. Very easy to conect in the network. Full HD, great image in the TV!!

It's a great streaming device and I love it's compatibility with all things Apple. We own an iMac, MacBook, 2 iPads and 2 iPhones, so it was a natural choice. The mirroring function is fun and easy, and I love that it syncs with my iCloud photos. We use the photos as the screensaver. The only issue I have is that it doesn't play Amazon Prime videos. Sad Face. But we just play them on our iPad and mirror them to the TV. Problem solved.
It's Apple!  This is my 3rd AppleTv.  They all work flawlessly, never had any issues with any of them.

It's a very good media streamer to Tv, it's biggest strength Is airplay and mirroring for any ios device like iPhone or iPad to Tv. Literally it's like having all the ios apps on Tv. Although I miss CEC feature of automatic Hdmi switch which chromecast has. Mirroring of games is not that smooth on tv, occasionally it jerks. It's must device for anyone having any other apple device.

It's great to stream all of my kids movies off of my iMac to my daughters tv but I have to restart it constantly. Almost every time I start a new show for them I get the infinite loading circle and have to restart the AppleTV. If it didn't do that I would rate it 5 stars.
It's nice playing my itunes collection on the TV with this device.  The only bad part is the price but apple products are always expensive.  You get what you pay for.
It's perfect small size packs a lot in what entertainment it can provide. It is amazing with the iPhone 5 mirroring options the best video quality on such a small device.

It's so easy to watch purchased videos, to rent new videos, browse YouTube, or even any of the videos on my home computers. When I find something I like on my iPad or iPhone, I can send it to the Apple TV effortlessly, and enjoy it on the big screen. I've also enjoyed using iTunes Match with this, so my entire music collection is also accessible at any time through any of my devices, including the Apple TV.The device also supports a number of video services, such as Netflix, Hulu, Crackle, HBO Go, ABC/Disney channels, Crunchyroll, and other upload choices like Vimeo. It doesn't support Amazon Prime Streaming Video.Though I use the USA Apple Store, I'm living in Japan, some of these other services do not allow access because my physical IP address is outside the USA, however all the content in the iTunes Store works fine.
summary: I wish I'd bought this sooner.

reviewText: It works well with the new Apple operating system but for the price there are a lot of cheaper options that work well for a lot less.
It work with all my family's iPhone as well as my iPad 2. I have teenagers and they enjoy using it to watch their music videos or YouTube . Very clear and crisp viewing in our tv.

I used to love the Apple TV for one reason, early movie releases.  I could buy movies sometimes as much as two weeks earlier than the physical version and while I didn't buy many, I could rent others.With Apple TV you have a very simple device that pretty much plays movies, music, YouTube videos, Netflix, and TV shows.  Yes this is cool and the interface just works but, it is seriously lagging behind other devices in the market.  For instance, my Google TV has Hulu Plus, Netflix, Play Movies, Crackle, Amazon Prime Instant Video, Flixster, Vudu, Amazon MP3, Pandora, slacker, play music, and a whole host of other options as well as the ability to manage my whole entertainment experience.The first problem is obviously, flexibility and other devices with Google TV or Roku boxes have way better options available to them.  The second issue is that Loyalty isn't rewarded with Apple!  You see, Apple feels that their exclusive product is worth more for rentals over shorter periods of time than the competition.  Both Amazon and Google deliver their rentals at lower prices and Amazon actually gives you twice as long to watch the movie.So, I honestly have to say that you should pass up the Apple TV until Apple gets their head out of their sphincter!  Mine is sitting here where I cannot sell it because I have too many movies that I stream with it (About 30) but, I won't give them any more of my money until they start Rewarding Loyalty instead of Taxing It!

I used to watch movies, and other media on my iPad, but now I effortlessly stream them onto my TV. Content is endless, and movies stream in high definition,even on my non-high def TV. The Apple TV box is really small, and the remote is even smaller, so make sure you remember where you put it down, or it is likely to disappear. Searching content with the remote can be tedious, but no worries; the remote app for the iPad, makes it easy.

I use it to watch/catch up on my favorite TV shows.  My daughter loves it because she has a library of her favorite shows (Handy Manny, Pinky Dinky Doo, Doc McStuffins, etc) that she can select from.  This is perfect for after dinner: she watches a 20-25 minute episode and then we get ready for bed. This is also good for those days where you are stuck home and you want to select what she watches.
I use my apple tv everyday. I watch netflix all the time. Also, that you can use your Ipad and display your images on the tv. Slides shows and more.

I use my appleTV everyday to watch netflix, listen to music from my iPhone, or study homework on from my iPad. It's a great source and easy to use. I highly recommend it, especially if you don't want to pay for cable and just want to use netflix and Hulu or watch movies from your iPad
summary: Must have for iPhone or iPad users (especially college students)

reviewText: I use this primarily to connect my PC to my TV. With this device you can access all of the content you have stored in iTunes on your PC or Mac right on your television. Of course, the apps are nice too and being able to purchase or rent (and then stream) movies and television shows from iTunes is wonderful. I highly recommend this product if you're looking to bridge your TV and PC.

I've been pretty happy with Apple TV so far -- I have it installed with HDMI cable to the TV, and a TOSLINK fiber-optic audio cable to my receiver.  Simple to install, works right out of the box.  I've not had the buffering issues that some reviewers mention, and the router we are using (Linksys 802.11g) is perfectly fine to give me good signal strength.Works well for YouTube, works well for Vimeo, works good with Airplay.  EXCELLENT with NetFlix, also-- the interface is better than on several Blu-Ray players I have seen.Integration with other apple devices is seamless -- you just suddenly have the "send to AppleTV" option on your phone or iPad.If you have other Apple devices, and a decent wireless setup, this will be a good addition to your media devices.
summary: Good Streaming media player -- Youtube, Vimeo, airplay...

reviewText: I've got everything Apple, so I figured this is the next step and I'm very happy with it.  Super easy set up.  Haven't hooked up with Netflix as yet, but I will.  But music and photos are a breeze!

I've had an Apple TV since gen 1, and just upgraded from the generation 2 device, so the first comment is:1080p is -so- worth it. I didn't think I would notice as much difference as I do, and the 1080P programming on iTunes is just gorgeous. I'm re-watching things like the scenes in Breaking Bad with those gorgeous New Mexico landscapes and the detail and picture quality is wonderful. I'm on an old Sony HDTV, which is 1080P, although only 60 hz, so I expect the picture quality may be even better on newer TVs. So, a big thumbs up for the 1080p picture and ITMS programming content.The other big plus with this device, is that if you are in the Apple ecosystem, everything just works. iPhones and Macs can copy their screen content to this gadget with a single click. Simply wonderful. Last summer I used my iPhone and the previous Apple TV to watch the Tour de France using the NBC iPhone app and streaming it to the Apple TV. For $15, I got commercial free, near-HD quality live from the Tour. It was the best TdF coverage I've ever watched and a bargain.Apple has added many services to ATV: PBS, Hulu, Smithsonian, etc, but you don't get all the choices of something like a Roku. However, between Netflix, iTunes, PBS, Smithsonian, Comedy Central I have more programming than I can watch, and it's quality stuff, not the BS of 300+ cable channels that I never look at.ATV let me cut the cable cord years ago, and I've never missed it.
summary: Worth the upgrade from 2nd Gen. Apple TV. Works beautifully with Apple ecosystem.

reviewText: I've had this product for about three days now and have to say that I love it!  For starters, all the TV shows, movies, and music I've purchased through iTunes is available through this device via "the cloud."  I can also access through "the cloud" music stored on my computer (I haven't purchased from iTunes) via the "iTunes Match" Service.I just watched the season 5 finale of BREAKING BAD on this device. I did not have to wait about 15-20 minutes for the 2 GB file to download to my computer. It was available immediately for instant viewing through Apple TV!  Another great benefit of this device is that you can stream videos from Netflix and Hulu!  Picture and sound quality is outstanding(I have a 720p HD TV).I love the fact that I can also control my Apple TV through a "Remote" app on my iPad.  So, if I ever break or lose my Apple TV remote, I can still use my iPad! Apparently, you can also use your iPhone and iPod touch as well. There are a lot of other outstanding features of this product; I  encourage you to read other reviews and the product description.This product is yet another reason why Apple is so successful and why they're recognized as a tech giant.  I prefer the word "juggernaut!"  Anyway, if you love Apple products and you have invested a good amount of money in iTunes content, you gotta get this product!

I've just recently got into the Apple universe with my iPhone 4S and my New iPad.  I truly love how well they both work with the Apple TV.  The only thing Apple doesn't have that i use is Amazon Primr, but otherwise I have no complaints.

I've never used a device like this as I have always just used cable boxes.  I wanted to be able to access YouTube on my television as well as Netflix.  This device was easy to install and set up.  The network connection has dropped twice in four months but I don't know if this is related to the device.  I am running a wireless-n network.  Not a big deal, simply unplug the device and plug it back in to reconnect to the network.  Ironically, this is the same fix for a lot of PC issues, eh?  Anyway, it's a nice little addition to the home entertainment setup and I use a Harmony 900 remote to control this guy.
summary: Nice addition to our viewing options

reviewText: I've noticed a lot of people are under the impression that this little box could single handedly replace their cable/sat subscription.  In most cases it probably won't.  It does not give you channels to watch at your leisure, but it will provide you with an easy to access and easy to navigate way to access plenty of online content such as itunes rentals, Netflix, video podcasts, Youtube, and Internet radio, plus a few others.But where this box really shines is when you pair it with another Apple device such as an iPad, iPhone or iPod Touch.  When running on the same network you are able to use "Airplay" to mirror your device onto your TV quite seamlessly and without wires.  Want to play your tunes on the nice speakers while you clean?  Easy.  Share your vacation pictures on the big screen with no fuss?  Simple.  You can even play games with the big screen, however depending on your network speed there is about a half second delay.I can't count how many times the music in our house has been pumped through the Apple TV.  Our TV system has the best speakers so it makes sense.Want to entertain the kiddos?  Airplay your ipad/iphone and turn on the video camera and let the kids have fun seeing themselves on TV.  Trust me, this entertains kids for quite some time.For the price, its a no-brainer.  It's not going to give you local channels, or replace all of the content you get with Satellite or cable but its a nice complimentary device for Apple users to take advantage of and at the $100 price you won't regret it.
summary: Great product if you know what your getting.

reviewText: I've purchased three Apple TVs over the past few years & have loved them all. I've given one to my parents & one to my sister none who are tech savvy, but they love how easy it is to use. To be fair I own a Ruko & Netgear Net-Neo as well and have found myself using the Apple over the other two. It's simple, no useless buttons and pretty much idiot proof for me :) The best feature in my opinion is the ability to add your own movies, tv shows and music to box. I've added home movies, purchased DVDs and lots of other stuff I can't add to the other streaming boxes. Plus I love using my iPhone, iPad or iPod to stream music, videos or whatever so easily. The pictures comes out clear, the sound crystal and no hiccups in the streaming. Also with the Apple TV you have the ability to block certain content if from nosy ankle bitters or Tweens. It's a fantastic way to gather the whole family for movie night without the hassle of driving to Redbox or a video store. Yes, the rentals are a bit higher, but you save time, milage and gas by simply staying at home.Now with the new update Apple offers more channels than ever. Channels I actually like & will watch. Disney, The Weather Channel, Sky News, HBO Go, Smithsonian, You Tube, and more. I cut the cable cord and honestly can't say I miss it. The monthly subscriptions to Netflix & Hulu Plus cost me less than twenty dollars a month. My dishnet work bill ran about 150 a month. Granted I can't watch new TV episodes until the next day, but really it's not a huge deal. If you're torn between streaming box sets it all comes down to this : Are you a Pro Apple person? If so get Apple TV. If not Ruko might be the best choice for you. Ruko allows you to stream movies from Amazon Prime, but you have to pay the 79 a year for the privilege. As for as streaming movies from your computer to the Ruko I haven't tried it so I don't know if it's possible.All in all I can honestly say Apple TV is my first choice when it comes to streaming TV.

I wanted to be able to group large numbers of digital pictures on my Mac, add music, and send the finished product to my large screen tv.  The Apple TV does the job simply and perfectly...now I just need to take better pictures!!!Setup was relatively easy and, after a few trial/error attempts, I believe I have it mastered.  I have yet to test the other features (e.g., Netflex movies), but the product does what I expected and does it well.  No more memory sticks or burning CD's.
i want to buy two more ... its that good! i recommend this for all users... it almost converts any regular TV into smart TV

I was really wanting to get a roku for the past few months but then I found out about the Apple TV and started looking into it. Even though there isn't all the games or apps that other devices have the Apple TV has Netflix and Hulu Plus...which are all I need it for! Very please with the device only problem is when I use my remote I have to stay away from my macbook pro other wise Itunes will turn on.

I was unsure about this product when my husband got it, but it works great! The internet works better through it than my TV or DVD player and I love showing my iPod screen on my TV. Excellent purchase!

I watch all my tv through the apple tv now, all my videos are stored on an external drive connected to my mac, with itunes open my apple tv can read all the videos on the drive and plays them just fine.  I also use netflix occasionally and was even able to watch the presidential debates live on the wall street journal app that it comes with, also enjoy podcasts, specifically the rachel maddow one.  who needs cable when you have an apple tv.

I wish I had one years ago. This is so convenient for me when I want to watch Netflix. I used to have to go thru the wii game console  to do that but it's easier, quicker and simple to access with Apple TV. I also watch a lot of HBO and again, much easier than going thru the comcast tuner. I really enjoy using my lolo exercise apps on it too! This works with my iPhone which has "airplay" and when I turn on the "mirror" switch, the lolo app will display on the tv screen! The Apple tv is super easy to set up, and if I misplace the remote that comes with it, I can use my iPhone as a remote!!
I would have given it a 5 star rating if it didn't have such a cumbersome way to enter passwords and user ids. A regular keyboard would be find.
summary: Why the cumbersome alpha/numerical entry mechanism?

reviewText: Just before I bought my husbands Christmas gift he came home talking about this and since he is an electronics buff I ordered it and he loves it. It arrived quicker than I expected, too.

Just got Apple TV delivered today and took less than 5 minutes to go through initial setup including connection to our wireless network. Tested with iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, and iPad 4...all work like a charm! To be more specific, I tested viewing photos, mirroring, and viewing videos (both stored on my device & streaming from internet sites).
summary: Easy setup and works like a charm

reviewText: Let me preface this review by saying an Apple TV will really only be fully beneficial to you if you already own an Apple product, specifically a Mac computer/laptop or iPad. The Apple TV was given as a gift to my fiance and I and we absolutely love it. I have some experience using them at work, but I didn't know it's full functionality until I had one at home.From the Apple TV, we access our Netflix account and stream content to the TV and also watch movies that we have stored on the laptop. Through both Apple Mirroring and the home sharing, we're able to put the movies on my hard drive into iTunes, which is connected to the Apple TV. No more watching movies/tv shows on my 13" MacBook Pro!You can also rent and buy movies and have them stored on the iTunes cloud directly from the Apple TV, which is another awesome feature.The best thing about the Apple TV was that it was really easy to set up. I literally plugged it in, connected the HDMI from my TV to the Apple TV, went to the appropriate input, and the directions came up on the screen and it was smooth sailing from there.I'd highly recommend the Apple TV to anyone, especially if you already own Apple products.

Let me start out by saying I am comparing this product to other products I personally own.  Apple TV is still the best streaming and mirroring combo device.  If you own an Apple product like the iPhone, iTouch, iPad, and Mac, you can seamlessly stream video and audio content to the Apple TV on iOS devices and mirror your screen on Macs.  This is probably the most powerful feature of the Apple TV and why I love it.The problem with the Apple TV 3rd generation is that it is currently not able to be jailbroken and has not been for some time, that is why I do not use the Apple TV to its full potential, however I do on the 2nd generation.  With 1080 over 720 on the 2nd generation, sometimes I wish the 3rd gen can be jailbroken then it will truly deserve a 5-star rating and can be crowned the best media streaming device, period.

Let's face facts, Roku has more options and gives you more bang for your buck. However, if you own any iProducts or a Mac the screen mirroring makes it worth the extra cash. Plus, your iTunes purchases are readily available as well.My wife and I are in college and while juggling that with taking care of our son, watching our lectures broadcast to our larger tv than on our laptops is convenient to say the least.
summary: Perfect if you have Apple products

reviewText: Like all Mac products this is awesome.  Easy to set up, simple to use.  My TV always seem to drop signal to the wifi, tried boosters which still did not work.  This cured my problem.
summary: Apple TV-It is great, what else do you expect

reviewText: Like in the title, it's an apple product which says it all. It's easy to use, looks great, and has a sleek design. Anyone who wants the ability to have Netflix and other video streams without wanting to buy an expensive blu ray player or buy a gaming console should definitely get one. I don't even watch cable anymore and I have the elite package from xfinity.

Like it, play YouTube 1080p videos on my iPad even everyday. And many apps such IGN on iOS device also support the airplay function, it is easy to use and bring a very good experience of watching videos on portable device.

Like Movies? Like Music? Do presentations? Like Netflix? GREAT, This gadget is for YOU! I suggest the mount option for cool but discrete mounting on back of tv. I like using the iPad with Remote App, the included remote kinda sucks for navigation.

Like other Apple products it performs as advertised. Little to no setup its ready to go out of the box and it does everything from your personal stuff to the commercial stuff. If you have other Apple devices get this.
Like other things Apple this is easy to set up and use and works flawlessly.  The set up was super easy using my iPhone (or iPad) to touch the Apple TV and my user info. was transferred to it.

Living overseas has us out of the loop a lot of the time. Ive been listening to the radio on the apple tv, everyday!! I love it! Its pretty funny to listen to the commercials from other states, back stateside. Looking forwards to trying out more of the features!

Lots of great features, but probably the two that are most fantastic:- getting to see the thousands of digital pics streamed from my PC on a regular basis, family is regularly mesmerized- getting to easily stream itunes music to the living room, finally all digital music available around the houseThen the perhaps more commonly thought of access to iTunes movies and Netflix is just great. Love not paying cable company more and this product has brought me to the edge of canceling video cable.
summary: Netflix + iTunes music & video access + photo streaming

reviewText: Love all the content and ease of use.Would give it 5 stars all day except for ....1 major problem I've noticed is that movies don't stream sometimes at all or stream very slow.I compared Netflix app to the Netflix app on my PS4.Several times in the past week I couldn't stream Netflix movies on my Apple TV. I know it's not my internet connection because my PS4 streamed the very same Netflix movies quickly and cleanly.I'm calling Apple today to find out why this is happening.Overall a great product once they get that figured out!
Love it. Connected to my iphone , ipad, and itunes. Very easy to use, like all apple products. Wish it had more apps but who knows what updates are coming.

Love it, use it almost daily.  As a result we are seriously considering "cutting the cable".  I especially like the new OS that allows me to mirror anything I'm watching on my computer (not only movies, but web surfing windows also) straight to my 56" TV with the click on one button. I think I'm on my third gen Apple TV and I've gotten most of my family members to get one also.
Love My Apple TV! It was a must have for all my other apple products. Love the air play with all the apple products.
Love the Apple TV! One of the best purchases I've made from Apple! Love watching Netflix and my iTunes content on it! Apple continues to release more apps!
Love the new pic quality, iPad  iphone smooth interface is great. Fast and bug free.  Like most Apple devices it just plain works.

Love the product.  I instantly show my videos, movies and pictures on my tv. It's so much easier to watch videos this way than on my iPad. It's great how apple makes all their products work seamlessly with each other.Be sure to update the product once you receive it. There are more apps available now.

Love these little devices.  Enables me to watch Netflix on all my large screen TVs.  Also use MLB Premium to watch my favorite games.  They are easy to setup and integrate with my iTunes account via iTunes match.  All of my movies, tv shows, and music is available on any tv.Streams great using my wireless network.  Has no problem picking up my Airport Extreme throughout my 3,000 square foot house.  (I do have a airport express plugged in on one side of the house to boost the signal)All in all for what Apple calls a hobby device I could not be more pleased.

Love the simplicity of use. I frankly use the device 80% of the time streaming videos off my iPhone or iPad to the Apple TV. It is the best and most convenient. I've used Roku before, and frankly speaking it seemed to have a lot of "bloat-apps".Apple TV has the bare minimum number of Apps of which some are free and for others you need a cable subscription or know someone who has a cable subscription with the channels that are on there (ESPN, HBOGO).Practically every video streaming website I've used (Youtube, Yahoostream, etc) has Apple TV support - so you're pretty much covered there.In the event there is NO support, then simply use the "Mirror" option on your idevice.Cheers.
summary: Simple and effective product if you have an iPhone or iPad to share content

reviewText: Makes things so much easier than playing anything from my phone.  I don't have to download my movies from ITunes anymore and I can get Netflix on it.  I thought it was a TV before until a friend showed us his.  Then we bought two.
summary: If you own Apple products and don't have this it's a must have

reviewText: maybe we don't need 4, but each one of us has an Apple TV on our TV....we love it! Easy and Fast!
My Apple TV worked perfect and was unopened and brand new right out the box. It  works fine and as described. No complaints.
My daughter and I like Apple TV! It is very convenient and easy to use like all Apple's products! recommend it for you!

My family is part of the emerging trend of 'cutting the cord', we get all of our media through the internet.We subscribe to Netflix and Hulu and get the other shows my wife enjoys through the 'Season pass' subscriptions offered in iTunes.If you buy all of your music and video from iTunes, this is really the only easy way to get that content on the big screen. Setup is easy but takes a while, because entering your passwords and usernames is painful on the included remote. Apple provides an App for iPhone that is a must-download, it really makes navigating the Apple TV faster.The Apple TV comes with several apps. The only problem is that many of them, like HBO GO, require a cable subscription and HBO service. The PBS app works without a cable subscription, as does the Bloomberg and Sky News apps. There is not an Amazon Prime app, unfortunately.AirPlay, an Apple technology that lets you stream your screen contents from your OS X device or iOS device (iPad,iPhone), works flawlessly, I could see it being useful for presentations on TVs and it's a great way to share what you're doing on your computer with the family. Again, as with most Apple things, it only works with Apple devices.
summary: Great media choice for people who are invested in the iTunes and Apple ecosystem

reviewText: My first Apple product was an iPod nano many years ago. I enjoyed it (still do), but it wasn't until I bought an Apple TV that I began to realize the greatness of Apple. It brought Internet connectivity to my tv in a simple, elegant way. Is it perfect? No, but it does so much that you're willing to overlook its shortcomings.Plug in 2 cables, and you're done: power and HDMI. It's pretty simple to setup wifi, and then you're up and running. You have access to iTunes movie and tv show purchases through the cloud, you can access iTunes media from your computer, Netflix, Hulu plus, Vimeo, YouTube, and internet radio stations. There are other streaming video services available, but I haven't used those yet. Personally I'd like to see Amazon instant video and UFC made available, but those aren't available just yet. I'm keeping my finger crossed though.Another great thing about Apple TV is its smooth integration with other Apple devices. You can have it mirror your Mac computer screen, or stream music, videos, and photos from any iOS device. I love mine so much that I bought one for my brother and two for my mother. We love our Apple TVs, and we're slowly but surely becoming part of the Apple family.
summary: Sucked me into the world of Apple

reviewText: My friends recommended this Apple TV, and it lived up to expectations. If only I had more free time to enjoy it!

My iTunes content streams in Full-HD, Netflix interface is extremely responsive as is the Hulu +. AirPlay is convenient for streaming your own local content on iDevices. Super fast connectivity with wireless n and connect through ethernet for an even better experience. It's a extremely stylish(sexy) piece of hardware as is the apple remote. I don't see a need for other applications offered by likes of roku because of AirPlay! Also content on iTunes well I've found everything I've ever wanted on that store! Because it's an apple product it works great of course.using airplay limits viewing but can be fixed by using zoom option on TV! I enjoy the benefits of NBA app as well. I'm so buying more for my other tv's. hope this helps.

My main complaints about the Apple TV focus on the remote and the UI.  Both coupled together are minimalist to the point where I could easily see them being very challenging for someone to use, whether or not they are age 50+.  Given the nature of the device mishaps with the remote are not without cost - rewinding your Netflix stream and watching it rebuffer to YouTube quality c. 2006 is not pleasant.  Perhaps if the UI was a bit more informative it'd make up for the remote's shortcomings, but no.I'll also add that the remote is so damn small it is very easily lost - between sofa cushions, underneath papers and magazines, etc etc.  I was ready to take a power drill to the stupid thing and attach a lanyard, but I bought a Fire TV instead.  It too is not without issue (where the hell is Cloud Player?) but it is far and away more user-friendly.Overall - a competent but not inspired piece of equipment.  It's great for NetFlix when you don't have a "smart" TV, and that's pretty much all I have ever used it for.  AirPlay streaming is nice; needing to constantly keep a computer on to use it is not.  I'd much prefer for iTunes to have something like Amazon Cloud Player's "upload the music you already own" feature, and stream it over the Internet.
summary: Does what it says, but function follows form to an annoying level

reviewText: My room mates and I love our Apple TV.  So many movies to choose from.  My only down side is that you can't add applications.  I think the quality of Roku and other devices is pure trash, so I would never change, but I wish you could add apps to the Apple TV.
My son got this for Xmas and is very happy with it & so is his daughter. Who does not like more programs

My son told me to order this and it will upgrade an older TV set I have.  I had no idea what it did, but am I glad I listened.It was simple to hook up, and to my surprise, I now have access to all the cool channels that people get with their new televisions, like Netflix, Hulu, and all those applications.I love that I can now get netflix in the bedroom.  Now if I can just figure out how to hook up my pining library, I will be all set.  ;-)

My TV is not a smart tv and I was looking for a way to get netflix to work.  Added bonus you can watch anything from you ipad or itunes and send it to the tv.  Watching a youtube video and want to show the room?  Just send it to the tv using apple tv. I wish there was an app for amazon prime however apple and amazon seem to be at odds.  For amazon prime users you will just have to access your prime movies from your ipad or iphone and send it to the tv to work.  It does work, it just is a slight inconvenience.  Very small discrete little box.  Would recommend to anyone looking to help make their tv act more like a smart tv.
summary: How to turn your tv into a smart tv

reviewText: My whole family loves Apple TV. We use it on a daily basis to watch all of our favorite shows. We also use it to connect with the ipad and iphone to play music.

My wife finally decided she wanted one for Christmas--mostly to show pictures and video from the iPhone.  We have been very pleased.  Using Airplay couldn't be any easier with our phones (the family has 4...) and showing pictures from our Windows computer was also easier than before.  Compared to the Streaming BluRay (we had an LG and now have a Panasonic), the Apple TV starts much faster, has better and faster menu system, which delivers a more pleasant streaming experience.  Purchased shows from iTunes are about the same price as Cable VOD, but better quality.One trick worth mentioning--When we facetime my daughter, I mirror the image from my iPhone to the TV screen, place the phone on top of a speaker just under the screen, and two of us talk to my daughter on the big screen.  Works great, and its much more pleasant that trying to pass the phone back and forth or cram into the picture.We use it mostly for sharing pictures, and streaming Netflix.  Its been well worth the money just for the pictures.  We could share pictures on the TV before, but it required more hassle, and we only did it on special occasions.  Last week I took some quick shots and video of a warehouse on fire near my office, and showed them to my wife on the big screen before we watched a TV episode.If you are an apple family, its well worth the $100 to share photos on the TV with incredible ease.  But I would say its not a good purchase if you don't have apple products.  We can do most of the same things through a Streaming BluRay player--just takes more steps and time.
My wife & I can't believe we waited so long to make the switch from cable. Nothing compares to the amount of access you have for the cost. We have reduced our monthly home entertainment bill by $200.

My wife & I have enjoyed the Apple TV since we purchased it from Amazon in June 2013. After having it for a while I can say we have enjoyed it very much. It has great content, features, and I even did a Keynote presentation on it from my iPad using the AirPlay Mirroring feature. I cannot compare it to other competing devices, but it's hard to go wrong with this device. My only real complaint is that you cannot customize where the apps are on the screen...meaning I'd like to have the Netflix app closer to the settings app. Not a real problem, but would be nice. I recommend this product.
Neat. Minimalistic. Cool. Would probably get lost in a move it being so small but nicely built. Probably get another
No complaints. Airplay Mirroring gets used regularly and the built in menus are nice and responsive. This is now my 3rd device (TV + PS3) for Netflix and it is easily the best.
Not easy for streaming videos.  Selections using remote are painfully basic. Jury is still out though, will give it more time to get used to before it gets tossed.
Nothing quite compares with Apple TV - the mirroring feature is what puts the apple TV above all other competitors. If you have an iPad...you need Apple TV to go with it...you won't regret it :)

Not only was this apple tv cheaper on Amazon than other places, but it shipped in only two days to my house. It was easy to install and a great way to enjoy our netflix, iTunes, and Hulu accounts on our flat screen.
not the best, as you are locked into the the apple ecosystem. Ability to airplay from ipads, iphones via ATV is HUGE!limited apps, netflix,hulu+, wish i could add more apps like PBS.....

Okay, I admit it. I'm an Apple Addict. I have three Apple TVs; an iPhone 5 and 5C; an iPad I, II,& a Mini; and several versions of iPod (my 160 Gb iPod is devoted to 700 or so of my Audible.com books). Oh, and my MacPlus, Mac LC and iBooks are stored away because I have a couple Mac Minis.Not boasting, just letting readers know I am an obsessive Apple Addict. So, consider my review accordingly.This Apple TV is a fabulous product that makes viewing my personal photos and videos, as well as my extensive video library on my Mac embarrassingly easy. Back when I worked overseas I downloaded full seasons of Monk, Battlestar Galactica, Star Trek Movies and, my favorite series of movies, The late Tom Laughlin's creation, Billy Jack.My one regret with this version of Apple TV is, there is no storage. I feel it would be superior if it came with 2Terrabytes storage, eliminating the need to keep the Mac turned on.Of course, just as many other Appel fans, I keep expecting Apple to announce the have developed the ultimate smart TV. I can only dream of what Apple will come up with.
summary: Great for Streaming Video & Music from Mac, iPhone or iPad. Still, Would be Better with 2 Terrabytes Storage

reviewText: Ok,I could say that I would really like to be able to add apps directly myself.  Would like pandora for example...yeah I know it is a direct competitor to iTunes Radio, but it has better content choices right now.  Use it a lot with Netflix and iTunes purchases,  also use iTunes Radio some.  I get around the pandora issue by streaming pandora to it from my phone.  Streaming is super easy from and apple device,
Ok product. Sometimes have difficulty connecting devices. Nothing real spectacular about this product. Have a real hard time connecting laptops.
summary: Ok product. Sometimes have difficulty connecting devices.

reviewText: Once again Apple makes a great product for streaming movies, music, photos and radio to your TV. I love my AppleTV. However, I wish Amazon would have an icon for streaming like Netflix, and iTunes since I have an AmazonPrime membership.
Only true reason to buy this other than the others that support streaming services would be the airplay which was why I bought it. I like being able to see my ipad on big screen.
summary: It's Not As Good As Most But, It Does Have Airplay!

reviewText: Out of the box and working in 15 minutes, its that easy. We mainly stream music and watch youtube and dabble with some of the other apps. It all works great.I was told it was possible to stream Amazon Prime from the iPad through Apple TV but that is NOT the case so this is not the device for you if Prime is what want. This is not an issue in our home because we stream Prime through a Playstation 3.

over time newer updates come out that make it more responsive and more content availalble. ive owned google tvs which annoyed me due to slow updates and not feeling like a quality product .. for 99 bucks or less this is a great deal and personally i like the interface better than the roku .. but the roku is cheaper but loses iphone \ ipad functionality
Plug n play perfection! (Requires iPhone, iPad or Mac) or really doesn't get any simpler!I understand that it's proprietary... Wish I could use it with my windows products..

Probably the most handy little box you could buy. It pretty much turns your regular dumb TV into a smart TV. The interface is very user friendly as most Apple devices so it’s easy for anyone to use. I wish it had access to an app store. Having a Pandora app would be great but you’re able to mirror other apple products so you can access Pandora that way.

Pros: easy to setup, even for the less talented.60 days Apple support.Small footprintDoes as promised, and as with other Apple products, playing with it gives you even more.Amazon has a better priceEverything is sealed in the package ( as is Apples policy) you absolutely know this new and the real thingI assure you this is the newest version, the older version is higher priced because it can be ""jail broke" which makes it able ( with geek experience) to stream things out of the Apple intentions. You don't have to be concerned with that detail or you wouldn't be reading this.With 1020 picture capabilities, the picture is stunning.I use this with my iPad. You can fiddle around and find what you want somewhere.Con: no Prime Amazon streaming vids. Apple, you will have to make nice with Amazon or you are going to lose customers. I do get Prime Amazon streaming vids on a app on the iPad. I will just have to get by with that until they get that settled.

Pros: Great little product. Extremely easy to use. HBOGO application was added with the last update (must have an HBO subscription to use). Watch ESPN app is great. Mirroring from an iPad or iPhone is still incredibly cool. Downloading the remote app for your iPhone or iPad is a MUST.Cons: It really hates to be hard wired to the internet. I have no idea why, but have given up on that. It runs great on WiFi.Updates sometimes take a couple of attempts. You can obviously skip updating, but you will miss out on awesome new features and improvements (like HBOGO).The app selection is still a little thin.

Purchased this Apple TV for my parents to hook to there Sony Bravia tv via hdmi cable but connection goes in and out. Have updated the tv, updated the Apple TV, tried numerous different hdmi cables and no luck getting it to stay connected picture goes in and out. The voice talking on the Apple TV is by far one of the most annoying I have heard and at first even after I turned it off still kept going. After trying 6 different hdmi cables finally got one that for now seems to work with it. Will see how it goes and hope the issue I had initially is no more. Both junk hdmi cable and funky glitches in Apple TV.
Purchased this product. Brand new. Excellent. Amazing packaging. I would highly recommend this to a friend. Easy to setup and use. High quality HD video quality. Processor speed is ultimate.
summary: Excellent!!! Must buy. Better than a smart TV.

reviewText: Really like the capabilities, but I am seriously thinking about hacking it. You have to wait for Apple to get new apps. So, no Amazon Prime videos, which is weird they have Netflix and Hulu Plus. Oddly you get no notifications when they put a new app up. Hulu just showed up one day. Kind of limiting, thinking about getting Boxee or something similar.

Really love the endless availability of TV shows, movies and music. Would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for having to pay for each show but there is the option to use the hulu plus or netflix feature for only 7.99 a month. The airplay mode using apple products with ios7 works great. You can throw anything you have stored on your iphone or iPad up onto your TV.
summary: Finally ready to cut the cable cord

reviewText: Received quickly. Easier to use than the built-in Samsung internet connection. Plus you can remotely use with your iPad on DVD recorder or TV with built-in tuner.

Remarkable device at very affordable price.  Setup is a snap, and it opens up a whole world of music,streaming movies, shows, and events as well as subscription services such as Netflix, blockbuster, Hulu, and many more.  It networks with your computers songs, video, and  photo libraries, and is less than half the size and weight of its original counterpart.  Worth every dime!Apple TV MD199LL/A [NEWEST VERSION]

Requisite Warning; I am NOT an Apple fanboy. I own several of their products. I own many windows products too. I build my own servers and workstation. I love iOS and can't stand OSX.Simply put, this device is easy, fast and intuitive. I have one of these connected to both my TVs, rather than buying a smart TV I would happily get one of these.Pros;Ability to easily and quickly play Netflix, Hulu Plus etc...Easily and quickly plays any content you've ever bought from itunesCan easily stream anything in your library over wireless. (This works very well for TV shows you happen to put into your itunes library but didn't buy from itunes per se)Attractive enclosureEasy set upCons;Doesn't play Amazon Instant Video. This isn't it's fault but I really wish it did.A tad pricier than other streaming boxes (but so much more polished)Probably wont work all that well if you do EVERYTHING outside of the Apple eco-system. But really, if you have an iphone you are already in the walled garden.
summary: If your eco-system has any Apple in it this is PERFECT

reviewText: Saves you a ton of money from having to buy a Smart Tv. I couldn't think of a day where I don't use it.

Set up is very easy and fast. Very intuitive interface. I also bought a Roku-3 for another room. The Roku has the advantage of being able to stream Amazon Prime videos. Also the Roku has the remote with the headphone jack which is a great option. If your a big I Tunes user this is the unit to but. If not I would recommend the ROKU-3. Both ran great and easy setup.

Set up was easy. It links to my iMac seamlessly, letting us watch our favorite shows on iTunes on the big screen. The remote is very simple -- if anything it is too simple. I have a Blu-Ray player that supposedly connects to Netflix, but usually just reports "Network Failure."  But the AppleTV seems able to connect to NetFlix even when the other player cannot.
Simple to hook up, beautiful interface, great to send music over from our iPhones or content on the laptops.  Great for watching HBOGO, Netflix, etc. etc.

So Apple TV is pretty awesome. It's fast, easy to navigate and is constantly adding new contents partners. So what is a downside of Apple TV? Honestly there is not much but a few things you should think about before buying one.If you are just wanting Netflix and could care less about viewing photos, mirroring displays, renting or buying movies and TV shows or playing music then Chromecast might be a better option for you. It's also less then half the price of an Apple TV.There are other options out there such as Roku. Roku is more open and has access to a bit more content, but that content is more obscure for most people and Apple TV has all the big players on board.  Where Apple TV is better then a Roku IMHO is interface and usability.  Roku is great but the interface can at times be slow and annoying. Apple TV has it's issues here and there as well, but using both for the last few years I get far fewer issues with my Apple TV, and Roku is very slow to update when issues arise.  So if you are the kind of person that has to have every single content provider under the sun a Roku is a damn fine device. If you are looking for all the best mainstream content with a lot of extras and a smooth interface then Apple TV may suit you better.

So far so good. SO easy to set up! We were literally watching one of my itunes movies in under 10 minutes. We were previously streaming netflix and hulu plus through our wii but its not HD compatible. This is full HD. Love being able to stream movies and tv shows from itunes. And the remote is MUCH easier to use than the wii remote!
summary: So easy to set up and get started!

reviewText: So glad I bought this! Overall, no big complaints. The only reason I give it a 4 is because of the lack of apps (compared to a Roku or something of that nature) Hopefully a new update comes that makes the Amazon Prime videos easier to access. I can watch them on the Apple TV if I mirror my MacBook, which is just a little of a pain.Overall, it works seamlessly with all your Apple products and any iTunes purchases. When you scroll, it is quick and smooth and I am definitely a huge fan already.
summary: Great buy for avid Apple users!

reviewText: somethings I would change, nothing that is worth writing about.  More than anything, this product has great quality!  I've been streaming Netflix from my Xbox 360 for two years now and even though it's only capable of 720p, my TV is only 720p anyways.  However, the sound and picture was dramatically better and noticed within the first ten minutes of watching.

Sometimes it runs the sound through our TV and auxiliary system, and sometimes it fails when streaming a movie from our Mac. We find we have to reset more than we like. When running a DVD through our Mac to the TV, there is not a lag in picture with sound or any streaming issues. When streaming from the Internet, it can have lags -- for example, the video is running fine on the computer screen, but it is frozen on the TV while the streaming is trying to catch up. This is bothersome and disappointing. We have high grade HDMI connectors and super fast Internet speed, so neither of these are an issue - it's the Apple TV. However, it is very nice for putting pictures up on the TV screen for people to see, etc.
Sometimes won't "connect to the server" when all my other connected devices are working just fine. Not an internet issue. Of course if you want apple tech support you have to pay for that too
So much better than Smart TV. I just wish the Apple TV would have HBOGO on it! But other than that, it's flawless. And amazon shipped it REAL quick. HA!

Sorry for the comparative review,but Ii have a Roku 3,Roku 2xs, the Apple TV and Sony Internet TV with Google TV.  So I should be able to compare them. I purchased Apple TV, because I wanted to be able to use it io view my iPad, and the Roku does not have A Youtube channel. I find myself mainly using the Roku, but probably because I cant have Hulu on both devices.Even though I like checking the Roku app store, I rarely watch anything that Apple TV does not have. The Apple works smoothly, and was easy to set up. I have not had enough time with the Sony TV to comment, but I bought the Sony because it has Google chrome, and Google TV! which might be less expensive for renting, or buying titles. Since the Sony has so many options, and channels, and apps, if it works smoothly it might completely replace the functionality of the Roku, but not the Apple.  The one thing about Roku 3 is that you have the headphone jack on the remote. So I am finding that all three devices are great, I don't have cable TV so I have gone wild with these things. If you are an Apple person you should get one. If you don't have a Mac or iPad, it is great, but you might want to wait until the verdict is out on the Sony, or the Roku 3 for a less expensive, yet robust, mature experience, Or if you are saving a bundle, not paying for a landline and cable etc., then if the Sony turns out as good as the price, get both the Apple TV, and the Sony w Google TV.
summary: Not as many appa/channels as other devices but covers the essentials.

reviewText: stream netflix over hdmi, stream from your computer - awesome!  just know that when we took it to a hotel it didn't work because the wi fi needed web authentication so it didn't work.  great purchase!
The Apple apps are great.  I like the music best, radioAnd Vevo.  I also added Netflix after canceling cable.
summary: Added Apple TV to new I Pad

reviewText: The Apple TV is a fantastic, affordable device to add to your home theater setup. It allows you to:- Rent and purchase from Apple's vast digital library of movies and TV shows;- Play music from streaming radio stations (of which there are hundreds to choose) or your own music if you sign up for iTunes Match;- Browse your pictures from photo stream (quick tip: create a "shared" photo stream titled "apple TV" and add pictures from your phone or iPad that you want used as a screen saver, then set the Apple TV to use that stream for screen saver purposes);- Setup a home media library and have all of your movie collection at your fingertips (GREAT for kids, no more scratched or lost discs, and material can be censored with parental controls);- Use AirPlay to stream audio or video to your TV effortlessly (great for playing services like Spotify or watching video stored on an iPhone or iPad);- Use NetFlix, HBO Go, YouTube, Hulu, or any number of other supported services directly from the device with clean, easy-to-use interfaces and 1080p & surround sound support.There's no question that if you don't own any Apple devices the value of the product diminishes a bit. There are other devices that will play NetFlix, HBO Go, YouTube, etc., that will stream home library content (although most of those don't allow for parental controls if they're using DLNA as their backbone technology), etc. But if you have just one Apple mobile device - a phone or a tablet - the Apple TV is hands-down worth purchasing. It seamlessly integrates into your environment and allows you to enjoy the Apple ecosystem on your television, and AirPlay is such a convenience.
summary: A must have addition to your home theater solution

reviewText: The Apple TV is a useful gadget. I bought it for my girlfriends bedroom when she first got a tv. She does not have a cable box, DVD player, or game console in her room. This device made it possible for her to do quite a bit, and she is extremely pleased with it. She mostly used it do netflix, but there are many other useful apps. She often uses the remote ability to play her iTunes from her computer through it as well. The only issues she ever has from it are a result of her outdated and slow internet connection.The device itself is visually appealing. It is very small and has the signature minimalist Apple design. The remote included is also very impressive. It is simple with limited buttons, but does everything needed. It is made out of metal and feels like a quality product. For the sake of comparison, holding the remote feels a lot like holding one of the older generation iPod Nanos. I believe the one in mind is the third generation that was tall and skinny, and came in various metallic colors. The remote has a nice weight to it and the buttons seem durable.After a year of owning the Apple TV, my girlfriend still loves it. I would state however that other options may be just as good at a lower price. The Roku players are a very similar product that are cheaper than apples version, and I'm sure she would be just as happy with one of those.
summary: Perfect for a tv without a cable box

reviewText: The apple TV is fantastic. I can see everything I want in the TV. It is a good product. Thank you.

The Apple TV is great for a household like mine where everyone owns Apple products.  Many people have stated how their Apple TV does not work for them.  I had an issue where whenever I would mirror a device, my home's Internet would restart.  That was due to a router setting.  With some research, that setting was tweeked and the Apple TV does everything that it's supposed to.
The apple tv works perfectly. I was skeptical about buying this from another retailer outside of apple, but it works fine.
The Apple TV works well. We like the AirPlay features that extend our iMac monitor to the TV. Our Roku does offer more channel options.
The bad thing is...it is not compatible for xfinity live streaming. You need to upgrade the atv to 6.02 for mirror-feature to work on ipad and iphone.
the best item with mac computer and iPhone.it works well and the Wifi system is so simple to use.
summary: best item with mac and iPhone

reviewText: The big reason I bought the Apple TV was for YouTube.  It was either Apple TV or Roku 3, although I heard about a Western Digital device but I don't know much about it.  I have had many Roku devices and they've all worked fine, but I thought I'd try Apple TV for a change.  I have recently changed over to Apple Ipads and laptops so I thought I'd give it a try.  Well, from my first few hours with it I'm quite impressed!  The YouTube set up is awesome!  The picture is great, the menu works fine, and I couldn't be more impressed. And, YouTube has SO much great content!  You can find just about everything on YouTube, documentaries, full music albums, sermons, speeches, how to videos, movie clips, you name it and it's probably on YouTube!  And I have the Roku2 with all it's supposedly great channels.  But you know what I use it for?  Netflix, Amazon, and Vudu.  That's it!  Crackle sucks, it has commercials, and PBS is cool but it's on Apple TV as well.  The other thing I liked about Apple TV was the Airplay connection where you can stream from your MacBook, Imac, Ipad, or cell phone to your TV.  I tried it with a MacBook and it couldn't be more simple!  I streamed some Coursera courses on it from my Macbook, and it worked flawlessly!  The Neflix interface is a little snazzier on the Apple TV, a little more slick and prettier than the Roku.  The one thing I don't really like that much is the Apple TV Remote.  It's kind of hard to get used to, I was always pushing the middle button accidently when scrolling.  It's also very small and about 1/8" thick and I wonder when I'm going to sit on it and break it.Other than that, like I said, I'm VERY impressed!  I'm glad I got the Apple TV instead of the Roku 3 which people seem to be having problems with.  But, I also kept my Roku2 and use it along side the Apple TV.  You just have to make sure you have a few HDMI slots on the back of your TV, which most TV's do have nowadays.  The Apple TV also is a nice piece of technology.  It is a lot heavier than the Roku, and doesn't seem "plasticky" like the Roku, but more like a solid hockey puck.  It's as easy to set up as it is to get a laptop hooked into your network, doesn't take 5 minutes.  All in all I'm impressed with the feel of the device, the interface is typical Apple cool, and everything works exactly as you would want it to.  What more can you ask for?

The device itself is very nice, fast, and with the most recent firmware updates (HBOGO and iRADIO) is even better than it was originally. I'd give it a higher stars rating if it offered additional functionality:WISH LIST ITEMS1. A native APP to watch AMAZON PRIME videos.Currently (Dec 2013), it is possible to watch AMAZON PRIME videos by streaming them from an iPhone, iPad, iPod to the Apple TV via AirPlay, and while that's an improvement over the original feature-set, it is not as convenient as a native APP just like NETFLIX or HBOGO.2. Improved and expanded Apple's "Remote" APP functionalityThis app allows the user to control the Apple TV from an iPhone or iPad or iPod similarly as the remote control that comes included with it... In other words, you need to turn your TV on, and select the desired icon from those displayed on your TV screen. To some degree, that is OK if you want to watch a movie. What if you want to listen to iRADIO? It should be possible to select that icon right on the iOS device screen without having to turn on the TV. So, what I am proposing here, is for the Remote APP to show the same menu options on the iOS device screen as on the TV.3. Capability to turn on an A/V receiver automatically when streaming music via AirPlay to the AppleTV, and have the receiver select its input automatically to whichever HDMI port the AppleTV is connected to, and start playing the music "with just one click". This is what takes place if you start streaming music from an iPhone or other Apple device to receivers with built-in AirPlay capability such as Denon or Pioneer, and it would be particularly helpful with ONKYO's receivers which don't have built-in AirPlay capability at this time.
summary: Apple TV: Nice device with room for improvement. See my WISH LIST below

reviewText: The first thing you will notice when you open your package is the distinct Apple quality packaging. Inside the box is the Apple TV unit itself, an AC power plug, a remote, an instruction manual, etc. All of the components included with this unit, including the unit itself, are very well made, rock solid, and scream quality. The setup of the Apple TV is also quite easy. Apple TV is WiFi compatible, but I opted to plug an ethernet cable into the back of it to ensure quick buffering times. It also utilizes HDMI, which is a nice feature for premium video quality. Pretty much this Apple TV acts as a gateway between your TV and all of your iTunes media on the same network, among other things. For instance, you can listen to music on your TV, watch iTunes purchased movies/TV shows on your TV, etc. The Apple TV can also access YouTube, Netflix, HBO GO, and many other useful "apps" which makes it a very compact media center pretty much. I would recommend Apple TV to anyone who makes purchases on iTunes, has a Netflix subscription, enjoys crystal clear YouTube videos on the big screen, etc.
The menu of options, channels including and speed of software are great. I prefer to operate with the iphone, which control the apple tv as it tends to be a bit small. I recommend it 100%
Then Apple TV is the way to go.  Simple setup, simple usage, simple decision.  If you already use Itunes for your music needs, then Apple TV is a no brainer.
summary: Need easy access to your entire library and other streaming services?

reviewText: The newest Apple TV for $99 ... great deal!  Service and delivery were outstanding and wicked fast.  Hook-up and programming were a piece of cake--after I bought the HDMI cable that doesn't come with the Apple TV.  Not a problem ... Amazon had the best deal going on the Mediabridge HDMI cable, too ($10).  I'm not a TV or movie addict, but I can see how Apple TV can turn you into one ... it just keeps getting better!

The newest version of the Apple TV is a wonderful piece of hardware.  It is a beauty in every detail.  I have a WDTV, a Roku and Apple TV.  The WDTV is the older version which doesn't support streaming, only your own content, so it is not comparable to the other two.Both system can be controlled with an App if you cannot find the remote that came with it.  They have great WiFi reception (I don't have any problem with interruptions, only very few occasions),  but this really depends on location and house construction.  Netflix is my primary source for both players.Here are the comparison:Apple TV:- 1080P- wondeful interface, easy navigation.  I love the similar movies suggestions.  Searching is a lot easier.- Airplay mirroring, for those with an iPad2/3 or 4S, this is a biggie- YouTube and Hulu- great construction, fine in every detail- aluminum remoteRoku LT:- smaller and lighter, easier to transport- Amazon Video on demand.  (but AVD now plays on iPads.  Will AppleTV be next?)- some form of Facebook functionality. I enjoy watching friends' videos on Roku.- separate analog audio out, I can play it to my multimedia Epson projector with a separate line feeding the home theater speaker system (a pair of Bluetooth Creative Zii and Bluetooth subwoofers).  Apple TV is HDMI with optical/Toslink.  Toslink is not very common with smaller portable devices like a multimedia projectors.- open to more contents, unless you jailbreak the Apple TV.
summary: Rock solid with wonderful interface - also comparison with Roku

reviewText: The remote is a cool device but a bit small for larger hands.  We lost it in the recliner because it fell into a crevice because of size and slipperiness.  I used my iPad to run the apple tv.  iPhone works also with free app.  You must set up your apple tv though with the original remote before you can use them to control unit. Did finally save both remote and recliner and did not have to spend $20 for a replacement. This is important because there are no buttons on unit to interface without a remote.Apple tv is pretty cool.  Like the hi def and choices so far.  My in laws saw it and bought one also and are happy with it.
summary: Great but don't lose your remote!

reviewText: The special feature to AirPlay what is on my iPhone or iPad is superb. I now do my presentations wireless

They keep coming out with more and more apps.  I especially love that MLBtv and NBA league pass are available through this device.  Typically speaking can also rent movies for cheaper through this then onDemand with my cable provider.  Airplay with laptop or iPad is also pretty damn cool.If they added an Amazon Prime video app it would be the cherry on top.

This allows me to stream videos and music from iTunes (on my PC) to my TV.  I can access my playlists for both music and video - if all your media is loaded onto your iTunes you will love this.The only downside I've found so far is the remote.  It's small size means it's much more likely to fall between the couch cushions, and I wish I could control volume with it.  But overall I love my Apple TV.

This allows you to watch things from your laptop, but it requires iTunes and thus is limited. If it allowed you to display anything from your laptop, it would be better. Also, Apple recommends that this "wireless" product be hard wired to the internet. Ok for me because I store it close to the router, but that could pose as an inconvenience if you wish to store it elsewhere because it tends to lose the internet connection more often than usual.

This device contains quite a few programs. Some of which require a subscription. Thus far we only use it for Netflix. It does allow us to stream and the picture quality is good. However, it is awkward to search. It is awkward to rewind or fast-forward.The remote does not have an on/off switch and there is not a notation in the manual that shares how to turn it on and off. I assume when you turn the T.V. off, Apple T.V. turns off. To turn it on one must press menu on the remote.

This device has proved invaluable to my streaming arsenal & provides plenty of content via the ever so useful "AirPlay" feature. The Netflix interface could use a bit of a facelift however it is still useable. Overall a good value for the price, more than worth it. Definitely recommend to those that own an iPod Touch, iPhone (4 & above), iPad (2 & above), Macbook Pro (2011 or above) &/or a combination of any of these devices.For those running Macbook Pros older than 2011 could use a program known as "Airparrot" to airplay to your big screen via Apple TV as opposed to using Mountain Lion's 10.8 native airplay feature since it will not run on the older hardware."Airparrot" performance will tax your CPU and not be as eloquent Mountain Lion's native airplay, however it will get the job done albeit a bit choppy.
This device is awesome. If you have apple products, it is a must have addition. All you need is a wireless connection.
This device was a gift to me. It's simply amazing!!!  I now play music and videos from my iphone and from my itunes acct, directly on my TV.  "So much fun!!"

This fits into my apple household seamlessly. I love that I stream my movies/music right off my iTunes and on to my TV in HD. I do not pay for HD cable, but the second I power up my Apple TV i get instant HD access to all of my owned content plus some extras.It's a great little box and I hope in the future they expand its capabilities because it really could be much more. That said, it works excellently and without flaws.
This is a great gadget.  Love all the features.  Not one problem with it! Love being able to access Netflix and all the music.

reviewText: This is a great media streaming device that works great over wi-fi.  Use it as an audio source to stream your lossless music from your Mac, stream video like Netflix, stream all your photos from your Mac, or use AirPlay and your iPhone to share about anything.  If you do have an iPhone or iPod Touch, you can use the free Apple "Remote" app to control the Apple TV... genius!

This is a great product and will only get better when the new OS X comes out within the next two months (Fall 2013).  OS X Mavericks will let you use Apple TV to connect wirelessly to your HDTV and use it as a 2nd (or 3rd) display for your computer.  That will be fantastic.
This is a great product if you want watch videos you have on your iPad or want to stream from Amazon or Netflix. Setup is easy an operation is intuitive.

reviewText: This is a great product.  I own three and they all work flawlessly.  I stream movies, music, and pictures from one iMac to all three and they all work perfectly.

This is a nice addition to the apple family. As long as you have a decent amount of apple gear you really do get a lot of use through this box. I can stream from my laptop and phone with ease. The connection sometimes does discount sometimes, and I wish apple would release an app store for this thing. But for a mere 100 dollars you turn your tv into a smart tv and is worth the investment if you are into apple and want an easy streaming experience.

This is an okay box and works great for pairing with other apple products but is very limited in channels and speed compared to the Roku 3. I would recommend the Roku over this if you want great free channels, Pandora,  slacker, TuneIn, etc and a better interface.

This is a product I cannot live with! I have 2 of them. One for my family room TV and other for my basement home theater. The streaming is so fast and perfect. We use mainly to stream Youtube videos, Music, photos, videos from multiple iphones, IPADS during a party. If you have any Apple product this is a must have. Lot of people don't know much about this product until they use it. AppleTV surprised many of my friends and they ordered the first time when they saw this at my place :). Only addition if apple can add a bluetooth receiver to this to stream music from any other devices other than apple devices and provide an audio jack other than just HDMI to connect to any stereo system, all the bluetooth audio receivers will go out of business.

This is a very awesome product, it works smoothly and is beautiful.  It comes with a small elegant remote, it has a sort of that aluminum unibody feel to it.I don't understand the point of SmartTV gimmick that come with all these new TVs.  I was looking at Chromecast, but I have experienced Android woes and felt that the additional $60 dollars in cost was justified for quality.

This is good as it gets. I had an apple tv now for a year and couldn't be happier. This product has only gotten better over time because Apple keeps adding more apps and improvements to the device. I believe that Apple will only continue to add better apps and more content because of its rumored interest into the tv market. I love being able to access all of my itunes music and playing it on the surround sound, the free itunes radio is decent too. I also hope that once more apps are created for the device that the user will be aloud to move and delete apps like on the ipad.

This is much better than my ROKU 2. It does not need to reload the movie like the ROKU. And I really like the playback of apps from my iPhone and iPad, it fills the screen and looks like a giant iPad, if the app is designed to do that like You Tube, any Apple app, Netflix (from iPad/iPhone), etc. Would recommend anyone with an i device to get this vs. the ROKU.

This is my 2nd Apple TV device, and if they come out with a newer version, I will probably buy it too.  I am heavily invested in "iDevices" in my household - iPhones, iPads, and iTouch music players.  I have my iTunes library that controls all the devices tied to my main PC that is in the office of my house.  I use iTunes as my digital entertainment hub for all of my devices.  iTunes has all of our music, music videos, and digital movies (including digital copies that come with my blu-ray movies that I buy).  I was looking for a way to take all of that digital media and play it in the family room where the home theater is set up.  I chose the Apple TV device.This box is about 3" x 3" x1" and is barely noticable.  Hookup is very simple - power cable, and HDMI cable to the receiver (or directly to TV).  Setting it up takes all of 10 minutes.  It can be connected to your network using a wired connection or wireless.  I use wireless in my house, so I had to set up the wireless on the Apple TV.  Once the Apple TV is connected to the internet, you will put your Apple ID and password in.  Everything you have purchased from Apple is now right there at your fingertips.  I also wanted to tie this device to my media collection that is stored on my PC in the office.  This requires you to turn on Apple's Home Sharing option.  Once you turn that on, the Apple TV will find your media library in iTunes, and make it available.There a few pre-seeded apps on the device (Netflix, HBO 2 Go, You Tube, etc.), plus access to all of the content you have in the Apple ecosystem.  Everything is simple to operate, the user interface is easy to understand, and if you have an HD TV, the quality of video is excellent.Again, I would recommend this to anyone that has a lot invested in Apple content and products.  Since this is a direct competitor to the Roku, Boxee, etc., the form factor of this is very similar to the others.  The only difference between these boxes is user interface and media options - for instance, a Roku box will not play anything you have controlled through Apple's iTunes, and vice versa.  Bottom line, this is made for people invested in Apple for their digital music, digital TV, and digital movies.  If you get your music from Amazon, use Prime Instant Movies, or buy music from Google play, this box will not work for you.  You will need to look at the Roku or other similar device.

This is my 2nd Apple TV I have purchased, I was so happy with the first one that I bought a 2nd one so I could have multiples in my house. They are easily connected through my Wireless network and stream video in HD quality. It comes with a remote, but I have also configured my IPAD/IPhone to control it was well.This is a great product.

This is my second Apple TV.  I loved the first and wanted to add another to the bedroom.  I love the mirroring and ability to watch movie clips before purchase.  It is super simple to hook up and never has in issue.  I downloaded the free remote app from itunes so I can control it from my iPad or iPhone.  Now the Apple TV device sits out of site and it can be operated without a direct line of sight.  COOL!
This is my second Apple TV. Our family now watches more streaming content then live TV. If it was not for live sporting events I would drop my cable service (and keep the Inter net of course).
summary: With Apple TV, I am very close to cutting the cord

reviewText: This is my second Apple TV.  This one is going in the living room.  I went with this because it will work effortlessly with itunes on my iphone, ipad, Macbook.

This is one of the better tech purchases I made this year. I can mirror from my iPhone or iPad mini, stream Netflix and Hulu plus or listen to music from iTunes. With the airparrot app I can mirror my PC which is great for streaming. I highly recommend the Apple TV

This is one of those things that gets a lot of use when people come over.  We use mirroring feature a lot.  It is a very good Netflix player.  Just wish they would expand the available apps a bit.  I get that they are competing with Amazon, but it would be really nice to have an Amazon Instand Video app.  If they expanded the library a bit, this would be my favorite media player.
