reviewText: This is probably one of my most used electronicsIf you have a bunch of music or movies on your itunes then i would suggjest this product over and overyou can't beat airplay if most of your library is on itunes.BUTA roku might suit others needs better especially if they don't use airplay
summary: Great if your music and movies are on itunes

reviewText: This is the 2nd Apple TV device I have purchased.  The first one I purchased to use at home to stream audio from iPhone to my home stereo along with streaming video/pictures from my iPad to my TV.  It worked so well that I bought another one for the office to connect to our 80" TV that we use in our conference room.  We have a lot of internal people with iPads and iPhones that want to show live content from their idevices that it seemed like a no brainer to hook this up.  We also get quite a few external people that show up to our office for meetings with idevices and want to show content on our screen, so again the Apple TV works great for allowing this to happen.A couple of things to note on this application of Apple TV.One, using AirPlay (the mechanism to connect to Apple TV from a iPad/iPhone) to "mirror" your screen to a display/tv will only happen in a 4:3 "like" format for the iPad and an even narrower format for iPhones.  So, if you have a wide screen display (i.e. 16:9 or 16:10) then you iPad screen mirror will only take up the center of the screen with black bars on each side.  The image will rotate along with the respective screen orientation of the iPad, so viewing the iPad in landscape mode will fill more of the screen but not all of the screen.  Not a big deal, just a comment.Two, some iPad/iPhone applications can stream directly to Apple TV in full screen mode without having to use AirPlay "screen mirroring", so you can fill your entire 16:9 wide screen.  For example the YouTube application can do this and fill the entire TV screen.And lastly, some ipad/iphone applications can deny your ability to use AirPlay to stream to your Apple TV.  For example, I was hoping my Xfinity application would allow me to stream movies to my TV but it told me I was not allowed to use AirPlay. :-(Just things to consider if you want to use the Apple TV for video streaming.  Streaming audio to your stereo system works great!  You need an optical digital input on your stereo to do this, so keep that in mind.  You can even stream music from your computer in iTunes over your network.  The Apply TV can connect to your network over Ethernet or WiFi.
summary: Great device for live streaming of your ipad/iphone screen!

reviewText: This is the 4th Apple Tv I have in my home and as the others it works perfectly. No complaints at all and it is easy to install and set up. I have run out of places for them now so unless I add on, this is the last one I will buy...LOL

this is the best $100 i have ever spent.  i used every function in apple tv and  have no need for the apps in my smart tv.  it does a good job up converting everything to 1080p. airplay is awesome too!
This is the best product I have purchased in years. Brought me, and my music collection into the 21st century.

This is the easiest most intuitive device that turns any TV into a smart TV. I have 3 and have gifted 3. As far as I am concerned...if you have an iPhone and an iPad...you can't do better. Roku and the like just don't offer the ease of use.
This is the future of TV.  simple to use, links to the apple ecosystem and conntect to (Netflix, HBO, Youtube)
This is the greatest product I have bought in awhile, great price. I love airplay. It is so easy to use.

This is the most current Apple TV model, at the best price I have seen it offered for. Make sure you pick up an Amazon HDMI cord, and you'll be good to go. I can operate the Apple TV with my iPhone and iPad, it plays music from my iTunes match account, the Netflix and HBOgo apps work perfectly with 1080 picture and Dolby 5.1 sound...it is simply an excellent device. Highly recommended.

This is the second Apple TV I have purchased. I bought a second one for the bedroom cause I love the first so much! I am an iPhone and iPad user so this is perfect for steaming music and movies to. You can also mirror the images from your screen onto the Apple TV. This was worth buying alone just for Netflix!!

reviewText: This is the second Apple TV I purchase. Both are exactly the same model (3rd gen, I think, which is the latest so far) and were purchased from Amazon within a year period.Both, when I considered purchasing the first one, and then the second one, I had in mind the following:1) I wanted a Hi-Def A/V IP tv box (no more standard-def through the Wii console Netflix), and work with HDMI cables (less cable clutter)2) It would have to be able to handle Netflix, YouTube, and then some3) Aesthetics were also relevant, so it would have to look sleek (if it was only really possible!), and have a small footprint and overall dimensions4) Finally, the deal-breaker would be if I couldn't find enough available content for it to show, since I spend many months every year outside the USA, and some video and music services (ie Rhapsody, Amazon Prime and many others) do not work outside the USA, but iTunes Store does.At the end it all came down to two serious contenders: the newest AppleTV, and the latest ROKU box.Having the iTunes Store content available overseas, on top of Netflix, was what tipped the balance in favor of the ATV, for the first time, and having had such a good experience with the ATV that time, set my mind into favoring the ATV unit for the second time as well. AirPlay from my kids ipods, and ipad, also proved to be a very nice feature. Hopefully with the coming OS upgrade, ATV might have some Apps capabilities coming into it soon.My internet connection is supposed to be 10 Mbps, and it measures up to 8-10 Mbps most of the time, and with that speed, I get good video and sound quality, without noticeable stuttering or long buffering times, so I'm satisfied with it.Amazon delivered on time, with super-saving free shipping, and the purchase price itself both times was marginally lower than Apple's official list price, so it proved to be a good deal for me. Hope you enjoy yours as well.
This item was slightly less in price at Amazon. It arrived quickly and works great. We have a Apple laptop and iPad so this is a great addition for intertwinement options.
This item works great, sets up in seconds and has so many features I'm still only now beginning to fully utilize them all!
This knife shows that it is black, but the one I got was pink! The knife is for a man who doesn't want to carry around a pink knife! Buy from another seller who is more clear about their colors.
This little device can do quite a bit.  Stream netflix/Hulu/other services, mirror apple devices, wireless second screen for OSX, and much more. Watch my review for more.[...]
This little device has made entertaining friends such a delight. The two features that make the best impression are the Photo Stream screen saver and AirPlay. I love it.

reviewText: This little thing started it all - now there are a bunch of products that mimic the original.I have 4 in my house and about to add a 5th, one for each TV.Some may like having a TV with smart capabilities instead to access Hulu and Netflix, but I have 99% of all my media bought from iTunes, which pretty much makes an AppleTV a necessity.Interacts with all my 6 iPhones/iPads in the household plus a Mac Mini media server.  People knock the closed wall of the Apple ecosystem but if you're in it, there's no easier way to do things as long as you don't want to interact with other technologies.

This one lives by the name of Apple! It is fast, interface is fastest, and has bunch of features such as Airplay, Remote App, etc. that are so handy if you have other Apple devices. Even if you don't, the remote is fast, sleek, and easy to operate as compared to other devices and so it makes searching Youtube and Netflix so much easier.  Although I bought this at Best Buy as I needed it right away, you can buy wherever you want. But, let me tell you....Don't get fooled into buying a blu-ray streaming player or Smart TV if all you use is Youtube and Netflix as this one can do it (and much more) so much easily and adds 1000 handy features for other Apple device owners.  The interface and remotes that come with other blu-ray streaming players don't even come close to APple TV! This one surely rocks. Usually I am very critical and don't become happy very soon but this one charmed me.
summary: Best streaming player with lotsa useful features!

reviewText: This particular Apple TV was purchased as a gift. Our son and his wife are not TV people, but live movies as well as certain TV shows. We knew from our experience that this product is perfect for just that. They tell us they use it often and love it!

This product can fit anywhere in your living room. It only requires 2 cords in order to work. There is no power button on this device. It is always on so when you need it, it will be ere for you. If you own an apple device, you can stream media to the tv in a matter of seconds. Very impressed with this item. One thing I don't like is that it can be slow when opening up an app. I still recommend is item to apple users.
summary: Small size, and a lot of media opportunities

reviewText: This product changed my life. I don't even need cable tv anymore, so I cancelled my Time Warner subscription and save $150 a month. Not bad, eh? If I want a show, I can buy it on Hulu. And I watch films on Netflix. And I can airplay from my MacBook Pro. What more could you want? Everyone needs an Apple TV.

This product is good for people who enjoy Apple items (like my husband). He likes Apple TV well enough, but finds it somewhat limiting with what can be rented vs. purchased (it would be nice to rent movies and not necessarily buy them). Perhaps it's a licensing thing, we don't know, but it's still a kink in the system.
This product is simple, straight to the point a must for all apple users.Caution for those living in the past, it does only have HDMI output for video.
summary: Must have for a IOS household

reviewText: This product works fine.  The case and remote are made well and of metal.  I also bought a ruku around the same time.  I like the quality of the Apple TV's case and remote, but the Ruku is easier to navigate.  The Apple remote was not designed for big fingers.  My students say they use their iphones and I touches to control their apple tv's - instead of the stock remote
This streaming TV from the internet  gives us exactly what it claimed.  This is the future.  On top of that is all the money we will save.  LM

This thing is great. A cost efficient way to stream Netflix as well without smart equipment or playstation/x box for much more money. The only downfall is that you cannot add apps. What it has is what you get. The only way to receive more is through Apple updates.

this thing is pretty great, I use it a lot for watching netflix and listening to iTunes radio. The only thing that is lacking is a Safari app and general third party apps. Its kinda lame that you can't download additional apps without jailbreaking it.

This tiny box is all you need to go with a high quality but dumb 1080 TV and WiFi to complete any streamingentertainment you want.It's fast, simple to hook up and configure, and use.The only problem is the excellent remote is so tiny, it's easy to misplace it.

This TV wifi adapter performs well but has the usual somewhat quirky, intuitive but hard to navigate menu that seems to populate all Apple products.  It is a good option for an older flat screen that has HDMI inputs but no "smart" functions.  If  you have a smart-TV  you are advised to pass on this item unless you really must have an Apple interface.

This was a graduation gift.  He was very pleased.  He sent me a note saying he's already using it.  The local delivery piece got hung up a bit but I was very pleased with how it turned out. I really like the local delivery option.
summary: It was a gift so I can only speak to process

reviewText: Though I am still learning all that this product can do, I already love it. The best feature thus far is that it allows me to play the music on my computer through my home theatre system. So, I get great sound when watching tv programs or when listening to my music.

Typical Apple device - does what it was designed to do very well, but (so far) this generation is hack-proof so you can't modify the software to add capability to it (like Plex). If you've got an iPhone or iPad and want to share that screen on your TV, this is the (only easy) way to do it. Otherwise Roku can do everything this can do cheaper and easier, and can also do a lot more.There's a reason the previous generation devices sell for more than $100 more than this generation on EBay - you can hack them and modify the software. I just wish someone would find a way to do that to this device. Apple just doesn't want you to be able to modify anything they sell. It makes tech support easy, but limits the capabilities of their devices.
summary: Only way to use AirPlay to share screens from iPad or iPhone.

reviewText: Typical apple product -- simple, easy to set-up, impressive. I just wish it had a direct icon for Amazon Prime, like what is displayed for HuluPlus, Netflix, etc.Easy to use. The Apple Radio and Internet stations for music are a great feature as well.

Until the recent updates, I preferred the Roku XS because of its versatility. It could do Amazon, Angry Birds, Pandora, and a lot of other "underground" video services. AppleTV could do a very nice Netflix client, Apple iTunes purchases, and in-home streaming, as well as AirPlay from iOS and OSX devices.Now that it can do HBO Go natively and Amazon Streaming via AirPlay in addition to everything else, I think it's the way to go, at least for me. It's beautiful and easy to use. It's OK that it doesn't play Angry Birds.
summary: Updated to be the best (at least for me)

reviewText: Using playon app and filmon app and Crackle App on my ipad and ipod touch I can mirror over 800 free channels on my 50" plasma. Bye bye  cable tv. Now all of my friends are saying goodbye to cable and buying apple tv and using the iphones as a remote to get hundreds of free channels. Apple TV is the best device I have used in a long while and I am now sold on everything Apple. Using Apple TV and an over the air hdtv antenna paying for cable tv is a thing of the past.

Using the Apple TV is easier than connecting my iPod to my receiver, and the Apple TV was cheaper than buying an iPod dock for my receiver. Now I can use the TV screen to change music instead of the little iPod screen. Plus the Apple TV will apparently work with any brand of receiver. I had been streaming Netflix with Roku HD, but the Apple TV gives me more access to my account, so the Roku has been relegated to the less-used bedroom TV. I have my iTunes music on an external drive connected to my router, and I can listen to it without turning on my PC.The Apple TV and my Yamaha receiver's remote cannot be programmed to operate each other. So I have yet another remote. And Apple TV does not stream Pandora, but my receiver does.

Very fast delivery after ordering. I bought this for my son's tv in his bedroom since he doesn't have cable in his room. He's able to watch his YouTube, Netflix , and listen to his music. Awesome product to turn a basic TV into a smart TV.
Very pleased easy to use. I also have a Roku. But this is a better product. I would recommend to anybody.

Wanted to use this as a single device to drive an HDMI flat panel from an iPad. Turns out you need a separate AP to make the connection. I thought I had researched it thoroughly but alas I did not. So, with the addition of an AP I was able to mirror my iPad's screen to the flat panel. Still have to fuss with screen size but over all happy.
summary: Worked as expect BUT requires additional WiFi Access Point

reviewText: Was ripping my hair out trying to stream videos from my PC to my living room.  I had tried XBMC, PS3 media server, and Plex.  I believe all three of these say they can do on-the-fly encoding, which is what I was really looking for (I have a lot of HD movies in MKV format).  None worked very well, although Plex seemed to be the closest to what I was looking for.  But it just wasn't able to handle the HD MKVs and it was driving me crazy, so I just grabbed an AppleTV and spent a weekend converting all of my movies in handbrake.  Handbrake is free and easy to use and once you get the movies into a format that you can add to iTunes streaming to the AppleTV works flawlessly.  I thought having all of my movies and TV shows in iTunes would be a pain but it's actually pretty convenient letting iTunes do all the organizing.  However if you're using Windows and don't have a great PC then iTunes may very well be a deal-breaker.  My PC is pretty beefy so I don't have much of a problem.The interface is sleek and intuitive, as you would expect from Apple, streaming works great, connects via HDMI (although it also has an optical audio port which is nice).

We already have a Roku and 'smart' tv's, but when are 3 year old cracked our LED TV, we went low end on the replacement and needed something for Netflix, etc.  Since we already own MacBook Pro's and Ipads (and Iphones), we went with the Apple TV.  For the most part, we've been satisfied and love the integration with Itunes.  However, the fact that Apple limits the third party apps causes some issues.  For instance, no Pandora App.  No Amazon Prime Instant app (not surprising I know).  The roku is much more open and would be my first choice due to the lower cost.
summary: Great if you are an Apple family, missing some openness

reviewText: We already owned an Apple Tv Device; and loved it so much we got this second one.  Don't forget to buy an HDMI cord because it does not come with one.
We are using this device in a corporate mid-sized conference room.  Connected to an A/V tuner/receiver, we can now provide Apple devices with a convenient way to reach the projector.

We bought this to stream amazon through our TV and catch up on shows via apps (HBOgo, etc). Seriously a life changer. One important note that I didn't catch in the reviews is you must have an HDMI to HDMI cable in order to hook it up; it does not come ready to go out of the box.

We disconnected our cable at the beginning of the year and haven't looked back. We have both Rokus and an Apple TV, with Netflix, Hulu and Amazon subs. The bad is the Apple TV is notably slower than the Roku and is missing Amazon Instant Video, but I still use the Apple TV more often because of airplay with my ipad which allows me to project nearly any video from the browser onto the TV. Korean dramas, anyone?If you don't have other Apple devices, go with the Roku. It's much better as a standalone product. If you do use other Apple products, the Apple TV fits right into your lineup.
summary: Not as good as Roku but airplay makes up for it

reviewText: We don't use the Apple TV with all of its potential yet.  We use it a lot for displaying photos and video from our iPads or iPhones using AirPlay.  Works quite well with that.  Displaying other picture albums is also fun to do.  A little disappointing when we try to project some apps from the iPad to the Apple TV and we get an error message that it is not supported.  I appears to be a licensing thing.  Apple TV is also nice for YouTube even though at times it "stalls" (YouTube waiting to download more content) when playing a selection and I am not sure if that is a problem with Apple TV or not but I don't think we saw as many stalls with our iPad 2 running on the same home network.  The one thing I should note is the YouTube app does not allow you to comment on YouTube videos after watching them like you can elsewhere.  I would suspect this was because with the tiny remote it would take forever to enter in a few sentences.  However, users can pair an Apple keyboard and that would work well for this.  Video through the many Apple TV apps are smooth even with my "slow" 3M DSL internet.  The unit is nice and compact and is extremely easy to set up when you first purchase it.  It is amazing how much you can do with a simple controlling remote but I would have preferred one with a few more buttons.  I would have given a 5 star rating if I didn't experience the YouTube stalls.  If this is a configuration issue, someone please note this and I will modify my rating.

We finally took the plunge and cancelled out cable service. And surprisingly, not only do we not MISS cable, but we're happier without it. Knowing that we're not throwing $1200 a year at a cable company makes us incredibly happy!
summary: Now that it has Hulu, cut your cable!

reviewText: We got in our Apple TV and set it up instantly! The apple TV allows for access to Netflix and Hulu from the device through an app on there. I also found it was cheaper to just buy some of the seasons I love on iTunes than to have a bigger Dish package just to have that one channel so it has allowed us to save something like 200 dollars a year by looking at what we could buy or rent through iTunes and the channels and shows we currently watch. Hulu has access to tons of shows including the CW. We did have a slight hickup in doing the airplay from my MacBook Pro 2012 with the updated software. The CW website was having serious lag problems when it came to the TV screen. YouTube was also a little lagging from the computer to the TV screen through AirPlay. That is before I found the part where there's a YouTube app on the apple TV so you can simply search and show stuff through the device itself. I highly recommend looking at YouTube for people showing the device before you buy just so you know what it can do.In order to do AirPlay we did have to upgrade out software on our Macbook Pro 2012 but our "New" iPad's are already compatable and do the AirPlay brilliantly. One other addition when the iPad was hooked up the "shown screen" or the picture we were getting on the TV screen was smaller than the computer and when we just used the product itself. We have a wide screen TV. So it shrunk our TV quite a bit. You do have to pay for Netflix and Hulu if you want to use the services. Also I'll add in how the iTunes works. All your purchases are on there and accessible, but if you buy a season pass the show will show up one day later to be able to view. For example, my guilty pleasure Beverly Hill Housewives show's on the television on Monday's but I can't watch the show through iTunes until Tuesday. I think it's Tuesday at like midnight or early in the morning but it's always the next day even for American Horror Story. Hope this helps those that are curious about the apple TV.

We have had this for almost 2 weeks now and I am ready to cancel my expensive cable.  It was SUPER easy to set up and now we have Hulu and Netflix and it pretty much covers all of the TV we were paying almost $200 a month for for less than $15 a month for those subscriptions.  Not to mention all of the other freebies on there.  It also ties into our iPad if we want to play something on any other apps that might not be on there.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

We have had this product for over a year and we love it use is everyday.  We keep our digital movies on our iTunes account and can access them regularly.  My husband uploaded photo's to it, so when we are not using it, or are listening to the radio we have our family photo's displayed on our TV as a screen saver.  The Apple TV gives you links to Netflix, Radio, Hulu and several other apps automatically so it's a one stop shop for digital users who have multiple accounts .  The only down side is you must have an internet connection even to watch your purchased digital movies.
summary: Great way to keep your digital movies at hand!

reviewText: We have one of these at church for our projector for our Pastor to use with his iPad.  I loved it so much, I now have one at home!

We have used this several times since our purchase. It is easy to set and to use. So portable that you can move from one TV in the house to another if necessary. It has been great for streaming Amazon Prime videos.

We like our Apple TV. The setup was easy and we were quickly able to connect to the iTunes account on our main household computer. The thing is, it might change the way you watch TV. If you are a person who is used to watching their television "on demand", and have Netflix and Hulu Plus subscriptions, this product is for you. If you are a "passive" TV viewer, like me, it does fundamentally change how you watch TV, and I haven't decided whether that is for the better.Sometimes you just want to put on a channel and watch a series of programs without having to do anything. With Apple TV and other similar devices (or YouTube for that matter) you have to select each program individually. You can build a playlist, but you're still picking everything. It takes away the ability to just leave the TV on in the background while doing other things.
summary: It changes the way you watch TV (but not in the way you think)

reviewText: Well, I finally made the leap and purchased an Apple TV unit. And I must say it was absolutely simple to hook up and sync to my iMac. It works like a dream. I absolutely love using Netflix on it.
summary: Why did I wait so long?

reviewText: Well spent money, I use it  to watch Netflix and have got what just what I wanted and it is so easy to use that my 5 years old daughter can choose by herself what she wants to watch

Well this is my 1st streaming product. im not into the streaming box phenom, i have cable so i really dont see the need in it. My main purpose for getting the Apple TV is because im all to in the Apple ecosystem...iPad (full size & mini), iphone, imac, mac air, ipod nano (that i lost last week) i got it all.  However, i normally play my movies on my ps3 thru the ps3 media only problem is CINAVIA yes the block for pirated movies. I did my research and got the Apple TV to remedy the problem and save HD space on my ps3.  And boy can i say this remedies the problem and i love it. however i really have no other use for it but for watching movies so all the other apps are useless to me so wouldnt be able to review also i do love loooove looooooove the airplay that is so cool and one day im going to test how i can take my apple tv and my iphone to a friends house and watch my movies. i give this 5 stars well worth it. Very beautiful UI better than ps3 convient and easy breezy set up. Now if only Apple will bring the retina iPad mini. Good Luck guys!!!
We love all things Apple! So easy to use- so easy that our 4 year old can use it. Only wish it had an alphabet key, versus going through the whole alphabet to spell something out.

We love this thing!  Very easy to set up and operate.  The list of available programming seems to grow every week.  I only wish our cable provider was more cooperative so we could take advantage of HBO GO and similar providers.

We love this. We choose not to have cable and this is the perfect amount of tv for us. I have noticed updates coming through over the last week or so. That's a nice touch. The remote is TINY. We are always losing it. But other than that we do love the Apple TV.

We now have four of these little beauties. One we use when we travel.  The other three are in our house and work fine together in the same environment.  You just give them different names.  While our most used feature is Netflix, we also stream directly from our iPads.  You simply select the Apple TV box you want the iPad to connect to.  They install easy and work flawlessly.  But they don't (won't) have an App for Amazon Prime.  That's our only complaint, as sometimes the program we want to watch is not available on any other service.
summary: Great Product -wish it included Amazon Prime

reviewText: We previously owned the prior iteration of Apple TV circa 2011.  It was slick but had a very limited range and was effectively useless in our wireless setup. We switched to a dual band ROKU 2 XS and had improved results.  The ROKU was not that reliable, however.  It frequently dropped signal and most of the time played back in a format well below HD.  The device does not tell you the bandwidth directly but provides a range of one to four dots with all four being HD.  We almost never never got four dots. Most of the time we got three dots, sometimes 2 or even 1.  Still, it worked.We bought the new Apple not expecting any improvement in signal or resolution but merely to watch shows on HBO GO.  It turns out that the suits at ROKU, DirecTV (our service provider), and HBO could not agree terms to stream HBO GO.  So, we were able to watch HBO GO on ipods and pads and computers but we could not watch it over the ROKU on our TV (figuring this out by the way took forever; its a fact that all of the parties involved seem to want to keep well hidden).  Needless to say this was frustrating since we were paying for the service through the HBO subscription.Anyway, the new Apple TV was an unexpected delight in every way. The signal streams in HD almost all of the time.  It is fast, way faster than the ROKU, and you can rewind and pause without dropping the stream - a common event with the ROKU.  It is simply a much more powerful device than the ROKU. Build quality is typical Apple but at the high end of what they do.  It is a solid, heavy and robust feeling piece of gear.  Compared to the Apple the ROKU feels light and cheap. The milled aluminium remote is a delight to use and is far nicer than ROKU's remote which is really quite nice itself.  Presentation is sleek and navigation and setup are a breeze.  The exception is accessing a computer library through the network.  It doesn't bother me because I have a dedicated stereo and have no desire to listen to music through the relatively poor Sonos speakers attached to the TV.  Others may disagree.All of this was totally unexpected.  I had anticipated range problems and was hoping that APple had stepped up and fixed the issue.  They had.  I am not an Apple fan generally but on this piece of kit I think they knocked it out of the park.  On a functional, aesthetic, and build quality basis I would expect this to be $300 - $400 piece of gear.  Either ROKU is reaping huge profits or Apple is taking a hit to position itself for the full blown Apple TV ecosystem rumored to be in the pipeline.  I think the latter.  For $99 this is an incredible deal.  To say that an Apple product is underpriced is even more incredible but, however strange, its true here.I have to give this five stars on all counts with the obvious caveat that it would be nice to access one's Amazon library from Apple.  A really great little piece of kit and a nice surprise.  Well done Apple.
We think the Roku was a little easier to use but nothing compares to the selection and quality of our Apply TV! I'm so happy that hubby got this for our home.

We used this to watch Netflix, rent movies or listen to music--the quality of the streaming is generally excellent, better than our usual cable transmission. We also use Airplay to send music or pictures from our iPad.  (We have an Apple airport router) It is simple to use, takes little space, and the remote is easy for anyone to learn.  (With a bit of effort, the Harmony remotes will work with it as well, but the Apple remote is so simple and effective that we prefer it )  Beautifully designed.  We have two and have not noticed any problems with both being used at the same time.  Please note that it does require the use of HDMI but does not require any other apple products.
We use this thing constantly since we're an Apple family. So easy to use and so fast. Works great to stream movies from iPad or Mac. Love it!
We were quite pleased with the product. The Ipad Iphone connection works pretty good and you end up having a smart TV.
What a wonderful item to have! We can watch shows of all types like netflick (7.99 monthly).  Easy to set-up and use!  We just love it!

What can I say, when we decided to to finally part with Cable TV our daughter and son in law both said they thought we would really like Apple TV.  I didn't understand what they were saying.  All I can say is I wish we had simply purchased two Apple TV units and left it at that.  The usability, convenience, and compatibility with what we already were using around the house has been amazing.  In particular nearly any video whatever it is alway gives us an option to view them on Apple TV which is great,  Much easier to view something on a TV than an iPhone.  We like the Apple TV unit so much that we are thinking of getting an Apple TV to use with a Smart TV we purchased.
summary: Great interface great product, great features.

reviewText: When I first purchased my apple tv. I didn't even hook it up for 6 months or so, not knowing how it would be any different than my Ipad or Roku.  But when I eventually did get around to hooking it up to see what my choices were I was very pleasantly surprised and it quickly became my most used product for watching shows on.It is different than the Roku because it does offer access to the Apple Itunes store, so I can purchase movies and watch them immediately right from my TV. But on the other end it's very similar to the Roku box because I still get to access my Netflix and Hulu accounts as well.Perhaps my favorite thing about the apple tv is that I can connect to any of my computer itunes databases through the homesharing feature. So any items that I previously purchased through Itunes can be played directly to my tv no matter where they are stored...and I have purchased and downloaded (from places other than itunes) many, many items.I rarely find a moment when I cannot find something to watch. It has a very clear picture and I have never had any problems with it stopping on me mid-way through my searching or watching of movies (I have had this happen to me with my cable box, and my roku box)

When I was buying this at my local Apple retail store, the rep told me it could play directly from my NAS (network-attached storage). When I got home, I realized she had either lied to me or simply hadn't got a clue.  The Computer part of Apple TV only streams from iTunes software on Mac or PC.However, with the help of a free app called MoliPlayer HD -- I first used this app last year on my Nokia Windows Phone -- and the wonderful AirPlay, it's a cinch to network-play my files on my NAS, a Diskstation product.  MoliPlayer HD can access any server or computer on your LAN (local area network), and play pretty all the video and audio formats out there.  The free version doesn't allow you to password-protect the app, but otherwise has all the major functions.  I just launch MoliPlayer HD, go to Nearby on the left, and it accesses my DiskStation as well as my Windows workgroup immediately. I then turn on AirPlay to send the media content to my Apple TV.The Apple TV is truly simple and elegant, and it just works.  I went through several Android-based media players but they were all difficult to use, froze frequently, not to mention anything from Google is reported to spy on you and your family.  On the Apple TV I can rearrange the app icons just like on iPhone or iPad. I can easily get rid off unwanted icons through the Restrictions settings. For instance, I don't have cable at home, so I remove things like HBO and ESPN and Disney channels.  Everything just works so well and so smoothly, even the screensaver is so well done.  AirPlay is indeed awesome!!  I plan to get an AirPort Extreme and AirPlay-ify all my media hardware.
summary: Now I can play from my NAS

reviewText: While I had to call Apple to set it up since the directions are almost non-existent for a person who is less than computer savvy, once it was set up, it did pretty much everything it said it would....perhaps some things not as good as I would hope due to the speed of our internet connection I would imagine...what we did find out though is that we could have gone through life happily without it...it seems like everything we thought might be free, costs (even things we have free on our regular cable on demand cost here) but we've got it and we will use it to whatever degree we will.
summary: It does what it's supposed to do

reviewText: While it fills the needs I had as far as streaming from my iTunes library, renting and Netflix go it still needs some serious software improvements.  Having to have every computer you plan to share from being in the same home sharing network seems excessively confusing.  Also having both movies and music from shares computers be under the computers menu instead of the respective music or movie category on the home screen seems dumb.  Also the home screen needs work so it is more like iOS and less its own amalgamation.
While I wish Apple would add some more apps like Amazon Streaming, I am able to stream video's off my computer, iPad or iPhone and it is great....
Who needs cable anymore? This is the future of television.  I'll never go back to cable where you get robbed every month. Easy set up and easy to use.
Why pay more? Same thing for less money! Hooked it up in just ten minutes and it works very well

With a house filled with Apple devices, I figured it was time to get this one too. I like the forum and function and am able to watch a large variety of visual media from my iTunes movie collection to YouTube videos.

With Apple there are no middle terms, or you love Apple or you hate it.Since i am in the first group of people and i have many apple products at home, Apple tv is a must specially when you use the Airplay function.
With this little device, I am able to watch a lot of free TV shows on the web. The picture quality on HD content is very good.
With Wi-Fi it's cool, but once you hook it up to a wired connection that's fast, it is a much better experience. Love it.
Wonderful product! Works seemlessly with my iPhone and iPad, I can mirror them both through Apple TV to my HD TV which is very nice. Must buy for those without one.
Works as advertised.  Not a lot of apps.  Air Play is great! . . . . . . . .
works as expected. Little slow on macbook. Works great with IPAD and IPHONE. Don't ask for more words when customers are taking time to review.
Works great.  I love it.  Was easy to connect and use.  My grandkids love airplay from my iPad.  Waiting for snow lion to be able to steam from my iMac.
Works great. My wife loves FaceTiming with my son in 55" HD ....lol..  It will be nice at the pool this summer to let other people choose the music we have playing.

Works just ok. Sometimes it stops momentarily. I'm an Apple soul, but would prefer the Amazon model if I had to do it over as it is more powerful and gets both Netflix and Amazon.  What I find particularly annoying is that it does not recognize the Apple Super Drive, so I cannot watch a DVD using this with my Macbook Pro. Also no Amazon Prime.
summary: An Apple soul, but wish I ordered the Amazon model

reviewText: You can't go wrong getting an Apple TV. With HBO Go and ESPN, airplay, rent and buy movies, shows, songs, etc. This will definitely be used at any dinner party. Anyone with an iDevice can stream their media.
You can watch anything from you tube to Netflix on your regular tv. All purchases from iTunes can also be viewed with this devise.

You get a lot of features for $100 here if you own all mac products. The missing star here is the technical limitations for more experienced users and a far too simplified interface.And for all you non-geeks, make sure you read up on what you can and can not airplay. Far too many people buy this device thinking they are going to airplay NFL games or HBOGO. Not the case. I knew this before purchase, but it seems many people did not.Mac people, you'll want to look into buying an app for your computer called AirParrot. Solvs a huge second screen/mirroring issue.
summary: Pretty good device if you own all Apple products

reviewText: You have to buy everything to use it.  I got it for airplay compatibility.  Hardly anything in the apple store to see for free.  Quite disappointing when it kills your internet from direct streaming.  I have to download to my mbp or iPad, to save from streaming from anything but the wifi transfer from my machine.  That part is very sad.  Otherwise you just end up feeling like other people have different experience than you.

You must have this if you own an iPad or iPhone. Airplay feature is worth it alone. I like all the channels apple is slowly adding however the current interface makes this interface way too cluttered. I hope they update this system soon... maybe in march. This apple TV is a gift but I would like to buy a new one for myself.

i should've known this this would be as locked down as it is. The main reason I chose it was because its HBO Go app works with comcast, while roku's does not (which is completely retarded and another discussion altogether). The quality of said HBO Go was was worse than I could imagine. Netflix's HD offerings look pretty damned good, so that's what i was expecting from a premium channel's stream. Anyways, this box might be good, if I had more money than brains and wanted to waste it on itunes videos, which are only useful in the apple ecosystem. Not sure what idiots pays these prices for something they can't lend, trade, give away, or sell. I guess the same is true of ALL drmed video. At least with discs, I'm capable of doing what i want with them. Another thing I hated was the sparseness of channels. I'd expect more big players like Amazon Instant Video to be available, but nope. The plusses I can think of are that it works well with my iphone, the airplay thing seemed cool, until you realize how many apps (like Amazon Instant Video) are crippled to not work. That, and i can stream all my music, but have to have itunes open to do so. Overall,  if you leave and breathe Apple, thus might be a good deal, but not if you want any sort of value.

I have had this for a couple months now.  Overall, I have pleased with it.  A little bumpy at first due to I had to keep signing in and out of Itunes and home sharing numerous times each day to get my Itunes Media to stream.  Has gotten better, I just have to close of of Itunes each morning and relauch it for my library to come back up on the AppleTV.  Not the fastest streaming compared to something like Netflix but I am assuming it is due to the higher quality picture ATV puts out.  So those with slower internet connections (probably 6 and below) will not like the buffer time.  Airplay is great but keep in mind not everything is airplay supported, for example HBO2GO.  Getting HBO on board and a bigger selection of apps, LIKE AMAZON INSTANT, would make this worth every penny.  Hulu Plus was recently added which will help alot of people cut cable or dish.  Not quite a cable cutter for me since I have a handful of TV shows not on Hulu that I watch and paying $3 a episode in the Itunes store is not going to happen.EDIT 11/24..DROPPED THE RATING FROM A 4 STAR TO A 1 STAR.  APPLE RELEASED A UPDATE THAT HAS RUINED MY AND OTHERS (GOOGLE IT) AIRPLAY.  I HAVE TO RESTART ITUNES AFTER ALMOST EVERY SONG OR I JUST GET THE ENDLESS LOADING SYMBOL.  I CALLED APPLE TECH SUPPORT AND THE REP WAS RUDE AND WANTED TO CHARGE ME TO GET HELP FOR A PROBLEM CAUSED BY APPLE.  APPLE IS GOING DOWN THE TOILET!

I order from Amazon at least on a weekly basis and have never had an issue with a product being defective, thankfully. I already owned an Apple TV, but purchased this one as a gift. Turns out, it didn't work. All I wanted was a replacement, not a refund, and Amazon refused both. Glad I hadn't previously encountered defective products with Amazon because I learned that they will not assist you in getting what you paid for. There went $100 down the drain and I will reorder this product from Apple to give to my relatives who are awaiting their long overdue (working) gift.

reviewText: Abso-freakn-lutely amazing.  I love Apple and its innovative solutions.  I watch my Apple TV nearly every day.  This one was a gift.  It makes a perfect gift for a gadget loving guy.  No regrets whatsoever!

reviewText: A few things changed my life and this is one of them.  I love being able to get all my videos from my Apple account on my large screen tv.  Apple TV is easy to set up Iike all their other products and there's no service fee for using it!

A few years back when the second generation Apple TV came out I got it for my birthday and have used it just about daily in my living room. Being that I've used it so much, I recently decided it would be best to get another for my bedroom.I can't say that the Apple TV third generation is any better than the second generation, but it does seem a faster when navigating menus and loading content. Both of the televisions I have are 720, so I can't really comment on the picture quality, but I'm sure it would be better if I had a 1080.Setup for the Apple TV was a breeze. I had it connected to my iTunes account, Music Match, and streaming content in five minutes. However, it did have to upgrade to the newest OS which took some extra time.In my opinion the Apple TV is one of the most overlooked Apple products that will deliver you the most content to your television. With this device you can rent movies, watch Netflix, steam content from you iTunes library, and stream content from your other Apple devices. One of the other features I like, is the ability to stream music to multiple Apple TVs. You can make iTunes send your music to multiple rooms, which allows you to hear your tunes everywhere you go.Pros:- For under a hundred bucks there is nothing else on the market that can beat it- Steaming content from your computer is flawless- Free content to Apple events, like concerts and new products- Creates a seamless multimedia experience throughout your homeCons:- Wish airplay was a more open concept, which allowed other devices to utilize itOverall, if you are looking for something to make your TV a little smarter or a way to stream your home movies and other iTunes content to the big screen, look no further.
summary: A must have for any television!

reviewText: After a frustrating experience with a non-functional Roku, I bought this. I had it up and running in about 5 minutes and love the interface. I mainly use it for Netflix, Vimeo and flickr slide shows.

reviewText: A hassle to set up and dealing with iTunes (through which the setup is handled) took several days of phoning and to this day I am not sure if I am properly registered.  Also, getting passwords etc. on the various services is a bit of a nightmare also.  Be prepared for a big investment in time until you get anything for your money.Full disclosure, I owned a Next computer and Steve Jobs abandoned me so I am probably prejudiced.  However, this latest Apple acquisition has done nothing to smooth ancient ruffled feathers.

reviewText: Airplay Mirroring is the most amazing feature on here. I would have gotten it simply for that reason. No more watching downloaded movies on my laptop screen with computer sound. Now my wife and I enjoy them on our big screen and not only the video is streamed but the audio too! And all on our LAN network. Amazing.We have several apple products and this just makes them all better. Now they all have connectivity with the Apple TV and we use what ever is most convenient for the remote...ipad...iphone...the standard remote...I also got rid of my xbox last year. (i'm 1 year Halo sober!) But the bad part was no more hulu and netflix on our flat screen. My wife loved those features of xbox live. No problem now! We can watch our Hulu+ and Netflix shows on the Apple TV. And even better, NO SUBSCRIPTION. Just one time $99. No $50 yearly subscription needed.As you can see I love my Apple TV. Such a great product and man what a great price. It brings so much more value to all of my mac products. You have to get one. Don't wait. Buy now.
summary: Airplay Mirroring!!! and better than Xbox live.

reviewText: Amazing technology. Apple does it again. My only suggestion would be to make the remote control bigger, it's so easy to lose!!

A new world this product. I can do a lot of thinhs, see film, watch my own photos, look for music, enter in a new Apple world. Great product and cheap. i am very happy and satisfied. Easy to intall and do a lot of things.
APPLE.... all you need to know cause what apple product has ever failed?  Im sure something new will come out better but this works great.

Apple has an exasperating mindset that tries to limit one's ability to share fully owned material across users, even in the same household.  I think that it is pure and evil greed, no matter how high and holy Apple thinks it is.  Anyway, at least with iTunes one can share libraries.  With Apple TV, an user must sign out of his library and sign into another in order to watch shows or listen to music on that other library, even if the library is in the same house.  So, for example, I have to sign out of my Apple account and log into my daughter's Apple account, which means she needs to provide me her password, in order to watch a show that she has bought on iTunes, even though she still lives in my house and is sitting next to me while we watch the show.  That is infuriating!  Also, in Steve Jobs quest to simplify everything, he made it much more difficult to navigate the menu than it should be.  The controller should have more buttons on it, and one should not have to repeat actions so much.  I like the overall ability to play media through the Apple TV, but the interface needs to be expanded, and the restrictions need to be lifted.
summary: I wish it had some more features, but it really is wonderful as it is.

reviewText: Here is what to know before ordering this:The video out is HDMI (which also carries audio if going to the same device), the digital audio out is Optical (no Coax).  So if you are like me and running short on HDMI spaces on your TV, keep this in mind.Otherwise, an amazing device that has forever changed watching movies.  It will play any movie in your iTunes library as well as allowing re-broadcast of any video being shown on your iDevice on the same home share (think YouTube / Internet Videos).I also really like the Netflix interface with this device as I spend a lot of time watching Netflix with my son.

I am a little disappointed with all the pay per view channels. I thought there would be more free channels. The pay per view channels charges just as much as Directv for PPV , Amazon Instant Video is a much better deal.Which Apple TV doesn't support, you have to download the app (Amazon Instant Video) on your ipad or iphone and mirror it to your Apple TV. It also doesn't support Epix you have to do the same thing with your device to get that channel. If I knew what I know now I may have not purchased this item. If you are considering it make sure you check it out real good first.The Roku 3 has over 750 channels, and they keep adding more. It does not have the mirroring feature, which is a real problem. Apple TV needs to allow you to add more channels. I can get the Amazon instant video and Epix by using the mirroring feature. But you have to have your ipad on and streaming the video to view.
summary: Most of the channels available are pay per view

reviewText: I am very pleased with this gadget which gives me a lot of fun.I can recommend its simplicity.Contecting your iTunes with Tv

I bought it for AirPlay in hotels. Waste of money, most hotel Internet needs to be connected via a website agreeing to terms, that doesn't happen with this. Even at home the wifi goes in and out. When it works, it's nice but not worth the money.

I bought the Roku a couple of years ago and loved it.  I bough the Apple TV because I really wanted to be able to mirror my apple products in my house. so we moved the Roku to the basement for the kids and have the Apple TV in the main living room.I like that I am able to sync everything up. and it was easy too.  I wish that I was still able to access all the different channels like you can on Roku - like TEDtv. on the flip side, I like that you can view YouTube easily on this device. so there are pros and cons.Overall, I like the Roku and AppleTV equally, they just each have their own benefits.  both stream well and rarely ever an issue.

I bought this to act as my Netflix and MLB.tv player. Xbox Live became too expensive to maintain, and not worth the price even if it were cheaper, given that I probably play video games less than ten times a year. The Xbox's network adapter (I have an older one) is pretty subpar as well.Enter Apple TV, the golden child of streaming devices. It's simple, clean of cumbersome wires and remote buttons, and fast. The network adapter inside is receptive enough to stream with few pauses or buffers. You get bouts of that stuff occasionally, but such is the nature of wireless networks. The menu is very comprehensive, and offers many features. The Netflix app is great, and you can stream music and videos directly from any other Apple product. If you're watching a video on your iPhone, or iPad, you may throw that puppy up on the TV and watch there instead.I do wish that you could download apps onto the menu. Also, be careful with the remote. Dropping it once, or banging it onto anything, can scratch or ding it very easily.

I don't want to take away from what all this thing can do. It is kinda cool but still different from what I was looking for. I was expecting to be able to display whatever I was viewing on my iPad on my TV. That is not the case. There are a few apps that can be displayed, otherwise the Apple TV has its own apps that you can purchase things on to view. Or if you have stuff you have already purchased on your iPad you can view that on your TV. But it does not have the ability to act as a monitor for your iPad as I had thought. Still cool enough to keep I guess as I'm sure I will learn new things that I can do with it, but overall I wish Apple would just figure out a way for me to display everything from my iPad and not just select items.
summary: Cool But Not What I Expected

reviewText: I finally took the plunge and gave up my cable subscription, thanks to apple tv. I am never going back! This is so easy to install and navigate and the choices for viewing are fantastic. Plus I am saving hundreds of dollars a year with no more cable.

If you have an IPhone this is a must purchase. It unlocks a great deal of content for your entertainment center. Plays your music from your phone or your music library on your computer through itunes. You must have a wireless network of course. Check it out.

reviewText: If you're looking for a small, easy-to-use, elegant but extremely limited set top box and don't mind purchasing everything from iTunes, the Apple TV works. If you want something that's a portal to other content providers, you might want to consider something else.Make no mistake about it, Apple wants you to buy everything from them and nothing from anyone else. Nowhere is this strategy more evident than with the AppleTV. Other than Netflix and a couple of other services that, if not available, would render this product completely irrelevant, Apple makes sure you don't have access to competitors, like Flixster or Amazon. If you want a movie or television show and it's not on Netflix (and it probably won't be), you will have to purchase it, and the only place to get it is, you guessed it, iTunes. If you've purchased a digital copy of a movie on a cloud like Flixster, you won't be able to use the Apple TV to play it like you would on a PS3, XBox, Google TV, Samsung Smart TV or any of a number of open systems.Unless.That is, unless you have OSX Mountain Lion. If you do, you with one click, AirPlay everything on your computer on your television. Everything that's on your computer is on your television, including the sound. It's a great feature for making presentations or simply watching a movie.And it helps you subvert the brilliantly engineered iTunes Monopoly that comes installed with every product Apple sells.
summary: 5 Stars If You Have OSX Mountain Lion, 1 Star If You Don't

reviewText: I love the little box.  It doesn't clutter up the shelf.  It  works great and I like to be able to choose what I want to watch.  No more cable bill!!!  :)

I'm basing my review off of the 3 big streaming solutions I currently own: The Apple TV, the Roku, and the Xbox 360. They're all good products, and they each have a slightly different purpose for existing. Below I review the Apple TV, and then compare it to the other solutions.What does the Apple TV have going for it?- The Apple TV syncs beautifully with all of your other iOS devices (iPhone, iPad), and now it also works wonderfully with Mountain Lion for Mac. Quite honestly, this is what makes this product so special. The ability to connect my iPhone up via AirPlay and listen to Spotify and Pandora in addition to my iTunes library is fantastic. With AirPlay Mirroring you can even watch apps like CNN live on the Apple TV (via the iPhone / iPad app). It seems almost like a bonus that it streams Netflix, and now Hulu Plus.- The biggest drawback this thing has going for it is apps. While you can now do much of these via the AirPlay mirroring, it would certainly be nice to have a dedicated ATV app. Especially for those without iPhones / Macs.- The pricing isn't bad in the iTunes Store. TV Shows run at $1.99 / episode ($2.99 HD), and movies you can rent for $3.99 ($4.99 HD). This is the same exact price you'll see in Amazon Instant.How it compares.To Xbox: Xbox 360 really has an ideal package going for it. It has a large library of apps (and continues to expand) and can play all the latest games. The apps range from Amazon Instant (a good equivalent to iTunes, though I notice more lag with Amazon), Netflix (the standard on everything), Hulu Plus, Hbo Go, and more. With the exception of Netflix and Hulu, everything else is missing in the Apple TV. I decided to start watching Netflix on ATV because the Xbox seems to lag with video streaming apps, but for everything else it works fine. Biggest drawback is price... While you can get a decent Xbox for $200 these days, you also pay annually for Xbox Live Gold to keep these apps. That'll run you an extra $60. You really don't find your value in Xbox Live unless you're also a gamer as well.To Roku: I like the Roku. It has a lot of the same apps as Xbox (with a few extra goodies like Pandora). You can use a lot of stuff without needing an iPhone or apple device. And it's a bit cheaper than the ATV or Xbox. This gadget seems to lack in video quality (noticed a big difference in color streaming with the Xbox and ATV), and occasionally the audio would cut out out on certain settings, but it does the job if you want a simple streaming device. They allow for people to make apps and add it to their market but, alas, it seems the marketplace has become stale. In the last 6 months I can't think of any apps that I downloaded and actually ended up using.In the end...Get the Apple TV if: You are looking to stream content flawlessly from iTunes, Netflix, or Hulu. And if you ALREADY OWN iOS devices / Mac computers.Get the Xbox 360 if: You like a lot of apps AND are into gaming. Otherwise you can go with option 3... The Roku.Get the Roku if: You're looking for a simple streaming solution that's easy to set up. It doesn't have any extra bells or whistles, but I'm guessing many people out there won't be looking for that. They'll just want to stream their content!Happy to answer questions below!
summary: Is Apple TV the best for you? It was for me.

reviewText: im not complaining about its ability to do what it says it can do, just the fact that its a tool to rip you off further... there are other options out there

I'm not going to bother summarizing this device. If you dont know what Apple TV is by now, I doubt my review will help the general public.I'll stick to the good, bad and ugly.Good:Slick InterfaceNetflix is a breezeLighting fast streamingEase of setupHBO GO and MAX GO are available through Airplay.Bad:Airplay (I know the Apple fanbase will crucify me on this but here's the reason why)Airplay barely streams anything from your iPhone or iPad- It doesn't stream : VUDU, Cinenow, Amazon Prime, Showtime Anytime, Encore TV, Epix or Starz Play.iTunes is sometimes unavailable, so your "iCloud" movies, are unavailable.Not enough out of the box apps on the UIThe Ugly:I think Apple's price point is a little off considering the amount of apps they give you out of the box. A little rip for the Apple loving world if you ask me. I have all things Apple, but in 5 years, who knows. I'd be up for a challenge and healthy tech competition.Overall, its a solid device, yet overpriced, that is still too limited to be considered a real asset to my home theatre.

reviewText: I'm not that hot on this device.I waited for the 1080p version to come out, and bought when it did.Pros:====Really good picture qualityElegant device - no external power supply, UI is nice to look atWorks well with iTunes on a host PCAirplay from an iPad is kinda neatCons:====Doesn't do much - no prime streaming, no Vudu, for example.  We hardly use it - preferring the Netflix UI on the TV in one room, and a Roku due to more streaming options available in the other room.Remote is almost useless - I use an iPad most of the timeIt had a network issue (I used hard-wired) - which was finally solved by a software update ... that required wireless networking!  Set it up temporarily and it's been fine sinceCan't do much configuring - can't even delete icons for things you don't want to have appear, though you can move them to a lower rowI like the headphone jack on Roku 2 and 3 - nice feature this misses.  I'd imagine it could be done via streaming the sound to an iPadAlso, I'm surprised there's no app store for these, or games using an tablet or phone as controller.Steve
summary: Doesn't do as much as I'd like

reviewText: I own a Roku that works great and now the Apple TV. Both are very good at getting movies from Netflix. The picture is better on the Apple TV and it tends to not rebuffer as often as Roku. You get more content available with Roku like Hulu, Crackle, etc. but the quality of the Apple TV is impressive. Apple offers movies and TV shows for purchase. However you can go to Amazon online with Roku and do the same thing. So if you want to go cheap Roku is nice. If picture quality and better quality is key Apple TV is it. Get both for about 150 to 200 bucks together and have the best of both worlds.

I purchased this so I could watch Netflix and Hulu Plus on our newly-purchased 55" LED/LCD TV.  Little did I realize I probably didn't need it after all, as most late model TVs these days already have these same apps/WiFi built in.  Not so bad, considering the price.  Also the owner of several iPhones, iPads, and MacBook Pros, Apple TV does allow seamless streaming of content right from your Apple devices, so easier to share stuff on your big screen with effortless setup and implementation.Recommend if you have several Apple devices and want to avoid incompatibility between those and your TV.  Don't need this if you own Android-based or PC-based devices as it will do nothing for you...not compatible.  Only reason to purchase if you are Android/PC is if you don't have a TV that is has these same content apps (NetFlix, YouTube, HuluPlus, etc.) already built in to the TV.
summary: Got on the Apple TV bandwagon a little late

reviewText: I received this on the weekend and set it up on Sunday. It was up in under 10 minutes. I was able to see my MacBook Air's iTunes library fine and was able to use Airplay streaming. Most importantly I was able to play YouTube videos in beautiful HD very nicely.Downsides: Typing in passwords is worse than any system I've tried including PS3 and ROKU. It's twitchy with the pretty but annoyingly imprecise remote control and it's prone to typing phantom characters (which with a password which hides what you typed is maddening). Surely there is a better solution (bluetooth keyboard?). Also the selection of movies and TV shows and the prices won't cause me to rent many. I like the movie trailers but they need a lot more selection. If I'm going to pay through the nose here at least let me find what I'm looking for. Of the newish movies I searched for, none were there. I know that is just me, but it demonstrates how far they have to go. I get better hits in Netflix and their selection is pretty poor as well.Upsides: Youtube! And movie trailers. And EASY setup. And great industrial design (except for the remote). Streaming from my IOS devices (and eventually my computers).Please Apple -- fix the remote or at least give us an option to display what we're typing with passwords. Let us connect a bluetooth keyboard or provide another option (maybe there is one I don't know yet).  Add more movies and TV shows.
summary: Well worth it, but with problems

reviewText: I recently purchased a "smart TV". The connectivity with that TV was not as good as the Apple TV. Apple TV is Great If you have children that like Disney shows. Also it has Vevo which is like Pandora with music videos. I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!!!!
