i used this to replace my antiquated stereo/dvd receiver station (only running internet based music/video options). The initial set up was quite consternating as the system would not recognize home sharing with my PC (and for that matter iPad and iPhone) based control system.  FINALLY, after several attempts with helpful AppleTV techs on the phone, figured out the problem was that AppleTV MUST be on the same network as the other "shared" devices. You cannot be on your "guest" network and also your administrative network. It also seems that you can't use your "guest" network even if all devices are on it!!Anyways, the system seems to work fine with the exception that the write-ups could easily lead a user to believe that the AppleTV will also send signals to AirPlay enabled speakers. This is NOT true! This means that if you have a totally wireless speaker system set up, any video type applications (Netflix for example) will NOT play on those speakers...only your TV speakers.Aside from those small points the system seems to work as advertised and provides an easy to use interface with a decent array of entertainment options.  Great way to simplify (and reduce clutter) an entertainment system.

I've been an apple loyalist since the very beginning and the Apple TV keeps urging on my admiration of their products. The Apple TV is a great addition to the apple line. The greatest thing about this little (and I do mean little) device, is that it offers prime apps. Things like Hulu plus, Netflix, HBO go, and now recent additions such as the History channel and PBS it is just amazing. If you are like me and are tired of paying more than you have to to the cable providers this will help. We no longer use our cable box and strictly use the Apple TV for all of our streaming purposes. Another great perk is the easy transition of viewing content from our iPad, iPhone, and Macbook straight to the larger and bigger screen all because of the Apple TV. Virtually all purchases are synced through the account so it keeps adding to its value. It's a great buy and present to the tech person in your life. I have bought over four of them just as presents for others.Updates are constantly performed and I can only imagine other additions to the app/network line. It's the way to view television... On our time.

Ive had Roku's etc that lose wifi signals all the time and require you to re- enter wifi passwords constantly.This does not happen with the AppleTv. I love it.Its like what everybody says about apple products. THEY JUST WORK.Its a shame that this statement is rare today.
summary: Very easy, rock solid interface for netflix, hulu etc.

reviewText: I've had two of these, and I must say they are so simple to setup and fun to use. I just upgraded to Mac OS 10.8 and now I can do wireless full-screen sharing from my Macbook Air with my ginormous TV! Well worth the money, especially because of the slick Netflix and Hulu integration. I'm lovin' it!
I've wanted one for years. Finally got one and it changed my life. I told my girl the day we got it that it would change her life. Now she says she doesn't know how she lived without it.
summary: Best thing I've purchased in the last decade

reviewText: I wish they would drop the No Amazon Video bit, but obviously I understand why they don't have it.  It's not a big deal though, because with airplay and any of my devices I can stream amazon anyway.  Win.  Very quick...way better than navigating smart tv online menus.  I like using airplay to mirror my sweet lappy to do work on my HD TV.  Listening to podcasts and any of my synced iTunes media on any registered devices is super nice too.  It is awesome having everything work together the way I want.

Live stream movies in full 1080 HD, which is absolutely superb and outstanding; playing your favorite TV shows, and even the awesome ability to share your personal photo's and/or video clips that you've taken directly from your iPhone, iPad, etc. to your own Large Flat Screen TV at home. All your neighbors will be jealous, but happy to join in on all the fun with those remarkable Apple devices.
summary: A Must Have Christmas Gift (and Keep too)! ...So Get Two! =)

reviewText: Love the way programs are set-up with no commercials,  Have not had a chance to sink with computer.  Getting ready for the magic conventions.  Wish we had WIFI in our camper.  Have to watch DVD's.  Slick unit.
My son wanted to connect his iPad to our 52" TV, so my wife bought him a cable for $50! We returned the cable and payed an extra $50 for this wonderful device.

My wife and I actually now have 2 apple tv's... so it's probably surprising that I'm giving the product 2 stars, right? Well the majority of the time I like the Apple TV just fine. The main issue comes from renting movies through the Apple Store. We have one Apple TV in our living room and it seems like a basic function would be to put the movie on pause and resume playing in the other room, right? WRONG. I've literally unplugged the other Apple TV so I can just watch our silly movie in the bedroom to finish it, but guess what? That $5 you spent on a movie, you can't watch it unless you stay in your living room. Or you can go back and forth trying to log out of Apple ID's trying to get it to play. Convenience is what they are supposed to be selling with this product, but when it comes to this moving switching, it's absurd. I truly don't understand how they couldn't make this simple feature easier. I am planning on a 3rd streaming device and will be giving another brand a shot at it.
summary: 2 Apple TV's... Time to try something different.

reviewText: Not a bad product unless you are using it to stream anything with AirPlay to your TV.  Amazon instant video hbo go xfinfity on the go show time ect.  All these apps aren't currently supported and will not stream to the TV.  At least not with my new iPad, I've been told it works with older models, but not with my new iPad or iPhone 5.  And you can't download those apps either it comes pre loaded with Netflix and hulu and that's it
summary: Beware if your using it for streaming

reviewText: Nothing to really say about the Apple TV second generation other than it works great and like other Apple products, integrates very well with other Apple devices.
No trouble to setup and install.  I've never had a problem with it.  And if you have an iPad, it's simple to watch just about any video on your TV, via the iPad.  It just doesn't get much easier.
summary: Simple.  Works.  Great Addition to an iPad

reviewText: Not so impressed with the Apple TV.  I mainly bought this so I had a device to link my phone and ipad to the television.  Sometimes it works, but most of the time it drops the connection constantly.  Also, most of the apps don't offer anything unless you already have cable,  so keep that in mind if you are thinking if using it for HBO or ESPN and do not have cable.  All in all, I'm pretty disappointed.
Overall one of the coolest piece of electronics i own. This totally links up my apple entertainment. Very easy to operate from any apple device.

OVERVIEWIt's small, quiet, and fairly inexpensive, although competing products are quite similar in this regard. It's got a nice screen saver that uses your iPhoto or Flickr library, and is a nice companion to iTunes. Unfortunately, 1080p video playback is a little choppy, audio format support is extremely limited, and if your media isn't already in iTunes, you're in for some work if you want compatibility.AUDIODolby Digital, the audio format from the 1990's that is being phased out for DTS, TrueHD, or even DTS-HD is the ONLY surround audio option available on Apple TV. This is a major let-down, especially considering the jailbroken Apple TV 2 is capable of DTS pass-thru, and that DTS is an audio format made popular by DVD over a decade ago.VIDEOIt's true ATV3 does 1080p video, although it tends to stutter with complex motion when outputting the full 1080p (any scene with a full-screen pan will inevitably skip frames at 1080p), and will outright crash if the video reaches a bit-rate it can't handle. I encoded a few BBC Earth Blu-rays at 'constant quality' and any scene with lots of birds would freeze the ATV3 every time without fail, and the only solution was to re-encode the video at a much lower quality. It took a few encodes to find a setting that wouldn't freeze the ATV. DVD rips look great, and when playing to a 720p TV the video is crisp and smooth, especially when playing a 1080p source downscaled. Netflix HD streams also studded during complex pans.INTERFACEWhere Apple TV shines is the interface, it's pretty, easy and smooth; though that too has some issues, not the least of which is the common interaction of holding down the 'select' button - it doesn't always work or register, and when it fails, a restart is not enough, you must power-cycle the unit to fix it. It has a decent Netflix app, second only to the Xbox or iPhone version (I have Netflix apps on many devices), in that it displays the movie list nicely and does a pretty good job remembering where you were in the menus most of the time. It sports iTunes Cloud support, so if you're like me and you have your songs in the cloud, you'll save some room on your media center with it. Unfortunately, there's no way to watch Amazon Instant Video or anything else that doesn't have an iOS app, and even if it does, you have to occupy your phone or iPad with it to stream it to the ATV.HOME STREAMINGAnd then the 'Media Center' aspects. This is most important to me and probably other people, and it's where Apple TV is the among the worst. Sure, if you rip your videos right, they'll work great. I've got multiple audio tracks and subtitles and meta information in my videos and everything is great, but only after I've encoded them to the exact specifications required by Apple TV: x264 video, AAC stereo audio, AC-3 surround audio, and 3GPP subtitle text. Nothing else will work. I repeat, NOTHING ELSE WORKS. I've been ripping my collection since April (over four months) and I'm nearly finished, but there's many people out there who would (or did) scoff and call me a nut for not simply getting something that could play MKV files with modern audio formats and save myself hundreds of hours of CPU cycles.The exception, of course, is iTunes-purchased content, it's up to you how you value that.BOTTOM LINE (from a long-time Apple user)Unless you're an avid Mac user who's willing to rip his/her videos to work with iTunes in order to stream them to the TV, I strongly advise something with more modern specifications that can play MKV, DTS, and other formats that you most assuredly have if you're not already managing your media in iTunes.
Plugged it in and it worked immediately.  Couldn't have been easier.  Easy setup and easy use, like most apple products.
summary: Easy to set up and use

reviewText: Put your $99.99 towards a Wii, Blue Ray player with apps, or a PS3.  I bought this Apple TV to mirror video from my IPad to my TV with AirPlay and some apps do not support it.  The (Smart) TV I want to use already has built-in apps and 3 video games attached to it.  I don't need yet another way to watch Netflix...Remote is not qwerty, but I knew that when I bought it.Amazon video streaming is absent.EDIT 03/08/2013Changing this from 1 star to 3.  While I still recommend a video game console over this unit, I find myself using the Apple TV more frequently because it it more reliable than the built-in apps on my LG TV.  The Apple TV user interface is also growing on me.  And, with a $10.00 product called "AirParrot", I can mirror my PC onto this device.
summary: No Amazon Prime, can't use AirPlay with some apps to mirror them to a TV

reviewText: Received it as a gift and was reluctant to use it for several monthsDidnt think I needed one more wireless gadget to consume more of the precious time I dont haveAfter several months I hooked it upThe effort to connect was minimal and operating it was totally intuitiveIt provides lots of options for TV viewing and more channels or apps or whatever the right description is, are added with timeIf you enjoy YouTube or NetFlix after you watch it on a big screen TV on an easy chir you wont want to view on a desk top or lap top (maybe a pad is OK)
Simply the best.  Better than all the rest.  Apple TV trumps all others on the market.  Wish they would add Amazon Prime, but that's between the two of them.
So far, the Apple TV is working well. I already cut the chord with Comcast! Only wish is that the Hulu app had continuous play.

So I held off on buying last year's model of the Apple TV because I figured that I didn't need one. I had a Roku XD and I thought that the experience that Roku's unit provided was as good as it was going to get... Well, I was wrong!Roku's unit proved to be a horribly inconsistent performer when it came to HD content. Constant rebuffering and degradation of the (supposedly) high-definition content would have had me pulling my hair out, if I had any. For all of it's significant pros (a USB port, numerous channels, more functionality than the Apple TV) my little Roku box couldn't really deliver where it counted: Netflix HD streaming. Now, before you scoff at my review, understand that I am running a highly optimized wireless network with several devices, including my Roku XD running on the 5Ghz spectrum. In fact, I went to great lengths to upgrade my network in terms of signal strength and pure bandwidth.Since I have an existing Apple ecosystem I finally gave in and decided to give the newest iteration of the Apple TV a chance. My first impressions are very favorable. I love the wireless display capabilities of the device. I also like the ease of using my iTunes account to access and consume content via the iTunes store and iCloud. Most importantly I absolutely love the way that the unit performs when it comes to high definition streaming via Netflix. Just finished watching "Ironclad" in HD with nary a hiccup, stutter or rebuffer...I may just end up using and enjoying my Netflix subscription this time around if the Apple TV keeps performing like it did tonight!If you have an existing Apple rig in your house and an iPad or iPhone, then this is a no-brained and a must have device.

So I've had problems streaming from my iMac to my PS3. File sizes are getting just too big to play well with my wireless network, or so it seemed. I'm sure that if I were to play around with enough settings and priorities I could get it to work just fine. Purchasing the Apple Tv 3rd gen was just a much more simple and elegant solution. Youtube play much quicker. Streaming from iTunes is painless.The only complaint I could think of is the removal of the hard drive after the 1st gen Tvs but I knew about that all along so there isn't much room to stand on that one. It has no issues pushing 1080p videos that were struggling to be streamed otherwise. I also really appreciate the extremely low power consumption. Saving cash is always a good feature.
summary: A streaming box that does exactly what it says.

reviewText: That is, when my kids aren't monopolizing it by playing Minecraft on their Ipads and using the AirPlay feature to stream it to the tv.  The Netflix and NHL Gamecenter menus are by far the nicest I've seen.  I have been using my PS3 to stream those in the past in this beats it out handily.  It was very easy to set up and configure and it's so small, you can barely see it behind my tv.  Playing my shared music is ridiculously easy and the picture/sound quality is flawless.

The Apple TV is a great addition to our home entertainment choices.  That is what it does.  It expands our choices of selections to show on our HD Screen TV.  In fact, we had not utilized the HD capabilities of our TV until we used the Apple TV device.
summary: Apple TV great addition to our home entertainment choices

reviewText: The AppleTV is a great product that essentially allowed us to cancel our cable service and now we watch 100% of our shows through AppleTV.  We utilize the Netflix app as well as occasionally purchasing content directly from iTunes through the AppleTV (mostly movies) and use the Airplay mirroring to stream live TV shows from various websites mirrored directly from our iPad.  The Airplay mirroring is a HUGE feature which has really made the AppleTV an indispensable product for us.  Netflix works well on the AppleTV, we used the Wii prior to purchasing the AppleTV and the interface and quality of streaming seems to be better on the AppleTV.AppleTV is highly integrated to work well with other Apple products and the iphone has a great free app which you can use to improve over the sleek remote that comes with it.  The nice small simple remote is great for going to quick places but when you start wanting to type, etc., an app like the remote app on the iphone is much more handy.  You can also pair a bluetooth keyboard to make typing even easier, but I haven't really needed that so much.You can also select Apples new internet radio station to play background music and if you have another Apple computer hooked up to the network it will also show a screensaver with your recent pictures scrolling from the photostream.Overall, this is a great product and has more than paid for itself in our ability to cancel our cable service.  The features such as Airplay are amazing and allow you to stream things from your iPad to the extent that you couldn't tell that you weren't watching the actual TV shows on cable.

The Apple TV works well enough, Airplay works alright though is overly complicated for my folks to use on a regular basis with their iPad 2 (it seems picky when using their apps, many of which are in Taiwanese). It's just a rather unspectacular device. Hulu and Netflix have terrible interfaces when compared to other versions of their software, there are no other non-iTunes stores that you can purchase movies from. And no Amazon unless you stream it through your iPad/iPhone.On the other hand, Airplay works well (though by no means flawlessly). iTunes has a very thorough store (though it too could use a facelift), and though added slowly, the Apple TV is getting some better channels finally. HBO Go here works on Comcast (*cough* Roku, wtf fellas *cough*).Recommendation: If you have a lot invested in iTunes or really want Screen Mirroring from your apple devices, get an Apple TV. Otherwise, there are better solutions out there.
The family loves it, no problems, and it is saving a bundle of money by not having to pay for cable.

The remote is minimalistic to a fault. No Amazon Prime which stinks, the Netflix UI pales in comparison to the XBOX one, some shows will not play more than 1 season and there are other issues.  The internet connection is always awesome and while they are always adding new "channels", most of them are require a paid subscription or cable service to access, which makes it difficult when you are cutting the cord from cable so to speak.  It should have a browser as well, would that really be a big deal to add mobile Safari or something?When I was adding a tv in the basement the plan was to get a tv and apple tv, but after using this one in our bedroom for a few months we decided just to get a Samsung smart tv.  Basically the same thing with more features all built in.
summary: It has potential but is just okay in present form

reviewText: The resolution on this AppleTV is unreal. Near perfect HD streaming on almost all shows.Way better than the Roku i had, and way faster. Love it.
summary: This is way better than the Roku

reviewText: The system was simple to set up but it just didn't get enough channels.  I already had a Roku 2 player but my mom, who lives with my wife and I, thought it would nice to watch YouTube on the TV.  She was not all that impressed and chose to watch it on her IPad instead so I returned it.  I don't really have anything negative to say about the box it just didn't meet the needs of the person who was going to be using it; my mom.

the unit works as advertised. I went with the apple tv instead of it's competitors because my peeps have ipads and the inter-connectivity between both apple products would be extremely useful to them, and so far everything works perfectly. They are able to stream directly to the device from their ipads as well as use the remote app for apple tv to control it as well. The little remote is built like a tank but it is very basic and limited, I would have loved to see more options/features available on it. So excellent picture and audio, and easy enough setup so I have no problem recommending the Apple TV MD199LL/A.Be sure to not select the audio help during the initial setup because the automated assistant voice is annoying beyond description and played way too fast so that it provided no help during the whole time it was on. It took a while of searching before I found the option to turn it off.

This device is really a lot of fun to use. It allows many, many options to enjoy applications and movies.  I really enjoy using my iPhone and iPad with if for YouTube and rented shows. A must have for any tech guru.
This is basically an apple router. It either has to stream from your computer or the interest. No local stored files of your movies or music.
summary: Not like the old Apple TV

reviewText: THIS ITEM IS GREAT FOR WATCHING VIDEOS FROM YOUR MOBILE UNITS.  I'M STILL PLAYING AROUND WITH IT AND STILL FUN.
This Item is wonderful. I have 2 now. We can watch Netflix, and YouTube Videos, Listen to the Radio, and much more. This is why I dont pay for cable, no commercials!!

This product allows those of us who have chosen to disconnect the cable to continue to enjoy TV!  With all of the streaming services now, and the "Digital content" that is included with the vast majority of DVD and Blu-Ray purchases now, it is about time that something came along to allow ALL of these in one stop!  With iTunes being the media manager of choice in my house, it was painful to have to find a way to get that content onto streaming devices, or deal with the inconvenience of having to watch movies on my iPad, or Desktop.  Now, thanks to Apple TV, I can sit back on the couch, with a slick remote, and have it all available at the touch of a button, streaming directly from my iTunes library via wifi.
summary: Apple TV Bridges the Gap for the no-cable generation

reviewText: This was great while it lasted. The best quality internet video device you can get. Netflix, Youtube, AirPlay, iPad mirroring, etc were just excellent. Remote is sleek and effective. The device can be operated via an app on your smartphone.Als, it broke down after less than 2 months. The wifi connectivity suddenly stopped working. Apple support on the phone was a bit annoying for the first time ever when they kept asking me to move the device around in a futile attempt to revive it. I could not return to Amazon as it was past 30 days and you get only a partial refund. Apple forums are full of posts from users who got replacements from Apple but saw the same problem again. So I am going to get a refund form my credit card company. Apple will surely replace it but the device has a design defect.
summary: Wifi broke down all of a sudden in 50 days

reviewText: This was the best gift ever! I love apple TV. It is so cool that you can miror your iPad right in the TV screen plus it comes with all kinds of apps to watch. It is fast and smooth. I am hooked. Worth every penny.
This was the best thing I could've ever purchased! I save so much money each month because I see no need for DirecTV now. I  love my apple tv! J plan on buying one more!

To start with the good, Apple TV simply fascinates me about the technology.- Seamlessly playing music, videos from my Macbook, iPhone- The First time setup was simple and effortless- Can easily watch Netflix, Youtube, Photo Stream, iTunes movies etc- Very compact and sleek with unmatched packaging skills as ever (for any Apple product)My frustrations are- Sometimes my Macbook and iPhone doesnt recognize the presence of the Apple TV. I have to reboot the Apple TV so that it gets listed in the list of devices for Air Play. This has happened to me 5 to 6 times in the past 1 month.- A single remote works for both my Macbook and Apple TV. If i operate the remote for Apple TV, the iTunes in my Macbook also responds simulataneously to that remote control clicks.- There was once when i tried to set up my wife's ID as well in the Apple TV after restoring to the factory settings. But this restoration did not help but this crashed my wireless router's security and the router went down. I reconfigured the AppleTV again to my apple ID to restore the wifi router back to normal. So, some function in the "Restore to factory settings" is incorrect for the AppleTV.- The AppleTV key board on the screen is hard to use (i felt a PS3 keyboard was even easier to use on the TV screen than the Apple TV keyboard)

Very easy to set up.small delay at times but very responsive.Remote is the biggest draw back.if you have artheritis you wont be able to use the remote comfortably.remote is too small for ease of use.The circular old ipod looking buttons are hard to press.
Very happy with the unit.  Unfortunately, the information did not show that an HDMI cable was required but not included.  Packaging and delivery was prompt and as expected.
Video streaming was bad. Audio worked OK. My original requirement was video streaming from my iPhone. Did not like it. returned

Way better than "Roku"... and Apple updates it often adding new apps, most of them have been free to use... like iTunes Radio, Smithsonian ch. Weather ch plus you can play movies or music on your computer using wi-fi from a free acct w/ iTunes... if you have an iPhone or iPod even better, you can play games from your phone on the tv screen display pictures.. easy easy easy set up - small 3 button remote and easy navigation. Worth every penny.

We are an Mac/Apple household. AppleTV is great for our whole family. You can screen share from your Macbook Pro or send videos from the ipad to the tv. It reads all of the home shared iTunes accounts and with the recent updates HBO Go is an added bonus.

We don't have cable, so we have a roku in one room and the apple tv in another.  The Roku is definatly easier to use and loads faster than the apple TV.  Also, you have access to Amazon Prime on Roku, which you do not on apple TV.  We tent to watch TV more often in the room with the Roku.

We got one of these little numbers and installed in the master bedroom. I never thought it could be more difficult to get out of bed, what with the crippling paranoia that accompanies the dangers of our modern world, but I can say definitively that now I only have two reasons to get out of bed, neither of which require me to leave the safety of my home. Thanks Apple!
summary: Taking Sloth To Amazing New Heights

reviewText: We love the integration but there really are no apps for this. It is all about buying from iTunes and that is about it. I also have a Roku and if it is apps and media streaming you are after it is the better choice.Don't get me wrong, linking into you iCloud is awesome and being able to access iTunes is too. I just miss my HBO go and Amazon Prime on this TV now that the Roku is in a different room.PopPop was in town and we were able to pull up our iPhone pics as soon as we got home. That was really cool. No one had to hover over a phone or wait for them to be transferred to a laptop or PC.
summary: Neat for iPhone and iPad, needs more apps

reviewText: We purchased the Apple TV MD199LL/A specifically to stream a TV signal from our computers to the TV.  While it does everything else well, Netflix, Amazon, etc., it skips and freezes consistently while streaming content from any and ALL of the four Apple products we own, iPhone, iPad, MacBook AIR and our desktop iMac.  No suggested fixes from any source have been successful in resolving this issue.  We have resolved to use the Apple TV for uses other than our intended purpose...  "TV".  Simply not that impressed.

We purchased this apple tv box for our HD tv in our family room.  We use it all the time.  It does require that you have Internet capabilities on your tv (which most newer tvs already have).  We own several apple products and we are able to sync up our music, photos, Netflix, and Youtube accounts for tv viewing/listening.  We do still have a cable box too and we switch back and forth between the two.  We find ourselves using Netflix the most for children's tv programs and movies.  For the price, this has been a great buy.  I would buy it again.
summary: Great product at a great price!

reviewText: We use it to watch Netflix and also to AirPlay to iPad and laptop. It is small and very easy to use.
What an incredible piece of technology. Unfortunately, my macbook pro is too old to airplay to my tv from Apple tv but Apple tv is great for netflix, espn, vevo, movies, etc.
Wife & Kids love it, hours of entertainment.  Gets lots of free programing.  Easy to set up.  Highly recomend for families.
Works just as says.Setup is a little difficult but worth it.Can show my I phone or my I pad on our 70 inch big screen so everyone can see.

Works with my old HDTV, works great with my ipads thru airplay. Netflix is great and HULU plus clear HD picture. had a Roku stick for about a week, what a disappointment stopped working sent it back and got this, You want a streaming box that works this is it. Love APPLE.
summary: LOVE IT, BETTER THAT ROKU STICK.

reviewText: +/- You can mirror an apple device display+ paired with an iPad or iPhone you can have the video from an app, like youtube or Amazon instant stream video to your TV without issue.+/- when mirroring display everything is leggy and choppy.- It does not have amazon instant app on it.- Apps are limited.- Limited to other devices at the price point- there other options that are 1/3 of the price that have similar functionality- only interfaces with apple productsOverall I'm disappointed with this purchase. The only thing I find remotely useful is having an iPad or iPhone and watch youtube or amazon instant from it. All you need is to spend another $300 - $400 more to get this functionality. I am very disappointed with this for that reason. The apps/channels are limited. It seems to be yet another $100 accessory to an iPad/iPhone. On its own, I think the market has better products that offer more, like Roku and Chromecast, either better price or more features.I was looking forward to mirroring functionality of this as well, but again I was disappointed, the video pauses and then tries to catchup and the audio keeps cutting in and out. This happened with simple things like trying to play a slideshow from iPhoto. Watching videos or mirroring a game is out of the question. I am not really sure what use it is. Maybe PowerPoint without transitions or displaying something static.If you are an Apple-only fan and have the full apple suite, this product my be for you because I'm sure you can overlook all of these issues that I have had.I would suggest looking into Roku or Chromecast, or if you have PS3/4, Xbox360/One, or a Smart TV, you probably have the majority of what this offers.

AppleTV blocks Amazon movies, something they neglect to boldly mention.  So you are pretty much railroaded into using iTunes when prices are better at Amazon!  A real cheap trick.  Bad, bad, rotten Apple!

As a person who loves Apple products this was a must in my house.  However, I was really disappointed by its capability.  It basically only gives you Netflix and Hulu.  A dvd player today does more than Apple TV.  Watching movies through ITunes is a pain because it is  constantly buffering.  This is not a problem with my internet because I watch TONS of shows and movies online and never have this problem . Only with the Itunes store.  I am really tempted to junk this thing and go with Roku.  Thankfully this was a Christmas gift otherwise I would be pissed I spent the money on this.

Apple TV is a Great Product, Just next leap in the technology loved the AIRPlay Feature convert my iphone into the Great, you can just watch all your video and Photo on your TV, if you have a IPHONE/IPAD you can convert your HDTV into a Smart TV by just paying 99$ , Sound Quality is Great, Video Quailty Awesome..watching movie on netflix and Youtube is more fun nowThanks Apple
Do not like it because there is not enough programming to make this a viable option as compared to streaming

Every once in a while I have to restart my internet box or computer when I turn on but I expect that will disappear once I install my apple airport which I should also receive soon. It is very vivid and really is fun but is work to learn to use. Netflix is easy and then you can buy something at itunes go to your computer and enter some code and then can play on Apple TV. If you have your own videos or photos you can also use this baby to play on your TV. I love everything Apple and would never have another computer. Now I have apple iphone 5S (bought at store through Sprint for $99), ipad, and apple computer in addition to Apple TV and now I am getting the apple airport.

Everyone is claiming you can get disney junior channel with Apple TV and that was my reason for buying it to find out that the claim is false because in order to get disney channels you local provider( cable, satellite etc.) has to provide a access code to view it and still makes you dependent on having cable no cord cutting and getting rid of cable with this product returned it
summary: No disney channel without having cable

reviewText: Haven't used it much. I think I have to beef up my wireless connection due to drop outs.Will update rating later.

Hello, when you finally are fed up with waiting, clicking backto where you thought your last place was... only to get jacked backto the start.You need an upgrade.This will peel your bandaids and give you what you need, healed and forgetting your pain.Stop thinking, its WD or Ruku, I don't miss my WD live or my 3TB WD MyBook HD, it lost a year's work on me.For shame WD, for shame.an ipad 4 will super complete you air play experience.rock out with accessing your external hard drives from your PC.Then there's the JB........ Done, no cable. Bada bing.
summary: Dump the WD, and get the right stuff, ATV

reviewText: If you buy an apple service like iCloud, a movie on apple TV, etc. expect nothing but problems. Password issues are the most prevalent. Never ever change your password...for no reason...ever! You will never get them in sync again. The appleid.com site will only make your problems worse. My latest issue, which caused me to write this was buying a movie on apple TV. I had a password issue which I had given up on. My wife finally got it resolved at 5am and she rented a movie for $5.99. Then she happily told me that I could watch it the next night. When we finally looked for it in "settings" and found the movies rented line, the little irritating circular thing that drives me crazy on my PC just kept spinning and spinning. The net was that I could spend an hour on apples worthless help line or piss away the six bucks. If your up for the aggravation of working with all this stuff then have at it. But for me, the promise of the technology age will never materialize, we will only lower our standards to accept it.

I have a raspberry pi with XBMC and it in no way compares with the ease and use of the Apple TV. I have two of these and find using Netflix on it just great, and combined with Airplay and linked to my computer, just great.

I have asked and asked why this is happening and I have found that others online are having the same problem.  With my macbook air, when I try to connect to apple TV, it shuts down my entire network.  I have to reboot everything.  No help in sight!

I have the highest speed wireless internet connection available in my city, but I can't watch a movie over the Apple TV because it has to pause so frequently and then takes forever to buffer only to play a few more minutes and pause again. It spends more time pausing to load then it does playing the show. I also have a Roku and with the same wireless internet it's very rare that the Roku has to stop playing to buffer a movie.

I recently purchased this product so I could watch Netflix on my iPad on the big screen while traveling.  Was unable to make the connection at the first hotel I stayed at.  Apple support was very helpful but informed me that the hotel would have to configure their system to accept my specific device on their wi-fi network if I was going to use it...and, by the way, I could only watch my iTunes videos as other video formats (Netflix, Amazon Video) were not compatible with this device.  I immediately returned the device.  There should be some serious WARNING labels on the packaging for this product (won't work in hotels, won't work for most of your video players).  I love Apple technology but this one seems to be far too primitive for the current market.
I still can't get this to do anything!  Followed directions, but it does nothing.  Anybody else have this issue?  I love the rest of my apple products.
summary: Not so easy to set up

reviewText: It's alright, it works relatively well with Apple Devices.... assuming the app isn't blocked - although it seems that they are blocked.  Very limited list of streaming apps available (compared to competing devices). This has pretty much been relegated to being an AirPlay Mirroring device for my Macbook.  I use other devices for actual streaming.If they had more apps, and easier controls this device could be great.

Loads of movies and shows, but all cost money! Even stuff you watch for free on the HD airwaves or through your computer has a price tag.  For example, say one night you watch one CBS sitcom, one PBS show, some News and your at 10 bucks!  These are typically 'free' shows/TV on the airwaves people!  Why should we pay?  Oh, and pray that the show your watching is NOT in HD for it will take between 20 to 90 minutes to load!  Another issue...take for example a typical 'YouTube' video, start playing it via AppleTV and suddenly after only a mere 20 seconds into the video it fades out, why?  Is there a copywriters infringement when something 'free' is channeled through your licensed AppleTV device via iTunes store? After a month of pulling my hair in an attempt to making sense of the costly 'free' programming I gifted this device to my folks who were content in using it as a mere interface 'gizmo' between their iPad and their Samsung HDTV. The 'Airplay' option is slow/sketchy to interface with the TV, its a 1 in 3 shot attempt to get a perfect non-buffering lock for video.  For 'stills' however, it works fine; but as we all know,  there are better, smaller and cheaper foolproof gizmos to interface your pics from your computer/smartphone to an HDTV.Sorry Apple, but I agree with the other 195 '1 star' reviewers, your product has a strange 'cost' and 'rights' relationship with free TV programming. Roku is better if you want to watch terrible 'B' movies for free and really for free.  'Googlecast'  merely gathers all the free and paid programming links for you in one place, but for TV and Movies, still,' the best -bang-for-your-buck'  is to get internet service and Netflix.  I have had DirectTV and Comcast service for less than 30 bucks (2014) a month, I pay an additional 8 bucks for Netflix and I get hundreds of 'on-demand' shows in dozens of genres at a instant, in HD,  that I can rewind,  FF, and save and no delay!
summary: not worth the wait or the cost

reviewText: Many of the apps eg. showtime on demand etc do not allow steaming from ipads, iphones to Apple TV.  Air mirroring is also very temperamental and unreliable.  I specifically purchased this to watch old episodes of certain TV series and I am unable to watch them.  I think I will return the item.

My primary use for Apple TV is as a netflix device. It does NOT perform this function well. It will often have a problem connecting to netflix, which requires a reboot to fix. It also knocks out airplay functionality when this glitch occurs. This happens regularly, making it almost useless for this function.I now use my ps3 for netflix in the living room and a roku for the bedroom. Not only better performance, but better interface on those devices.I do like airplay, and the ability to access my itunes media... But it is so unreliable I would never buy this product. If they ever fix this glitch I would up my rating significantly... But this essentially destroys functionality and no fix has occurred in too long a time (and I update the software as soon as it is available).
Short time I've had this can only know it takes a while to understand the system. Great picture quality and location.

The reason why I even bought the Apple TV was because I wanted the AirPlay integration with the iPad (streaming the iPad's screen).As any Apple product, this thing was a pleasure to take out of the box and set up. There is nothing much to say about the setup process and interface, it's very simple and on pair with the competitive devices (I also have an older Roku 720p box).It worked for the first, like, 25 minutes. Until I updated it and opened a random youtube video from the "most viewed" category. The device played about a half of that video and simply hanged (went quiet and frozen the picture/frame). I tried to restart it by using the combination of keys at the remote (as per Apple's manual), then by taking out the power supply, then by connecting to my laptop via exotic micro USB cable (luckily I even had it from an older Samsung phone)... but no luck. The Apple TV would only display the Apple logo while booting up and then black screen. After spending a couple of hours on the Internet forums I discovered that surprisingly many people are facing this type of issue. Some users blamed TVs (I have relatively new 60" Samsung and it works perfectly fine via the HDMI with a number of other devices); some users blamed HDMI cables (so I tried a couple of them with no luck); and there have been plenty of other "dark magic" options which I also tried, and which included  disconnecting the TV from the power supply and almost reading mantras. The bottom line is that the problem isn't new but Apple isn't doing anything about it for whatever reason.One wasted evening and I decided that it's not worth it. The return process was smooth and simple (as always with Amazon) and I got a full amount refunded in a day or two. Kudos to Amazon on the customer experience!As far as the AirPlay is concerned (the original reason for my purchase), I found that the feature is only useful for the photo slideshows. I was hoping that I could use the iPad as a full-blown keyboard / remote control for the TV but that's just not how the AirPlay works; this application is only compatible with certain services and kicks in when you start a youtube video for example, it opens it's own interface that intercepts the output from your device... guess what happens as soon as you navigate away from that page on your phone (let's say to search for another video)... it just stops playing it. And not to mention that the resolution and the screen ratio of the iPad doesn't match the 1080p TV... so instead of enjoying the full screen experience you actually end up seeing black borders on the both sides of your TV screen (while broadcasting the iPad's screen).All these TV boxes deliver very limited user interfaces as compared to the real computers with real browsers; I am now considering to purchase a mini-computer for the Netflix and etc. (those typically start at $300 but it's a way better alternative).
summary: I had to return this product, unfortunately; it seems that Apple does not maintain their TV.

reviewText: There is an annoying bug: in mirror mode, sometimes the sound playback of the latest MacOS X will just not work with these Apple TV and besides restarting the whole Mac sub-system nothing helps.100$ for a wireless HDMI connection to my TV is too much if it does not work flawlessly.Other shortcomings:- no volume control- no line audio output- way too big for what is does & no way to hang it on a wall or hide beneath the TV.- no good on Linux, Android or Windows- crappy included apps and no 3rd party app supportGood parts:+ very small lag, even when mirroring animation in 720p+ works with iOS and MacOS

this apple tv 3rd generation is fully accessible to the blindwith voice over.unlike most other devices that offer netflix with no accessibility at all.your tv has to have a hdmi input connection. there is no andalog connections.it does not come with the hdmi or digital audio cable. so you have to buy them from a third party seller.it is easy to connect. the power and hdmi connection. and your ethernet cable if you are not going to use wy-fi.that's it!the voice over is slow to respond though.when you first plug it in wait about 30 seconds for it to start talking.(it does not have a power switch. but does go into stand by mode).it should tell you to press the small button on the right side three times to turn voice over on.from then on everything is accessible. you can turn voice over off in the settings menu.it speaks all of the menus and icons.all the movie descriptions and catagories speakthe first thing you have to do is setup your wy-fi connection and log into your netflix account. it remembers your i d and password even if you unplug the apple tv.most movies load in about 10 seconds.i tunes is not very good. when you rent a movie it takes about 15 minutes to load the movie before it will play.my only complaint is it does not have a keyboard for searching. you have to cycle the letters and numbers with the 4 way joystick? buttons. but it does speak the on screen keyboard as you go through it.it is not a qwerty keyboard.it has 5 rows of 6 lettersa to f, g to l, ,m to r, s to xy to z,1 to 45 to 0delete,clear, .com, .net. (you do not have to type these in.)if you want to save internet bandwith you can set the apple tv screen resolution to as low as 480 or as high as 1080p resolution in the settings menu. also accessible.do the same in your netflix account if you have one.

This Apple TV is Great for streaming Netflix and Hulu plus, But you cannot access movies off your hard drive, unless it is converted, put into iTunes(which can take awhile). And if you want to rent a movie it has to download first! The movie does not stream! So if you want to see a movie in HD you better have a fast connection because the movie will have to download first. The one great feature of the Apple TV is that you have AirPlay,  which means you can access media, and play games off your other Apple devices(iPhone, iPad, iPod, ect...), and play it on your HD TV!  Pretty cool :-)

This is a cool device, no-doubt.  It worked great at home, where I had a wireless network with internet access.  I liked several of the built-in options, including Netflix, very much.  But, I didn't buy this for home...I bought this to use on my boat, to couple movies from my iPhone to my HD-TV.  The Apple-TV won't connect to the iPhone without both devices being on the same WiFi subnet. Nor would the Apple-TV connect to the iPhone's personal hotspot (well, the Apple-TV does connect to the internet, but the iPhone and Apple-TV aren't on the same subnet and won't communicate... STUPID).  So, I bought a wireless router, installed it on my boat... Apple-TV would then connect to the iPhone, but Apple-TV won't work without internet access to verify your phone's movies... STUPID.  Once again, because the iPhone's WiFi hotspot is a different subnet than the iPhone's internet (4G) connection, the two won't work together.  It's such a stupid design that it can't be accidental, Apple had to have done this on-purpose.If you're looking to use this at home, where you have WiFi and you have internet access, this thing is pretty cool.  Try to do something a little different, and this product loses its mind.  I returned mine and bought a Lightning Digital AV Adapter cable, much happier now!

We are disappointed that we can not play Amazon movies.  The audio can be heard, but the video won't play.  Until Amazon and Apple get together to fix this, look at a RokuRoku 2 XS 1080p Streaming Player--it does it all.  We wish we had gotten the Roku.That said--it does play Netflix movies beautifully.  It mirrors everything else well.  It comes with one free week of Hulu Plus.You probably want to go ahead and order an HDMI cable as it does not come with one.AmazonBasics High-Speed HDMI Cable (6.5 Feet/2.0 Meters) - Supports Ethernet, 3D, and Audio Return [Newest Standard]
Would love it if they would add amazon prime.  However, all in all it is much better in performance speed to load and pic quality I still gave it 5 stars

I have two Apple TVs and 2 Rokus.  The Apple TVs are basically unusable.  They stutter, delay, and pause buffering for extended lengths of time.  The Roku does not do this.  Netflix seems okay on Apple TV and Roku both.  Apple rentals (and _everything_ is a rental) always stutter and buffer with long delays.  As a Amazon Prime subscriber I can watch Amazon movies on Roku.  They never stutter, pause, or buffer.  On Roku Netflix doesn't stutter, pause, or buffer.  The problem appears to be the Apple rental server.Again, The Apple TV is unusable.  I have unplugged them and set them aside.
summary: Constantly stutters, delays, buffers;  Roku does not do this

reviewText: As a Roku owner too, it became entirely obvious that the AppleTV is far inferior to the Roku box, and twice the price.  After purchasing, we plugged the AppleTV in and tried it out for a couple of hours, then unhooked it and right back into the box.  Thank you Amazon for being so good with returns.You are promised that the AppleTV will stream from your iPad or iOS devices, while this is partially true - it's not the whole story.  The Apple TV doesn't have Amazon Instant Videos on it, so I tried to stream my instant videos from the iPad to the AppleTV via AirPlay.... it connects just fine, but do to limitations, you are unable to stream the actual videos.The box overall just felt limited, there is no way to add channels, no way to add applications or anything to it.  It ends up as just a simple Netflix box.  Big deal.  The Roku has tons of channels plus you can extend it with PlayON to a heck of a lot more.  I can still stream my iTunes and what not through the Roku and it has a heck of a lot more to offer.  Overall, it's no contest.  AppleTV is nowhere near close to primetime.

A very well designed product with user friendly menus. Not so great unless you are a fan of i-Tunes and paying for virtually everything.I hoped to be able to view my local (WGN) news feed (free to air with an antenna) but alas it does not seem possible - maybe I'm doing something wrong. Radio stations are plentiful and in the main free, so it's not all bad. Will buy a Roku eventually.

First off let me say that I absolutely love my iPhone and my Macbook Pro and now my Apple TV! But of course there are always things you don't like. And in the case of the Apple TV it is the fact that it lacks 98% of the features that other internet HD players! It isn't fair because I love Apple but they need to write more apps and an app store for the Apple TV. If I was you and you don't have a Macbook or Mac of some kind then I wouldn't bother with buying this. It is really useless without your Mac and/or iPhone.
summary: Love My Apple TV but NEEDS MORE FEATURES!

reviewText: Great look easy set up, but not what I thought it was. I thought it was a portal to hook my I pad to the tv and it is more like a Netflix device.  But on the other side if that is what you want it is great.

I can not explain this was like the ignored van version of an automotive company which makes sport cars comparison.PROS: It worked... for a monthCONS:Airplay doesn't work no more after SO MANY technical issues and attempts to get it to work. Fully updated and still have problemsIgnored Apple product (Don't buy it)Netflix has problems buffering (I mean it, compared to my ps3 and laptop, netflix loads fine, on atv .. it doesn't wtf)Limited features.I NEVER HAVE RECEIVED A PRODUCT THAT WORKED AND THEN FAILED. This is my first one and probably due to software problems.
I constantly have to restart itunes on my PC for ATV to connect to it, app selection is not there even with air play.

I have a Sony Playstation which works flawlessly.  I gave Amazon streaming and Netflix.  Both work flawlessly.  I have had Apple TV for 2 years.  It is nearly worthless.  DO NOT frustrate yourself by renting a movie.  Hours and hours to download, then 24 hrs to watch or it's deleted.  Still don't know how Captain Phillips ended.  I was a major shareholder in Apple stock until about a year ago.  I just tried to watch a movie trailer of 2:20 min duration.  That was the last straw.  Too bad.  I love my iPad but Apple TV is crap.  After 10 mins still not playing, still loading.  Save yourself the aggravation.  Apple should not have brought this product out.  It stinks.  I miss Steve Jobs, I fear Apple is in decline.

reviewText: I was pretty excited as I bought this. The features Airplay and Youtube were the biggest advantages of getting this. However, both of them have serious drawbacks and are not at all functional.The airplay has too much lag and is not a good experience for watching anything. It is better to use the HDMI cable. This is even more true for me since I keep my router away from TV, so data has to go from my laptop to the router to the tv.Youtube app was a disappointment as well, since it does not play any VEVO videos and the interface is pretty bad. This can be attributed to be google's fault as well, but I don't care. I want a good experience while using appleTV and I didn't get it.I returned it and went for a Roku. Not disappointed so far.
Just don't use it enough to appreciate it or rate it meaningfully. I bought it for a vacation home and forgot to pack it!

* My main complaint is that it crashes and reboots itself a lot.  I thought that Apple products should not be such poor quality so I exchanged the first one for a new unit - but it has all the same problems.  I keep checking for software updates hoping they will fix some of the problems.Other issues include:* While streaming music from my Macbook air it will just stop playing sometimes.* While playing netflix movies the playback pauses often.  I don't have this issue with any of the other devices I use to stream netflix.* There is no volume control.  So I have to use two remotes to watch a movie.  Why?* The remote does not have good range and you have to point the remote directly at the front of the box or it will not work.* From my macbook air I can only airplay from itunes, not from any other app.  For example, using a web browser to access youtube.  The apple tv has a youtube app but it takes forever to type in a search one letter at a time so it is almost unusable.I could go on for a while longer but listing all the problems is making me tired.----UPDATE - Nov 2012----Apple released a new software update for the AppleTV recently and that solved almost all of the issues I was having. I also updated my macbook to the latest MacOS version. Everything works pretty good now!
summary: Poor quality - but if it worked better it would be good

reviewText: Simple, quick review.This is great if you have an iPad, iPhone or Mac laptop, as you can use airplay and mirror with this.Comes with Netflix and much more built in.This CAN NOT be jail broken as of yet, so if your looking for that get a 2nd generation.Good value if you use most of the features.

Sorry, it is not a review. I am sure the Apple TV is very good for those within the Apple Eco-system, but for those who are not still a good one though Roku, WD etc may have better alternatives. Wanted to point out that the Apple TV this version has been long in the tooth for now and due for the next gen (better support for IOS7.1 etc) and possibly upgraded internals like dual processor, tie-ups with major content providers, more channels etc. If Apple hold the priceline then it would be worth the wait to get the next gen Apple TV.
summary: Not a review but the Next version is to be released soon 22Oct

reviewText: The Apple TV is quite a disappointment.Airplay is incredibly cool.  Streaming content or entire screens from you (or your friend's) Apple devices is incredibly easy and quite brilliant.  Streaming music from iTunes running on your PC or Mac is decent.  Photo Stream integration is nice when it works.  Using the "Remote" app on iOS devices to control it is kind of neat.If you don't use the iTunes Music Store for purchasing content, you'll find the entire top row of icons to be useless.  Even if you do use ITMS, it still feels like ad-ware when you turn it on and see a bunch of scrolling advertisements to purchase movies or music.The Netflix player is bad.  As a competitor to the ITMS, it gets second-class treatment.  The video quality is poor and barely ever achieves HD.  There is no "Next Episode" option.  Worse yet, I have several Netflix titles that *ALWAYS* error out on Apple TV but work everywhere else.  The PS3 Netflix player is significantly better in almost every way - especially with regards to video quality and the fact that it actually plays all of the content available on Netflix without error.  Good luck getting Apple or Netflix to support the playback client.The Photo Stream integration is cool - when it works.  I was surprised to find several errors trying to log into my iCloud account, that didn't feel very seamless or "Apple-like" to me.  The Photo Stream option didn't work at all for several days, but after several attempts I did get it to work.There is limited channel selection.  There are several services that will probably never be available on Apple TV because they present competition to the services that Apple wants you to consume.Overall, Apple seems to be somewhat stagnant in this space.  I can't overstate the coolness of Airplay - which can be fun for parties (bring your own music!) but the device is lacking in almost every other way.Perhaps I would feel differently if I bought my content from the ITMS, but this thing is a big disappointment.
summary: Disappointing Device That Has A Few Neat Tricks

reviewText: This device doesn't allow amazon prime to stream and other videos, such as you tube, stream with low quality. OK as a picture viewer and not much else. This product is in need of improvement, My smart DVD player works better for movies and was cheaper.

We bought this expecting it to be a new Apple TV box. We spent hours trying to get it to connect to our internet. Finally my husband called Apple Support and we were told that it was not a new box and that the warranty was only days away from expiring. I would not recommend purchasing this at all.We bought a new one from Radio Shack after this one was returned and it worked perfectly.

again i spent my hard earned money luckly not on amazon, but it wont work on older tvs( I KNOW I KNow everyones thinking duh she should know that ) For some reason i thought it would work with an av cord like roku but i was wrong i either have to bye a new tv that supports hdmi ( which  i am an idiot yes lol at me. :) But looks like i might be return it. reviewText: Apparently, there's an issue with the updates. This has been a long standing issue with Apple but updating this device causes the digital output to not work. Apple is aware, yet they continue to sell this unit. Think I'm lying? Google it!
Apple TV was incompatible with my 10 year old Sony TV.  No HDMI port for plug in to function. Check your TV for correct port.
summary: Wanted to watch home movies on TV

reviewText: First of all, I am an Apple lover. Own several Apple products.I am so thankful to Apple TV, because I started loving  my Boxee!!. I am slowly observing that Apple is moving from  people oriented products to profit oriented products. Anyways.......I digressed......Apple TV....these guys first of all lock up the box, everything takes you to iTunes store and asks for your CC, Block you from accessing any of your personal non store media, movies, music, etc. that's stashed up in your NAS or external hard drive. Thank heavens for small mercies.......the AirPlay.  Even Boxee does AirPlay.......just that it doesn't mirror, that's all. There are hardly a few apps on ATV, it depends on your ipad, iphone and so for apps. Boxee has 200 of them. Most of them serve free content. Anyways.....I am disappointed. Bottom line? Not worth a 100 bucks. I would have a real little media serving computer such as Boxee. If not for AirPlay mirroring, I would have sent it back.Hope that helps you make a good decision.
Great software.  the interface is the cleanest on the market.  But overall I use my roku 3 all the time, which has the apps i use, Amazon prime, plex, and the blaze tv.

I bought this primarily for Airplay from my iPad, but also from my MacBook Pro.Apparently, my MacBook, even with the latest OS X Mountain Lion, is not capable of Airplay.  What???  Something to do with the WIFI strength, or Apple wanting you to purchase a newer Mac.  I installed software called Parrot, but the delay from the laptop to the Apple TV was unusable.From my iPad, Airplay worked pretty well, but sometimes would be slow to respond or would stop in the middle of a presentation.  Really not good.With iOS 6, Apple also updated the Apple TV software.  Airplay now works much better.Streaming audio always worked well with the PC, MAC, iPhone and iPad.CONS:1.  You are best using a physical network cable instead of WIFI.2.  Why can't I stream movies or TV from my Windows Media Center library?3.  Why can't I get TV on the Apple TV?  I mean, is it a TV or a Internet video device?4.  Why do I get the Apple TV screen when I want to AirPlay?  It's not very professional.  Can't I customize the background?5.  If you queue up a YouTube video, and go to watch it again, sometimes it won't play.  You then have to search during a live presentation.  YouTube flashes pictures of related video that sometimes contains inappropriate pictures.  Perfect for getting your presentation made without distraction.  (Detect sarcasm here.)PROS:1.  Doesn't heat up like the old Apple TV with the hard drive.2.  Once you get Airplay to work well, it's a great tool for teaching and sharing.3.  Viewing photos on a large screen is fun.4.  Internet Radio is entertaining, although we don't use it often.5.  Netflix streaming is easy, although ROKU works just as well.I would buy it again just for airplay.  Otherwise, there are other options out there.  Sorry Apple.  I am loyal, but you just haven't gotten this product right yet.
summary: Love Apple, product is ok, but not perfect.

reviewText: I bought this thing on base and it work just fine for the first five updates.  After that I have been emailing apple about the performance of this device.  I've been ripped off a couple of times trying to download a movie.  It will charge you but,  then movie will try to load and not play.  Apple has reimbursed me on the latest attempt, but this happens about every four to five downloads.There's also the update my system sign!  Guess what?!?  Will not update!!! Endless attempts but no success! "The update was not successful!" I don't know how much time and energy I've wasted trying to get this thing to work.  I have many Apple products and because of this is one device I'm willing to end my association with Apple forever.Sometimes, I have to unplug my device and restart it a few times just to get a movie to play.  I average about five attempts per movie when it is acting up!  Endless Frustration!!!
If you don't have Netflix or other similar services, Apple TV is totally useless. Use it for air play only.
I have been gifted two of these things and still think it is pretty useless.An inexpensive BluRay player does more for the same or less cost.Apple has a lot of hits, but this is a bust.

I have had a roku for a few months. I bought the roku for my mom so she could watch shows in the living room. I have netflix, amazon prime, and hbo go on the roku. My ps3 was my streaming device in my bedroom. Bad thing was, I couldn't stream hbo go on the ps3. I came here and read all the reviews about how awesome apple tv was compared to roku. I bought the apple tv without the slightest idea that prime instant video and hbo go weren't supported yet?!APPLE TV HAS BEEN AROUND FOR YEARS AND YOU'RE GOING TO TELL ME HBO GO AND PRIME INSTANT VIDEO AREN'T SUPPORTED? Not happy at all. The only way I could stream hbo go or prime is if I bought a $200 ipod or $400 ipad and used "air play". Now I have to return this piece of crap. Definitely not worth the apple logo you get on your device.
summary: No support for some of the most commonly used streaming services...

reviewText: I have had the Apple TV for about three months now. The Apple TV frequently stops working with netflixs for days at time, there is no pandora, no way to add apps, listening to music from your icloud costs an additional $25 a year. Simply put the only reason to buy this is because it has the apple name brand on it. Apple is getting lazy and relying on their name instead of their products. GO WITH ROKU.

I needed this device in order to use Netflix in conjunction with my Wi-Fi hotspot, since I don't have a "smart" TV.  This item was easy to install, but has not worked efficiently at any time. Just try to call Apple to get help......it's a joke. Every time I want to use Netflix, I have to enter my e-mail address followed by a password. This device does not remember anything. Using the remote with this device is annoying. It only allows you to enter one letter or number at a time and has a grating voice that calls out what you've typed in after each and every entry. There's no way to mute it. Netflix is definitely NOT the cause of my frustration. I have no problems accessing it on my computer. Things device was definitely not worth the money. I'd advise someone interested in such a device to buy a Ruko....at half the price.
summary: Stinks right out of the box!

reviewText: It doesn't have a web browser that's the most annoying thing and I could not install any apps using the app store. The watchespn app doesn't work for me as I am not subscribed to the listed ISPs. It was very easy to install but it takes lot of time to write something using the remote. Overall dissapointing had to return it..
I thought I could connect to videos and files on my PC. Wrong! Will only access I-Tune library. Just another gimmick.
Like all other apple products, it boxes you in and limits your options. Not compatible with older MacBooks.  Only worth having if you have subscription services.

Problems: 1. Using Airplay with new Macbook Pro (having what is on my laptop screen show up on my tv screen), the sound through the television kept cutting out.. not only when streaming video, but even streaming audio. This is terrible.2. The remote operates on the same frequency as remotes for mac computers. When I use the Apple TV remote, I am causing the computer to do various things. This doesn't happen when I am using Airplay, but otherwise, it happens. I have a desktop computer that I like to have on sleep when I am not using it. I click the Apple TV remote.. the computer wakes up.. I hit more buttons, more things happen on my iMac. This is a drag.3. No direct access to Amazon Prime. If the Airplay function were working properly, I could use my laptop to send the signal to my TV via the Apple TV device, and watch Amazon shows.. but this does not work.. as I mentioned, the sound is very intermittent.I am bringing this device back to the store, and am planning on purchasing a blu-ray player that has wifi built in, and apps for not only Netflix, which Apple TV does have, but also Amazon videos, which Apple TV does not have.--Update 7/4/13: Here is a helpful comment I received, which I am adding to this review, in case some of you do not read comments:"You can 'pair' individual remotes to certain laptops so that you don't have that problem."I have not tried to pair each remote to each computer I have, but according to the above comment, it is possible.Even if I had been able to pair a remote to a computer, and pair the Apple TV remote to Apple TV, I still don't think Apple TV is a good value. If you already have a blu-ray player, but it does not do streaming video, then you might want Apple TV, and perhaps the one you buy will work better than the one I bought.But, if you don't already have a blu-ray player, then you might think, like I did, that it is best to spend a bit more money to buy a blu-ray player that streams videos. There might even be some streaming blu-ray players that cost a bit less than Apple TV. Worth looking into, if you want.Here is a link to Amazon Video-compatible devices. You will have to scroll down quite awhile to find the long listing of blu-ray players that stream Amazon Prime. This is Amazon's own list, so I am guessing it is accurate.http://www.amazon.com/gp/video/ontv/devicesI have found that people in various stores that sell blu-ray players are not always knowledgeable about some of their products. I chose a blu-ray player from Amazon's list, and then asked a store salesperson about that blu-ray player. She told me it did not play Amazon videos, but according to Amazon's list and reviews, the player does. I bought the player, a Sony BDP-3100. Here's the link for it:Sony BDP-S3100 Blu-ray Disc Player with Wi-FiI've only had this item for a week and a day. It does stream videos from Amazon, Netflix, and many other sources. A software update two days ago added over 20 more streaming video channels than it originally came with. The player does not, as of now, stream itunes, and probably won't, but that is fine with me.Since I have not had the blu-ray player long, I have not written a review about it. I'm going to wait awhile to see how it holds up.Hope this info has been helpful.

Game runs on the apple tv!?)- it's cheap, but you can not do more than viewing pictures on it to be honest....My solution....i switched to a  http://amzn.to/11mxK92and attached it to my TV with wireless keyboard and mouse

reviewText: We bought the Apple-TV to watch movies, but all we end up watching is the movie load, and load, and load, and load. In fact, it took Finding Nemo more than 24 hours to completely load using a fast and reliable DSL connection. We experience the same issue when streaming home videos from our iPhone's. Depending on the length of the iPhone video, it usually takes 5 to 10 minutes to load on average. When streaming just plain music, I can literally set the iPhone right next to the Apple-TV and it still 'hiccups' every so often, having to re-buffer the stream. Maybe we're doing something wrong, but this is completely unacceptable in my opinion which is why I've rated this product 1 star.CONS:Other than what's mentioned above, the Apple-TV really offers nothing but premium content (subscription fee content). If you have cable or satellite television, then you really don't need this product. You can't even add or remove apps. We're Amazon Prime members but this product does not support that.PROS:If you enjoy standing in lines, sitting at stop lights, or watching paint dry, then you certainly won't mind waiting on the Apple-TV.
You can watch just mp4 ! : mkv, avi... impossible !I like apple but 100 $ for that : no way !

First off, I want to say that this tiny product is not worth the $100.00 plus tax and let me explain why.When I first bought the product, as I love apple macbook Pro's, the device is very limited to 13 products. However, 13 products make much less bloatware on the device. The Box is very shiny and luxurious as it comes to looks. But, When I looked at the 13 products listed, I tried out the movies rentals and the itunes on my computer worked fine in comparison. THe biggest problem is that when I downloaded the product, it did not allow me to watch the movie right away. THe loading time is over 2 hours to watch a movie that is only an hour and 30 minutes long on the lowest settings for internet connections. This was baffling and should not be overlooked. Please save yourself the money and just use your computer to watch movies or a dvd player. In fact, buy a redbox because this product is the least satisfying money I have paid for a long time.Please like my review because of the facts. Thank you.
summary: The apple Tv wins more in cons than it does pros (please read)

reviewText: If you are one of those people who have to have everything apple then this is for you.With this device you have access to Itunes (whoopee), Netflix, Hulu Plus and of course Apple Air play so you can stream your home movies to you Apple TV 3.But you do not have the 100 different apps like Plex or Playon you can get with other devices such as Roku. Apple TV 3 does not have a HBO GO native app built in like 99.9% of its competitors and Like everything else that is Apple related you are locked down to what they want you to have.  Apple TV 3 is not able to be jailbroken to add XBMC and it this point it looks like it never will be able to.I prefer Roku (or ANY other streaming media device) over this one.  I just sold mine on craigslist for  of what I paid for it because it was useless to me.
